google.name: Artichoke Basille's Pizza
google.address: 111 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
You know when people said “Try Artichoke Basille’s, it’s weird AF but you have to try it to believe it”, they were exactly right.
First off, the size of their slice is enormous, both in area as well as depth of the filling.
And the filling (on their artichoke slice) is weird, but creamy, cheesy, herby, and artichokey all around.
I’m not sure if it’s even pizza, but what it is is damn delicious and an all around great deal.
I got my slice thoroughly reheated and had a great meal.

I had one artichoke pizza for lunch and a crab pizza to-go for dinner. The crab one was a bit too salty and did not have the flavor I was hoping for, but the artichoke spice was surprisingly good. Tasted like a large quiche with a greater ratio of cheese to egg.

If you come at the wrong time, then the pizza sit in the store for a while, but the workers offer to give each slice a reheating in the oven (extra crispy). They also helped cut the slice in half so I could share with a friend.

I would recommend visiting this location if you are around the area. The price is pretty reasonable to try a type of pizza many other stores don't dare to make.

Second time visiting Artichoke Basille's Pizza and must say their pizza is so unique and rich. One slice of the famous artichoke pizza was more than enough to fill the two of us. A few seats are available inside the restaurant.

Artichoke Pizza in Greenwich Village is a slice of heaven for pizza lovers! This small but mighty spot, developed by two brothers, serves up some of the most decadent pizza you’ll ever taste. The Artichoke Pizza on Broadway is especially famous for its super creamy, rich topping that feels just like artichoke dip, all atop a thick, hearty crust.

Since opening their first location in 2008, Artichoke Basille’s has expanded across the nation, gaining fame along the way. They’ve been featured on The Tonight Show, The Rachael Ray Show, and many other notable shows and publications. This place is the real deal.

We had a slice that was full of creamy goodness and double crusted – it was absolutely delicious and incredibly satisfying. If you find yourself in Greenwich Village, do yourself a favor and stop by Artichoke Pizza. It’s an experience your taste buds will thank you for!

Best pizza in nyc.

This place has the most decadent pizza I've had in the best way possible. I've eaten a lot of pizza in both NY and Italy, and when the Artichoke slice is fresh, it's incomparable.

The slices are very big, one will get you full.

google.name: Magnolia Bakery
google.address: 401 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Magnolia Bakery in the West Village is a must-visit destination for anyone with a sweet tooth! I recently indulged in their famous treats, and let me tell you, it was absolutely delicious. The moment you step inside, you're greeted by the warm, inviting aroma of freshly baked goods that instantly puts you in a good mood.

The highlight of my visit was definitely their iconic banana pudding, which is creamy, decadent, and simply divine. It’s no wonder this dessert has garnered a loyal following! I also tried their classic cupcakes, and each bite was a delightful explosion of flavor, perfectly moist and topped with rich, buttery frosting. The variety of treats available makes it hard to choose, but everything I sampled was fantastic.

Beyond the delicious offerings, Magnolia Bakery holds a special place in pop culture history, particularly for fans of HBO's "Sex and the City." This charming bakery gained fame as one of Carrie Bradshaw's favorite spots, often featured in scenes where she enjoyed a sweet treat while navigating the ups and downs of life and love in NYC. The iconic image of Carrie walking down the street with a cupcake in hand has become synonymous with the bakery, making it a pilgrimage site for fans of the show.

The atmosphere in the West Village location is cozy and nostalgic, with a charming decor that adds to the experience. It’s the perfect spot to sit back, enjoy a treat, and soak in the vibrant energy of the neighborhood.

Overall, Magnolia Bakery is not just a place to satisfy your sweet cravings; it’s a slice of New York City history that continues to capture the hearts of locals and visitors alike. Whether you're a "Sex and the City" enthusiast or simply someone who loves delicious baked goods, a visit to Magnolia Bakery is an absolute delight!

A small, laid-back bakery in West Village with wonderful desserts and the world-famous banana pudding.

We stopped by specifically to try their banana pudding, but they also offer a wide variety of other desserts. Each month, they feature a special version of the banana pudding with unique flavour twists. You simply grab the pudding from a small fridge inside and pay at the counter. They provide cutlery and napkins, but that’s about it—there are no tables to sit and enjoy your desserts.

The banana pudding lived up to the hype. It wasn’t overly sweet or too rich, and the portion size was just right, making it a perfect quick dessert after lunch or dinner if you’re in the area.

Delicious banana pudding. The other desserts I got were good but the banana pudding what they are known for was outstanding. Freshly made as well. The servers were friendly and took care of us quickly. They were restocking the display of vans pudding once we got there. I would recommend this place.

Visit: July 2024

The cafe was nice and had a wide selection of desserts. I wish there was a place to sit and enjoy it though. A little bit pricey for the desserts, but it was good. Got the key lime pie ice box. There was a strong lime taste and the creme was silky smooth. The base did a nice job to balance out the flavours and texture

This Bakery does not disappoint!
As a sex and the city fan it was a must go. We started our bakery tour or Magnolia from the original location and then found them over the city.
We had a selection of bake goodies but the chocolate fudge cake 🧁🍰 and the world famous Banana pudding 🍮🍌exceeded expectations!
We bought the kit home but got told they ship worldwide 📦.hopefully they do if not a trip back to NYC for this bakery alone is worth it. 🥳🗽

google.name: Blue Note
google.address: 131 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: We had bar tickets for the late show and arrived 30 minutes early, but we only got in at 11:00, and the music didn't start until 11:30. I didn’t like the wait, and I was lucky to get a seat. The cocktails were good, and the music was enjoyable, but I could only see the bartender. I recommend getting a table; otherwise, you’ll be squeezed in with a lot of people and have no space to move or breathe.

Nice cozy atmosphere.  Get there early stand in line for good seat.  If you want to see the show don’t buy tix for the bar.
We Robert Glasper an amazing show, this was our first time to the Blue Note.
There are some other club venues outside I may go and check out my next time in the NYC

The food was good and the atmosphere was great. The prices for everything was high but that’s expected in NYC. If you’re going to a historic place like the blue note you should just enjoy the experience.

I have to give it a lower rating because after tipping our server she came back and demanded more money. She said 25% was a minimum. She was very aggressive and zeroed out the previous tip and put the machine in my face. I asked if 20% was ok and she said 25% so I left $45 as a tip.  I told her this was the first time I had a server demand a specific tip. She asked me if I was American and said this is America. She could not have known that I was active duty military and served time in Afghanistan. I just complied with her demands. That comment was grossly out of line. It really put a bad end to the night. After spending $250 on food and $80 on stuff from the gift shop, would expect not to be harassed.

Oh such a dreamy experience!!
Ive wanted to come here for a long time and finally it happened!!
Im so glad to be able to go there, had a great seat too.

The door was supposed to open at 6 and we got there 5:40.  There were some people in line.  The door didn’t open til 6:20, and the line got quite long.
After it opened, people were put like sardines, as other people mention, tables were close to each other and you will be sharing a small table with other customers.  (It did not bother me after the show started)
The performance started 30minutes late at 8:30, ended a little before 10.  At this point I knew the people for the next show are also waiting long.
But the experience is worth the wait!

There is a tiny gift shop on the 2nd floor which can be very crowded.

Iconic jazz club in New York. I booked tickets fairly late, opting for bar seating on this occasion. I’d recommend getting there early - I booked for the 10:30pm gig, with doors allegedly at 10pm but they were open when I arrived about 20 minutes before this. There are only 10 or so seats on the bar so if you want one you need to get in quick. Otherwise it’s standing room only and very tightly packed! There’s a minimum spend of $25 on the bar and $35 on the tables. A ‘standard’ beer costs $10 and they have some craft beers in cans for $14.

The music, as you’d expect, is excellent. It’s not so easy to see from the bar - this is fine if you’re going fairly casually to enjoy the experience but book table seating if you want to properly see the band. The sound is still great at the back, with dedicated speakers. Each gig lasts ~45/50 minutes, with two gigs per evening (early and late). There is also a small but well stocked shop upstairs. Accessibility is excellent with a metro stop very nearby and regular trains to the rest of the city. The gig finished just before midnight but the area was still bustling.

Not a cheap club but iconic with excellent live music. That said, for a beer it’s no more expensive than anywhere else in the city! Great service, too.

google.name: Dos Caminos
google.address: 675 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Happy, lively and welcoming atmosphere. I loved that they were ready for Halloween. What a great place! The enchiladas were good.

I was cold. They had run out of tea, so our friendly server brought me a small pitcher of hot water... with a smile of course. Just a great place that I'm happy to recommend...

Especially after such a disappointing time at Artechouse exhibit, this place was a star. Highly recommend.

MEATPACKING DISTRICT, NY - I recently discovered Dos Caminos, and I have to say it's one of the best spots in Manhattan for amazing Mexican cuisine and drinks. The outdoor seating along the charming cobblestone street is just fantastic. Personally, I can't get enough of their flavorful fajitas and their wide variety of drinks and snacks. And if you have a sweet tooth, you've got to try their Dark Chocolate Tamal - it's a must! The service is always top-notch, the food is consistently delicious, and the atmosphere is fantastic. Whether it's lunch, dinner, or weekend brunch, Dos Caminos is definitely worth a visit. And with over 150 tequilas to choose from, it's the perfect place to party in the Meatpacking District

This is one of the best spots in Manhattan to have great Mexican food and drinks outside.
There’s a ton of outdoor seating along a charming cobblestone street. I like their fajitas- it comes with a heaping portion of sizzling meat full of flavor. I frequently come here for drinks, tacos, quesadillas, nachos, ect. For desert, I like their Dark Chocolate Tamal. Always excellent service, quality food, and a great atmosphere.

My husband and I went on Sunday to celebrate our third anniversary. We got as an appetizer the guacamole and chips, the guacamole was the best I had! Really fresh and flavored! As our entry I got the shrimp enchiladas suizas on mole sauce and my husband had the picadillo beef burrito and both were really delicious, drinks were absolutely lovely, . Our server Epifania was amazing with us and gave us excellent customer service. We'll definitely come back 🙏🏻
Great food and fast service. Alejandro was very friendly and attentive. Will recommend this location to all my friends thank you!

google.name: Babbo
google.address: 110 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text: Had a very good dinner here. Lamb chops was tender and cooked perfectly. Ravioli was amazing but small portion. Squid ink pasta with crab was good but not great

Incredible meal with just the most phenomenal nuanced flavors. Highly recommend the halibut and the crudo. The cocktails are wonderful. The atmosphere is lovely with beautiful festive decorations and the service is impeccable.

I was looking forward to trying Babbo. I would have thought of this as a classic. I would have been wrong. The decor was drab. The room felt dank. The music was good, but it had four or five songs by one artist at a time, first Elton John, then Queen, then maybe Springsteen, then it went out entirely.
The service was warm and efficient, but there were a lot of staff on the floor and I don't know who was in what role.
The food was just dated. The best dishes I tried were the octopus and a radicchio salad. The crab pasta listed serrano chilis but had no heat and the crab itself was bland and without flavor. The biggest disappointment was the pork chop with cherry tomatoes and cippollini. The pork was horribly overcooked (they didn't ask a temperature). It was covered in bell peppers and chopped onions, there was exactly one cippollini and half of a cherry pepper. We sent it back and it was removed from the bill.
The restaurant could only be described as tired. There's so many better options not far, try those.

Really enjoyed my dinner at Babbo. It’s one of the few places that serves Egg Raviolo. While the pasta was a bit al dente for my taste, I loved the creamy center and the butter sauce. The Pork Chop was excellent—juicy but with a nice char. And I liked the pickled onion that came with it. Service was friendly and attentive.
Upscale spot for Italian cuisine. Personal favorites were the braised beef ravioli, the red snapper crudo and the duck ragu special.

google.name: STK Steakhouse
google.address: 26 Little W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
STK Steakhouse is the perfect place for a date, celebratory dinner, or meeting up with friends for drinks. With a lively but relaxed atmosphere, excellent service, and delicious food and drinks, you are guaranteed to have an enjoyable experience, no matter the occasion.
I went in for a quick bite during the week and was pleasantly surprised to discover that they have what is easily one of the best happy hour deals in the city. For $3, $6 and $9, you can choose from a large selection of happy hour dishes, and ALL signature cocktails for only $9, from 2:30 to 6:30 PM. Each dish was tasty and well-portioned, and the cocktails were perfection.
I look forward to visiting again for dinner or brunch.

Tonight, I had an outstanding dinner at STK with Adam, and it was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was vibrant, the service impeccable, and the food—truly unforgettable. I’ve dined at hundreds of restaurants across the city, and STK has instantly secured a top spot on my list. Every dish was perfectly crafted, the flavors bold and innovative, and the presentation simply stunning. Attached are some photos and videos capturing the essence of our night—an evening of great food, excellent company, and a dining experience that truly stands out.

Best experience ever !!! I booked this reservation for my anniversary dinner and originally I wanted the rooftop but it was chilly that night and the staff was nice enough to switched my reservation so my bf and I could sit inside. The ambiance was amazing. The food was 10/10. The waiter Zorey was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave us some great recommendations. The restaurant manager Celine was truly amazing.She definitely made my anniversary dinner special and one to remember. Her aura and energy are top tier. I definitely will be coming back to this location!!

I really appreciated the fast and attentive service at STK. Ariana was mindful and attentive throughout the dining experience. Ariana made the experience delightful! The food here was also made fresh and it was very tasteful. Would come here again!!

The food, ambiance, and service is top tier. Celebrated my 2 year anniversary with the love of my life and it was amazing. Definitely worth it. William our server was attentive and had a great personality. 10/10 would definitely come back again.

yelp.name: STK Steakhouse
yelp.address: 26 Little West 12th St, New York, NY 10014

google.name: Mighty Quinn's Barbeque
google.address: 75 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Brandon and team were amazing. We were attended to right away. He explained how to place the order and then the team took over. The ribs were well cooked and the wings were crunchy. Their Carolina mustard sauce was delicious.

Will definitely come back and what’s best, it didn’t break the bank.

They prepare barbecue the authentic old-school way, cooking low and slow. I like to come here for the brisket sandwich, sausage, and wings. The mexican street corn is awesome. And so is the cinnamon bun bread pudding. There’s a bottle of barbecue sauce on every table. Everything’s delicious.
Everything is fine I guess.  I am not really a barbecue fan.  It is just pieces of meat to me. The place is great for a big group of people.  I love the atmosphere and decor.

Stop by for a quick bite the staff was were welcoming. We both got beef brisket combos , I was asking about the bread pudding and he gave me a little sample of it . Definitely one of the better Mighty Quinns I been to !!

First time trying Mighty Quinn’s and I must say it was the best decision of my life lol. The atmosphere was amazing made me feel at home in the south. I was greeted by Ana who was extremely helpful in my decision making with my order being that I was a little indecisive because everything looked so appetizing. Thea was also very helpful in assisting me with my side choices after I informed her of my pork and beef allergy, which I only had to state once and she made sure to go over every single side that was available for me. The staff was amazing the customer service was above and beyond and the facility was very clean. The food was a 10/10 I got the lunch special rice bowl with chipotle bbq chicken, Mac n cheese, and sweet potatoes‼️ Highly recommended ☺️

google.name: One if by Land, Two if by Sea
google.address: 17 Barrow St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
One if by Land, Two if by Sea has a classy menu, a great history, and beautiful decor that makes it very romantic. I took my girlfriend there for our 3 year anniversary. The restaurant was gorgeous and the decor was perfect for those special photos. The dim lighting created a perfeambiance. The food was incredible. The food wine room upstairs is extraordinary. The only minor issue I encountered was with how small the menu was, at best you will feel satisfied after eating meal. I didn’t care because the food I ate was delightful.”
The dessert was special. This is definitely a place you will want to experience.

I found out about this restaurant in the weirdest way ever. I am a paranormal enthusiast, and I was on YouTube watching one of those 'Top 10 haunted whatever in NYC'. Well, this kept showing up as a nice and beautiful place, but they say that women who sit at the bar usually get their earrings taken off. Anyways, I'm not here to leave a paranormal review. I'm here because this place was amazing! I went with my 16-year-old daughter, and we fell in love! We had the pre-fixed meal. Everything was perfect, the food, the atmosphere, our waiter, the music, the piano, the host. I had the beef wellington and my daughter had lamb I believe. I don't remember any of the dishes, but I included the photos in case anyone would like to see them! I will return again one day, hopefully one a day with my future husband.

Fantastic experience and charming ‘old school nyc’ environment and venue for my Anniversary. Compliments to the chef and his team for food creativity. Service very attentive to our table. Highly recommend this restaurant for an event or just a high end dinner out.
Enjoyed a light dinner and dancing on a Tuesday night, and it was fabulous! The small plate of beef Wellington was top-notch! Cocktail was quite good, and the band sounded fantastic!

One if by land and two by sea was a fantastic experience. I’ve heard so much and been recommended this restaurant I just had to try. So I came with my partner for our anniversary and we are so happy we did. Our servers Sasha and Kazi were pleasant and attentive. We had wonderful small talk and they really took care of us. Such a memorable and romantic experience. I’ll cherish it highly.

yelp.name: One If By Land Two If By Sea

google.name: Waverly Inn
google.address: 16 Bank St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great service and a lovely back patio. Food was good and classic fare for brunch. Shrimp cocktail was a bit veiny - should have gotten the crab cakes instead!

Would happily go back.

It's absolutely incredible. I had dinner with my eldest child while they were visiting from out of town. It is what might be considered a little pricy for many, but definitely worth it even if only for a special occasion.
Went here for anniversary dinner. Amazing food and service. Would definitely return for another special occasion.

Waverly Inn is falling off.

Our server was great. However, we both laughed out loud after he finished reciting the specials. It was a Caesar salad, seafood angel hair pasta, ribeye steak, steak with wine pairing, caviar service, and macaroni and cheese. It took him 2 minutes to recite all the ingredients and prices and we laughed. I said it should be its own menu and he said they chef forces them to keep them all as specials to seem more exclusive.

By the time he came to us, we had already read the regular menu so the specials should have been offered sooner… and on a menu.

We got the kale salad and 2 burgers. The kale salad was soaked in dressing. Like the leaves were heavy. And it was a thick dressing that took away any flavor. I got indigestion. From a kale salad. Let that sink in. And I could taste the salt on my tongue.

Once we finished the burgers came. A half pound of ground beef with a thin single slice of cheese: it felt like we were eating large undercooked meatballs. But it is “the Waverly” so we gave it a shot, not the worst in the city but I wouldn’t get it again.

And then the fries- imagine the bottom of a bag of potato chips being dropped into a deep fryer for 3 minutes too long. My fingers had oil on them so I switched to a fork. And they actually come to
The table in the frying container! It’s outrageous. No flavor besides oil, and comes w three drops of ketchup.

On top of it all, the host was dressed like he was hosting the Grammys and not looking up from his desk.  That’s probably fine for the few times Andy Cohen comes in, so the host can pretend that celebs still haunt this place and that’s how to be a good stealthy host. However, the real clientele is typically 3 to 4 different groups of 22-26 year olds white kids at  birthday parties. It’s like a chuck e cheese for kids who moved to the city. Loud and obnoxious and not a chill spot anymore. The host is chuck e!

Bring back the way it used to be. Until then, I hope this review helps.

Curb appeal as a local photographer love this corner and neighborhood. A cozy courtyard. Food review will come!

My Instagram @nyphoto.at

google.name: Old Homestead Steakhouse
google.address: 56 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text:
MEATPACKING DISTRICT, NY - If you're in the mood for a classic dining experience, you have to check out Old Homestead Steak House in the trendy Meat Packing District. Established way back in 1868, this spot has built strong ties with its butchers, ensuring they get the first pick of the finest beef. You'll find nothing but prime, dry-aged meat here — it's a promise they've kept since day one! Plus, they snagged the Wine Spectator Award in 2006.
.
The restaurant might not be huge, but its charming; old-school decor adds to the cozy atmosphere. While it’s nestled in Chelsea, the vibe is all about comfort and tradition. The service here is generally great, though sometimes it feels a bit understaffed during visits. Just a heads up: they don’t serve complimentary bread.
.
Now, let’s talk about the food! The New York Strip and Ribeye, cooked just the way you like and seasoned perfectly. Instead of traditional sides, you can decided to share the spicy Thai fried calamari, which is sweet and delicious, along with the stuffed shrimp. Everything is cooked to perfection, and you'll definitely plan to return. With an incredible ambiance, rich history, and fantastic wine selections, you won’t want to miss this staple of New York City.

One of the oldest steakhouses in NYC. Last time I came here was many years ago with clients. It felt good to just be here to enjoy the food.

No frills steak house. Had the steak burger (huge), ribeye, fries and calamari (we fat).

Wow!! What a night. Not only was the food amazing but I have never had such incredibly efficient and kind service. For my boyfriend’s birthday we went and they started with the “extra mile” setting up balloons I had brought earlier and champagne on the house. The chopped salad was lovely but the star was the aged prime rib. My BF was practically scraping the meat off of the bone. I enjoyed the buttery sea bass and we both chowed down on the crab. Finishing with chocolate cake and we were set. I’ve never had such lovely service and cannot wait to come back. Special thanks to Luis for his amazing work and attention. We felt so special. This is a must do in Manhattan!!

First time at this iconic steakhouse, being from nyc, every neighborhood has their favorite steakhouse's pizza 🍕 Chinese takeout🥡 ,bar, just the way nyers are. This restaurant is so old my great grandparents ate there. The steaks excellent, ribeye Gotham cut, bone in filet, has browns eggs, the main. I cant lie i normally take before pics, unfortunately for the review we smoke a few joints before hand, started bsing, forgot about photos. Appetizers where excellent baked clams, carb cakes fire🔥 Caesar salad, & great friends. Great 👍 food. Our waiter was excellent. Make for one memorable evening. Ty

Skip this restaurant. Not worth the money. I had 2 wine out of dirty glasses, 24$ each. Sides were okay, the filet a bit overcooked. Service is medium and the location really not special at all. I also dont like to have a lake of sauce with my steak. go somewhere else.

google.name: The Taco Shop
google.address: 166 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
The best taco shop in the entire West Village, maybe even best in southern Manhattan. Amazing food, drinks, atmosphere and service.

Hands down the best steak tacos I have had in any borough. Every time I have eaten here it has been an absolute delight. They even have a $20 happy hour special: Three tacos and a drink and it's well worth the price!

Angel works Monday through Thursday and makes the best Mango Margarita (frozen and straight) I have ever tasted. A hidden gem of the West Village that deserves way more credit than it's given.
DO NOT GO HERE! The food was terrible, chips were stale and the rice and beans tasted like cardboard. How this place is still in business astounds me.

Quite hidden little place downstairs. Extended happy hour and beautiful tacos and flavored margs! Defo recommend the fish. Miscommunication with the items but quickly resolved and we are very happy. Would recommend. Incredible food, drinks and service 😋

Brunch is the way to go here. The menu is exactly the same as dinner, and you get to pick and choose all the food you would ever want to try for $20 for 90 minutes.  For an additional $16, you can have unlimited drinks.  We came on St Patrick’s Day where they colored their margaritas green. Service was impeccable and prompt, and all the food was delicious.  We had all of the tacos, tamales, and quesadillas.  Don’t forget dessert. The churros are a must!

unpleasant atmosphere attended by some loud Venezuelans, and the waitress commented to her colleague that there was terrible mouse poop!! I did not enjoy it at all!! Oh, by the way, I ate inside the place. Outside it looked nicer because there was no bar music and the waiters' screams.

google.name: Little Owl
google.address: 90 Bedford St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Little Owl has been such a special place for us this year. Starting from when we got engaged till the day we came back to do our engagement photoshoot! Little Owl and the staff has been nothing but accommodating for us and so much more! Recently we have been able to do our engagement shoot here at Little Owl and everyone has helped our vision come to life! We just want to thank you everyone who has helped us on this day and it is so much appreciated ❤️

The cute little place is downstairs from the "Friends" apartment building. I came in for lunch one day while I was in the area playing tourists in my own city.  The restaurant is small and clean inside, and they do offer outdoor dining.  They have a limited sized menu with some pretty good options, and the prices are reasonable. I went with the Crispy Bell and Evans Chicken, and it is absolutely delicious. The skin was perfectly crisp, and the chicken itself was juicy. The mashed potatoes with gravy were superb.  Service was great here as well. I was expecting your usual tourist trap kind of establishment, but this place exceeded my expectations. It is definitely worth checking out if you are a fan of "Friends" and are looking for a place to dine while in the area. I will stop in again the next time I want to play a tourist again in the area.

Quaint and cozy restaurant located below the building that was used in filming the show Friends. However, you can expect nothing short of a delicious meal at Little Owl. We went for brunch and were able to be seated with minimal wait (you should make a reservation). The food was amazing. The service was outstanding.  We had the brioche French toast, pork carnitas enchiladas, grilled & roasted corn and the French fries (chile aioli is amazing).

Loved the branzino. The cocktails are delicious.

A bit disappointed by the tomato salad (tomatoes were bland). Fried calamari is mid. Fried duck is mid.

We randomly walked here on a Saturday at 6 ish and were able to get a table with out a reservation outside. Food, waitress, vibes were all on point!

The meatball sliders were the best thing we ate. You have to get them, tender, quality well seasoned beef and the sauce was heaven.

Jolene got the strawberry drink frizzy and the glass had the coolest little stripper on it!

I loved the porkchop, cooked perfectly and juicy. the soy tasting sauce paired well with the beans and lettuce.

The risotto was ok, lacked flavor compared to the other items but still good.

The waitress was awesome, super good with recommendations and it was such a perfect day!

google.name: Pastis
google.address: 52 Gansevoort St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
I had been here pre-kids (13+ years ago) and we loved it then and we still love it now. Such a lovely atmosphere and the food is spot on. I love when I can find a place that remains consistent and is still great. Can’t wait to come back again on our next visit.

Service was great. I was thinking of something and she brought it right to me without having to say it out loud! Now that’s service!!

If you have larger parties, I would recommend you make a reservation to avoid a wait. Most tables are smaller tops.

Everything we ate was great!

Visited the Whitney Free Friday and was able to score a table here at 5:40. It was cheery and convivial and there was a celebratory air —the start of the weekend for many young couples, girlfriends and double dates sitting around us. The food was good but not amazing. The scallops crudo was amazing and innovative with the passionfruit/lime essence. The mains (moules frites and duck confit) were tasty and well delivered but pretty standard. The smashed roasted potatoes with the duck confit was a bit too soft.  The rouge fumée cocktail was excellent! Service was very attentive and super.

The trout was good, so was the scallops. As for the steak, it came a bit more done than expected, as it would be good if the meat cab also come with some salad and not just fries. It helps to balance off the greasiness of the meat and garlic butter. Service was great as well.

Had a chance to eat at Pastis while the Dishoom pop-up was going on. It was an absolute delicious experience. We went for the breakfast and was amazed at how good the plates were (particularly the chai) and also the service by the Pastis team was great. Highly recommend the restaurant (and the pop up if you see this in the next few days). I hope this type of experience happens again in the future

Love it where!’ It’s become one of our go-to places every time we’re in NYC! We went twice during our 2 night stay because it is that good. Our waiter was so nice and the food was amazing.  And been there again in January 2024 and the food was waaaay too salty, but this time, everything was great. My only criticism is that new tuna carpaccio… not great. My husband and I shared it as an appetizer and we both weren’t fans of it. It’s as if someone had made ground tuna and spread it on a plate. Couldn’t pick up a single slice without it disintegrating. But other than that, we LOVED our food and went back for breakfast 😂 will definitely be going back!!

google.name: The Tippler
google.address: 425 W 15th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text: Hosted a party here and The Tippler team is next to none. Angela is fantastic and easy to work with. She was able to cater out the space and was very accommodating with questions and request. The entire staff is just as awesome as the space itself. Highly recommend having your party here or to check it out for a cocktail.

Cool spot in Chelsea Market. Not necessarily a speakeasy but has the vibes.  Underground, warm lighting, cool crowd, and nice ambiance. The cocktails were good and the staff was friendly. We had the Green Envy and Take it Ease (yes Ease and not Easy)....

Highly recommend. Warm and cozy atmosphere, feels very hip and trendy. Delicious selection of small plates and some great beers and ciders, as well as an almost overwhelming variety of classy cocktails. My bartender took the time out to figure out the best drink for me, and I'm glad she did - the Call an Uber alone was worth the trip.

Went here with my wife few nights ago, right before closing… my wife and i wanted a quiet drink but she started feeling weird 5 mins into her drink. She couldnt stand straight and we were bombarded by 4-5 guys at that point… we escorted ourselves out of the situation as best as possible but i can definitely tell you that she got drugged and targeted. This was one of the weirdest nights of my life. The owner should see this and reach out to me directly and get rid of this issue. This is bad.

Ordered drinks and paid, all well till then. A few days later, come to find out that my credit card was charged a 30% tip I did not give. This should serve as a warning to double check your charges before you proceed to pay the balance. Disappointing! I won,t be back. When going out, I wanna have fun and not worry about being potentially ripped off, and having to review my credit card charges. NAH, thank you.

google.name: Palma
google.address: 28 Cornelia St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
I made a reservation for dinner on the weekend and was excited by the beautiful decor and friendly service even before we started eating. I ordered a glass of white wine and the truffle pasta. The pasta was cooked to my liking, and the generous amount of truffle was immediately noticeable, making it a delicious dish.

My friend opted for the daily pasta, which had a lemony olive oil flavor, and it was also really tasty. We wanted dessert, but after finishing our hearty pasta dishes, we were too full to indulge. 😂
I definitely want to come back for a special occasion next time!

Visiting nyc and wanted to try a nice Italian spot. This place is so beautiful and cozy, great for a date night! Food was amazing and I believe their pasta is made fresh! Make sure you reserve in advance because seats get taken very quickly.

Amazing food, and excellent service. Went there for a late lunch and it was a great choice. It is also very close to Taylor Swift’s old apartment where the song Cornelia Street is taking place. If you are in the area, I definitely would recommend.

My wife found this lovely restaurant on TIKTOK, and boy am I glad she did! If you get a chance try to be seated in the back of the restaurant. It will make you feel you are transported to a little restaurant in Italy.

The service was amazing, nicely paced and everything came out hot and delicious!

For appetizer we went with the Arancini they were so tasty! For the main course my wife got “tortellini in brodo” and I got the special, which was lamb chops cooked to perfection and creamy mashed potatoes. And lastly for dessert we went with the  classic tiramisu. Drinks were nice and strong as well! This place definitely lives up to the hype! Will definitely will be recommending this restaurant to friends!

Hosted our engagement party here with close family. Everything was perfect - the food was delicious, the service was attentive and flawless, the ambiance was sublime. We were seated on the private terrace and felt like we were transported to a tuscan villa! Francesca and the event planning team were super - the constant communication, attention to detail, and care, was above and beyond. I look forward to hosting future events and regular dining at Palma in the future! This place is criminally underrated compared to its overrated Italian restaurants in the West Village area! Don’t hesitate - dine here or host your event here. You won’t be disappointed.

google.name: John's of Bleecker Street
google.address: 278 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Johns of Bleecker Street is a very quaint spot where a lot of famous individuals have tried pizza in New York City to our surprise. It’s probably one of the best if not THE best clay oven Pizza joints in NYC! If it’s good enough for celebrities, it’s good enough for me to try and I’m glad we did. Give them a shot if you’re into town for your next trip to NYC!
Visited twice in a week it was so good.  Classic New York slice, charming restaurant with great service.  The best pizza in NYC?  Maybe, maybe not, but definitely the best overall pizza experience.

I did a lot of research about NYC pizza before going to NYC. I was seeking out the best.  John’s on Bleaker kept coming up. I am not super familiar with the NYC subway system but I was determined. I was staying at Hilton Garden Inn New York/West 35th Street. I asked they employee at the door if they sold the pizza by the slice but they do not. That is important because while I sat waiting for my pizza multiple other people came by asking the same thing. A lot of people did the same research and wanted to try this “famous” pizza. My honest opinion. It was pizza. There was nothing that made it any better than other “good” pizza I have eaten before. I wouldn’t go out of my way to get it again.

John’s has forever set the bar for my New York style pizza standards.

An establishment almost 100 years old, this is somewhere to prioritize eating at when in NYC.

No reservations and no slices, only whole pizzas and a wait that is well worth your time.

We got a half half pizza with one side classic pepperoni and the other their special Boom Pie. Both sides were delicious, with a crispy thin crust and plenty of toppings.  If you don’t know what size pizza to get, go large. Believe me, you want as much of this pizza as you can get.

You’ve got a lot of pizza choices in New York, choose wisely. Choose John’s.

It’s as advertised. The line looks long but only took about 15-20 minutes. Texture of the pizza is incredible as it is super thin but keeps its shape and doesn’t fall apart. Tomato sauce is incredible and a perfect crust you want from a charcoal brick fire pizza. Have wanted to go there for years and was worth the wait. Maybe the best pizza you can find in the country

google.name: Employees Only
google.address: 510 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Can't rate their food as I was just here for drinks. Visiting from Toronto, Employees Only was on my bucket list for some time ever since seeing the documentary Hey Bartender. I went on a solo date early evening. At first it was a little intimidating as I was alone and all seats were taken. Luckily a seat became available at the bar and I swiped it. Service was amazing, cockails were spot on. I had the Smoke on the Water, After Midnight and the Yankee Notions. Bartender explained the prep process of all drinks. As a fan of the bar, I ended up buying some merch and he stuffed it with some branded pens and postcards. Definitely gonna make my way back the next time I am in NYC.

It’s probably been 10 years since my last visit here and it’s still going strong. Came on a Wednesday night for drinks after a show and it was pretty packed with about. 15 minute wait to get in. Drinks were nice - they do lean heavily towards shaken cocktails and while not my preference, they’re nice on occasion during warmer months. I had the after midnight which was just a perfectly balanced raspberry and coffee combo. I’ll be back!

This is only our second time here and we really enjoyed it. It was a Saturday so we stood in line prior to opening to ensure a seating at the bar. We wished we could have had more cocktails, but we had an omakase dinner reservation afterwards that we wanted to enjoy to the fullest (with all our taste buds in tact). The cocktails were tasty and the bartenders were terrific. We look forward to returning when we are back in town.

This is my favorite NY bar. I met some of the team when they had a guest bartending in Mexico and wanted to come since then. Cocktails are really good, shout out to the EO Espresso Martini and the Naked City that were my favorites. Food is also nice, you can sit at the bar or have a table for something more quiet. Service is top, great hospitality from everyone and amazing atmosphere. It gets really crowded late night.

I went to this place with my brother-in-law. We love their special cocktails. It is definitely a great experience. The service was good. We waited a little bit the first time, but when we went there the second time, we didn't have to wait because they know us now :) It's not just a regular bar; their cocktails are always special. The ambiance is cozy and inviting. The bartenders are skilled and friendly. I can't wait to go back and try more of their delicious drinks. The attention to detail in their cocktails really sets this place apart.

google.name: Blind Tiger
google.address: 281 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Solid beer bar. Decently sized tap list and had patrons in there during the afternoon. Didn’t try the food but the menu looked good. Even had a spot to charge my phone. Would pop in again if I was in the neighborhood.

They have a big selection of beers to pick from and I’m glad we stopped by for drinks. The decorations are more on the simpler side, but there’s several tables and chairs. For people who don’t like bitter beers, I’d recommend their half moon mosaic dream ipa or espresso martinis. We will definitely come back to try more drinks and have more of their espresso martinis. They also have a two drink minimum for credit cards. You can keep an open tab for the night and pay before you leave.
The Blind Tiger was recommended to me by my son. It did not disappoint. A great selection of craft beers. We also ate the mac and cheese. Great service and not too  busy.
Fantastic and ever-changing selection of craft beers.  Comfort food available and bar get busy so sometimes takes a few minutes to order.  Beer in a nice atmosphere is the main thing here.
A Village staple for good beer and tasty food. The beer taps offer a wide variety of mostly NY and nearby regional brews. Worth a visit if you love a great beer

google.name: L'Artusi
google.address: 228 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Went to the renowned @lartusi for brunch and was surprised by how chaotic and busy the place was. First floor was packed from groups of people waiting to be seated or walking in to score a table.

Overall, I really enjoyed the pasta because the noodles had amazing texture and the sauces were unique and delicious. I’d be interested to try more in the future, but will probably not be ordering other non-pasta items.

Great pasta, decent portions, nice vibes. Good dessert menu as well. Good service doesn’t disappoint. Can be a bit loud and busy during peak hours - tables are placed quite close to each other that the servers have a hard time moving in between and you can hear every word people say.

The burrata was DIVINE. The Brussel sprouts and other appetizers were really well done. I liked the pasta, but it didn’t stand out as much. Focaccia was real delightful. We were a big group in the private dining room.

Service was too slow. Long periods of waiting, especially for the first set of food. Water replenishment was also a tad slow.

The desserts were okay. The presentation of the olive oil cake was tacky. The cookies were cold??

Overall nice spot, cute area, really good food; very good for family style / sharing.

Food was delicious! We had the Cacio e Pepe and Tagliatelle pasta plus the trifle for dessert! Staff were so friendly and even gave us a glass of champagne as it was our honeymoon. Restaurant atmosphere was all great. Highly recommend.

Loved the food, didn’t love the wait.
Worth a visit I think, and will revisit to try their other menus as well but be prepared to wait.

We arrived several minutes later than our reservation time, yet had to wait 20min to get our seats, then another 10min for the server to finally notice us (when seating another table next to us) to bring water and menus. But once the food was ordered, everything was much faster.

There were a lot of frustrated diners crowding the lobby before and after our meal, who would often check in with the host on the status of their tables, so I don’t this was a one off experience just for us. Also had a glimpse of their system and they pack the table schedules in so tight, with no buffer between seatings. You’re bound to wait here.

As for the food, we ordered 2 pastas, 2 appetizers, and 1 glass of wine for lunch, coming at a total of $100 before tax/tip for two. Reasonable for the area and food quality. No complaints on the food whatsoever, it was good portioned and tasty.

google.name: Mermaid Oyster Bar
google.address: 89 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
What began as a casual New England-inspired fish shack in Manhattan’s East Village has evolved into a stylish American seafood brasserie, known for its warm hospitality and bold, seasonally inspired dishes.

Walking into The Mermaid Oyster Bar  feels like a mini escape into an inviting ambiance that is warm, relaxed, yet refined. The menu, featuring classic seafood dishes with inventive twists, reflects the freshest seasonal ingredients. Whether you’re savoring oysters from the raw bar or diving into a lobster roll, each dish captures the essence of seaside dining with a touch of New York sophistication.

We stopped by for Happy Hour, which runs from 4pm to 6pm. We ordered the shrimp and avocado sliders, fish tacos, clam chowder, and lobster Mac and Cheese. Everything was absolutely delicious. At the end of the meal came complementary chocolate dessert which was a much appreciated gesture.

Every detail, from the food, to the attentive service, and the decor, has been thoughtfully crafted to create a comfortable and memorable dining experience. For anyone seeking a taste of the coast in the heart of the city, Mermaid Oyster Bar offers a refreshing, laid-back retreat.

I was so sad when Mermaid Inn closed in the east village but am so happy to see this one open!  First they have a great happy hour food and drinks weekly and on a weekend! This restaurant is modern chic.  I just thought the actual bar could have been little bigger.  The host, bartenders, servers and the manager were all super awesome! The drinks and food so good! I’ll be making this spot my regular spot!
Cool atmosphere with great service. Tried multiple items on the menu and all were delicious. Lobster Roll was my favorite along with the shrimp and avocado slider!
We ordered the Great Grand Seafood Platter ($99) and were not happy with the size of the oysters and the quality of the food. We wouldn’t order that platter again.

Delicious food and great service. Came in on Friday and were sitting outside when the huge rain storm hit, they moved us inside. Highly recommend the seared calamari salad, the fries are good but eat them quickly because they get hard when they get cold

google.name: Cafeteria
google.address: 119 7th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA

review_snippets.text: I had a wonderful experience. Great food and atmosphere. Server was amazing too. Knowledgeable and down to earth. Shrimp appetizer was so good! Short ribs were tasty and carrots yummy. Top tier. Dessert was delicious!

This was such an unexpected fantastic place to eat. Outdoor dining was set up beautifully and well covered. Servers were spectacular, very on the ball and friendly. All the food was exceptionally good for a casual eatery. The watermelon feta salad was excellent as were the shrimp tacos. They added a veggie patty for us to the kale salad which was a perfect topper. And you must visit the restrooms; totally unique!

Super hip place that gives upscale vibes with the interior and serves elevated comfort food. Indoor-outdoor boundary is blurred with the seating that feels very open and nice. Great place for brunch or early dinner. There’s all types of people, families in there, very wholesome. There’s plenty of gluten free/vegan/vegetarian options as well. Servers are nice and accommodating but not overwhelming. Bar is gorgeous and the drinks were great!

I had the Bistro Burger with a lettuce wrap (9/10), Deviled Eggs (9/10), Burrata (9/10), Polenta Fries (10/10), Grilled Chicken Paillard (6/10) and the Wildberry Mojito (8/10) over two visits recently.

As an interior designer, I must note that the interior is absolutely stunning and very thought to the last detail. For a small space, they really made it look nice and conceptually consistent which I love!

Post graduation dinner. Loved the ambiance of the space. I saw couples, families, girls night out but I can definitely tell this place also gives hype happy hour/after dinner vibes. Indoor/covered outdoor seating. It was pretty chilly the evening we came and their heat lamps outside are NO JOKE! Fantastic bar. Loved that the music was a great mix of pop culture and old school that didn’t blow my eardrums out.
Drinks was amazing, food delicious and very good presentation. Our bartender Karl was very nice and very attentive. 100 % recommended

google.name: Joe's Pizza
google.address: 7 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: My friends and I went to Joe's Pizza and tried five different signature slices—each one was delicious! The crust was perfectly crispy, and the toppings were fresh. We had a great time, but the place was pretty crowded. Still, it’s definitely worth it for some of the best pizza in town!

It’s my best friend’s and I first time in New York and we knew we just had to go get pizza from here. We choose the perfect time, really late at night after the bar. And it was so worth it, he pizza was great. The people were also kind and helpful. I love seeing the celebrities they have pictures with. I mean what can I say that hasn’t been said already. Come try them out.

This is a classic NYC dive pizza shop. Only a few seats.  Standing tables outside. But the pizza is delicious. Thin and chewy crust, yummy sauce and cheese that is just slightly salty to give the best flavor.  CASH ONLY.  But no worries as they have an ATM in the entrance.

This is the Quintessential NY Pizza for me, a 5/5, 10/10, probably the best American-style or New York-style pizza I’ve had in America. Maybe L’Industrie challenges it? But not sure…

REASONS:

The crust: My favorite pizza crust, with the signature thin and crispy dough. Light enough to be floppy, but also strong enough to stay together when you fold it in your hand. And the first crispy bite of flavor is just food heaven. The pizza crust also has quite a bit of flavor, which is rare in most pizzas, and is perfectly baked to get the nearly burnt but crunchy texture.

The cheese: The fresh mozzarella is my favorite, so savory and melts in your mouth.

The tomato sauce: Those San Marzano whole-peeled tomatoes really shine in this sauce, which is bursting with flavor.

Get the fresh mozzarella slice! Although the classic cheese and Sicilian slice are good too.

$3-5 for a slice is a great deal, $25 for a pie. Cash Only, fast service, the line can be long but always moves fast.

Joe’s Pizza in New York is an iconic spot with a slice that truly lives up to the hype. The thin crust and perfectly balanced sauce make it a must-visit for any pizza lover. Fans of Spider-Man will also appreciate the nostalgic vibe, as the place famously featured in the movies. Whether you’re a local or a tourist, Joe’s serves up a classic New York slice that’s hard to beat. Don’t miss it when you’re in the city!

google.name: Family Meal at Blue Hill
google.address: 75 Washington Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text:
The food was good but nothing impressive/special. We did the wine pairing which was a huge mistake, it didn't go with the food at all. Honestly we should have known the wine pairing wouldn't be good since the chef changes the menu each day based on what's fresh (hence it'd be difficult to get the most optimal pairing). The servers also didn't know anything about the wine.

Overall, the food is fine but not good enough/unique enough to justify the price.

Overall, the entire experience was more on the disappointing side. This is not our first time dining at a "locally sourced ingredients" establishment or a Michelin-starred place. We also tried not to leave any food uneaten, knowing that the products were locally sourced, but this does not reflect our thoughts on the dishes.

The meal started on a fun note with different types of cucumbers paired with a green dip that was quite delicious. However, from that point onward, the main course was disappointing, despite the theme of the lunch being French brasserie.

The salad and ratatouille were nice, but the mussel dish tasted bitter due to the sauce, and the steak and potato plate was quite dry and rubbery. I've had similar dishes many times before, so it wasn't an issue of trying them for the first time.

As for the dessert, it was a large donut with apricot filling. It was served without any utensil to cut it, which might have been fine. However, the donut itself seemed to have been sitting out for a while—the bread tasted oily, and the filling inside was unfortunately quite sour. Even my partner, who usually enjoys all types of desserts, did not enjoy this one.

Lastly, regarding the service, everyone was friendly, but given that it was a menu-less place, we would have appreciated some explanation about the dishes without having to ask about each one.

We are not sure if we'd like to return to this place, although we might give it another chance since the menu changes seasonally. However, it's a big maybe for now.

Truly exceptional, but didn’t we know that already? They customized vegetarian meals for me and dad while my partner ate the freshest fish and meats to his hearts desire. They truly know how to make ingredients sing. We also had the wine pairing and I don’t know when I’ll have wine like that again- nothing hits the same anymore. Can’t wait to make a trip update to the farm one day

• Blue Hill in Manhattan is a wonderful place that I'd love to visit again.
• Their farm-to-table concept is simply amazing. They started with a restaurant in upstate New York and now have one in NYC too.
• What I really liked is that their veggies are grown on their own farm, and the meats and fish are provided by their partners. You can taste the fresh difference!
• The interior has a simple yet classy vibe, with lovely flowers adorning the space.
• The food is served as a mix of different dishes in a four-course tasting menu.
• They did an excellent job accommodating my dislikes and allergy requests.
• The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly.

Fantastic meal! All the ingredients were sooo fresh you could tell they grew it instead of sourcing like other restaurants. Especially in peak of summer, the vegetables and berries were so sweet and clearly vine ripened. Going to start coming often for date night!

google.name: Wilfie & Nell
google.address: 228 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great, easy place to grab a drink after work.
Not overly pricey, and the drinks were on the smaller side, which I appreciated.

Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. Went to the bar to order water and said excuse me 5 times to a group of men just to order and they told me I didn’t need them to move to order and then proceeded to order my drink for me. I got upset and told them I did not need strange men to order my drinks for me. The bartender saw this interaction and said me he poured the water for me after passing it to the guys who would not let me pass. If a lady is telling you she’s uncomfortable about her drink why are you as a bartender not acknowledging that. Especially after seeing that they were not letting ME order. Terrible crowd, terrible service. Also adding, do not go here if you’re a person of color. This spot is NOT it. The west village is generally racially charged but it seems all the racist are concentrated in this bar

Friendly neighborhood bar in the West Village.

We've had wings, fries and tried the burger too, all really good. This, together with a great wine and beer selection and an eclectic 80's soundtrack make this a bar we return to time and again.

We loved popping in here for a drink before dinner. The rustic interior inside is great and our cocktails were fantastic! Our bartender was also extremely friendly. All around a great experience, enjoyed the open windows and doors and would love to come back.

If you’re a person of color, please refrain from going to this establishment. Not only was there not one person of color in sight besides my friend and I and the bouncer, but you felt the animosity with crowd and staff including the bartender. We were treated with no respect after the bartender saw us being talked to wrongfully by 2 white males, then a group of white women got in our faces and made us seem problematic over a simple “excuse me”. I felt uncomfortable and wouldn’t recommend it at all!

google.name: Buvette
google.address: 42 Grove St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Atmosphere was great! And food was awesome! Really nice place to sit outside during the fall with a hot cappuccino when the leaves are falling 🍁 Highly recommend. There is always a long line and they don't take reservations for brunch. I had some pastries (come in pairs of two and are small), the waffle, and a croque. All great! Highly recommend!

Buvette in Chelsea is simply a must-visit for me every time I’m in New York. I was first introduced to this location, though I’ve also been to their Paris spot, and it’s always amazing—the food, the vibe, and the service are consistently top-tier. I recently caught up with a mentor here, and though it was his first time, he immediately understood why I love it so much. The ginger fizz drink is a standout, something I wish I could take home, and the waffle sandwich is unbeatable. For breakfast, especially the egg and salmon toast, Buvette is absolutely the best in New York. Just be sure to get there early; it’s popular for good reason!

Amazing French food! Also had the best chocolate mousse here, definitely worth the price! Reservations are highly recommended cause the place was packed on a Wednesday night. Some bar seatings available but not a lot. The restaurant is cozy so limited seating available.

We’ve been visiting Buvette since 2015 every time we stayed in NY and this place is a must-visit, not only for good food & drinks but also for lovely memories. The NYC location has a more chill & friendly vibe than Tokyo. It’s always a pleasure to see Noble again who serves us like an old friend and we definitely look forward to visiting again soon.

i went as a party of 2 on a saturday at 11am and we actually got bar seating very quickly because everyone else in front of us had larger parties or were waiting for tables. the wait for a table probably would’ve been 45min+

we got saumon fume, chevre, pain perdu
the eggs were a little underseasoned imo (needed more salt) and the french toast was really eggy. the bread was good in all the dishes but i dont think it’s worth a long wait. also they had the biggest caper ive ever seen

google.name: Murray's Bagels
google.address: 500 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text: When in New York, you’ve got to have bagels, right? I’d pinned this place ages ago, so I took the chance to walk over. It’s called Murray’s Bagels, and they have a huge menu to choose from. I picked one at random, and it was still delicious. I love the chewy, soft texture of their bagels.
We were only in New York for 4 days but went here 3 times for food and coffee. Delicious bagels, lovely staff and customers. The loaves looked gorgeous. Fabulous little bakery! We loved it.

Murray’s Bagels is a particularly popular ‘hotspot’ for many local residents in and around this part of Chelsea on the Westside of Manhattan. Notably very well situated inside a deli styled turn-of-the-century store front and interior with a painted antique white tin ceiling. An original architectural element retained in the layout of its interior design. The comfort level was not overwhelming and though there were side tables featured for pairing two people per se, at one, there were only six available places to choose from. Most were occupied singly while there. Spaces were limited due to seating used for customers waiting on orders to go during their busiest rush times. But on a Sunday like today, the atmosphere turnover is quite ginger. A relaxed mood and sensibility aside the clamorous momentum behind the counter filling the orders as quickly as assembled. Now, to be perfectly honest, The Traditional classic smoked lox, with cream cheese on a bagel with everything  on it, on an Everything Bagel— was pretty decent. What was tough to get past was the toughness of the bagel itself. Like chomping European hard-bread made in America. In all fairness having tasted many many bagels this was tougher, chewy, and really harder to bite through. Seriously my preference would be its competitor further up the street closer to W. 23rd. Though, that was its only drawback! Nothing else. The lox, absolutely fresh. Tomatoes, capers, red onions, and cream cheese, perfect! Nothing more than satisfying! But the bagel was the only downfall. I’m not opposed to the whole place for it’s popularity but, as finicky as a kid can get to be, it’s hard not to decide on finding another place that doesn’t have that hardness tacked to the taste, and especially bagels. They can be extra soft, and really fluffy and tasty too. So, otherwise, a truly beautiful place no matter what the opinion is, (it is indeed very Scandinavian) totally in the  ambiance and aesthetic culinary tradition. But “Don’t mind me” … it’s just a matter of preferences like anything else here in The Big Apple!

The bagel was like a scooby doo sandwich! 🥪
Mensch bagel- (advocado , omelette spicy mayo) 3.5/5 - it was a good bagel but the bagel itself was a little too tough to me. The ingredients and the mix was very good. But I took a half a star for the price being so expensive for a bagel.

I think the neighborhood hero atmosphere makes it a cool spot to just stop by.

The bagel was kinda tough but fine, but even worse, they didn’t respect the schmear.

There are definitely better bagel spots in NYC

yelp.name: Murray's Bagels
yelp.address: 500 Ave Of The Americas, New York, NY 10011

google.name: Morandi
google.address: 211 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Nice atmosphere, good wine list. The cooking oil needs to be changed. The bread was sooo good. The cacio Pepe was meh. The potatoes were excellent. Often a line for the bathroom. Service was professional but a little rushed.

Overall this restaurant averages a 3 in consideration of 5 star service, 3 star ambiance  and 3 star food. Funny thing is that Google reviews from NYC foodies placed higher at 4.6 stars. My boyfriend ordered rigatoni and I ordered the Bisteca (steak). The rigatoni was tough like either the pasta dough wasn't made in right proportions or it was cooked too al dente. Even fresh grated Parmesan sprinkled over it couldn't save it. I ordered the steak medium well. The beef was tender but the temp was off with a little too red still. It came with about 3 radicchio leaves and a small serving side of potatoes, which was probably the best part of all that was ordered. Service was great though the food was not to par, the waiter kept on refilling our glasses with NY finest tap water.

This place has an old school charm about it. We walked it on a quiet night and were seated without reservations. The decor of the place is so charming and so were the folks. We ordered the focaccia margarita & Cacio e Pepe and they were incredibly nice! Highly recommend!

In the realm of West Village Italian restaurants, Morandi has been a staple for many years. The atmosphere is quite charming, and the interior is classic wood and stone. The restaurant is quite large, with extra seating outdoors; that being said, you will need a reservation. The staff were always kind and efficient, and that being said, they never went out of their way for anything.

The food is quite good. I’ve tried a few different dishes. The focaccia bread is more of a flatbread; I don’t know why they would take all of the air out. The pastas were delicious and I recommend trying those. Overall, you can’t go wrong with the food here.
Went for restaurant week with my boyfriend and we absolutely LOVED the food. Service was excellent, Antonio made it all even more special. We’re definitely coming back. What a great night!

google.name: The Standard Grill
google.address: The Standard, High Line, 848 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
We loved this place, the 'decor' was really nice, the staff was great, this was elegant without being posh.
The food was also absolutely well done, we would definitely come back in this restaurant if we are in the region.
Obviously it was a bit on the high side for price but nothing ridiculous either, so I thought it was worth every penny.

Note for information, we live in France most of the year so our 'standard' are really high, the The Standard Grill managed the exceed them ! Thanks again to the whole Team.

We first visited this place just over four years ago as my partner was set on having a lobster roll. She liked it so much  that she insisted we visit again and it was just as good as the last time. I enjoyed the hand-made burger which was outstanding although we had no room for anything else! Lovely staff and good atmosphere (we were there at lunchtime and kids were welcome). Can really recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to eat having just come off the High Line or Little Island.

Our second time here. Parked right out front and easy to get  seated. Food is delicious. The Monkey Bread is a must even though we didn’t order it this time we got the  rainbow mimosa flight instead. Delicious fresh juices. Had to pa k the omelettes to go because they were so hearty. Definitely worth a walk outside of the Chelsea market.

Food and drinks were amazing!! The restaurant is really nice/pretty and everyone that works here was super friendly and helpful. Restaurant has great vibes. Definitely try the king crab pasta!! Need to go back again soon to try the caviar tater tots!!

My friend and i went here after a short walk from the Whitney museum.  Great menu, excellent food and service. Walking distance to the Highline and Little Island. The skinny fries were delicious soft on the inside but crunchy on the outside.

google.name: Perry St
google.address: 176 Perry St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Really great food. The pea soup was the best soup I have ever had. The green curry was amazing too. As well as the chicken, and sushi! The molten cake was not that great. It felt like it was frozen and then thawed.

Incredible food. The layering of flavor, the depth of preparation and the precision around preparation are all a magical union. The service set a high bar and we just had the most wonderful experience. Thank you for having us!

Wow, where should I begin? They warmly welcomed us like family upon arrival. Introduced themselves, sat us down right away. Came around often to top us off with water. The cocktails were outstanding, and the food, even more amazing.  I was so impressed. The caviar dish is a must. The asparagus salad is also not to be missed. You must get both of their cheese appetizers, the bass, and their salmon main. It had to be one of the best salmon dishes I've ever had. The preparation was flawless. The broth was incredible; it was a nice juicy piece with the crispy skin...incredibly well executed. The Balthazar bread is always excellent. The deserts, strawberry shortcake and chocolate dish...delicious.  We were full, but made room, they were too good to leave behind. Thank you a million times over. Please keep doing what you're doing, all of you. You clearly continue to take pride in your culinary craft, and hospitality. I can tell that you don’t skim on quality of ingredients either, in true JG form. Love this place. Location is amazing, close to the expansive water views. Grabbing a taxi is easy too, quick trip to Hudson Yards for the Vessel, Little Island, Chelsea Piers, whatever. There are so many options along that side of Manhattan. This is truly an NYC gem!

Perry St

Layout/atmosphere
*Bar area behind maitre’d station (two plants on the bar); lounge couches/tables to left; tables & booths to right and in back; big glass windows (view of West Side Highway, natural light), Edison bulbs

Service
*Bartender Mack - attentive

Food/drink
*Cucumber Martini (Ford’s Gin, cucumber, mint lemon) - very tasty, refreshing
*Complimentary sourdough bread & butter (three slices)
*Butter Poached Maine Lobster (potato garlic ravioli, lemongrass and makeup broth) - delicious; lobster was buttery & tender; ravioli was great addition; broth poured table side (citrusy, could have drank it on its own)
*Molten Chocolate Cake (vanilla ice cream) - cake moist, hot fudge was just right; chocolate crumble with the ice cream

Very happy with my experience here - this is fine dining that executes well and still surprises. Loved their tuna as well as their fried chicken. Pea soup is exceptional and a must add on to their tasting menu! Service is friendly and professional - great spot to impress whoever you’re with!

google.name: ZiZi
google.address: 182 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text:
Nice Mediterranean food. Some options are repetitive and bit heavy. Bread for my crazy baba came burnt to the point I couldn't eat it.
Atmosphere is nice. Service attentive. Drinks are quite good.

Awesome middle eastern location! I was surprised to have iPads for menus, though we couldn’t order off of them.

Absolutely loved their version of pita bread, it was fluffy, soft, and warm.

We ordered the lamb and chicken shawarma dishes and we were not disappointed. The lamb was super tender.

Zizi is a nice spot for a Mediterranean meal in the Chelsea area. The place has a rustic vibe, I am sure it would look good in the night with all the candles lighted up in the walls.
Liked their dip (Crazy Baba) and pita and the fact that everything tasted fresh. The portion size is good as well. Although felt that there could have been more options, especially in the dips.
Every item looked good in the menu so we ordered a lot variety. I must say I had more expectations, therefore, I felt that the food lacked flavors. It was more aesthetically pleasing, flavor wise just decent.
The shakshuka didn't feel like a shakshuka, it was a soup rather. The bread in the Mushroom sandwich was hard as a rock making it difficult to eat. The puff pastry was good and crispy but the dish as a whole was just okay. For a Mediterranean place, their hummus was too plain and basic. I have had better hummus in other Mediterranean restaurants in NYC. The only thing I can vouch for is their pita bread- really good and freshly made. Otherwise the food felt just plain and simple not extraordinary. They didn't deliver according to the expectations.
Also didn't find the staff to be friendly and engaging. They were just doing their duty.
I feel the restaurant has the potential to do much better.

Come here with friends, come here on a date, come here with whoever or by yourself! You're bound to have a good time! I’m getting excited thinking about the next time I’ll go and it’s only been a few days.

Literally, everything was perfection from the drinks, to the food, to the service, to the music. I would ask for extra hummus for the chicken Shawarma. It’ll also go well with the lamb chops!

I was craving for some Mediterranean cuisine, so I randomly found ZiZi and gave it a try. Loved how different Z selections. We ordered hummus, baba ganoush, and falafels. They were really good! Pita bread was also soft and warm. We also ordered overnight lamb. Compared to Zs, overnight lamb was ok. Nothing special. Tried better ones before. We got complementary chocolate mousse which was nice! The restaurant is a bit too noisy, so not suitable for date nights.

google.name: Hudson Clearwater
google.address: 447 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: So good!!!! We stumbled across this cute little place and were pleasantly surprised. Food was amazing. Cute decor, very clean and friendly staff. Will definitely return next time and hopefully sit out back. We got the Southern Eggs Benedict and Steak and Eggs. Food came out quickly and was DELICIOUS!

Came here for a work event yesterday & I was pleasantly surprised and wowed by their amazing food!!

We ordered their braised short ribs (so tender, seasoned perfectly & delicious!), raw oysters, espresso martini, and their bruschetta with black fig, caramelized onions & bread.

I would love to come back for any of the food items I had yesterday. Staff were welcoming, kind & accommodating as well. We ate in the back patio, the vibes/ mood was perfect

Great food, great drinks, great atmosphere, great service. What more do you need? I was first delighted with the back yard patio on a warm night. It was lovely with twinkling lights and little tables. The drinks list was thankfully manageable and after 2 of us having 3 different drinks, we thought every item on that list must be a winner. Then the food was marvellous. The combinations of ingredients might make you wonder  but, just like the drinks list, everything we had was great. Especially the sweet potato side dish! Doesn't sound like it would be anything special but the mix of slightly roasted pieces of sweet potato with harissa and coconut yogurt was a highlight. Go there!

Hudson Clearwater is a brightly lit brasserie, very casual, and empathetic. I only had a steak salad for lunch and it was quite good. The greens were fresh and they didn't skimp on the quality of the beef. $36 for a salad indeed is on the expensive side though. Not quite sure I'd actively seek this joint out but if the opportunity arises, wouldn't hesitate to enter.

I wasn't that impressed with the food or service. Both of the meals missed flavor. Portion of Huevos rancheros is rather small and extra $11 for small pieces of stake is really too much. Service was so-so. The only thing we liked was house-made lemonade. Their back garden is so nice and cozy and that is the only reason I would come back
here.

google.name: Casa La Femme
google.address: 140 Charles St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
This is an amazingly beautiful space, wow. The service was impeccable, so attentive and really makes you feel special. The food is just incredible. Delicious apps, the Salmon melted away by my fork. The dessert and cocktails were also spot on. Then a belly dancer came out to top off the magical evening.

Truly a special place, great for dates, out just a relaxing drink. Happy to finally come here. You should too. Enjoy

Came here to celebrate my cousin’s birthday and we had a great time. We did the $45 prix fix menu for the 9 of us. We tried pretty much everything on the menu and everything was tasty.
The service was also great.

The reason for my 4 stars and not 5. As I went back to look at the menu because we wanted to come back I noticed that there were desert included and we never got the desert, that was kind of disappointing since everything else was great. But it made me feel like we didn’t get everything we paid for.

it was an unforgettable experience. The moment we walked in, we were warmly welcomed and immediately felt the cozy, authentic atmosphere.

The food was delicious.  The highlight was the live belly dance performance, which made us feel like we had stepped out of New York and into Egypt. The service was exceptional, with attentive and friendly staff ensuring we had a wonderful evening. Highly recommended for anyone seeking an authentic Egyptian dining experience.

This interior 😍😍😍 even the floor. I absolutely love this restaurant.

The appetizer bread was very good, it had a very nice flavor and felt fresh.
The mousaka was very flavorful too. The dessert baklava is just two pieces, can't say much about it.
The service was okay, they were very helpful with the menu.
We went on a Monday so the place was very empty, the decor is very nice. But upon close inspection most of it looks very old.
Overall I would say that the place was good for a birthday or a special occasion, there were a lot of good spots for pictures.

Pretty expensive but it’s a beautiful place. Great atmosphere and service, good drinks. Food is good but not amazing. I’d only go here for a special occasion due to the price and the fact that there’s a brief belly dancing thing which is kinda cool.

google.name: Amorino Gelato - New York Greenwich Village
google.address: 60 University Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
