review_snippets.text: I stopped by for a quick snack and had a crepe with tiramisu and caramel drizzle, topped with dark chocolate sauce, as well as a cone of gelato with mango, strawberry, and vanilla flavors. The taste was amazing! The ambiance is great, with both indoor and outdoor seating areas.

I visited this place because my friend wanted gelato. We were both drawn to the waffles, so we decided to get a Waffle with pistachio gelato and a chocolate macaron. The rich pistachio flavor paired with the whipped cream and waffle was amazing—I couldn't get enough! We finished it all and left feeling satisfied!

It has a wide variety of gelatos, a section of fruit gelatos and another milk-based section. Its flavor is exquisite and it does not contain too much sugar, which is pleasant to consume, it is so good. I highly recommend the " dulce de leche " , " stracciatella " and " raspberry " flavor ! .

People might claim other gelato/ice cream shops are "great", but they probably have never been to an Amorino. By far the most consistently fantastic gelato shop outside of Europe I've come across. We always make a point to stop at one when we're in NYC.

Their dark chocolate ("Amorino chocolate" ) is fantastic, and pairs well with the caramel and its little crispy bits. Passion fruit is nicely tart, and the mango is super rich for a sorbet. The lemon is also very nice. The coconut was good on its own, but really shined when paired with the dark chocolate.

The staff was meticulous in making sure the presentation was on point. Great experience overall.

I was on a casual stroll with my friends and we wanted to stop by a cafe to get ourselves  a quick cup of coffee and found Amorino’s on our way so we passed by.

I got myself a nice flat white and some macaroons, absolutely beautiful and tasty the both. The flat white had a very good balance between the coffee and milk which really elevated my day, unlike most other places where they always overdo one of them. As for the macaroons the overall texture and creaminess was very rich in flavor which really made it melt all the way in my mouth. I got a pistachio flavored one and my friend got hazelnut.

Would definitely recommend passing by this Gelateria, i’ll be coming back to give their gelato a try and give another google review

google.name: Mamoun's Falafel
google.address: 119 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Mamoun's Falafel is a classic, old-school establishment that consistently draws a crowd—and for good reason. The food is always fresh and delicious, making it a favorite spot for many. There’s never any issue with the quality or taste of the food; it’s simply excellent.

However, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, they only accept cash, so be prepared. If you’re short on cash, you'll need to use the ATM right outside the store, which charges a $3 fee. The staff, while efficient, can sometimes come across as brusque, especially when you request extras like sauce on the side or if you’re a dollar short. Also, seating is very limited, so it's best to plan on taking your food to go. The prices are slightly on the higher side, but given the quality of the food, it's worth it.

This place is literally a hole in the wall! There's hardly any space to stand inside the store, but the food is exceptional! The food came out pretty fast, and they had some outdoor seating on the street. The sandwiches are a bit messy cause they are stuffed with goodness! Would definitely go back!

I tired this place because it seems iconic and recommended but to be honest it fell a little flat for me. I ordered the lamb pita sandwich to try on my visit. Truthfully it lacked anything to make it feel special and worth the trip besides the fact that it was reasonably priced. The meat was a little chewy, the lettuce tasted like pre-chopped butter lettuce from a Trader Joe’s bag, and the toppings lacked depth.

I wouldn’t recommend this spot given how many other spots you have to choose from in New York.

Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 1/5

The falafels were no doubt the star of the show. I got some falafels and the falafel sandwich. I found the sandwich to be tangy and sour.  I’ve had better sandwiches. The falafels themselves on their own were quite good! Service was fast. It is a hole in the wall with 2 tables with 2 seats inside the place. They have a makeshift seating outside which is really in bad shape. I wanted to enjoy my meal here but the seating made it difficult to do so. I know it’s New York City, and space is not plentiful. Next time, I’ll try the chicken shawarma.
We came here on a food tour and it did not disappoint! I love a good restaurant with a good back story and even better food! The falafel was flavored to perfection! Will definitely be back

google.name: Off the Wagon
google.address: 109 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Went on a Wednesday night to watch the Knicks playoff game. I had the Burger and a Side of French Fries. The burger is juicy, lots of flavor, and the fries were crispy.
Many TVs to watch Sports. There was Hockey, Basketball, and other sports on.
Drinks are around $10 (decently priced for the area) staff is friendly.

If Chelsea is there, expect the best time. Had the burger and salad and both were excellent. Their happy hour deals will make you stay too long, but in a good way.

I will be coming back.

I’ve been quite a few times and I can say the music is usually pretty good! It’s a nice spot to go to catch any sports games on some fairly large TVs, but also if you’re a New York fan, this is the place for you. Food until late, drinks, friends, DJs. Staff is great too! Try the wings !

Amazing spot to watch sports and grub on some good bar food. This place also gets rowdy late night with a lively crowd. I came in to watch some college football the other day and ordered some chipotle bbq wings and fried pickles. The wings were delicious and they have 8 flavors to choose from. Fried pickles were amazing too. They have plenty of TVs and a bunch of local beer on tap. There’s an upstairs as well so plenty of room for games and late night dancing.

Visited this place for the first time with my friends and my gosh we had such a fun experience! The staff was incredible. We were a big group and sat upstairs and the bartender up there was just the nicest guy and incredibly fun. The food offered here is amazing!! The best thing on the menu in my opinion was the empanadas (chicken was my favorite) and the tater tots!!
Just an overall amazing experience and will definitely be coming back here again!

google.name: Cafe Cluny
google.address: 284 W 12th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
My favorite breakfast menu item so far is the avocado toast with a poached egg and side of greens. The greens were evenly and nicely marinated in a vinegar sauce. The poached egg was a fun and tasty addition to the avocado toast. The avocado spread was good, along with the toast and tomatoes. Overall it was solid but I do tend to prefer more adventurous flavors.

The steel cut oatmeal with fruit was nicely done. The coconut shreds and almond slivers helped it quite a bit and were a nice touch more than regular oatmeal with fruit. I don't think I'll get it again simply because it is huge and I don't want to spike my blood sugar so early in the morning. But some people are eating French toast with syrup for breakfast so for those people this would be an improvement in terms of blood spiking.

I stumbled upon Café Cluny in West Village on Sunday evening after Pride Parade and thought it looked cute from the outside. My friends and I decided to give it a try, and it was a great find! The interior is very cute and relaxing, with lovely decor and lighting.

The service was phenomenal, our server is Amelia. Staff are friendly and attentive. We tried the pan seared branzino and
Yellowfin tuna tartare, both beautifully presented and absolutely delicious. The cocktails ( paper plane, aperol magarita, aperol spritz and negroni) were fantastic too.

I'll definitely be coming back to try their brunch!

Highly recommended. Enjoyed lunch here on a weekday so enjoyed the airy atmosphere as opposed to the packed weekend crowd. Friendly and attentive service, excellent food prepared very well and serves hot, broad variety of food. A must is the French onion soup! The spaghetti duck bolognese is also exceptional. Enjoy!

Great spot - the fare is unexceptional but very nicely made. We had the salad and the eggs with the profiterole desert. The service is excellent. And the atmosphere is even nicer.  The profiterole was mostly ice cream and the eggs were nicely done.

The interior is nice, and the food is excellent. The onion soup was particularly tasty. I'll definitely go back, especially when Julianne Moore was having her dinner at the table next to mine. I'll never forget this night.

google.name: taïm mediterranean kitchen
google.address: 222 Waverly Pl, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Their menu is different from what you see on here. The shawarma & bowl are almost of the similar price.

The food is good but a bit higher in price for what you get. The restaurant staff won't smile at you and aren't very polite.

Delicious Mediterranean food, super flavorful. Not for the wimpy. Tahini is rich with sesame oil, hummus is full of garlic, eggplant dip is hearty and lemon-y. Their pita, very fresh and light, is dusted with za'atar and cumin. Falafel come in spicy or regular, both are delicious and light. Don't skip the Mint Ginger Lemonade. Good for kids and vegetarians who appreciate subtle flavors.  Fast counter service, nice staff, zero ambiance so it's better for takeout than to sit-in at their counter.

I have worked in the West Village for years and have consistently seen the quality of this location’s food decline while the prices rise.  The latest order I placed today will be my last!  Ordered a falafel bowl with half rice and half hummus.  There is barely any hummus and the rice is dry and stale, not how they used to make it.  I dunno why their quality just gets worse since they are a popular lunch spot.   Oh and now they charge for a pita on the side of a bowl.  Fortunately the falafels are still good, but this isn’t worth the $17 bowl for me any more.

Really solid falafel, if not exploding with flavor, it was still delicious. Almost 5 stars but not quite because of playing it safe with the spices. Perfect ratio of tahini, tomatoes, cucumber, ask for pickles. Actually, you can request any item from their little display and it’s included…feta, marinaded garbanzos, etc. It’s quite good! Pricing is reasonable. Music is good. You just sit at a counter facing the quiet street.

As a local come here often but place has gone down in quality SIGNIFICANTLY in past 6 months. Small portions, missing ingredients from orders, unfriendly staff.

Sadly I think you’re better off going to Hummus co, Just Salad, or even Naya and you’re likely to get a better meal out of it.

Management or something must have changed.

google.name: Negril Village
google.address: 70 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Overall, not a bad place but overpriced for what you get. I do not recommend coming here. There's much better Caribbean food elsewhere, especially uptown.

The jerk chicken was nice and spicy but a little dry inside. For most of the food here, it's a bit overpowering on the spice (rather than a careful cooking for the texture) so you're not a spicy food person? You may not like the menu.

The server was friendly and knowledgeable. The hostess had a lot of attitude. I arrived at 2:00 p.m. and the place was completely empty, but she acted like the place was fully booked. We had a reservation confirmed.

Finally, there was something weird going on with the music. It would stop every now and then and the volume would fluctuate two notches up and down throughout the song. Kind of strange. The music gave it a nice upbeat vibe but also rendered a place. Not as great for intimate conversations.

I love this place ! The food was 10/10 the oxtail soup is definitely worth the try. My servers name was Andre ( I think ) but he was great attentive to everything even let me meet the chefs to give them their flowers. As a born and raised Jamaican give this place a try ! It’s BYOB , but trust me the mock tails they make are amazing you add your own liquor and there is your cocktail !

This place was amazing ! Anthony our waiter absolutely phenomenal. My husband took me here for my birthday in may and we came back a month later to celebrate our 8 year anniversary. The food was amazing. You can bring your own bottle and Anthony has the perfect recommendations for what to mix with.
Come here with my ex for his birthday, and yes, we are still cool. It's a very nice restaurant, the staff was wonderful and the food and the drinks are on point.

Our party of two went to Negril this past Mother’s Day, and although we didn’t have a reservation we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. Our server Christina came over and introduced herself. I don’t think I’ve ever had such a warm and personable server as Christina. What a beautiful spirit she has. By the time we left it felt like we had known her for years. She truly enhanced our dining experience at Negril.

And the food? Spot on! We had plantain as appetizers, which were perfectly made. One entree we had was lobster tails with a side of grits. Another was chicken roti. Both were delicious with just the right amounts of seasonings. We also had some crazy delicious drinks. One was passion fruit and another I don’t recall exactly, except for the fact it was tasty and refreshing (that’ll be the white colored one in the pics).

I love the vibe of this place. The music is at the perfect level, (not too loud), and the interior design is pleasing to the eyes. Way back when I used to frequent the old place on 23rd when I lived in Chelsea, but I like the atmosphere at W. 3rd even more.

The only reason I’m not rating Negril higher is because it took an unreasonably long time for our food to come out. We were told that our order had not printed out in the kitchen (or something to that effect). Because of the delay we were unable to make the next event of our evening and had to cancel and reschedule, which was disappointing. While the delay altered our evening plans, after we canceled the next event we were then able to relax more and enjoy the great dishes and environment. Gotta be flexible and roll with it sometimes.

In spite of the above, I’m looking forward to returning (largely because of the amazing service Christina provided), and have already been thinking about what to get next time! In closing I admired the professional, yet warm and personable staff, loved the great food, and just simply enjoyed being there. Give Negril a try, I’m sure you’ll love it.
Highly recommended!

google.name: Empellon Taqueria & Bar
google.address: 230 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Can't wait to come back again soon. LOVE the vibe here. Great food and service. Fish tacos + French Fries - it's like my idea of heaven. I will be back soon with a big group of friends - perfect place to hang out + toast with espresso coladas!!! Thanks Ross + Empellon team!

Great food and drinks with a fun atmosphere.

Highly recommend the 7 salsas as an app and the spicy cucumber marg as drink. Even if you don’t like spicy cocktails, the spice is only in the rimmed salt so you can make it as spicy as you want.

Pretty small menu mostly tacos but we enjoyed the fish and shrimp tacos. Tacos are decently sized.

2 of us shared, in order of liking from most to least, the special tacos (with wrapped bacon), shrimp tacos, and lamb tacos. The special tacos were uniquely interesting, shrimp tacos good, and for the lamb tacos I wasn't a fan of the salsa boracha.
Overall, the food was all good, though it's pricey for tacos.

Me and my friend had a good time at Empellon Taqueria. We tried the beans flautas, vegan chorizo, brussel sprouts and fish tempura tacos.

We both had 2 virgin piña colada, the first one was soooo good the second round was meh.

There are 2 dining rooms, one in the front and one in the back. Happy hours Monday-Friday 5-7pm

The total came out to $130 before tips

I stumbled into this Mexican restaurant by complete accident & was lucky enough to find a table at the right time. The staff very friendly & attentive. The interior was available but the outdoor dinning was very inviting & also available.  Service was great, drinks were delicious & food definitely outstanding!  The carnitas were a little salty but delicious to say the least. I do have to admit, it was a little pricy but can't denied that it was money well spent. Can't wait to go back.

google.name: Malatesta Trattoria
google.address: 649 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: A lovely spot in the West Village - with lovely pasta and a top tier atmosphere. Some small issues - not being able to reserve a table for two people (walk-ins only for that table size) and the bread they gave us was a bit stale. I liked that they split the one pasta we ordered over two plates - a sweet touch!

Nice place. The spinach gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce was definitely the highlight of our order, extremely delicious! The grilled portobellos were pretty good and went well with the mozzarella. The tiramisu was just decent (there are better ones in the neighborhood)

Amazing food ! Price and location are great! Definitely would recommend this place ! I ordered few starters fungi di Prato ( arugula and mushrooms, would not recommend)and Panzanella (watermelon salad)
I would recommend Panzanella , for main I ordered  spinach gnocchi (it was too salty) but was tasty ! My favorite was dessert! I ordered Panna Cotta !
My advice for management of the place is to be more present on the floor and help to your team at conflict situations ! I think it’s extremely hostile work environment! The  restaurant needs to hire HR or work with team more and explain that bullying colleagues is not right way to solve the problem! And management should know what going on and stop the conflict instead of watching it from the host stand .
We had an excellent experience at this place. The pasta was all very good and fresh. The only thing was the ravioli was a bit on the smaller side

Very crowded place, the ambience was noisy but cozy. I'm not a huge fan of Italian food in the first place but my friend is vegetarian and really likes the penne from here. I got the tagliatelle ragu which was $18. The portions were a little small, they gave us some bread to snack on before the food came out which was nice. The complimentary bread was a little soggy (maybe from the rain, this establishment is pretty open which is nice). The waiters were all very nice and the food came out in a timely manner even though it was crowded.
I wouldn't say it's my favorite but the pasta was a nice texture, there just wasn't an incredible flavor to it and the portions were smaller than I was expecting.
Fun place, not for me, but maybe for someone else!

google.name: Bobo
google.address: 181 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Bobo is such a cute brunch spot. It’s located inside a townhouse with a beautiful dining room, outdoor terrace and a dimly lit den below street level.

The den may be nice for dinner or even by the windows, but we were seated in the back away from the sunlight on a gorgeous day out. If you’re looking to enjoy the beautiful weather, I’d recommend sitting in the dining room or outdoor terrace.

I tried the avocado toast, which was simple with nice flavor from the sunflower seeds and a side of greens. I’m looking forward to trying more dishes next time.

I was very surprised by how nice this place is! The interior of the restaurant is very welcoming and the outdoor patio in the back is so cool. They have some great happy hour deals as well.

The food was tasty. Tuna was delicious and the salad it’s bedded on was just as good. The chicken had a very good sauce on top of it and was juicy. Drinks were priced reasonably especially for the area. Service was pretty good too. Our party had mixed reviews of the place, but I really enjoyed my experience.

Recommend this place if you like French food and are in the area.

The food, service, and atmosphere were good!
The server was very nice and we enjoyed the food a lot. The chicken I had was very tender and good. The shrimp risotto could be cooked a bit longer, but it was also good. I would love to try their brunch menu next time.

EXCELLENT fish dishes. Both the tuna and Branzino were absolutely delicious. I could not figure out which one was better.

They have a pretty good happy hour and I enjoyed the white wine. Oysters were OK. Great happy hour deal though ($2 each).

The second floor is a bit noisy. Very cute interior though just noisy. A little tight with the tables. I would be interested in coming back and sitting downstairs.

Very nice staff.

Something to consider for a date night or with friends!

Amazing food, the crispy artichokes are a must! The interior is really nice, has a great atmosphere, although the tables are a bit too close it’s not an issue. Service was great, sympathetic and fast. Will definitely come back next time I’m in NY!

google.name: Art Bar
google.address: 52 8th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Such a fun bar! The waitress was super friendly and helpful. The pina colada syringe jello shots were my favorite!

Came here for a friend’s birthday! Our server Karlita was super friendly and helpful and the fries were hot, fresh, and tasty af. Really enjoyed my Botanist Martini ($12) which tasted just like a fresh green juice, but have to say it was annoying that there were no prices on the menu; we had to ask our server to look up each individual drink because they ranged from $10-19 and you had no way of knowing. Wish they’d fix that — but still a super fun hang!

Came here on a Wednesday evening on a holiday week. Very busy but my group of 4 was still able to get a booth in the front room. Aesthetic is lively and quintessential NYC before the World Wide Web.
One of the few places that has been able to keep this vibe. May it exist for another 30+ years.
Great spot to meet up with friends to grab a cocktail without having to pay city prices (~$11 for a martini)
Good happy hour that runs until 7pm also.
Bar tender Beth was very attentive and drink prices aren’t to bad .  They start you off with a glass of water which is nice  while you wait for your drink.

we came on a Saturday at 7:30pm and there was sufficient space to sit indoors or outdoors. the drinks are great, but it would be nice to see the prices. i’ve ordered 2 martinis that are “at least $10” and one was $12 and the other was $19. the lack of clarity is misleading to customers. for reference, the paper plane is $13, lychee martini and pomegranate are $12

google.name: Gotham Restaurant
google.address: 12 E 12th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

review_snippets.text: As a European visiting this French inspired restaurant I have to say I was a bit disappointed. I know that everything has to move fast in Manhattan but sometimes its better to take things slow, especially for a restaurant that wants to be of a higher standard. The starters were brought out a little to fast after the appetizer but so far no comment. What got me a bit annoyed is that right after the starters i wanted to digest a bit and enjoy my glass of wine but about 5 to 10min later i got served with my main course.  Way to fast to even enjoy the whole food experience! The staff tried their very best to pamper you and have a great experience. The only thing they can do better is the timing of the courses. I spend around 500 USD. This included : 2 cocktails each, 1 appetizer, 2 starters, 2 main courses,  1 bottle of white wine and 1 dessert and of course a nice tip. So overal I like Gotham Restaurant,  I would dine here again, but next time I'll tell them we are not in a rush. Thank you Gotham Restaurant for the nice evening!

Outstanding experience, we enjoyed the Wednesday night live jazz band. Our meal was delicious. The oysters were delicious, tuna tartar a must! the cauliflower  soup went great with their house made fresh bread. main courses were amazing and presented wonderfully. The wine selection is very extensive. staff was very helpful from coat check to servers even management would come by to check on us and ask if everything was well. I will definitely return again or bring friends from out of town to enjoy this beautiful and great ny restaurant experience. loved how they any left over to go for you by coat check.

So we went there for restaurant week. The food quality wasn’t bad, but I am concerned with the customer service. (The lobster on the regular menu tasted awful: not worth $58 in my opinion. But the $7 bread was amazing)

(1) the appetizer included in the $60 bundle meal was charged again in my final receipt, I caught it and asked them to change back. It happened to another friend of mine recently too in this restaurant. I wonder if it’s the restaurant’s plan or it’s some waiter’s/waitress’ intentional mistake. Very suspicious.

(2) During the time when I was chatting with my friend over dinner, different waiters and waitress kept coming to check with us, making us feel we were over staying. 🙂

Outstanding experience! I give them my outmost recommendation.
First, we had a special occasion to celebrate and we highlighted this in our reservation.
The receptionist carefully reviewed the reservation notes and seated us accordingly. Joseph was a gem and set the tone for the evening.
This definitely elevated the experience from the first moment.
The service delivered by the waiters were perfect. I mean it perfect!
The food was delicious and the drinks was refreshing.
To conclude, would definitely love to come again And I definitely recommend it.

The service was so impeccable. The servers explained the dishes so well and was so attentive. We were a party of 5, and they basically had 5 servers bring out each of our entree at the same time. I've never seen that!

And the food was delicious. Very accommodating for vegetarians. They had the white asparagus that was a special menu item and it was smoky and juicy. My friends had the steak and pork chop and loved it as well. We ended the night with 3 desserts. Their strawberry lemon pie was also a special and was the best dessert I've had in a while.

yelp.name: Gotham Restaurant
yelp.address: 12 E 12th St, Flr 1, New York City, NY 10003

google.name: White Horse Tavern
google.address: 567 Hudson St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Nice spot with street dining, you can admire all the people passing by.
The smashed burger was amazing, really juicy and with lots of flavor from the pickles and onions, the fries were really good also.
The crispy  calamari was also really really good, the crust was crispy and the calamari really tender. Good selection of German draft beers.
The service wasn’t that good, there was only one server for all the outside tables.

Food was good.  The beet salad is a must have.  I enjoyed the blue cheese burger but my husband not so much. Hence the 4 star for food. The calamari is ok but served with a tomato sauce, which wasn't great.  Certainly have had much better calamari. Service was friendly and the vibe of the bar is great.  Feels like it's been there a long time.  Would recommend for a quick bite if you're in the area.
i loved the feel of this old tavern. I didn't get to spend a lot of time there since I was on my way to the airport. Nice little place to absorb the local history. Food is decent as it is a tavern.

One of the most iconic burgers in all of New York City! This place has been doing it right for a few centuries now!

All of the drinks are fantastic, you cannot go wrong with any of them. And get all the apps the Caesar salad, the nachos the calamari we devoured it all! Came for this burger and stayed for the vibes

We loved this restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious. The B.E.C. Dumplings are to die for! Pictured is the burnt lemon chicken and the double smashburger. So good! We’ll be going back next time we’re in NYC for sure!

google.name: Carbone New York
google.address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: So so good! The service is great and old school Italian. The portions are huge! Can’t stop raving about the baked clams, vodka rigatoni and veal parm. We are having a private dinner at Sadelle’s, which is catered by Carbone. They helped us make a reservation so we had better idea of what to pick for the private dinner. We tried a lot of things and was comped a few sides as well. So much better than I ever imagined. If you can get a reservation this place is a must!

The food is good, but there are better Italian places. The reputation exceeds the quality. However, if you do get a reservation go, it is good, just expensive. The vodka pasta is great. The meatballs are overrated. My favorite part is always the complimentary appetizers.

One of the best Italian in NYC but it's a bit pricey. Worth it to try on special occasions. Spicey rigatoni was def delicious but not worth it's high price tag. Other than that, everything here is great as expected.

Carbone is an exceptional culinary establishment. The dining experience begins with a delightful assortment of bread accompanied by mozzarella and salami, setting the stage for a memorable meal. The menu boasts a delectable array of dishes, including the tantalizing spicy vodka rigatoni, succulent meatballs, flavorful veal parmigiana, and a heavenly cheesecake. The service provided at Carbone is exemplary, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant is meticulously curated, creating the perfect atmosphere for a refined culinary journey. I highly recommend Carbone for an extraordinary dining experience.

Carbone NYC is a culinary gem that truly delivers an exceptional dining experience. From the moment you step inside, you are transported to a glamorous and elegant atmosphere that sets the stage for a memorable meal. The retro decor, complete with checkered tablecloths and dim lighting, exudes a classic New York City charm.

Now, let's talk about the food. The menu at Carbone NYC is a delightful homage to Italian-American cuisine, featuring classic dishes with a modern twist. The famous spicy rigatoni vodka is a must-try, delivering a perfect balance of heat and creaminess that will leave your taste buds craving more. The lobster ravioli is another standout dish, boasting tender meat smothered in rich tomato sauce and gooey mozzarella cheese.

The service at Carbone NYC is impeccable, with attentive staff who are knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make your dining experience as enjoyable as possible. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply looking to indulge in some top-notch Italian food, Carbone NYC is the place to be.

In conclusion, Carbone NYC is a culinary masterpiece that seamlessly blends traditional flavors with a modern touch. The food, ambiance, and service all come together to create an unforgettable dining experience that will keep you coming back for more. Trust me, a visit to Carbone NYC is a treat for all the senses and a culinary journey you won't soon forget.

google.name: 8th Street Winecellar
google.address: 28 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text: fantastic happy hour. get a bottle for $30. good cheese plate and $1.5 oysters for happy hour too. we went on a tuesday just as it opened and there weren’t too many people. it filled up pretty quick by 6pm. happy hour goes till 8 so you have lots of time to stop by after work. the vino verde was our wine of choice and the perfect crisp sip for a hot summer day. for the intended vibe 5/5 (patio happy hour). you never know what you’ll see people watching near washington square park - hh & a show

Best bartender ever! So knowledgeable and friendly. Allows tastings and makes sure you find your ideal glass of wine. Wine selection isn’t huge but it’s eclectic and they will help guide you to your final selection. Cheese board is amazing quality and also a lot of bang for your buck. It’s a go to wine bar in the neighborhood.

What a cute happy hour spot! We got a bottle of the Spanish red for $30, a cheese tray, and the arancini. So delicious. A perfect vibe for summer. Our server was sweet and knowledgeable as well, but there was a bit of miscommunication about our cheese tray. She said she would bring us the list of cheeses so we could choose, but she didn't come back for a while and then when we asked her about it, she said that the order is already in, so we didn't get to choose. It still tasted really good though so not too upset about that.

Nice wine bar. Staff did not want to engage in recommending specific things.
It’s a perfectly fine place to go to for a drink - nothing more, nothing less

I reserved the back area of the underground bar for my birthday and it was perfect. By the time we arrived, the owner himself welcomed us and helped us with our initial wine selection. As our guests arrived throughout the night, the bartenders made sure everyone had a wine glass and that no glass was ever empty. We were so impressed by the service and how accommodating the whole staff was. And of course the wine itself was great as well. Definitely recommend this place for celebrating a special event or even coming to casually enjoy affordable wine!

google.name: Red Bamboo
google.address: 140 West 4th Street, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I had a great experience dining here, with one of the most kindest waiter ever. The atmosphere is cozy and everyone was so friendly including the other guests. The meal I ordered was so tasty! It was very satisfying and filling. I can’t wait to go back and try something different.

One of the best vegan places I've ever been.
I tried the vegan chicken rice, and it was perfect in terms of flavor and textures. The vegan chicken tastes brilliant, I absolutely loved it and actually looking forward to visiting another time and trying something new on their menu.
The lady there (not our server) was very sweet and the ambience is very cozy, so this place is perfect for a late lunch where you just wanna have a beer and eat great food after a long tiring day of exploring the neighborhood.
🫰🏼🫰🏼🫰🏼

I came in to place a large takeaway order.  Leslie is fantastic and took care of my order with all my special requests. I got a milkshake to go and it was delicious!! Forgot to take food/drink photos but I did take photos of the menu to share here.

Adding that when I picked up my order, the kitchen had labeled everything how I asked which helped me so much!! Outstanding service at this restaurant. Everyone loved the food tonight. 😋

The food was amazing! Highly recommend the mashed potatoes and brown gravy! We ended up getting EXTRA brown gravy because it was so good! Plus organic vegan wine and the crunchiest breaded chicken, in the best, in NY.

Friends brought me here while I got stuck on a 2 day layover in NYC. We shared several dishes and everything was delicious. So grateful to know of a fully vegan place in the city. And shoutout to Les for being an incredible sever. Thanks again for everything!!

yelp.name: Red Bamboo
yelp.address: 140 W 4th St, Ste A, New York, NY 10012

google.name: Gottino Enoteca e Salumeria
google.address: 52 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

review_snippets.text: So unpleasant experience.  I went to celebrate my friend's birthday  5 people, we were waiting for the previous clients to leave so we can sit on a table, then suddenly another woman sits right away  claiming that it was her birthday and that  she and her friends will be sitting there. None of the waiters step in to solve the inconvenience; one waitress stopped by and asked us to move to another table without enough space to sit. They never listened to us or made anything to understand and come with a solution.  I will never go again, and I do believe the staff  is completely unhelpful and useless.
Great wine bar in the area ! They have an outdoor garden where you have a quieter ambiance. Great selection of wine.

Truly some of the best small plates in NYC. Fantastic wine selection and incredible guidance from the staff regarding pairings. Definitely try the ricotta and figs, and their prosciutto is sliced fresh in front of you and is worth every penny. Great date spot, or place to share a bunch of tasty dishes with a group of friends.

super cute. such reasonable prices and lovely vibe. great food and not too busy! go here if you want to have a calm night and escape the city’s chaos and too busy restaurants. wine, olives and cheese with a book is great here on a wednesday.

Delicious Italian small plates in a cozy West Village spot. We came in on a Sunday night for dinner and got a table for 3 people without any problem. We tried 2 crostinis, the white fish and the brussel sprouts salad. We particularly enjoyed the crostinis. The staff was so friendly. Looking forward to coming back and sitting in the garden!

google.name: Caliente Cab Co.
google.address: 61 7th Ave S, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Our anniversary dinner at Caliente Cab after a Yankee’s game was absolutely unforgettable, thanks to our remarkable waiter, Jose! 😊 He went above and beyond with his exceptional customer service, making my husband and I feel so special from the moment we sat down. Jose’s attention to detail, warmth, and genuine care made our first experience at this restaurant one we’ll never forget.

The food was delicious, but it was Jose who truly made the night magical.
We’ll definitely be back—thank you Jose, for making our celebration so perfect! 🦋💕

We were first and foremost grateful for finding this restaurant because it was quite difficult for an unprepared tourist without a reservation to find a spot to eat in the neighbourhood. This place is big so we only had to wait for about 10 minutes for a turnover in our favour.
The food itself was extremely generous to say the least but I need to just get used to this fact of life in the US and accept I will never finish a meal with my puny European appetite. We tried a mix of different things and they were all very satisfying.
If I had to complain about anything, I would say there was little to no fish in the Ceviche as it was mostly made up of seafood and I was a little surprised at the lack of spice in the dishes. That can easily be fixed by readily available hot sauces but it shows the dishes were adapted for a more international audience.
My final tip is that the sizes of cocktails come in 3 options:
1. Too small
2. Too big
3. Animal feeding trough (sharing portion)

A ton of outdoor seating, covered in a patio-like setting. A great place to enjoy drinks and great mexican food outside on a nice day. The fajitas are excellent. I also like their nachos, quesadillas, mexican street corn - and the tacos are big. I give them bonus points for complimentary chips and salsa, which seems to be a rarity these days.

Walked here after work it’s a great area to take a stroll in. The ambiance was great to catch up with friends or colleagues over a cocktail. Size offerings their margaritas are unmatched. Highly recommend!
Note: For a Mexican spot they have very little gluten free options. I personally always favor Mexican restaurants because their menus tend to be gluten free however that is not the case here.
A perfect lunch menu that includes a main, side, and a drink for only $17+tax and tip, plus complimentary tortillas with salsa. The food was quite good, the service was nice, no complaints.

google.name: Wallsé
google.address: 344 W 11th St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
The restaurant week dinner menu (available everyday of the promotional period) was delicious. All the flavors of the dishes were well balanced and refreshing.
-Beef was tender with a delicious red wine sauce.
-Cod was buttery with a melt in your mouth pastry layer.
-You could taste the corn in the chowder and the cream was not overpowering. The crab cake in the dish was a nice complement.
-The melon soup and fruits used were refreshingly sweet.

The servers are very attentive.

The restaurant is very clean and well maintained.

Came here for dinner during restaurant week and loved the food! The staff were friendly and nice and very helpful with the food selection. I looooved the corn soup! The vibe was great for a date night, but it was on the quieter side, so I wouldn’t recommend it for a bigger group or for girls night

Absolutely fabulous!  Husband and I decided to try this restaurant on advice from the concierge of the hotel we were staying at.  The food was wonderful, I got the venison and my husband got the spätzle.  The star of the meal was the dessert, sachertorte, a pastry that is lighter than a cloud with ice cream.  A must order for anyone that dines there.

The wine list is specialized to Austria.  I was interested in finding a Reid Kellerberg Durnsteiner Riesling.  The sommelier was very excited when I showed him a photo of what we had ordered at a restaurant on the West Coast.  He was more than happy to oblige, he directed us to a 2018 Reid Kellerberg Durnsteiner Riesling.  Told me this is his Dad’s favorite.

We will definitely be dining again at Wallsé.  A gem in New York City!

We arrived a bit early for our 7pm reservation and were taken to our table fairly quickly. The staff were all very friendly, informative on the menu, and professional. The aesthetics are lovey; including the fresh flowers in the window still, bathrooms and all the dining room tables. The food was excellent. My mom loved the grapefruit Austrian beer & I enjoyed one of the Austrian dry white wines in the photo. The butternut squash soup is a must & dairy free (made of coconut milk). My mom & sister got the organic chicken and I got the cod, which was cooked perfectly & the sauces & veggies paired so well with it. The atmosphere is not too quiet and not too loud, just right. Would definitely return to bring friends here and try some other items on the menu!

I was here for my birthday last night. It’s a very unusual restaurant in the west village. One of the best dining experiences I’ve had in New York for a long time. First of all, if you’re looking for a restaurant with a reasonable noise level, this is a place for you. The staff is very attentive and knowledgeable. All the dishes were outstanding, from the presentation to the quality of the ingredients. I had the smoked salmon as an entree (excellent), and the schnitzel as an entree. We all had the schnitzel: out of this world! So light. My friend had the strudel for dessert (very good) and I had the best dessert of the house: kaierschmarren. TRY IT!!!!

google.name: NOMO SOHO
google.address: 9 Crosby St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great location, clean rooms

Rooms very small. No service at all: no minibar, no bar, breakfast is a joke.

You book a “pay at the property” rate on their website to make sure they avoid the Booking’s commission because you know how expensive it is, yet they try to charge you card before your stay and decide to cancel your reservation a few hours after sending an e-mail in the middle of the night.

And last but not least, I have never seen such a bad hospitality. Front office staff very arrogant and   Not flexible.

I wouldn’t recommend that place.

Dear readers, this place could easily get five stars if it was not for the doors that separate the rooms being paper thin. Usually, when there are connecting rooms, the doors are thicker to avoid hearing every little thing,  it was as if we were in the same room with our neighbors.  I could hear every word that was being said, and it’s really embarrassing if you’re trying to have intimate conversations. On top of that, when we were asleep they would wake us up if they came in late…OTHERWISE it was in the best spot…so close to everything. We would walk everywhere, close to little Italy, Chinatown, Brooklyn bridge…if it wasn’t within walking distance the subway station was around the corner. The restaurant was beautiful, and the food was good as well. We had a great view from the 24th floor…I highly recommend it, just see if there are rooms without connections.

I was referred to this place by a friend who has only had good things to say, but it was severely lacking for us. The carpet in the room had stains and the bathroom needed some work. The shower looked to have had a glass door before, but we had a plastic shower rod hot glued to the floor to keep the water from running into the rest of the bathroom. We ate at the restaurant that evening and the food was not worth the cost. The morning luggage check attendant had poor customer service and we were concerned to leave our luggage with him. Overall, there wasn't many employees available for assistance.

Nomo SoHo Hotel shines thanks to Jeffrey's exceptional hospitality! His kindness, attention to detail, and genuine care made our stay unforgettable.

Stylish hotel, perfect location, and outstanding service. We'll be back!
Only wish is for their rooms to get updated.

Thanks, Jeffrey, for an amazing experience!

Stayed here for work and the lobby area was super elegant. Was greeted by front desk and offered a room upgrade. Was on the top floor with amazing views of New York. I found everything clean and location was convenient. Highly recommend.

google.name: Artichoke Basille's Pizza
google.address: 111 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
You know when people said “Try Artichoke Basille’s, it’s weird AF but you have to try it to believe it”, they were exactly right.
First off, the size of their slice is enormous, both in area as well as depth of the filling.
And the filling (on their artichoke slice) is weird, but creamy, cheesy, herby, and artichokey all around.
I’m not sure if it’s even pizza, but what it is is damn delicious and an all around great deal.
I got my slice thoroughly reheated and had a great meal.

I had one artichoke pizza for lunch and a crab pizza to-go for dinner. The crab one was a bit too salty and did not have the flavor I was hoping for, but the artichoke spice was surprisingly good. Tasted like a large quiche with a greater ratio of cheese to egg.

If you come at the wrong time, then the pizza sit in the store for a while, but the workers offer to give each slice a reheating in the oven (extra crispy). They also helped cut the slice in half so I could share with a friend.

I would recommend visiting this location if you are around the area. The price is pretty reasonable to try a type of pizza many other stores don't dare to make.

Second time visiting Artichoke Basille's Pizza and must say their pizza is so unique and rich. One slice of the famous artichoke pizza was more than enough to fill the two of us. A few seats are available inside the restaurant.

Artichoke Pizza in Greenwich Village is a slice of heaven for pizza lovers! This small but mighty spot, developed by two brothers, serves up some of the most decadent pizza you’ll ever taste. The Artichoke Pizza on Broadway is especially famous for its super creamy, rich topping that feels just like artichoke dip, all atop a thick, hearty crust.

Since opening their first location in 2008, Artichoke Basille’s has expanded across the nation, gaining fame along the way. They’ve been featured on The Tonight Show, The Rachael Ray Show, and many other notable shows and publications. This place is the real deal.

We had a slice that was full of creamy goodness and double crusted – it was absolutely delicious and incredibly satisfying. If you find yourself in Greenwich Village, do yourself a favor and stop by Artichoke Pizza. It’s an experience your taste buds will thank you for!

Best pizza in nyc.

This place has the most decadent pizza I've had in the best way possible. I've eaten a lot of pizza in both NY and Italy, and when the Artichoke slice is fresh, it's incomparable.

The slices are very big, one will get you full.

google.name: The Frederick Hotel
google.address: 95 W Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA

review_snippets.text: My only regret during my stay at the Frederick is that I stayed just one night.  A great small neighborhood hotel that makes me want to rethink staying at big hotel chains.  I felt like I was staying in a small neighborhood place, but this is downtown NYC and  accessible to anything you want to do.  The rooms are on the small side but inviting, efficient and very comfortable.  The smallest details have been thought out in the room, with terrific bathrooms.  The breakfast was way better than expected from a buffet breakfast - it's all cooked fresh and real.  The hotel staff was so friendly and very willing to engage and help out.  The hotel bar, Primo was special, a great mix of people from the hotel and not - an upscale neighborhood hangout with great bar service.

Minuscule, over-priced room. We didn’t have a single drawer and the “closet” held an iron and some Pringles. The only kind or accommodating staff were the doormen. Everyone else acted like you were an imposition. There is no functioning water filter, water fountain, or even a simple jug to fill up bottles. The water in the rooms smells like rancid eggs. You have to request potable water and receive it in the form of lukewarm plastic bottles. The staff informed us only one was allowed per guest. Not a good look for a “hospitality” business. We had to request the front desk to have our bed made in our room. “Late” checkout is only one hour extra, though they will make you wait longer to check in.

This is a poorly run Motel 6 with some refurbished hardware and black and white photos on the walls. Avoid at all costs.

The Frederick Hotel is an upscale 4-star hotel in the Tribeca Neighborhood in lower Manhattan. Rooms were clean and elegant decor. My only complaint would be that our king-size room was extremely small. However, I loved the bathroom. It was clean with a rain-type shower head and a map of Manhattan on the shower tiles. The location was very ideal to lower Manhattan surrounded by multiple restaurants, a Target, a CVS, Wholefoods, and nail/hair salons. The World Trade Center Memorial, Museum, and Shopping Center were only 5 blocks away. An added bonus is that the train subway station is in front of the hotel, which made it very accessible. I would recommend this hotel.

Family of four (two under 3 yrs old). Frederick was fantastic for staff, service, location, and amenities. Happy we spent our 10-day vacation with them. Across the street from the subway and in a walkable neighbourhood with a nearby playground and essential stores. All the front staff were super friendly. Staying there was the first time we felt that a hotel was more than four walls and a roof, but it was staff that made the difference. You represent NYC well, Frederick! Much love!

No view, though, just the inside atrium, but we didn't miss it. It was a great home base to explore NYC.

Oh, what a steal for a luxurious overnight stay at this hotel. The elegant room was tastefully decorated with modern furnishings and a stunning view of the city skyline. The hotel's amenities are a state-of-the-art. Guests could enjoy personalized concierge services during their stay.

google.name: Gilligan's
google.address: 310 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
My friend and I stumbled upon this place on a Sunday evening while walking from SoHo to Chinatown, and it felt like discovering a hidden gem. The lush greenery and vibrant atmosphere gave us serious Miami vibes, a refreshing contrast to the sweltering heat of NYC right now. We were impressed by the quality and generous portions of the food and drinks. Speaking of drinks, they were excellent too! Frozen watermelon margarita is a MUST!

All food that we had is soo yumm! Beautiful and well decorated.
- East Coast Oyster
- Steamed Mussels
- Maine Lobster Roll
- Smashed Avocado

However, the service was a bit slow. While our server was friendly, it took us more than 15 minutes to order our second round of drinks, which was a tad frustrating. Understandably, they seemed understaffed given how busy it was.

Overall, despite the minor wait, we loved the ambiance and the delicious offerings here. Definitely worth a visit. Will be back!!

Cute spot, Chris provided amazing service!! It was much appreciated. Watermelon drink was good and our food (lobster Cobb, burrata toast, oysters) was delicious. Towards closing there were a few extra critters 🐀 running around so it was def time to go but otherwise, a great night out.

Really beautiful place, has a tropical feel to it. The service was good but did decline towards the end when it started getting a bit more busier. The food was delicious, minus the shrimp pasta it was a bit on the bland side. But everything else was so great. The menu is very minimal, which was perfect for us because we got to basically try almost everything in the menu. The drinks really were the highlight! The drinks were refreshing and just right for a nice summer day. Would definitely be back again.

10/10 for this fabulous plant oasis. I would come just to sit with the plants.
Drinks were delicious and appetizers were fresh and light.

Service sucks. Rude bartender with zero common sense. Hot as balls and bro wouldn’t bring me a water. Ordered the $45 raw steak. I brought it up to the bartender and he told me not much he can do. Lmao

Edit: menu says it comes with shoestring fries but it actually came with a side of lays potato chips. Once again bartender like “my b” bootleg Maluma mfer

google.name: The Dutch
google.address: 131 Sullivan St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: It’s a nice casual place, good drinks and setting. Tuna carpaccio had too much fish sauce added. Calamari was a nice Asian inspired idea but really needed a sauce, somewhat dry. The burger which is a signature dish felt like it had been sitting around, not freshly melted cheese or special sauce, bun was too thick and dry. Fries were great. Overall just lacking focus on taste and well balanced flavors.

Lovely food and atmosphere. We were lucky to sit outside it was warm enough in November, it has a great vibe of the streets of Soho. We had seafood spaghetti and confit duck meatloaf which was absolutely delicious with some squash and pomegranate side. Wine is great too and their homemade choc chip cookies are divine. Thank you

I recently tried Dutch coffee, and it was absolutely amazing! The flavor was rich, smooth, and perfectly brewed—definitely a standout for any coffee lover. However, the breakfast wasn’t quite to my taste. It was a bit too spicy for me, which might appeal to those who enjoy bold flavors, but if you prefer a milder breakfast, it might not be the best fit. Overall, I'd still recommend trying the coffee for sure!

Came here for brunch. I highly recommend reservations.
We sat outside and the heaters were enough to keep us warm. Price is high, but ABSOLUTELY worth it. Everything that came was delicious. My favorites were the deviled eggs and biscuits. Really enjoyed my mocktail that I think was called viper fang. My only complaint was that service was a touch slow/all over the place, but we did come when it was busy.

Came in for brunch on a Sunday without reservations. I was seated solo promptly. There were plenty of seat options inside and a few outside. The customer service was great. The brunch menu was limited and over priced. I ordered the blueberry flapjacks. They were okay. I also had a cappuccino which was not that great, I didn’t finish it. I would come back to try other things on the menu but I would probably try other places in the area before doing so.

google.name: Balthazar
google.address: 80 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: This was the best restaurant from our whole trip to NYC. We had made reservations before even landing in New York. It did not disappoint. From the food to the service everything was awesome. Everyone loved what they ordered. Worth every penny. Definitely want to come back.

A true NYC classic. With a French bistro atmosphere reminiscent of Parisian restaurants, the food and desserts were quite good. The steak with fries paired with a good red wine were to die for!. The service was good but felt a bit rushed considering the price point and quality of the place. Very nice wine selection too!

Went there with my wife and daughter and her roommate. First of all make sure you reserve. We had a reservation and our table was ready. Talk about a packed place.. This just adds to the atmosphere there which is just bussling with Conversational activity. Love it.... Ahhh the food... We ordered escargot, balthazar salad and seafood ceviche for starters and for main I had the new york strip, and my wife and daughter ordered the steak and fries and her roommate had chicken...The escargot were really yummy and the salad was delicious but the ceviche was the best quality seafood ceviche I have had in a very long time. As to the main meal, the chicken was tender and tasty, the steak and fries (both) were just right and I enjoyed the new york strip. The fat and meat were both cooked to perfection.... For dessert we had pavlova and ice cream profitrolls. The rolls were OK but the chocolate sauce was sublime, dark chocolate with just the right smoothness and taste... The pavlova was a disappointment to me. I have had better in so many countries and back home. The merengue was too too too sweet and the texture was off. Plus I am accustomed to a pavlova with cream and not a lemon/lime mascarpone.... Anyway, the desert was not enough to detract from the experience.  I had a great time with lovely company and excellent food.... A definite place to visit.

The thing I really like about this restaurant is that they close at midnight. I had a steak which was delicious and so tendered. They give you a really good portion of their French fries with it which is amazing. The atmosphere and service here is also fantastic.

The food was perfect! Drinks were strong enough  😊
The cherry tart with pistachio ice cream was unbelievably delicious.
Definitely will come back.

google.name: Lombardi's Pizza
google.address: 32 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
They claimed to be the best pizza restaurant in NYC and it’s true! Pizza was wonderful love every ingredient in their pizza. Aperol spritz was a perfect drink for this meal. Will come back again for sure.
FYI: they take only cash and I recommend to withdraw cash in advance since the ATM machine in the restaurant takes extra charge.

Lombardi’s in New York is the pizza pilgrimage you never knew you needed. This iconic spot is said to be America’s first pizzeria, and after one bite, you get why it’s been around forever. The pizzas are absolute perfection – thin, crispy crust with a touch of char, topped with fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella that melts in your mouth, and basil that feels like it was just picked. The classic margherita is chef’s kiss, but honestly, every pie on the menu is a winner.

The vibe at Lombardi’s is pure old-school New York. The walls are filled with history, and the atmosphere is warm and bustling, like a true NYC institution. It does get busy, so plan for a bit of a wait, especially on weekends. But once that hot, delicious pizza hits the table, you’ll know it was worth every minute.

Now, heads up – the pizza is fantastic, but it’s definitely on the pricey side for what it is. You’re paying for both the quality and the history, so just keep that in mind. If you’re visiting NYC or even if you live here, this is one of those places you have to check off your food bucket list. It’s New York pizza at its finest – just with a bit of a premium!

Lombardi’s Pizza is iconic. The pizza was phenomenal and the atmosphere was cozy. However, the service was just alright. We ordered beers and asked for waters as well since we had been walking all day. The beers were brought out immediately but the waters never came, even after asking 2-3 times additionally over the course of the meal. We counted 4 other groups sat around us getting waters. The waters never arrived, even when we asked for some to go. It felt a tad bit disrespectful having to ask constantly, but maybe it was just an off night. Other than that, definitely worth the visit.

Absolutely amazing! Definitely make this a stop while in NYC. The owner & staff are so friendly and hospitable. We had such a great time eating & drinking here. The pizza is the best in NY! We will definitely come back again.

Such a great pizzeria to stop at. Service staff was friendly, and since we came in right before dinner rush, we were seated right away.   Be warned this place fills fast! The pizza would be well worth the wait, though.  Super fresh and tasty. One of my most favorite pizzas I've ever had. We ordered several pies, and each was amazing. You can't go wrong here.

google.name: Dominique Ansel Bakery
google.address: 189 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Finally had a chance to visit this wonderful bakery. Was not crowded in the morning on Friday or Monday.

Sweet potato and brown sugar cronut of the month (Oct 2024) was great and is a rather light flavor. I expect they’re all pretty great in their own way.

DKA ended up being one of our favorite items especially when they’re fresh. Flaky and sugary on the outside with pockets thicker areas in the middle. Very good!

I would also highly recommend the cookie shot which is warmed to order and the vanilla milk is tasty!

Perfect little egg sandwich isn’t as little as you would think. Comes on a pretty standard sized brioche hamburger bun. This was better than the spinach quiche in my opinion. It was very light and fluffy. Quiche on the other hand has a light and flaky crust.

Strawberries and cream pavlova looked like a fun item to try but it wasn’t my favorite. Even though it wasn’t my favorite, it was still pretty tasty.

Chocolate croissant was super chocolaty. Chocolate strips inside as well as weaves throughout the lamination.

Wish I had tome to try all the pastries!

Dominique Ansel Bakery is the one spot we always want to revisit when we’re in SoHo—it’s simply unforgettable! Our last visit was in 2019, and we’ve been talking about it ever since. This month, we treated ourselves to their monthly flavour cronut, The Dulce de Leche with Gingerbread Ganache, and it was absolutely exquisite. The buttery, flaky layers combined with the rich, creamy dulce de leche filling and the perfectly spiced gingerbread ganache made for a comforting, cozy treat that’s just right for the season.

We couldn’t resist sampling a variety of other pastries, and every single one was exceptional. Enjoying our treats in the relaxed back garden area—a peaceful and charming oasis—made the experience even more special.

This bakery is a must-visit when you’re in SoHo. We can’t wait to return, and hopefully, it won’t be too long!

This bakery is an absolute treat for pastry lovers! They offer an outstanding variety of patisserie, and our favorites were the famous cookie shot and the cronut – both worth every bit of their reputation. The flavors were creative, perfectly balanced, and clearly made with the highest quality ingredients. It’s no wonder the place is so popular; we did have to wait in a long line, and finding a table was tricky.
However, the deliciousness made it all worth it. If you’re willing to brave the wait, you’re in for a memorable treat. Highly recommend!

We stopped by after seeings some reviews on YouTube. It's a really good little bakery.  The cookie shot was good and fun for the kids. The pastries were all very good.

The outside patio I very nice.

I'd definitely stop by if you're in the area.

DKA (Dominique Kouign Amann) is highly recommended! Best KA in NYC or probably in the US. Butterly and sweet, crispy outside, chewy inside. Cronuts were great also. The prepackaged sabre cookie was great too. They offer free drinking water and restroom. Seating was too crammed. I recommend to visit in the afternoon to avoid long queue.

google.name: Tribeca Grill
google.address: 375 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Absolutely amazing Italian food! Went here for a work dinner, 5 of us.

All the food was outstanding with wonderful flavours and perfectly presented. Just see the pics.

Definitely a place to book as it was very busy both inside and outside. We sat outside and it was a little chilly but great for people and dog watching.

This place is not cheap! But worth it for a special occasion.
We spent a wonderful evening with great, tasty, perfectly prepared food in a unique place. Service was kind and great, too. Will definitely be back. Thank you💗

We lived in the neighborhood for 15 years and I couldn’t remember why we always avoided this place until recently. We had a reservation for 2 and the place was empty for the majority of our meal, and even fairly empty when we left. There were plenty of four tops, and almost every table was a four top except for four tables along the side that were for two people. Of course, the hostess sat at the table for two, very tiny, which barely fit our courses and beverages. Every other couple sat at the four top.

Appetizers were mediocre. Entrees were average.  We shared everything except the Maui Maui.  The Caesar salad was not tossed properly. Most of the bites were fairly bland, you could barely taste the dressing. But then there was one or two bites that were incredibly potent, and the anchovy flavor was overwhelming.  My husband only received the bland bites. I had two bites of the Caesar, which I just described. I’m sensitive to raw onions, which they disregarded, and the raw onions in the Panzanella was so powerful even though I removed it from my plate. I had just one bite of that as well. And I had less than half of a cheeseburger without the bun and 2 fries. The fries were stale and reheated, absolutely horrible. Toward the end of the meal, which I barely ate, I was not feeling too well and had to leave the table. Within 60 minutes after my meal, I was very ill.  Several hours later I continued to get worse.

Outside of our past experiences which kept us from returning to Tribeca Grill, we have dined here twice with a friend who is considered their “VIP” and the service and meals during those experiences were fine. I can’t stand restaurants that treat locals with less respect and deprive us of a proper experience even though we are the ones that would be supporting their business. I guess that’s why we’ve never considered Tribeca Grill our home base.

I hate to only highlight the negative experiences, so I’ll share the best part of the meal, which was the wine and of course the company. The Sommelier was also kind and attentive. Our second waitress was also pleasant, but our first impression from the host, hostess and the first waitress was rude and unwelcoming. We also had a nice bus boy who recognized half way through the meal that the table was unstable and did his best to address it. We appreciated his kindness but did not need the attitude from the first half of the staff, nor the illness from the food.

Was looking forward to an American masterpiece,

French onion soup 1/5
Needs to cook down the onions more, tasted rushed. Stock was more sour than sweet.
Maybe not enough onions and not cooked long enough. Can’t complain of the melted gruyere cheese so they get 1 out of five.

Market green salad 0/5
Was too salty, couldn’t eat it.
When tossing salad added too much salt, when I mentioned to the waiter they offered salad with no dressing. Bad suggestion equals bad service.

Grilled octopus 0/5
Overall tasted bland, octopus over cooked

Pan seared diver scallops 4/5
Undercooked was seared sashimi scallops.
Was able to eat it cuz the scallops were fresh.

Fillet mignon 3/5
Steak was perfectly grilled, peppercorn sauce was bland, grilled asparagus was perfect. Potato gratin was bland needed more salt.

Regarding the service, they tried to remove the plates several times even tho we were still eating, very disappointed when we are trying to enjoy the evening for what it is.

Had the three course set menu which was good value.  The food was excellent and reasonable value. There was a really good wine choice with reasonably priced European and local wines.

The decor of the restaurant was very nice and provided a great atmosphere.  The service was attentive.

All in all a good experience.

google.name: Cipriani Downtown - Restaurant
google.address: 376 W Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Cipriani Downtown has a vibrant atmosphere with a stylish interior, but the dining experience left much to be desired. While the food is decent, it doesn’t live up to the high price point. The portions are small, and the flavors were underwhelming for what you would expect from such a renowned name. Additionally, the service was inconsistent. Some staff were attentive, but others seemed uninterested and inattentive, which affected the overall experience. Although the restaurant has a great reputation and a lively ambiance, it didn’t quite meet expectations when it came to service and value for money.

Not worth the hefty price tag but Service was Impeccable, Atmosphere was beautiful ans the food I had was average.... Highly recommend you try for yourself and see if it's worth it. I know plenty of other places just as beautiful with better food. The Burrata and desert was excellent and the only thing i truly enjoyed!

I recently visited Cipriani Downtown and had an excellent experience! I ordered the baked white tagliolini with Praga ham. I had a glass of their house Cabernet which were both great. My girlfriend had the salmon along with a cocktail, and she loved hers just as much. There are a lot of different options on the menu and the dishes I saw coming out looked fantastic. We didn’t have dessert but those looked pretty good as well. We didn't make a reservation, so there was a bit of a wait when walking in, but nothing too long. Depending on the time you go, the wait could be longer, so keep that in mind. Overall, highly recommend for great food!

Pricey. Had a $27 Bloody Mary in a narrow glass with a lemon wedge. The sake time cocktail was much better. The steak tartar wasn't anything special. The presentation wasn't very appealing.  It looked like a raw hamburger patty taken out of the freezer, thawed, and plopped onto a plate. The pasta with ham was rich and delicious.  Small portion.  The ice cream was comparable to soft serve with a side of Hersheys syrup.  Liked the nuts for it. Good expresso martini.

Quite a nice restaurant for a special occasion but only if you sit outside - it’s quite loud inside. The food was good but on the pricey side. Very friendly staff but go there if you are celebrating a special occasion. Also limited in vegetarian options but a great place for meat eaters!

google.name: Carbone New York
google.address: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: So so good! The service is great and old school Italian. The portions are huge! Can’t stop raving about the baked clams, vodka rigatoni and veal parm. We are having a private dinner at Sadelle’s, which is catered by Carbone. They helped us make a reservation so we had better idea of what to pick for the private dinner. We tried a lot of things and was comped a few sides as well. So much better than I ever imagined. If you can get a reservation this place is a must!

The food is good, but there are better Italian places. The reputation exceeds the quality. However, if you do get a reservation go, it is good, just expensive. The vodka pasta is great. The meatballs are overrated. My favorite part is always the complimentary appetizers.

One of the best Italian in NYC but it's a bit pricey. Worth it to try on special occasions. Spicey rigatoni was def delicious but not worth it's high price tag. Other than that, everything here is great as expected.

Carbone is an exceptional culinary establishment. The dining experience begins with a delightful assortment of bread accompanied by mozzarella and salami, setting the stage for a memorable meal. The menu boasts a delectable array of dishes, including the tantalizing spicy vodka rigatoni, succulent meatballs, flavorful veal parmigiana, and a heavenly cheesecake. The service provided at Carbone is exemplary, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant is meticulously curated, creating the perfect atmosphere for a refined culinary journey. I highly recommend Carbone for an extraordinary dining experience.

Carbone NYC is a culinary gem that truly delivers an exceptional dining experience. From the moment you step inside, you are transported to a glamorous and elegant atmosphere that sets the stage for a memorable meal. The retro decor, complete with checkered tablecloths and dim lighting, exudes a classic New York City charm.

Now, let's talk about the food. The menu at Carbone NYC is a delightful homage to Italian-American cuisine, featuring classic dishes with a modern twist. The famous spicy rigatoni vodka is a must-try, delivering a perfect balance of heat and creaminess that will leave your taste buds craving more. The lobster ravioli is another standout dish, boasting tender meat smothered in rich tomato sauce and gooey mozzarella cheese.

The service at Carbone NYC is impeccable, with attentive staff who are knowledgeable about the menu and eager to make your dining experience as enjoyable as possible. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply looking to indulge in some top-notch Italian food, Carbone NYC is the place to be.

In conclusion, Carbone NYC is a culinary masterpiece that seamlessly blends traditional flavors with a modern touch. The food, ambiance, and service all come together to create an unforgettable dining experience that will keep you coming back for more. Trust me, a visit to Carbone NYC is a treat for all the senses and a culinary journey you won't soon forget.

google.name: Boqueria Soho
google.address: 171 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Good place for paella and tapas with great service, but would highly recommend to sit outside if it’s not too hot. The inside can become really packed and loud, with a majority of seating being high tables.

A paella here is essential, order it right away before taking the time to think about the other dishes because it’s takes around 30 minutes to get ready (which is standard).

Highly recommend to get the octopus dish as well.

A piece of Spain in your palate, but Soho style. Nice variety of spanish tapas (small dishes) and some other Mediterranean type treats. A great option for both day or night if you’re wondering around the Soho

I liked the vibe of this restaurant, definitely resembles a feel of a typical tapas bar in Barcelona, and looks like a popular date spot. Ordered a bunch of tapas, my favorite were lamb skewers and grilled asparagus. Gave 4 stars because there was just too much oil, some tapas were just swimming in it. It's not the best for people with sensitive stomachs.

Stopped by for lunch, and found it’s definitely a great spot for a girls' day out, with a cozy ambiance that makes you want to stay. The Paella de Mariscos was a standout—it came packed with seafood and had great flavor. We ordered the medium size, though I think the portion could’ve been a bit bigger. Still, with all the seafood, it felt worth it.

We also tried the Gambas al Ajillo, and if you love shrimp, I’d say it’s a must! Overall, I really enjoyed the experience and would gladly come back.
We had a fabulous date here, and we were very lucky to be accommodated by the host in a beautiful corner booth. The Rioja is delicious, and we enjoyed the meatballs, octopus and some other dishes.

google.name: Blue Note
google.address: 131 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: We had bar tickets for the late show and arrived 30 minutes early, but we only got in at 11:00, and the music didn't start until 11:30. I didn’t like the wait, and I was lucky to get a seat. The cocktails were good, and the music was enjoyable, but I could only see the bartender. I recommend getting a table; otherwise, you’ll be squeezed in with a lot of people and have no space to move or breathe.

Nice cozy atmosphere.  Get there early stand in line for good seat.  If you want to see the show don’t buy tix for the bar.
We Robert Glasper an amazing show, this was our first time to the Blue Note.
There are some other club venues outside I may go and check out my next time in the NYC

The food was good and the atmosphere was great. The prices for everything was high but that’s expected in NYC. If you’re going to a historic place like the blue note you should just enjoy the experience.

I have to give it a lower rating because after tipping our server she came back and demanded more money. She said 25% was a minimum. She was very aggressive and zeroed out the previous tip and put the machine in my face. I asked if 20% was ok and she said 25% so I left $45 as a tip.  I told her this was the first time I had a server demand a specific tip. She asked me if I was American and said this is America. She could not have known that I was active duty military and served time in Afghanistan. I just complied with her demands. That comment was grossly out of line. It really put a bad end to the night. After spending $250 on food and $80 on stuff from the gift shop, would expect not to be harassed.

Oh such a dreamy experience!!
Ive wanted to come here for a long time and finally it happened!!
Im so glad to be able to go there, had a great seat too.

The door was supposed to open at 6 and we got there 5:40.  There were some people in line.  The door didn’t open til 6:20, and the line got quite long.
After it opened, people were put like sardines, as other people mention, tables were close to each other and you will be sharing a small table with other customers.  (It did not bother me after the show started)
The performance started 30minutes late at 8:30, ended a little before 10.  At this point I knew the people for the next show are also waiting long.
But the experience is worth the wait!

There is a tiny gift shop on the 2nd floor which can be very crowded.

Iconic jazz club in New York. I booked tickets fairly late, opting for bar seating on this occasion. I’d recommend getting there early - I booked for the 10:30pm gig, with doors allegedly at 10pm but they were open when I arrived about 20 minutes before this. There are only 10 or so seats on the bar so if you want one you need to get in quick. Otherwise it’s standing room only and very tightly packed! There’s a minimum spend of $25 on the bar and $35 on the tables. A ‘standard’ beer costs $10 and they have some craft beers in cans for $14.

The music, as you’d expect, is excellent. It’s not so easy to see from the bar - this is fine if you’re going fairly casually to enjoy the experience but book table seating if you want to properly see the band. The sound is still great at the back, with dedicated speakers. Each gig lasts ~45/50 minutes, with two gigs per evening (early and late). There is also a small but well stocked shop upstairs.
