Accessibility is excellent with a metro stop very nearby and regular trains to the rest of the city. The gig finished just before midnight but the area was still bustling.

Not a cheap club but iconic with excellent live music. That said, for a beer it’s no more expensive than anywhere else in the city! Great service, too.

google.name: Macao Trading Company
google.address: 311 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Came here on an early Friday evening with no reservations. Hostess sat us quickly. Within an hour the restaurant was packed. It looked like a nice ambience for date night. We just ordered a few apps. The glass noodles had lots of flavor. Waitress was nice and friendly.

Such a fun romantic place to go for a date night!

Good:
- The lobster noodles were amazing! I was blown away since the noodles were so tasty and chewy and also the sauce had so much flavor The lobster meat was tender and savory
- The dessert was so good the donuts were flakey and chewy and adding on the condensed milk was nice
- Very solid ambiance, dimly lit and private booths to eat

Bad:
- The place is pretty expensive!
- Took a long time to flag down waiters and get them to take our orders - nice servers though

Overall enjoyed the experience here and would come again! I liked he decorations mostly and the way it crafted an experience

We had an absolutely amazing time at Macao. Our bartender Dino was exceptional and  went above and beyond to enhance our experience. He not only crafted delicious drinks but also took the time to explain every detail.
If you visit, make sure to try the dumplings—they are an absolute must! The combination of flavors and textures was simply outstanding. We left Macao with great memories and will be back for sure!

Celebrated our 1year anniversary. The drinks, appetizers and entrees were amazing. Each plate they brought out was just leaving us speechless.
The ambience was relaxing.
Recommend this restaurant, it will not dissapoint🫶🏽

This place was awesome. We sat at the bar and enjoyed a couple of their specialty cocktails and shared some dishes. Recommend the mushroom appetizer and the Hakka noodles. Those were my favorite. African chicken was moist and flavorful. Octopus app was cooked really well just had seasonings that weren’t for me. The vibe in here is very cool and they played fun 80s music all night. Apparently have a night club that is hopping in the basement late night until 4am, but we just went for dinner. Bartender service was amazing. Recommend for sure!

google.name: Locanda Verde Tribeca
google.address: 377 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: The food was amazing. The crostini, lamb sliders and fluke crudo was delightful appetizers. The squid ink pasta & duck entrees was very flavorful and cooked to perfection. Our server,  Cornelia was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave such great suggestions. She was always smiling and a pleasure to have as a server tonight. 10 stars service and food!

The pastas and raviolis are so average, I’ve made better food at home. Pasta was very thick, not aldente, just simply mixed with pesto or melted cheese. Peanuts in steak tartare are not needed, just not a good flavor combination. The best thing hung was ricotta cheese. We waited for food so long.. not coming back.

Red shrimp was tasteless, although the beans were good. Pasta dishes were too salty and very skimpy on the meat (see photos) Service was uncoordinated and bizarre (waiter didn’t understand meaning of al dente?), our pasta dishes took way too long to come out and the manager not introducing himself tells us they are coming out soon but it’s another 10 minutes? Still, wonderful atmosphere, and we will be back.

Beautiful interior, great vibes, delicious cocktails and food is ace! Ordered one portion of chicken for one and it's massive, big enough for two to share!
Very easy staff, walked in and with almost no wait we were able to get a seat by the bar.
Thumbs up highly recommended!

This place was delicious. The service was really great as well. The manager was super kind and accommodating to us as well. The host and server as well. They also filled our waters faster than anywhere I’ve ever been. Very impressed considering they were under renovation and had seemingly few staff as well for a busy place on Friday night. Would definitely go back we ordered burrata which was delicious. All three of us enjoyed it. I ate Spaghetti alla nerano as my entree and enjoyed it. The zucchini was very filling too. I enjoyed the locanda tazza as well and the paper plane both very tasty as well. My mom had the Black Tagliatelle
calamari alla puttanesca & breadcrumbs
and said it was good lots of seafood!

google.name: La Esquina Brasserie
google.address: 114 Kenmare St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom’s to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the underground speakeasy restaurant La Esquina. Reservation is required to access this one via a guarded door leading to the underground scene with cramped but very lively bar, restaurant and dj scene! Food is generally very good but nothing that particularly stands out as deserving five stars.

My husband and I both really enjoyed our food. The tacos were great and so was literally everything else that we ordered. I also loved my spicy cocktail, cant recall the exact name. The waiter was very sassy, but I wouldn’t say he was rude. I found the vibe to be great as I really enjoy people watching. We paid around 300 usd which isn’t little for a street place like this but I think it was worth it 🍹

Came on a day where there was a heat wave going on and the AC was not working properly. When we asked the waiter about what’s going on with the AC they said it’s not working too good due to the heat outside? This definitely put a damper on my experience because I feel like it would’ve been perfect had the AC been working, drinks were great and so was the food. The music was also good, they played a lot of Spanish music.

I recently visited La Esquina and had a fantastic experience. My server was amazing - attentive and friendly, despite the restaurant being busy. The food was great too, with delicious Mexican cuisine that left me wanting more. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience. Can't wait to come back!"

I loved the service at La Esquina. They were quite prompt and had attentive service. Especially the waiter Ozzy he was very professional. The food order came fast, I did not have to wait long for delicious food! Would defiantly come back again and recommend to friends and family to try out some fun Mexican food!

google.name: Bubby's
google.address: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Be patience, but this place deserves to be visited 🍽. It exceeded my already high expectations. The food is authentic and thoughtful. Everything tasted delicious. I loves the "trilogy" pancakes 🥞 extremely fluffy and full of flavor. My daughter is a perfect gastronomy guide and expert of the best places where to go in NY.

This place is an extremely popular spot for brunch, and it's easy to see why! The food is delicious, but be prepared: reservations are recommended since it can get busy. Unfortunately, they don't take reservations on weekends, so expect long queues outside during those days. Plan your visit with this in mind to avoid waiting too long.

The menu features all the usual American breakfast and brunch favorites. One standout dish is the pancakes—they’re thicker than usual and incredibly fluffy, making them a must-try! Our guests were trying American breakfast food for the first time, and they absolutely loved it.

If you're a coffee lover, be aware that they only serve drip coffee, with no espresso or other coffee varieties available. It’s good to know before you go!

Seating options include both indoor and outdoor areas, each with separate queues. The indoor seating area is medium-sized, but due to its popularity, it can get crowded and noisy. While it’s not a dealbreaker, it’s something to keep in mind.

Overall, this brunch spot is definitely worth a visit, just remember to plan ahead!

Brunch here was amazing but please be warned, the portions are massive! You can probably share a plate with who ever you are eating with. Also, this place normally has a line outside. It is very popular. Be prepared to wait outside or make reservations. The fried chicken is soooo good!!! You must try the sangria flight too 🙂

Reliably good comfort food especially the biscuits. The line is always long but moves rather quickly in my opinion. The vibe is lively but can be a bit noisy, understandably so. It’s an institution for a reason. Staff is always nice and patient.

Open. Bright.  Good energy but not too noisy. We’ve been here for breakfast before and loved it.  Came back for dinner with our adult kids. Everything was great. The chicken skewers was prob the best. The burger was good as always.  Had to get the fluffy pancake flight. And the deviled eggs were perfect.
Big fan of the unlimited ice tea - I had to drive afterward.

google.name: Mermaid Oyster Bar
google.address: 89 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
What began as a casual New England-inspired fish shack in Manhattan’s East Village has evolved into a stylish American seafood brasserie, known for its warm hospitality and bold, seasonally inspired dishes.

Walking into The Mermaid Oyster Bar  feels like a mini escape into an inviting ambiance that is warm, relaxed, yet refined. The menu, featuring classic seafood dishes with inventive twists, reflects the freshest seasonal ingredients. Whether you’re savoring oysters from the raw bar or diving into a lobster roll, each dish captures the essence of seaside dining with a touch of New York sophistication.

We stopped by for Happy Hour, which runs from 4pm to 6pm. We ordered the shrimp and avocado sliders, fish tacos, clam chowder, and lobster Mac and Cheese. Everything was absolutely delicious. At the end of the meal came complementary chocolate dessert which was a much appreciated gesture.

Every detail, from the food, to the attentive service, and the decor, has been thoughtfully crafted to create a comfortable and memorable dining experience. For anyone seeking a taste of the coast in the heart of the city, Mermaid Oyster Bar offers a refreshing, laid-back retreat.

I was so sad when Mermaid Inn closed in the east village but am so happy to see this one open!  First they have a great happy hour food and drinks weekly and on a weekend! This restaurant is modern chic.  I just thought the actual bar could have been little bigger.  The host, bartenders, servers and the manager were all super awesome! The drinks and food so good! I’ll be making this spot my regular spot!
Cool atmosphere with great service. Tried multiple items on the menu and all were delicious. Lobster Roll was my favorite along with the shrimp and avocado slider!
We ordered the Great Grand Seafood Platter ($99) and were not happy with the size of the oysters and the quality of the food. We wouldn’t order that platter again.

Delicious food and great service. Came in on Friday and were sitting outside when the huge rain storm hit, they moved us inside. Highly recommend the seared calamari salad, the fries are good but eat them quickly because they get hard when they get cold

google.name: Shuka
google.address: 38 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
We checked out this amazing Mediterranean place, and it totally delivered. We made a reservation ahead of time—definitely recommend doing that because it was packed, even on a weekday.

Our server was awesome, giving us great recommendations and being super honest about the portion sizes. The portions are pretty big, and the food is heavy but tasty.

Appetizers run about $15-20, and mains are around $30. We got three appetizers and one main, and it was more than enough. Don’t miss the French fries—they’re some of the best I’ve ever had. The deep-fried feta is a must, and the lamb was so soft and tender.

All in all, if you’re into Mediterranean food, you’ve gotta try this place.

Don’t miss out on the Muhammara. It’s heavenly. The cocktails were great, especially the Gin based ones. I tried Haifa which was mixed with beetroot and was great a change of flavor with regard to the routine cocktails. The staff was great and was tending to us. We mostly went with their suggestions for our order and everything was incredible. I hope to find a table here again.

Tours is a deceptively large restaurant that goes far back and has plenty of seating.   Outdoor seating is available.   Great selection of Mediterranean Cuisine from dips to entrees.    Moderately clean facilities.   Reasonably priced.   Card payments are accepted.   Highly recommended.   We will definitely be going back.

We sat in the patio area in the back. It’s a great area to enjoy some light and the colorful wallpaper as part of the decor. The hummus was splendid and definitely recommend ordering the hummus platter.
I am vegetarian and found good options to explore apart from the usual falafel which I had to resort to in most Mediterranean places. Also ordered the chocolate French toast.

Arrived around 10pm, we were super hungry and everything exceeded our expectations. This meal was magical and delicious. Perfect for sharing plates. The hummus creamy, the meat tasty, the salad with a special dressing and variety of delicious greens. We were served super fast and the waiters were super helpful since we asked specifically for anything spicy. The atmosphere is also super nice. Don't hesitate on coming here.

google.name: Lure Fishbar
google.address: 142 Mercer St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Wonderful evening spent at Lure. They have thought of every detail from the presentation of the restaurant (feeling like you are on a boat) to the food and service everything is impeccable. We partook in the restaurant week which is a great deal to try some fine dining. I do think there could have been more flavor in the dishes but it was clear it was made with the freshest ingredients.
If you like fish and sushi this is your spot! Tons of fish and side combos. So many appetizers and salads to choose from. Great drinks. Love the ship feel inside! I incredible food!

Amazing sushi, oysters, great service, sushi chef Wilmer is always a show and is very attentive, as well as rest of the staff. One of our favorite restaurants in soho. Bartenders always amazing, extremely friendly and welcoming 12/10

This was an exceptional experience today. We celebrated our friend's birthday 🎂 🥳 and received amazing love and attention. It was one of my best visits to Lure by far. They truly know how to make the moment special. Thank you, O. Farmer, for your wonderful hospitality. 😊

High on the Hog brought us here. The food was fantastic - can’t recommend the red snapper enough. The crispy rice sushi wasn’t aesthetically pleasing, but was delicious. The only complaint was that the restaurant was incredibly loud. We ate in silence, because we literally had to shout to hear each other. The decor is great, but sound dampeners definitely need to be fitted.

google.name: Tacombi
google.address: 267 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: A very nice, simple, yet delicious Mexican restaurant. The location and decor were really to my liking and fit the whole theme perfectly. The food was plentiful but tasty and the service was lightning fast. All the dishes were super fresh tasting and light except the burritas which stood out as the only heavy and somewhat dry dish in the bunch and could benefit from some sort of sauce. The tacos and quesadillas on the other hand were really very good and I would happily come back to try the rest of them.

Great vibe and authentic atmosphere! Great food and very friendly and professional staff!
Loved the quesadillas and the agua fresca!
Recommended!!! Enjoy 😉
Sorry no pictures of the food…because the staff has been so nice to help me charge my phone!!!

Recently visited and had the fish taco and shrimp taco.
Both were excellent—well-seasoned, flavorful, and among the best tacos I've had in New York city.
The atmosphere is cool with great decor and music.
The service was perfect. Highly recommend this spot !

I feel scammed. There was a collaboration with a “Michelin “ star restaurant from Mexico City so I ordered the special item on the menu. What came were thinly sliced meats on a taco with NOTHING else in it. It did not even taste good. Felt like something you can pull out of a box in the frozen aisle and heat up. Is this some kind of joke or social experiment. Never trust any influencers again.

LMAO SCAMMERS!!. Did they claim it’s Michelin star taco?! They should refund me. It’s one SMALL pics of DRYYY meat with dry corn wrap. Charging $7 for ONE TACO, a pic of beef meat and bread. Hard to chew and tasteless. Worst restaurant in nyc and I live in the city. They did not provide sauce unless you ask. lol

google.name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse
google.address: 409 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: It was a very average night out dining experience. Mediocre service, food was up to par, but not exceptional (I ordered lump crab meat and it was good, but as a Maryland girl I like great). The bass I ate was very nice and I enjoyed the lobster Mac and cheese. The steak for three was huge for a table of five. Oh, and they don't warm their bread so there's that... otherwise it's a suitable late-night dining option

First, I need to just say WOW. The absolute best steak I have ever had. Myself and 2 friends went to celebrate our July Birthdays. We started with a couple of cocktails which were great. Appetizers were one piece of thick cut bacon, 1/2 dozen oysters and fresh tomato and mozzarella. The bacon, which they cut into thirds, was incredible. Nice crisp on outside, juicy on inside with the perfect amount of fat. Oysters were super fresh and clean. The mozzarella was perfect consistency and tomato's were sweet. Porterhouse for 3 was cooked rare, as ordered. It was rare throughout with a nice char on the outside. The oil they use to cook on the plate was spectacular. We all dipped the pieces into it. Sides were creamed spinach, which was a vibrant green and delicious, German potatoes, crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, and lobster Mac and cheese which had huge chunks of lobster. Dessert was tartufo, which I never order and it was delicious, and pecan pie. Both came with home made whipped cream, or schlag. It was super thick and cut the sweetness.  The service was attentive without hovering and the room is beautiful. I can't wait for another special occasion or for me to get a job where I can afford to go every week.

We had a lunch on saturday at 12am (friends and family). It was super quite, only two tables were booked. The area itself is quite. Location is stunning! The food even more. I had a filet mignon (medium). Super delicious, good portion. Side dishes are ok. Prices are very high, especially the wine (double price compared to switzerland for the same bottle with same vintage).

when your leftover steak tastes just as good straight from the fridge.

the place also has good sound "dampening"... didn't sound like an auditorium.  even could turn up my hearing aid without lots of noise.

Guys night out at Wolfgang's in Tribeca. Rib eyes for the table of 5 with mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, lobster mac, onion rings, and asparagus. Cooked to medium perfection, whiskeys neat and rum and Coke topped off the meal. Excellent service, excellent experience at a really cool restaurant. I would definitely go again.

yelp.name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse
yelp.address: 409 Greenwich St, Tribeca, New York, NY 10013

google.name: Rubirosa
google.address: 235 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Overall top notch pizza. The crust texture was too crisp for my taste, but still flavorful, and all the other ingredients were 💯
Great drinks selection, too. I got the amari flight for "dessert" and couldn't be happier.

Want a little bit of everything Italian? This restaurant is for you! The restaurant atmosphere makes you forget you’re eating right off the street and gives an intimate feeling like you’re dinning with friends and family! Bryan K was not only our server but our best friend by the end of the meal and it made all the difference. You can taste the love in the food. We still thinking about our dinning experience there. We HIGHLY recommend doing a split pizza to share and their dessert sampler was amazing. As an Italian, this restaurant has my blessing and recommendation. Thank you Rubirosa for making our visit so memorable.

The tie dye pizza is incredible. Different and unique but still a NY slice. Also tried the ragu and lasagna. Everything was great. Great music and atmosphere. Worth the trouble of getting a reservation. This whole place is a vibe.

Rubirosa was recommended by a friend who lives in the area.

The crust is an absolute delight. Each bite has the perfect texture and flavor. The cheese was also delicious and my favorite part was the sauces. I recommend trying the tie dye which has pesto, vodka sauce and marinara. The combination is well-balanced with the perfect ratio of each. So much care was put into making these pies!

It's nice and intimate inside. My type of dim-lit night stop.

Nicely curated pizza restaurant with terrific made to order thin crust pizzas. The flavors are outstanding and work well together. Nice wine list to compliment the food.  Cocktails and beer are also served.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

google.name: Osteria Morini
google.address: 218 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Our dinner soooo good I’m so happy we went for my birthday. Our server Brahim was attentive and very friendly. We had a meat and cheese board as an appetizer which was 10/10. The parmesan Reggiano and goat milk blue cheese were so good and the meat we chose was very fresh. I had the cappelletti pasta entree which was over the top amazing, never had anything like it, and it came out super hot! My fiancé had the veal, amazing as well and a great portion. I can’t wait to go back here.

The location is good, and the menu looks decent, so we decided to step in for lunch.

Unfortunately, all three different meals we ordered were really bland! It is surprising, as pasta in general is not a difficult dish to make, at least to make it average level. The pricing is pricey, but that comes with the location, I guess. Not sure what the problem is here - perhaps too much is pre-prepared? Nevertheless, it is definitely not a place I'd return to.

Absolutely no complaints about the staff, who is friendly and attentive.

⭐️⭐️⭐️

Visited Osteria Moroni in SoHo, drawn by its fusion Italian menu. The food we ordered was decent - it hit the 'okay' mark but didn't quite dazzle the taste buds. However, the high price tag, especially for the wine and drinks, felt a bit steep.

Considering the location, some premium is expected, but just a few blocks away, there are spots offering more authentic and value-packed Italian experiences.

A fair choice if you're nearby, but there's more to explore in the area for Italian cuisine enthusiasts. 🍝🍷📍

I’ve been coming here for over a decade and love sharing this spot with friends. The food is always so good. Typically get a charcuterie board, steak and 1-2 pasta dishes for 4 people. And of course a bottle or two of wine. The gelato parmigiana (spelling?) is so good. Whipped up spreadable cheese. Prosciutto is cut when you order.

The food was very good. We had a board of meats and cheeses cut on the spot. The paste was fresh and yummy and the same for the meatballs.  The service was not so friendly or nice. And the vibe is ok but don't go in for that.

google.name: Ferrara Bakery & Cafe
google.address: 195 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Went to Ferrara late morning during the week when it was not too busy in the cafe.

Got a double espresso and a lobster tail,  which ran me $6.25 and $12.50 respectively.   I'm not sure if the cafe prices are higher than getting it to go,  but $12.50 for a lobster tail is beyond overpriced even for a tourist location.

This lobster tail was perfection all around.. perfect flaky shell and the cream filling was about the best I've ever had.   Made me feel a little better about that price.     Friendly service from my server Carmelo.

Overall would recommend... just expect to open the wallet

There were tons of things to try here and take to-go. Even had a few dessert forward liqueurs for purchase.
Gave the chocolate covered cannoli a try. The shell was less crispy and crunchy than I was hoping for. This could be due to the thick chocolate coating it had to hold. Chocolate was great though. Filling could have had more chocolate chips in our opinion.
The lobster tails looked like something to try next time.

Cute place in Little Italy that we found via researching. It came highly recommended by locals for desserts. We stopped in and had coffee and dessert. The staff was super friendly and fun at the dine in section. Everything we had was amazing! Thanks to everyone who recommended it!

We liked the desserts we ordered, we just wished that the wait to be seated and served wasn’t 1hr+ and 40mins+, respectively. Unfortunately for us, we ordered a fruit plate and were served barely washed rotten fruits. Sometimes the service and quality of food spoils the whole experience. As such, we wouldn’t be coming back or recommending this place 😕

I just had to try a New York cheesecake while visiting NYC, and it was fantastic - light and fluffy for a cheesecake. I highly recommend it.

However, the gelato I had there was the most expensive I've ever had, and it wasn't worth the price.

Lastly, the single aisle for takeaway was very narrow, making it hard for customers to browse and for others to pass through to pay.

There's a little sheltered outdoor bench to enjoy your delightful treats if you do not want a full sit-down service inside.

google.name: Café Habana
google.address: 17 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: This place was OK. I will do my research first before coming to this restaurant. The name is a little deceiving as is not a fully Cuban restaurant. They don’t have many of the typical Cuban food cuisine, however, we were surprised to find the food was good not the most delicious but it wasn’t bad. It had a good flavor I will say that this restaurant is more of a Mexican cuisine than Cuban. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and the corn on the cob was on point. We will definitely come back when we need a quick bite, but not when we need a full meal. The service was OK, but they seem to be overwhelmed by the amount of customers that the restaurant can handle we had to ask for napkins like three times also getting the attention of the servers was a difficult as they’re moving around a lot. The bathrooms are very tiny, the lighting is very dim, There is lots of posters and graffiti, but it goes with the neighborhood , I did not feel an AC running inside the restaurant so I am not sure if they run the AC during very hot days .Overall, not a bad place but again make sure you do you your research and check the menu before going in.
Very welcoming atmosphere, the customer service is quick and efficient. Credits to staff Mashell and Veronica they’re amazing! I’ve been here many times and the food never disappoints. 10/10⭐️

My partner and I ordered a steak burrito, corn, rice & beans, and quesadillas. We instantly noticed a lack of flavor in the quesadillas and my burrito. You'll need the sauces they gave to add some taste. Corn was the best. Soon after, the food did not sit well with my GF. The service was good, but we will not return.

From the moment we stepped in, the service was excellent, adding to the overall fantastic experience. The corn, acclaimed as the best in New York, lived up to its reputation and left us wanting more. And let's not forget the frozen margarita which was also very good although could have been a bit more booze forward.

Big Bro and I pulled up to Habana at 1:24pm coated in sweat after the mile walk, as it was the first real hot day of the summer. Even my all linen fit was futile against the heat.

We entered the non-descript 39 seat hole in the wall cafe with tiled floors, a handful of barstools and faux leather booths for seating, and ceiling fans being the only weapon against the heat. It was JUMPIN, but we got a seat right away as they turnin tables quick.

The interior is a little beat up, and I mean that in the best way possible. I've never been to Cuba, but Cafe Habana is authentically Latin American. It reminds me of small places in Mexico or Puerto Rico that don't look like much when you enter, but the food BANGS.

It’s a no frills place. Not like Tacombi though, don't get it twisted. Tacombi plays on Mexican culture, talking about the balmy beaches of the Yucatán and sharing the beauty of authentic Mexican culture with the world and then looks you dead in the eye as they charge you $6.98 before tax and tip for a tiny little fish taco with no sides. Don't get me started on Tacombi. Tacombi is like big pharma to me.

Enough about the opps, my b.

We ended up ordering the world famous corn, plantains, the cubano sandwich, and the marinated roast pork. The grilled corn, dressed in mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder & lime was actually insane… I was initially like “damn this Equinox trainer has me paying $5 for some corn” but thank GOD I did. I forgot one of the few absolutes in life… CORN MAN GETS PAID!!

The cubano sandwich ($18.95) came with fries, which is a rarity in NYC these days. It consists of Citrus marinated roast pork wrapped in ham with swiss cheese, chipotle mayonnaise & pickle on a toasted roll. The pork was so juicy that little pork juice was squirting down the roll on every bite… that visual is crazy lol but it was delicious.

If you're reading this and don't live in NYC you're probably like "damn that's expensive he's trippin..." but this is par for the course in the city, and absolutely Nolita/Soho cheap.

I'm fascinated that a place like Cafe Habana exists in the Nolita/Soho area. I would expect it to be deep in Alphabet City or Union City. Idk. Cafe Habana is just so unpretentious, right smack in the middle of one of the most pretentious places in the world. New York City continues to surprise me everyday.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov_reviews

google.name: Blue Ribbon Brasserie
google.address: 97 Sullivan St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Came to BRB for our first dinner in NYC.  The food was incredible.  We ordered the calamari and escargot to start.  The calamari was probably the best I have ever had.   It was cooked and served in thus incredible broth.   The escargot also did not disappoint.  Sadly they don't offer bread to dip into the broth.  We had asked for bread and it came after.

For our next course we ordered the Basque paella.  I have no words to describe this.  It was perfectly cooked with fresh mussels, claims, calamari and shrimp. The chicken thighs and chicken sausage were a pleasant surprise as it is typically pork (Which I don't eat).  The portion was huge and I wouldn't have ordered another dish if I knew it was that big.  Finally we ordered the striploin with mushrooms.  The steak was cooked to perfection.

My critiques are their drinks.  The cocktails ordered were horrible and had to force ourselves to finish them.  Ordered their old fashion and a goose martini.  Both terrible.

The place was bumping for a Friday night.  Tables are too close and it was a bit too warm.

I first tried bone marrow at this original Blue Ribbon location over 2 decades ago. The iconic NYC institution is still excellent, using the best quality ingredients, freshest seafood for their raw bar towers, great old school NY service (a rarity these days) and a delicious cocktail and wine selection. We sat outside in the outdoor dining which was perfect on a nice weather evening. Best fried oysters ever, and don't sleep on the skate!

We went here on the recommendation of a friend. It’s expensive, but you get what you pay for. The ceviche was probably the best I’ve ever had, and the oysters were super fresh, tasty, and well-shucked. We had a few drinks, but the cucumber mocktail far and away stood out with its cool and refreshing flavor. The oxtail bone marrow is very interesting and definitely worth trying. The service was also top tier.

Side note: the kitchen stays open super late! Our reservation was for 1:00am, and I don’t think the kitchen closed until at least 2:00am.

Best Fried Chicken!!!!
It was my first time here and I loved it. We tried the special fried shrimp which were delicious. The green spicy sauce was what made them so tasty. Great recommendation from the bartender. We also had the fried chicken and WOW! It was amazing

Booked a reservation here based solely on the reviews and I was blown away not only where they highly recommended, its open late! which is a big plus for workaholics like me and my husband.
It was such lovely experience. The food and drinks were absolutely delicious the music was great. My husband enjoyed it so much he suggested we visit frequently so that he can try everything on the menu.

google.name: Katra Lounge & Event Space
google.address: 217 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We had a ball!! As always. But the food service has to get better.  My friend waited 2hrs for food. And I waited over 30 mins for my drink order to be taken. I ended up just going to the bar. But they need 3 or more servers on each floor.  It gets lit and packed quickly.  Again great spot to party tho. Just a few things need to be worked on.

Love the vibe. Vegetarian options are just the chickpea salad and a Mac and cheese side.
But had lots of fun with my besties.

Went there for the 2 for 1 happy hour on Friday. The bartenders were friendly and polite, the drinks are really made with top shelf liquor and the DJ was great! I had a henny lemon drop. The only little issue I had was, there wasn't much American finger foods on the menu. The menu was more Indian inspired.  I got chicken wings, which were fine I just wanted something that would be less messy to eat. Overall, I will definitely be returning.

Came here for after work holiday party with a group. We were welcomed with 5 star hospitality service  that made us feel super VIP. Everything from DJ to bartenders, hookah service, food was executed/ prepared with perfection. Katra Lounge, it's staff and owners know exactly what they are doing. No wonder why it's been around for so long. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!  🔥

Came here on a Monday for a holiday party hosted by someone I know. It's a small area but it's pretty cozy I think. The food and drink on the menu can be pretty pricey so I just ordered naan cause I wasn't looking to spend too much. It was really good and fluffy. There's lot seats and the bartender was pretty nice. It's a good place I think for a holiday party or get together. Would like to come back and see how it is on the weekend.

google.name: Negril Village
google.address: 70 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Overall, not a bad place but overpriced for what you get. I do not recommend coming here. There's much better Caribbean food elsewhere, especially uptown.

The jerk chicken was nice and spicy but a little dry inside. For most of the food here, it's a bit overpowering on the spice (rather than a careful cooking for the texture) so you're not a spicy food person? You may not like the menu.

The server was friendly and knowledgeable. The hostess had a lot of attitude. I arrived at 2:00 p.m. and the place was completely empty, but she acted like the place was fully booked. We had a reservation confirmed.

Finally, there was something weird going on with the music. It would stop every now and then and the volume would fluctuate two notches up and down throughout the song. Kind of strange. The music gave it a nice upbeat vibe but also rendered a place. Not as great for intimate conversations.

I love this place ! The food was 10/10 the oxtail soup is definitely worth the try. My servers name was Andre ( I think ) but he was great attentive to everything even let me meet the chefs to give them their flowers. As a born and raised Jamaican give this place a try ! It’s BYOB , but trust me the mock tails they make are amazing you add your own liquor and there is your cocktail !

This place was amazing ! Anthony our waiter absolutely phenomenal. My husband took me here for my birthday in may and we came back a month later to celebrate our 8 year anniversary. The food was amazing. You can bring your own bottle and Anthony has the perfect recommendations for what to mix with.
Come here with my ex for his birthday, and yes, we are still cool. It's a very nice restaurant, the staff was wonderful and the food and the drinks are on point.

Our party of two went to Negril this past Mother’s Day, and although we didn’t have a reservation we were warmly welcomed and quickly seated. Our server Christina came over and introduced herself. I don’t think I’ve ever had such a warm and personable server as Christina. What a beautiful spirit she has. By the time we left it felt like we had known her for years. She truly enhanced our dining experience at Negril.

And the food? Spot on! We had plantain as appetizers, which were perfectly made. One entree we had was lobster tails with a side of grits. Another was chicken roti. Both were delicious with just the right amounts of seasonings. We also had some crazy delicious drinks. One was passion fruit and another I don’t recall exactly, except for the fact it was tasty and refreshing (that’ll be the white colored one in the pics).

I love the vibe of this place. The music is at the perfect level, (not too loud), and the interior design is pleasing to the eyes. Way back when I used to frequent the old place on 23rd when I lived in Chelsea, but I like the atmosphere at W. 3rd even more.

The only reason I’m not rating Negril higher is because it took an unreasonably long time for our food to come out. We were told that our order had not printed out in the kitchen (or something to that effect). Because of the delay we were unable to make the next event of our evening and had to cancel and reschedule, which was disappointing. While the delay altered our evening plans, after we canceled the next event we were then able to relax more and enjoy the great dishes and environment. Gotta be flexible and roll with it sometimes.

In spite of the above, I’m looking forward to returning (largely because of the amazing service Christina provided), and have already been thinking about what to get next time! In closing I admired the professional, yet warm and personable staff, loved the great food, and just simply enjoyed being there. Give Negril a try, I’m sure you’ll love it.
Highly recommended!

google.name: Eileen's Special Cheesecake
google.address: 17 Cleveland Pl, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Yelp named this spot the #1 cheesecake in America, so I had to check it out! The staff was incredibly friendly, and they offer a great selection of flavors. However, there’s no seating or restrooms available, and while the prices are reasonable, the tart sizes are really small. If you prefer thick, dense cheesecake, you might prefer Junior's. But if you're into light, fluffy cheesecakes, this place will be perfect for you.

This small and cozy bakery sells great mini cheesecakes. With so many flavors options to choose from is hard just to order one. It’s so flavorful. I just wish they will add some seatings. Anyways, try stopping if you are in the area, you won’t regret it.

This is definitely the most addictive cheesecake I’ve ever had. It probably has a lot to do with how it comes in small bite-sized servings making you instantly reach out for another one. Maybe also because it comes in so many delicious flavors and you’d have to get through a lot of combinations to find your favorite. Or maybe it’s really just rich and tasty and perfect in so many ways.
Oh my gosh, all their cheesecakes look absolutely amazing! I really wish I could’ve brought some with me to Miami. I can’t wait to go back to this spot the next time I’m in New York!

Tried 4 flavors of their personal sized adorable cheesecakes - mango, coconut, pineapple, and strawberry.
Absolutely loved the mango, strawberry and pineapple cheesecakes, coconut was very mildly flavored as compared to the other three. The mango was the best !!!
The staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. They have all the cheesecakes on the display. The service is pretty quick, and the line moves quickly, so it is not much of a wait. They accept both cards and cash payments.
This is a cute and cozy shop, with limited space to stand and eat, so we ate some and packed some more for later. Their packing was pretty good too.
100% would recommend coming here to try their cheesecakes. The portion size is perfect, and it's not too sweet and the flavours are yummy, but not overpowering.
Loooooved this place so much !

google.name: Chipotle Mexican Grill
google.address: 200 Varick St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: The afternoon female cashier on 9/19 is incompetent and rude. Charged me steak bowl instead of chicken so I asked for receipt when I noticed the price difference.  She couldn’t give me the correct receipt. She gave me a receipt of the previous customer who ordered a steak bowl and says I wasn’t charged. I showed her my online account which shows I was charged and charged the wrong amount. She was annoyed and said just take the food.  She really thinks I wasn’t charged and didn’t know how to make a simple correction. The brown rice was hard and not cooked properly

The food was fine. It's the service. If you don't speak Spanish, the staff talks about you right in front of your face because they THINK people in America don't speak Spanish. SURPRISE! The cashier realized that I understand spanish when i was just standing there listening to their conversation and told everyone and they started freaking out. The funny part is they can speak English but won't say the rude things in English because they're scared.

I can't wait to have a field day with corporate about this and hope every single last one of these people get fired. These entitled workers need to learn a valuable lesson in life. Just because your parents brought you to a country where a majority don't speak your language, some do.

So disappointing that this is what they were giving out for salad dressing and they gave me the last one. The guy before me complained about how it was basically a drop in the cup so they gave him another one. Wow. That’s not okay.

The proportions are a joke here. For these Manhattan prices at least fill it up like it's meant to be. Paying full price for a bowl and getting half of that is ridiculous. Will never go to this location again.

It’s always clean here, it gets a little hectic during rush hour but it’s understandable. The workers are pretty friendly, very informative. I’ve experienced some friendly workers and some not so friendly workers but overall I think they have a good crew.

google.name: Joe's Pizza
google.address: 7 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: My friends and I went to Joe's Pizza and tried five different signature slices—each one was delicious! The crust was perfectly crispy, and the toppings were fresh. We had a great time, but the place was pretty crowded. Still, it’s definitely worth it for some of the best pizza in town!

It’s my best friend’s and I first time in New York and we knew we just had to go get pizza from here. We choose the perfect time, really late at night after the bar. And it was so worth it, he pizza was great. The people were also kind and helpful. I love seeing the celebrities they have pictures with. I mean what can I say that hasn’t been said already. Come try them out.

This is a classic NYC dive pizza shop. Only a few seats.  Standing tables outside. But the pizza is delicious. Thin and chewy crust, yummy sauce and cheese that is just slightly salty to give the best flavor.  CASH ONLY.  But no worries as they have an ATM in the entrance.

This is the Quintessential NY Pizza for me, a 5/5, 10/10, probably the best American-style or New York-style pizza I’ve had in America. Maybe L’Industrie challenges it? But not sure…

REASONS:

The crust: My favorite pizza crust, with the signature thin and crispy dough. Light enough to be floppy, but also strong enough to stay together when you fold it in your hand. And the first crispy bite of flavor is just food heaven. The pizza crust also has quite a bit of flavor, which is rare in most pizzas, and is perfectly baked to get the nearly burnt but crunchy texture.

The cheese: The fresh mozzarella is my favorite, so savory and melts in your mouth.

The tomato sauce: Those San Marzano whole-peeled tomatoes really shine in this sauce, which is bursting with flavor.

Get the fresh mozzarella slice! Although the classic cheese and Sicilian slice are good too.

$3-5 for a slice is a great deal, $25 for a pie. Cash Only, fast service, the line can be long but always moves fast.

Joe’s Pizza in New York is an iconic spot with a slice that truly lives up to the hype. The thin crust and perfectly balanced sauce make it a must-visit for any pizza lover. Fans of Spider-Man will also appreciate the nostalgic vibe, as the place famously featured in the movies. Whether you’re a local or a tourist, Joe’s serves up a classic New York slice that’s hard to beat. Don’t miss it when you’re in the city!

google.name: Starbucks
google.address: 72 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I understand it is a busy store. But a bathroom was such a horrible mess. You pay over 7 bucks for a coffee then expect somewhat decent bathrooms. I saw at least 5 people working at the counter. Could they take turns and clean the bathrooms?
I’ve come here one time in the past and had gotten an iced chai latte and it was great. The service here was pretty decent would maybe come back again in the future.
Very fast, friendly service and drinks was as you could expect for Starbucks!

Slightly confused as to why the employees don’t have common courtesy. Attempted to open the door at 5:30AM on 11/6/24, two employees made eye contact with me but the door was locked. They looked busy so I didn’t bother them. They clearly see me waiting right in front of the door but don’t say anything. At 5:40AM another customer comes and has to start banging on the window multiple times for them to sign through the glass that they’ve decided to open at 6AM today instead of 5:30AM as listed on the door and online. Completely understand things happen in a business. Employee could call out, short on supplies, etc. However, common sense and common courtesy would say to put a sign on the door or have a 5 second conversation with your customer waiting outside your door. Were they planning on having me wait outside for 30 minutes? If someone is going to get coffee at 5:30AM in NYC, they likely have things to do and can’t afford to wait around. Wish you all the best but not the brightest individuals working today.

This is a great Starbucks location! The space is clean, spacious, and modern.

Pros: The bakery is fully stocked, including the cold pressed drinks. The workers are fast and friendly.

Cons: No easy access parking before 6 pm. Limited in store seating due to tons of people planted for the day.

Overall, definitely worth a trip if you are in the area and need a refresher!

google.name: The Red Lion
google.address: 151 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Came along for the music stayed for the atmosphere and staff were great some great Irish bar tenders. Live music all night and sports during the day what else could you want. Reasonably priced drink for the location and walking distance to the west village. Would recommend to anyone who lives here or visiting.

Sticky floor, dance party vibes! Mostly a younger crowd but had guests of all ages!

Visited on a Saturday evening and walked right in ($10 cover per person - weekend before Halloween).

Live band (Pink Lightning) played array of songs from many decades.

Very crowded dance floor, bar area, and surrounding spaces. Lively atmosphere. Would recommend for a fun night out.

Amazing live performance. Excellent service. Beautiful atmosphere. I tried for the first time a Beyond Meat burger and it was really fine. Chicken tacos were great too. The red lion brewed beer was tasty. We spent a marvelous live music night.

Great spot! The live music was great and upbeat. They have specials each night. We made it for 50 cent wing night (Tuesday). Our waiter was Dara from Ireland and he was GREAT!

The wings were standard, pub wings. Know that they don't come with carrots and celery with this special. They cost extra and you must buy a bar drink.

Inside is quite loud, but there is seating that worked well for us outside under an awning as well as on-street seating.

Cons:
- the homeless, the drunk homeless and the mentally unstable homeless. They were disruptive to say the least.

- beware of the prices on the menu and the prices on your receipt. We were charge $2 more than listed.
Hadn't been here since the NYU days in 2002 but thoroughly enjoyed myself watching Rugby and enjoying a few pints with an old buddy.

google.name: Off the Wagon
google.address: 109 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Went on a Wednesday night to watch the Knicks playoff game. I had the Burger and a Side of French Fries. The burger is juicy, lots of flavor, and the fries were crispy.
Many TVs to watch Sports. There was Hockey, Basketball, and other sports on.
Drinks are around $10 (decently priced for the area) staff is friendly.

If Chelsea is there, expect the best time. Had the burger and salad and both were excellent. Their happy hour deals will make you stay too long, but in a good way.

I will be coming back.

I’ve been quite a few times and I can say the music is usually pretty good! It’s a nice spot to go to catch any sports games on some fairly large TVs, but also if you’re a New York fan, this is the place for you. Food until late, drinks, friends, DJs. Staff is great too! Try the wings !

Amazing spot to watch sports and grub on some good bar food. This place also gets rowdy late night with a lively crowd. I came in to watch some college football the other day and ordered some chipotle bbq wings and fried pickles. The wings were delicious and they have 8 flavors to choose from. Fried pickles were amazing too. They have plenty of TVs and a bunch of local beer on tap. There’s an upstairs as well so plenty of room for games and late night dancing.

Visited this place for the first time with my friends and my gosh we had such a fun experience! The staff was incredible. We were a big group and sat upstairs and the bartender up there was just the nicest guy and incredibly fun. The food offered here is amazing!! The best thing on the menu in my opinion was the empanadas (chicken was my favorite) and the tater tots!!
Just an overall amazing experience and will definitely be coming back here again!

google.name: Palma
google.address: 28 Cornelia St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
I made a reservation for dinner on the weekend and was excited by the beautiful decor and friendly service even before we started eating. I ordered a glass of white wine and the truffle pasta. The pasta was cooked to my liking, and the generous amount of truffle was immediately noticeable, making it a delicious dish.

My friend opted for the daily pasta, which had a lemony olive oil flavor, and it was also really tasty. We wanted dessert, but after finishing our hearty pasta dishes, we were too full to indulge. 😂
I definitely want to come back for a special occasion next time!

Visiting nyc and wanted to try a nice Italian spot. This place is so beautiful and cozy, great for a date night! Food was amazing and I believe their pasta is made fresh! Make sure you reserve in advance because seats get taken very quickly.

Amazing food, and excellent service. Went there for a late lunch and it was a great choice. It is also very close to Taylor Swift’s old apartment where the song Cornelia Street is taking place. If you are in the area, I definitely would recommend.

My wife found this lovely restaurant on TIKTOK, and boy am I glad she did! If you get a chance try to be seated in the back of the restaurant. It will make you feel you are transported to a little restaurant in Italy.

The service was amazing, nicely paced and everything came out hot and delicious!

For appetizer we went with the Arancini they were so tasty! For the main course my wife got “tortellini in brodo” and I got the special, which was lamb chops cooked to perfection and creamy mashed potatoes. And lastly for dessert we went with the  classic tiramisu. Drinks were nice and strong as well! This place definitely lives up to the hype! Will definitely will be recommending this restaurant to friends!

Hosted our engagement party here with close family. Everything was perfect - the food was delicious, the service was attentive and flawless, the ambiance was sublime. We were seated on the private terrace and felt like we were transported to a tuscan villa! Francesca and the event planning team were super - the constant communication, attention to detail, and care, was above and beyond. I look forward to hosting future events and regular dining at Palma in the future! This place is criminally underrated compared to its overrated Italian restaurants in the West Village area! Don’t hesitate - dine here or host your event here. You won’t be disappointed.

google.name: Mamoun's Falafel
google.address: 119 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Mamoun's Falafel is a classic, old-school establishment that consistently draws a crowd—and for good reason. The food is always fresh and delicious, making it a favorite spot for many. There’s never any issue with the quality or taste of the food; it’s simply excellent.

However, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, they only accept cash, so be prepared. If you’re short on cash, you'll need to use the ATM right outside the store, which charges a $3 fee. The staff, while efficient, can sometimes come across as brusque, especially when you request extras like sauce on the side or if you’re a dollar short. Also, seating is very limited, so it's best to plan on taking your food to go. The prices are slightly on the higher side, but given the quality of the food, it's worth it.

This place is literally a hole in the wall! There's hardly any space to stand inside the store, but the food is exceptional! The food came out pretty fast, and they had some outdoor seating on the street. The sandwiches are a bit messy cause they are stuffed with goodness! Would definitely go back!

I tired this place because it seems iconic and recommended but to be honest it fell a little flat for me. I ordered the lamb pita sandwich to try on my visit. Truthfully it lacked anything to make it feel special and worth the trip besides the fact that it was reasonably priced. The meat was a little chewy, the lettuce tasted like pre-chopped butter lettuce from a Trader Joe’s bag, and the toppings lacked depth.

I wouldn’t recommend this spot given how many other spots you have to choose from in New York.

Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 1/5

The falafels were no doubt the star of the show. I got some falafels and the falafel sandwich. I found the sandwich to be tangy and sour.  I’ve had better sandwiches. The falafels themselves on their own were quite good! Service was fast. It is a hole in the wall with 2 tables with 2 seats inside the place. They have a makeshift seating outside which is really in bad shape. I wanted to enjoy my meal here but the seating made it difficult to do so. I know it’s New York City, and space is not plentiful. Next time, I’ll try the chicken shawarma.
We came here on a food tour and it did not disappoint! I love a good restaurant with a good back story and even better food! The falafel was flavored to perfection! Will definitely be back

google.name: The Grey Dog
google.address: 244 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Grey Dog is a fantastic spot! I loved the cozy decoration and the welcoming atmosphere. We came during the last 30 minutes of brunch, and the food was still excellent. The pancake and fried chicken were crispy and delicious, and the breakfast bowl with French toast is a must-try. Plus, they have a happy hour starting at 4 PM, making it an even better place to hang out. I’ll definitely be back!

Great "live" place with a unique old design, good food(medium-sized) dishes
The toast served inside the dish?!
Good stuff,
Could change the toilet into two separate toilets to avoid the crowd.

We got a bit unlucky and the day we went it was down pouring really badly. And unfortunately the only seats available were on the patio so the seating arrangements were not fun, or comfortable. The chairs were also wet but this is out of the restaurant's reach. The food was decent! Not amazing and not bad, it was not a bad experience, but I wouldn't go again because it did not really give me that wow factor that I look for to return.

Dont forget to reserve a table if plan to come on a weekend. Packed! But food is great, service is fast and attentive. Pancake and french toast is moist , yummy. Our latte is strong they have good selection of coffee.

A friend and I came here not too long ago to try it out since we were in the area and it looked cool and we were not disappointed. It is a nice little restaurant and The food was excellent. The service was phenomenal, and our server was awesome and was very kind. Will be back again! Highly recommend!!

google.name: Lupa
google.address: 170 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Came here because a friend said it was head and shoulders better than Carbone across the street, and we were not disappointed. From the cocktails to the foccacia bread all the way to the tartufo for dessert, everything was excellent.
Great midday meal. Quaint indoor or outside sitting. Full bar.  Perfect for two or family out.

I am glad people like this place because I am being generous with 3 stars. We ate outside which was lovely and the service was pretty good. The food on the other hand was not exactly the same. I did enjoy the bread and appetizers however strip steak and dessert had no flavor (unfortunately I am not exaggerating… no flavor). It was pretty busy so hopefully this was a one time occurrence.

The food and the service is fantastic at Lupa! Five stars service! Our server was amazing and the atmosphere incredible, it feels like in a tratoria in Rome! the octopus and Arancini were absolutely good, and the wine list it’s out of this world! We had a perfect table next to the wall.

All around great experience, this Roman inspired restaurant offers ambiance, quality service, and tasty food. Pairing the wine came easy with their Sommelier, server was attentive with a splash of personality, he offered his “best dishes” and when ordering them it was certain he was not wrong. Short rib ragu, the pork chop, meatballs, all was to be desired.

google.name: Parm Mulberry Street
google.address: 248 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Came here for the rigatoni carbone, it was pretty good. We also enjoyed the fresh mozz with prosciutto. The arugula salad had fig in it, I loved it but my friend was not a big fan. The spaghetti and meatball was ok. We came here for dinner on a Saturday. The line was quite long, as expected. The guy worked at the door was good, attentive, and communicated well about the wait time. It was a small and busy place, but our waitress was patient and welcoming.

Our visit here was a good time! We got a chance to sit outside and enjoy the breezy, sunny day. We had the eggplant parm sandwich which was soo good with the sesame bread!! It was perfect to split with my husband! Then the rigatoni was fresh and well cooked. It was not as spicy as I thought it would be but it was tasty !
Pasta was overcooked, rigatoni was too spicy, waitress was inattentive, garlic bread was kind of dry but the bursts made up for it. Also my pasta had no cheese! Lovely atmosphere.

sat at the corner bar, it was so nice to be a little tucked away. we were helped by emma and she was absolutely fabulous. she delivered our food quickly. she is the best and i hope when you eat here she is working!

OH MY GOD! This is my favorite place in the city right now and I do my best to introduce it to all my friends and family. Parm on Mulberry St. is a tiny restaurant that serves some of the best italian cuisine in big portions at a reasonable price. Although their menu is on the smaller side, each of their dishes come out fresh, hot, and very tasty. I usually enjoy their pizza garlic rolls and mozzerella sticks for appetizers and eggplant parm platter for dinner. The best part is that all the platters come with a side of spicy rigatoni that is very similar to the one at Carbone. Basically, you get a 2 in 1 deal when ordering a platter.

Seating is very limited and it is crammed in the restaurant so be prepared to enjoy a hearty meal on a small table while bumping elbows with the person next to you. There are a couple tables in the restaurant and outside. There is also bar seating.

The staff is very friendly and attentive. They are good at making conversation and make you feel at home while you enjoy your meal.

This place is a must try!

google.name: Aria Wine Bar
google.address: 16 Bedford St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text:
Searched RESY for a tapas restaurant and was plenary surprised when an Italian restaurant showed up. We did not have reservations and went at 5 on a Friday. We were seated with no issue, at this point it was basically empty. Within half an hour there wasn’t a seat in the place.
We had the grilled octopus salad as well as the goat cheese and mango salad to start. Both were outstanding. For main courses we had the lobster risotto and the lamb shank. The lobster was cut into pieces like little prizes throughout the risotto. The bone on lamb shank over risotto was so tender it fell off the bone.
We will absolutely be back, we loved this meal!

Aria wine bar in NYC is a must-visit! Our server, Alyssa, was fantastic - attentive, knowledgeable, and made great recommendations. The wine list is extensive, and we enjoyed several varieties thanks to Alyssa's expert guidance.

The bread, freshly baked and perfectly crispy on the outside, was served with a side of high-quality olive oil for dipping - a simple yet delicious combination.

Overall, Aria wine bar is a gem in the heart of NYC. Great wine, great service, and a cozy atmosphere. Don't miss it!

This place was fantastic! The service was exceptional and they walked us through the menu, the specials in detail, didn’t rush us to order and let us take our time. The burrata, Caesar salad, pesto pasta, mushroom truffle pasta were heavenly . Also wnjoyed the Chianti they had to offer, prices were also amazing, about &60 a person for a table of 4 - including tax tip 3 drinks a person , an appetizer per couple and 4 entrees…HUGE!

Thank you!

This place is amazing, it's a cozy area and has a wonderful staff. They treated us so well and made our day more special.

The food was delicious, and also the drinks! My favorite food was the warm chocolate cake.

Definitely a nice place to hang out with friends or have a first date.

Had an amazing time here. The service, the food, the people. Love it all. We celebrated an engagement party and everyone loved their time here. Get the risotto lamb dish if it’s available. It is cooked to perfection. Fell off the bone. I give this place 5 stars!

yelp.name: Aria Wine Bar
yelp.address: 16 Bedford St, West Village, New York, NY 10014

google.name: Cafe Select
google.address: 212 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Giving this pace 4 starts because 1. when we went in the summer there was no AC, so it was a bit hot and 2. I thought my salad was extremely mediocre and was very watery on the bottom. We were there pretty early on a weeknight (around 6:30pm) and didn’t have to wait in line to get seated, but the spot looked pretty busy around 8pm. Overall, if you’re in the area and looking to grab something and people watch, this is a good spot, but I wouldn’t travel to eat here.

We merely stopped here for a refreshment on a very hot New York  City day.
Cafe Select had a nice menu but alas, we were still digesting our lunch. So a coke and a margarita were on the order.
Sitting up at the bar, out of the heat, we caught up on our plans for the rest of the day.
The decor is absolutely gorgeous, with eye catching posters and prints and bud lights sprinkled across the entire ceiling.
Had to take a photo of the Rolex clock mounted from the roof with Jim’s Omega watch in the foreground. Rolex’s fame of keeping accurate time didn’t hold up well against the Omega.
😂😂😂
If you come to dine, there is seating outdoors on the pavement which is enticing. That along with the funky decor and great customer service, makes #cafeselect one to put on your list.

#thewanderingreviewer#newyork2024 @cafeselectnyc  #caféselect #cafeselectnyc #omegawatch
Nice restaurant in Soho! The atmosphere is great, the food is good, the service is quick. I recommend and hope to return another day.

I was walking around and spotted the cool lights from the outside and decided to go in and have dinner here. The atmosphere was so lovely and Christmassy. I had the truffle burger and it did not disappoint. It was so good.

This place is so warm and cozy! Loved the atmosphere. The cocktails were amazing! I normally hate tomato soup but I got theirs and it was delicious. The staff was pleasant as well. I highly recommend this spot.

google.name: The Odeon
google.address: 145 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Overall loved this place. Loud, busy restaurant with great service and good food. Everything we ordered was very good: tartare, quiche, salad and omelet, but cinnamon donuts were our favorite!!! I would order all of it again but the 5 is because of the overall vibe of the restaurant. I can’t explain why exactly but it was just a great place to have brunch. Our server, I think her name was Macey but could be wrong, was great, attentive, friendly, funny and helpful.  Overall highly recommend and I want to return to try the grilled cheese.

Classy spot and the food was top class. We started with calamari which were excellent. We then had the Yellow Fin Tuna burger/sandwich! and the Lobster Roll. Both were delicious!  The service was also spot on. No rushing between courses which allowed us to enjoy the atmosphere and savour the food. We sat inside as it was very hot. They do have a small outside seating area but we were glad to be inside as you got the full impact of the restaurant! If you are looking for a taste of New York in classy comfort then definitely try The Odeon!👍

Impressed with how fresh shrimp cocktail was.
Very nice options for lunch
The service is the best part
Good drinks
Love so much

Classic NYC spot with great atmosphere. This has always been our main go-to for an after work martini, burger, and fries.

Bar seating is always fun!

The Odeon is iconic. It’s what NYC used to be and strives to become again. I’ve never had a bad bite here, doesn’t matter what you order. Our server was very charming and tended to us well.  Sit inside for the energy and scene, outside for good neighborhood vibes.

google.name: Tomo21 Sushi
google.address: 172 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Sushi was not great, place was very noisy. We went for the combinations and the sushi did not taste very fresh and we got sick of it after eating a bit of it. Ended up paying $50 per person. You can definitely do better in the neighbourhood for that price

Actually one of the best sushi spots in NYC. The quality of fish is amazing and fresh. The nigiri pieces are legit the size of your hand, it’s crazy. The thing I love the most is how reasonable the prices are given the quality and size of the sushi. I come here every time I visit NYC, it’s one of my all time favorite spots! I hope it never changes.
Great sushi spot. Wasn’t too busy on a Friday night. Fairly priced. Staff was nice. Give them a try!

The sushi were really good, and the prices are rare for this location. It's a great place for lunch for those who work nearby.

Keep in mind that the place is really small, the tables are close together, and you can’t book in advance. The service was also a bit slow.

Nestled in a small little spot, is this wonderful sushi spot that serves large portions of fish that are always fresh and delicious. Moderate prices don't stack up to the amount of fish and food you get. Definitely a bang for your buck.

google.name: Cuba
google.address: 222 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Cuba is such a fun spot! The ropa vieja is a must-try, and the calamari tamarindo is delicious. Their cocktails are unique and really hit the mark. The live music creates a great vibe, but fair warning—it can get a bit loud. It’s on a busy street, definitely make a reservation. Overall, highly recommend.

Incredible food, friendly and familial service. Highly recommend the paella, it was so dense with flavors. The restaurant is charming, and there's a small private dining area you can see peeking through a cute window behind the bar. It did take a while for our main orders to come, but the food did not disappoint. And, happy hour!

A group of ten of us had dinner at Cuba, and it was a hit! While it’s listed as a “Cuban Restaurant & Rum Bar” on Resy, the vibe leaned more towards a restaurant experience than a full-on rum bar.

As a Cuban who grew up in Miami, I had high hopes, and this place delivered. The menu is extensive and has all the Cuban classics: ropa vieja, vaca frita, rabo encendido, arroz con pollo, croquetas, papas rellenas — you name it. For appetizers, we went all out. The papas rellenas were excellent and became a table favorite. The ceviche (not strictly Cuban, but a welcome addition) was fresh, although the portion was on the smaller side. The tostones — both the plain and stuffed versions — were terrific, and the yuca frita was yummy. The croquetas were just okay; I’ve definitely had better.

I ordered the rabo encendido, and it was delicious but I didn’t love the bone-to-meat ratio. The flavor, though, was spot on, and it came with rice and beans (like most of their other dishes). Portions were generous —maybe too generous; most of us couldn’t finish our meal. I also tried the rum old-fashioned, but it wasn’t quite there; it was a bit watered down for my taste.

The service was excellent, with attentive staff who were helpful with their recommendations. They even treated us to complimentary cigars at the end.

One small downside was the temperature in the room we were in — it got pretty warm. They turned on the heat pump at my request, but it ended up adding a bit of a musty scent which wasn’t ideal. Minor issue in what was otherwise a great evening.

Truly enjoyed the whole experience around Cuba restaurant. Great cuban ambiance with nice live music, and super friendly staff with great service throughout the night. I wished I could get every dish on the menu! Old cuban cocktail was yum with a fresh sugar cane stick. Daily special ceviche was nice and tangy and fresh. The pulpo a la plancha was my fav of the night. Cooked perfectly, great texture and flavor. The crispy potatoes that came with were really good too! The daily special stir fried skirt steak with fried rice was very comforting! Bombon cubano was the perfect way to finish the meal. So decadent and nicely paired with fresh mint and strawberries and vanilla ice cream. Can’t wait to go back and try other dishes!
Not the best Cuban food in the city by far. Overpriced and basic food. The atmosphere was cramped and dark. The server was weird. The drinks were watered down.

google.name: Whiskey Tavern
google.address: 79 Baxter St A, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: I happend to find this place and I can’t explain how happy I am that I did! Everything about it was just such a vibe! The music! The bartender Allen! The food! The inside atmosphere! The spicey pickle back shot! They really have a good thing going on and I will def be back! Allen is top tier such a happy soul he likes his job and you can tell! I got the appetizer sampler and everything was fresh breaded and fried no frozen box stuff I was impressed crispy crunchy delicious!  Cheese pull!

Found this place by chance after crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing atmosphere, good vibes, happy hour deals are perfect, food is INSANE. Not only is the NFL playing but also they have movies on. Staff are so friendly and welcoming! Defo one of my fav bars in NY - we went back several times during our vacation

We came across this bar while our friends went to get their marriage license and stopped off for a drink afterwards. The staff there were really friendly and welcoming, so we decided to stop there again for one drink after the wedding the next day. On our arrival they made such as fuss of our group we ended up spending hours there, they made the day even more special. The bar staff are amazing people, especially Colin and Alex, the atmosphere and people there were also amazing. We had the best time and would definitely recommend visiting.

For years we’ve been looking for a place where we can go for after-work drinks/happy hour. Why did it take us so long to find this place? This is the best bar/pub I’ve ever been to. The atmosphere was amazing. They make you feel welcome. Their attention to detail in making you have a good experience is something I’ve never seen anywhere.

This is such an awesome offering in this area. Never had a pickle back but I could tell their pickle juice was absolutely legit! The service was stellar (super friendly, felt like they were part of our group without being intrusive at all). Would definitely come back and bring more friends.

google.name: Ear Inn
google.address: 326 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Historic AND delicious food?!? YES!  We had a delightful time at the Ear Inn - our waitress was amazing!  Great drinks, great atmosphere.  The place is small, and it does get crowded. We sat in the back room, which  was empty when we arrived (2pm) and packed by the time we left.  We loved it.  Up front, by the bar, the England vs Spain Copa game was on, the place was lively!

What a cozy little spot. Had a jolly few hours here today. Tasty little negroni and my friend had a spiced margarita. Both blended well and refills soon followed.
The steamed dumplings were fresh, hot and mega tasty.
Lovely friendly staff and patrons alike - such a great vibe!
An experience unto itself.   GREAT food.  Kind of brief waitstaff.  Beer excellent.
Old ass bar with a nice pour, skinny bathrooms if u must.
Such a cute cozy place! Jazz is 8pm every Sunday!

google.name: The Brooklyneer
google.address: 220 W Houston St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: Reserved part of the bar here for a friends birthday, the bar is a nice space and kept clean. However, we were told we’d be given aux for the night but they had a DJ that was extremely rude to our group refusing to take requests and yelling at the group for asking, even when we were the only group left at the bar for the night. Would recommend The Brooklyneer overall.

Great atmosphere, food and drinks! I love coming here after work, bartenders are friendly and know how to make a good drink. After frequenting this place so much I brought my friend for her birthday and she had a great time. 😃
Great happy hour place. Held an after social event at this location for roughly 30 plus individuals and they were accommodating. Good drink prices. Nikolas is the man!!

Poor bartending services. Had to remind the bartender 3 times to get my drink and ends up spilling it because hes not paying attention. But that is not the worst part. The worst part is one of the bartenders assaulted and hit my friend in the face. Please fire this man for hitting a customer. His name is Nicola.

The owner, Billy, was really accommodating of us hosting our pre-wedding drinks here. Very welcoming and our guests said they loved the spot as a perfect pitstop, between the church and reception venue. Will definitely return.

yelp.name: The Brooklyneer
yelp.address: 220 W Houston St, New York, NY 10014

google.name: Market Table
google.address: 54 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014, USA

review_snippets.text: I lived across the street a decade or so ago and remember loving Market Table. We went back recently and had an amazing meal. The bartender said they’ve been open for 17 years! Definitely recommend. Really great service. Cocktails are also fantastic and creative.

This is truly one of the most charming, feel-good restaurants in the village. The beet salad was fantastic, and our entrées—half roasted chicken and pork tenderloin—were flavorful, with the chicken especially moist and delicious. While the orange chiffon cake wasn’t quite what we expected and was a bit on the dry side, a scoop of ice cream helped balance it out. Overall, a lovely experience with great food and ambiance!

A very special restaurant in the West Village with extremely delicious food. I've eaten many branzinos but this has to be one of the best I've ever eaten. Asparagus soup was perfect. Good Olive Oil cake. Didn't miss a beat. I'd say make this a must on your food travels. Also recently had brunch here and it was delicious. Great food.

This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in nyc. The food is incredible, you can taste that all the ingredients are high quality. They’re accommodating towards gluten allergy and have some vegan/vegetarian options. All the wines are organic and the cocktails are great.

Reserved a table here for Saturday brunch. Patio outside was full and no one sitting inside at noon. The natural lighting is great here. Menu is interesting and prices are reasonable. (great value for money) Service is delightful.

google.name: Amity Hall Downtown
google.address: 80 W 3rd St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Prefacing this with my being a homebody and non-drinker, so not exactly the target audience for a bar.
I stopped in since I had a free drink from donating blood, and decided to order some wings to go along with it. The wings were super crisp despite the barbecue sauce and were a very pleasant surprise (justifies the pricing a bit but still more than I'd like). The "cherish me" drink was pretty good but also small, so value was hit or miss depending on your wallet.
The bartender was nice and responsive,  no complaints there. It was hard to sit down though, since there wasn't much open seating, but that would depend on the day.
