Overall, I'd consider going back.

The New York Blood Center has this place as one of their participating venues. After my project at Union Square, I decided to go here despite the rainy day that ensued. I had three vouchers from the center and let's just say that I made a good decision. Their food smelled awesome so I had a chicken little along with my entitled free drinks. I left the choices up to the bar since I'm not very picky.

Anyway, I had a fun time here and the staff were super chill. There was an event planned here so I was lucky to witness it. Don't know what it was but it looked like the customers were having a swell time. Even though it's my first visit, I have more than enough Intel to conclude that this place deserves your time and your business. I would recommend and I say give it a chance to impress you.

I got a table for me and my partner on Halloween after aimlessly walking miles to finally find somewhere with food AND a useable bathroom.  But we sat and wanted to order sodas and food, note* no alcohol because our night was already crappy. We were just starving. Our server who was wearing cat leopard costume needed a card to open a bar tab but we only had cash, being im a waitress i understand, I offered my ID in replacement if possible but she refused that so we agreed to put all of our stuff in and close out immediately to make her life easier, because again, I am also a waitress. We closed out and got our change, the food immediately came, we’re eating and talking and as I have a mouth full of food this waitress approaches me and my boyfriend on some “so no tip?” …I’m sorry but when ever have you gotten a tip before we’re done eating? And who approaches their customers like that while they’re eating and talking. I genuinely would never go out to eat anywhere and not tip, I tip fast food workers. Food industry is hard, especially in the city. I also normally don’t write reviews but I was officially appalled when I looked over to see her with her co workers pointing at my check she just grabbed and telling her I didn’t tip. At least walk farther away to speak badly on a customer. I approached her nicer than I should’ve been explaining I had a bad night, I was trying to get more than 4 bites into my food but not tipping her was never on my agenda. After I approached her she fully fixed her attitude and tried apologizing, I appreciated the correction in behavior but honestly I didn’t finish any of my food and immediately felt uncomfortable.  The male hostess and manager were very kind and the atmosphere was very nice, my only issue was that server

A fun bar near NYU. I visited this bar last week with a friend and we both enjoyed ourselves. We had the bottomless mimosas (very good) while we waited for an event. Our bartenders were very friendly, and the atmosphere was lively as well. This seems like a great place to watch games as many sports shows we’re on while we were there. They have some good food options as well. Definitely a good time.

Booked a semi-private space with them for our wedding rehearsal dinner and they had an awesome event offering, and their event team was one of the best I’ve worked with in the city! They were so attentive, and even reached out week of as there was a big game scheduled to be streamed there the same time as our event so they moved us downstairs to our own section so that our rehearsal dinner wouldn’t become too loud or mixed with the regular crowd coming to enjoy the bar. Would definitely book with them again for an event, as well as would go watch games there! Definitely recommend.

google.name: Pianos
google.address: 158 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Classic Lower East Side NYC bar. So many other places didn't survive the pandemic but I glad this place did. Great venue to watch shows and dance upstairs. Their happy hour burger on an English muffin is my favorite.

While I did not try the food here, the frozen margaritas are pretty good ! I used a drink ticket for the open mic event that I was attending, but they also had a happy hour before 8 pm. I liked that they have music in both the front and back areas of the space. I would highly recommend this spot for someone looking to have a conversation amongst friends w/ music in the background. There's also some events held in the back for open mics if you're interested in performing !

Such a great vibe, and diverse, nice music, of all type, and different artists performance, with great talents, of all kind. Nice drinks, food smells delicious, and look lovely. Although i haven't tried any food as yet. I'm always full when i get there, next time ill leave an empty appetite to try it out. I been there 4 times already, and its always awesome.
Fire 🔥! The brunch food list is excellent, the prices are very reasonable, and the crowd is electric fun. Please, do yourself a favor and go. I'm definitely going back for more🥳 come and join me.
Had an amazing time here and we got shown some super awesome art. Will definitely go back if I visit NYC again

google.name: Beauty & Essex
google.address: 146 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: My daughter took me here as part of my 40th birthday celebration, I am a professional in the industry and not everything impresses me. We are also big foodies and love good ambiance, food, and service. This place did not disappoint at any time of the night! speakeasy with lots of vintage decorations, the doors open to a cozy yet elegant environment. Lots of details that set the mood for a great night! The staff was attentive and the food was well-executed. Will definitely come back and spread the word!

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Beauty & Essex, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! Don’t let the pawn shop at the entrance fool you; once you step through the hidden door, you are transported into a vibrant and exotic atmosphere that sets the stage for a culinary adventure.

The food was absolutely delicious, with a diverse menu that caters to a variety of tastes. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The cocktails were equally impressive, expertly crafted and perfect for complementing the meal.

The staff at Beauty & Essex truly made the experience exceptional. Our hostess was incredibly friendly and welcoming, and despite the restaurant being packed, we experienced minimal waiting time for our reserved table.

Overall, I highly recommend making a reservation at Beauty & Essex when visiting NYC. It’s a delightful blend of fun, fantastic food, and a lively atmosphere that you won’t want to miss. I can’t wait to return on my next trip.

The food was good, but the overall experience was not. Our reservation was for 8:45, but we got there early and were given a table right away (the table was not in the main dining area). While at that first table, we ordered drinks, then were advised by the waitress to order the appetizers and mains all together, and explained that our order would be phased in 2 courses. While waiting for the food, the table next to us got up and alerted us of a big roach going under our table. The manager moved us into the main dining area immediately. Shortly after moving to the new table, the appetizers and food came all at once. It felt from the start like we were being rushed. After another complaint, the manager comped our appetizers due to the restaurant's error. We also overheard the table behind us complaining about another issue, and they were comped with a couple of shots. The drinks we ordered were a hit or miss; the same drink came in too sweet or two strong. Don't think we will be coming back. It seems that the overall quality and service of the place has greatly declined.

I always wanted to come here. Loved the idea of a guitar/ jewelry store that opens a door to a restaurant! Super cute!! Visited during restaurant week. The kale and apple salad was really good and I mean really good. I'm a picky eater and usually don't like kale, but compared to the other options, that was the only thing I would get, and at least I'd get my veggies in. It was the best appetizer, and everyone at the table agreed. The salmon was a little on the salty side but tolerable. The chicken dish was really good. And Everyone loved their dessert! I would definitely recommend and will be coming back here!!

One of my favorites places in the city! The spicy salmon tartare and french dips are the best, the tun wonton tacos, steak tartare quesadilla and kale salad are also fantastic. The strawberry shortcake shots is one of my favorite desserts and the donuts are fantastic! Nothing bad to say about this place, especially the vibes!

yelp.name: Beauty & Essex
yelp.address: 146 Essex St, New York City, NY 10002

google.name: Clinton St. Baking Company
google.address: 4 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Brunch at this spot in New York may require navigating a bit of a rough neighborhood, but hey, it's NYC – that’s part of the charm! Once inside, you'll be greeted by an inviting modern decor and warm, attentive service that immediately makes you feel at ease.

Let's start with the cocktail: an apple cider creation that was pure culinary artistry. It was the perfect balance of fall vibes but versatile enough to be enjoyed year-round. The apple flavor was bold, clearly locally sourced, and refreshingly crisp – not overly sweet, just perfection in a glass.

Now, for the real reason I'd catch a flight back to NYC: the pancakes. These are not your average pancakes. Pancake-making requires real skill, and this chef knows exactly how to get it right. These beauties were fluffy but never soggy, with crispy edges that didn’t taste burnt, and a texture so light they almost melt in your mouth. Sweet but not sugary – it’s a delicate balance, and they nailed it. Honestly, these pancakes are in my top five of all time. Hats off to the kitchen for the love and mastery poured into every bite. You’ll be rethinking your whole life with these pancakes! Absolutely phenomenal.

Went for brunch and overall was very good but nothing that I need to go back for. Biscuits were my favorite bite. Crumbly and flaky at the same time. We had the southern breakfast which was very good but again not a “I must go back for this”. Bacon was cooked perfectly crispy with a hint of sweetness. Scrambled eggs were light and fluffy. I liked the grits but others in our group thought they needed to be looser with more butter. Fried green tomatoes were my least favorite they were not greasy, which is a big plus, but the batter was too thick and that’s really all you tasted.  Homemade hot sauce was really good, pretty spicy and added a nice kick to the eggs. Small restaurant that is very popular  therefore very crowded. We had a reservation and got seated right away. Definitely worth a try as it was a solid brunch.

Always a great spot to get brunch. Definitely worth the hassle of securing and having to wait for a seat. We always have the chicken and waffles along with something else, this time it was the chicken sandwich. Everything was delicious including the drinks that aren’t pictured.

First time trying this place and it was simply delightful,love the environment,place is clean,friendly staff. I will say it was worth the wait! If you really want a delightful food to get together with friends .!! I order the blueberry pancakes and they were super good I ate them all and we also order eggs Benedict and a regular breakfast I forgot the name of it but if any body ask me everything was super good,last but not least coffee was hot and good taste.It is 100% worth the wait!!!!

We took our daughter here for a bite to eat.  We loved the place, and food choices.  It was great to see that this place accommodated a baby's chair.  The service was fast.  The only reason why we didn't give it a 5 was because the staff person at the door was rather rude.  She was on the phone and inattentive to our needs.  Even though she sat us down rather fast, we didn't get a very friendly vibe from her.

google.name: Hotel Chantelle
google.address: 92 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Food presentation was on point. Eggs were perfectly cooked, and home fries well seasoned. The steak was decent, but overall the meal was good. The ambiance was charming, it effortlessly transports you into a quaint setting surrounded by beautiful decor, and the live music was a nice perk. Definitely recommend coming here whether it’s for two or a group. Service was spot on, and the drinks were decent.

Attended a Halloween burlesque event here. The show was amazing and the food and drinks were perfect. I absolutely loved that each table had a small dish of candy on it. The white truffle flatbread was decadent. I loved the paella and the chicken dish was very tasty and fresh as well. The strawberry margaritas were on point.

Hotel Chantelle... the building, the entrance, the indoor bar... nah... BUT walk up the stairs and WOW!!! Such a beautiful terrace!!! And yes!!! Drinks and party!!! Great experience! Food is delicious, drinks are fresh and chic. We didn't get the unlimited drinks for 1 hour and 1/2 cuz we wanted to try the beautiful cocktails. We had fun and great to be out with your girlfriends. Highly recommend for brunch.

I took my girlfriend on date night at hotel Chantelle and it didn't disappoint. I wish I could take away .5 star for no live band on Friday night

The foods & cocktails were great, especially we got a great online deal. The ambience was to the point, great bar flowers decoration, love the classic lamp post.

The dish highlight was charred octopus (starter) I would say 75% was cooked well the rest was chewy, but they were tasty. I tried pineapple express (it was great summer cocktail). The entree: Branzino and steak were good but not that special.

Overall highly recommended for the cocktails.

First time visiting here for an after work rooftop event, and I totally loved it. Fully stocked bar. Rooftop is spacious with ample seating. Dj played all the right hits to keep you grooving.  Restrooms were always clean, which is a plus for me.

google.name: The Delancey Rooftop
google.address: 168 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Had a great time at The Delancey! It was crowded at the second floor and quiet in the basement, but the energy was amazing. Prices were average, and it’s a perfect spot if you're looking to party with friends. Would definitely recommend!

Went here for some spoken word poetry and stayed for all of the talent they had coming on stage. Drinks were about $20 each so can be pricey, but the bartender knew how to make a cocktail. The place is beautiful and they have 3 different floors. We didn’t eat any food.

Great club.  Great mix of rock and electronic music down there and some great indie rock.  Friendly people, passionate youth.  A very pleasant time.  Great find.    I really liked the concert venue, especially for lovers of good rock. The bar has a good selection of beer and drinks, snacks, hamburgers. I really liked it, I will definitely come again!

Went here for a Caribbean style party with 3 other people. Nice tropical vibes with lots of plants and flowers. It was a daytime event with great DJ and very crowded. Most attendees were younger than my adult children. (This is the case in most places these days.) We still had a nice time moving in spot to the grooves. Everyone seemed to be having a great time. Drinks were pricey but that’s expected. Stayed for about an hour then headed downstairs and chilled in a lounge area with A/C to cool off before heading to our next stop.

Be aware ladies! I literally got my phone stolen from my purse last Friday! It was inside my purse when I realized I did not feel it anymore. This is a common occurrence based on some of the reviews. These thieves wait for it to be more crowded to target people. We asked the bartenders and the bouncers and they seemed aware that this happens. If there is a ring of people going around and go to the bars to steal phones why are they allowed to enter? I had been here before, but can’t believe this happened. I didn’t think I needed to worry about my phone being stolen INSIDE my own purse. Thankfully my wallet was there still, but that is what they’re doing. The place is fun, but is not worth having the trauma of getting your phone stolen in plain sight. Very disappointing. Reconsider going somewhere else; broke people come here to steal other people phones. I had to get a new iPhone and I was able to see where my old iPhone was and it literally says is in Senegal, Africa. This is whole scheme going around and I would’ve be surprised the staff is in on it. Karma will find its way!

google.name: Zest Sushi Izakaya
google.address: 249 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Phenomenal happy hour. The sushi is really good here. The ingredients are fresh and the rice is well made. The rose on the happy hour menu pairs nicely with the sushi. The owners and the staff are super cool.

Came in at 7 pm on a Friday, seated immediately. Ordered 2 appetizers and got them within minutes, then 2 rolls and drinks, and got them even faster. We were out of there by 7:20. Talk about speed! Food was amazing, great music and really nice atmosphere. Very very fresh and delicious sushi. Highly recommended

Zest Sushi is a cute casual spot located in the lower east side.

Possibly the best sushi happy hour deal I have seen in Manhattan, with a wide variety $6 rolls, appetizers, mini dons, fried rice, and drinks! You can find this deal every day between 4:30-7pm.

The sushi is decent for the price, and service is decent as well. Just note, they don’t take reservations and it is walk-in only, so if you want to take advantage of happy hour, you should get there at least around 6pm, with an anticipated 30 minute wait.

If you are super picky about your sushi, I wouldn’t recommend this place for you, but otherwise, Zest Sushi makes for an affordable dinner out!

Cant Miss This Spot!! Delicioso!! Got There at 6:01 was out by 6:22 . I wasn’t rushed it just Worked out perfect as a tourist trying to  see as much as possible in NYC. Got 2 Rolls A Fried Rice a Sapporo and almost drank 2 liters of Agua. Everything was delicious. I was seated immediately. My order came out in 2 minutes. It was bing Bang Bada Boom Perfecto! Gracias Zest. Happy Hour $6

Cozy izakaya style sushi bar with large fish and roll selection. wine and sake selection is accommodating for all tastes. Gyoza was cooked to perfection and the toro nigiri is amazing. Highly recommend for a comfortable and local Japanese spot.

google.name: Essex Restaurant
google.address: 124 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Grabbed brunch here recently for the first time and it was such a great find! Our brunch was delicious, mimosas were great and the servers were friendly. Busy restaurant and can be a bit noisy but definitely a fun atmosphere! We will be back when in NYC again!

4.3 /5. Fun, rockin’ Happy Hour. As I waited for my friends to arrive, the waiter was attentive and asked if I wanted to be served as she dropped off the menus. I got my drink & water before they arrived several minutes later. Water glasses were quickly filled and the waiter came by again to take drink and food orders. We started with the oysters, unfortunately, they were a bit small and not so tasty -  was not a fan of the sauces provided. I would probably try this again as it’s not really the season for oysters right now. The shrimp wantons was a table favorite, as was the calamari. The flatbread was small and just Ok. We ordered a second round of food as it was our dinner. The Manchego mac and cheese was outstanding! It was probably the best Mac n cheese I’ve had at a restaurant with a healthy amount of cheese and perfectly prepared with a toasted top. The 3 of us were almost full but we managed to finish the very good truffle fries. I probably wouldn’t order the roasted peppers next time, even though they were prepared excellently. All the food arrived piping hot, which should be easy to do but most places don’t do this. The place was buzzy with people drinking but there was still room if you wanted to drink, arrive early for a table. Fantastic happy hour! Oct 2024

This place is great and very low key. The service was perfect, and the food was also great. It's not pretentious and roomier than most other restaurants in the area. The mixed drinks were superb. I would like to see some other beers on the menu that are not draft choices. Keep up the good work, I'll be back.

Helena provided us optimal service. I brought my service dog along and she was so respectful to her as well. Whenever our drinks were even halfway, she made sure to refill and cater to our bottomless mimosas choice. Great experience. Ask for her if you want to make sure your brunch experience is seamless

Went for restaurant week after viewing a bunch of ads on instagram. However, it didn’t meet expectations. It felt the bus boy did more than our server and that she was dodging our table purposely. The food was average. Our green beans were undercooked with stems still on. Surprisingly, chocolate cake had a garnish of a sorrel not mint. The service was very disappointing & not welcoming; overall wasn’t worth the price

google.name: Starbucks
google.address: 80 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I've been going to this Starbucks for years. The staff is always friendly and the drink and food is just the way I like it. I love the location right across the bridge from Brooklyn, where I go visit for church when I stop in NYC a few times a year. I'll be back in November.

Spacious with good seating. And they have WiFi. Unfortunately, they only have one open electrical socket on a corner to power mobile devices. Like many places in NYC, electrical sockets have been blocked/made inacessible to discourage squatters/homeless users. Wish Starbucks would have official charging stations.

The dude simply refused to accept my $50  banknote, saying he can accept only 20 and lower. Is $50 not the money in the US anymore?that’s so weird. I had no issues paying with $100 in other Starbucks store
Super pleasant staff, great location that is walking distance to Williamsburg bridge. This Starbucks also has a restroom which is super important given the present dearth of restrooms in the city.
I asked for an ice chai tea latte and the gave me a warm chai tea not even a latte and when I asked for a new one because the messed up they still made it warm.

google.name: Congee Village
google.address: 100 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Food was great value for the price!!! Fried squid was a bit too oily so won’t order it next time. Supposed to be salt pepper fried squid but could not taste the pepper. Salted fish fried rice was oily too and no taste of the salted fish.

Other dishes were yummy and portions were large enough! Service was attentive and waiters had a good attitude for a Sunday evening! Atmosphere was peaceful but it would be better with some background music!

Overall it is good, I would stay away from the fried dishes as they are too oily.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Congee Village in Chinatown, New York, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm hospitality and immediately served a comforting pot of tea, which set the tone for the rest of the evening.

The food was simply outstanding. Each dish was bursting with flavors that were both rich and delicate, surprising me, especially since I’m not usually a big fan of Chinese cuisine. Congee Village truly changed my perspective. The variety and quality of the dishes we tried were remarkable – everything tasted incredibly fresh and well-prepared.

One of the highlights of our meal was the value for money. We were a group of eight, and the portions were impressively large, yet the prices were unbelievably affordable. It’s rare to find such a great combination of quality and quantity at such reasonable prices in New York City.

I highly recommend Congee Village to anyone looking for an authentic and delicious Chinese dining experience. Whether you’re a fan of Chinese food or just curious, this place is worth a visit. I’ll definitely be returning!

Referred here by a friend who loved congee. Right in Chinatown and when I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance. The menu was extensive but I only came for the congee. I was offered tea upon being greeted but I declined because I’m not having caffeine but thought that was a nice gesture. I got the pork and duck congee. YUM! The texture was creamy and the pieces of duck skin you get were so good. I ordered some fried dough that you can dip like you would with bread and soup. I added some of their chili oil and it gave it more flavor. I was definitely satisfied with this congee and glad I went!

Delicious ambrosial fantastic dishes. The fish is sooo fresh with the scallions. Clocking the server they don’t serve a good face (cuz it’s a chinese restaurant don’t expect white service) but they made sure you are fed enough food and not over ordering. They gave us a pot of daily soup and dessert for free!

The restaurant is not the cheapest option, but it offers a beautiful dining environment and delicious Cantonese cuisine. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to experience authentic Cantonese flavors. Many Chinese patrons consider it a favorite and return frequently. While it might be a bit pricey, the quality of the food and the overall experience make it worth the visit. If you appreciate fine dining and enjoy exploring different culinary traditions, this restaurant should definitely be on your list.

google.name: Barrio Chino
google.address: 253 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Absolutely fantastic food! Everything was so delicious and we can’t wait to go back again! Had the guacamole and house made chips, steak tacos and enchiladas verdes along with a Paloma Margarita. Yum yum yum! Our waiter Justino was fantastic and very personable - can’t wait to go back again! Delicious!

The Al Pastor & Carnitas tacos slapped. Great ambiance and friendly bartender. We loved the tequila infusions and their mezcal list. Wish we saved room for more! We will be back next time we are in town.
We had the classic margarita, tamarind mezcalita, guacamole, tuna tostada and barbacoa (the reason I come here 😋). All delicious and authentic. Service was just ok. Server not as attentive.

The 🌮 Al Pastore are amazing!
Fidel, behind the bar is awesome!

Can almost never go wrong with tacos and Barrio Chino didn't disappoint. Arrived on a somewhat busy night without reservation. Outdoor seating was readily available. We had chicken, and steak tacos. You have a choice of ordering two or three tacos. You can only pick one type (chicken, or steak, etc). So we ordered two chicken and two steak tacos and switched one out. Servers were nice and attentive. The tacos came out fast and were delicious.

google.name: The Ten Bells
google.address: 247 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We only got the charcuterie and cheeseboard, some sardines, and the orange wine. It was all good!

Really liked this bar. It's on a busy street that makes it fun to visit. And it being a wine bar was great - felt a little more upscale and mature. They had our group move from a dedicated table to the bar, and we actually appreciated the change as we got to be closer to the street. They also gave us lots of samples before we picked our glasses, which was much appreciated. Only negative - not a big fan of "natural wines".

Ten Bells!!

The place we met. The most amazing wine bar with great food and the friendliest service. Celebrating our wedding day here was a no brainer!  Thank you to everyone here for always making our visits special.

Beautiful place ! They have an outdoor seating all the way at the back. A huge dining room style table for shared seating and bar seating in the front. They have good choice of small plates and portions are literally small. I wish they had A/C in the seating area. It got humid and hot and we moved our tables to outdoor. Our server suggested a bottle for our table to pair with the food we ordered. Overall a decent experience.

GREAT happy hour option. $1 oysters and a $20 carafe of wine. The place got filled up at the bar pretty quickly, but it has a back room with a long table and an outdoor area. Might be my next oyster spot! (And will still come back for tapas too)

google.name: Verlaine
google.address: 110 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I’ve been going to Verlaine in the Lower East Side for years, and it’s always been a great experience. The vibe is consistently cool, with dim lighting, vibrant photos, and good music that set the perfect mood whether you’re there for a dinner date or after-work drinks with friends. I’ve even caught a live salsa band here, which was incredible, and celebrated a New Year’s Eve that was unforgettable! The bartenders have always been chill and welcoming, especially Xavier. On my most recent visit, I enjoyed some light bites like the fried chicken dumplings and sake shrimp skewers, both were delicious! And, of course, my partner’s favorite, the Lychee Martinis, never disappoint. Just a heads up, on weekends, it can get full, so plan to arrive a little early for the best experience. Highly recommend Verlaine as part of a fun night out in the area!

This place is truly a vibe! The service is great . Everyone is super friendly and helpful. Leech martini is so delicious and the food is very flavorful. My favorite from the menu would be the short rib sliders. I also love the shrimp skewers!

I came in on Saturday Aug 21st for the first time and man this place is sexy! 😃 The Lychee was amazing!!! Lawrd! Staff were awesome especially the bartenders. This is a veryyy cool spot if you’re on a date! I loved it and I highly recommend it!

Bartender guy with the beard was so rude for no reason!!! My boyfriend wasn’t even having happy hour & the bartender never even acknowledged us. 20% gratuity added despite us never getting service, constantly had to raise our hand for another drink and bartender got mad that we did. We sat on a table first then moved to the bar. The only helpful one was the anime shirt one, he was nice and helpful, he should be bartender or server. Bad service from the servers and that one bartender!!! I do not agree with the 20% tip automatically added!!!!!!

One of my favorite restaurants to go to when I’m in NYC! Love their menu the food is always fresh, served extremely quick and the $8 yummy lychee martini’s are delicious! Can’t go wrong with this place definitely will be coming back whenever I can 😁

google.name: Hair of the Dog
google.address: 168 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: My son and I decided to visit this location where we would visit with coworkers in the past. They truly stick to their name by having dog shows on the big screen television. The decor is country style and spacious. Their onion rings are delicious.

Winter Bear and I came here for a quick catch-up. The bar had both indoor and outdoor seating. There was only one waitress and they had a few games on the TV. The bathrooms were clean and had a few stalls.

We ordered a few drinks and nachos to share. They had tons of specials and the drinks were strong. The fountain sodas were a bit watery. The nachos were generously sized and tasted fresh.

The waitress/bartender was friendly but she was mostly drinking with other patrons. We had to go order at the bar to get service.

I gave food a 4 cuz I didn’t eat here, I only got drinks on a Sunday at 8pm and the music was good, jumping from pop, to hip hop, r & b and every blue moon a Latin song. But all vibes. I love how they have specials pretty much all day. They also got a beer pong table which is cool if you want to actively do something / meet people. Def will come back if I ain’t got no plans or to pre game. Overall for the price of drinks and other near by bars,  it’s worth a visit.
I was very impressed with the music, and the energy of the bar! Went with a group of girls and had so much fun dancing and didn’t have a hard time getting a drink. Will definitely be back!

Pretty standard college bar. I went on the weekend from 12-2 with some friends. No entry fee which is great and the line wait isn't long. Music is pretty good too. Nothing to complain about a decent place.

google.name: Essex Market
google.address: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Fantastic assortment of food. Just needs more seating. Recommend the lasagna at this italian place/kiosk/booth (5 stars for this). Owner was super nice, too! Sorry the name escapes me at this moment.
It was my first time at the market since it moved. It looks great. However, they don't have a dumplings place inside.

Lots of cool shops and restaurants. My favourite Riverdel Cheese was replaced by Rebel Cheese. I haven’t been here in over 4 years. The guy behind the counter was helpful and patient. I wish they would bring back the caramalized onion. I still remember it from 8 years ago when Riverdel was in Prospect Heights just down the street from where I lived on St Johns Place. It was the impetus for me to go vegan after almost 30 years as a vegetarian.

A nice new building to go shopping. It is actually a kind of market but then permanent and inside. You can find everything from vegetables to fish. There are also tables upstairs where you can eat quietly with a view of the stalls or the street, which is great.
Amazing public market full of grocery vendors and quick eats places. It has lots of options for food from pizza to burgers and other unique eats. It has lots of seating space and good ambiance.

google.name: Russ & Daughters
google.address: 179 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: The lox sandwich, which is what you come for, is indeed very very delicious. The lox are fresh and delicate and the bagel is chewy and delicious. The question is, is it 20.00 dollars delicious? For a one time experience, definitely. But I cannot imagine making this my go-to bagel shop. Try it, love it, move on. Cute names for the menu items, though.

It was crowded and there was a little bit of a wait.  Make sure you take a number first, because there is no line.  Just wait for your number to be called and then order.

I came here because I heard they had the best bagels in New York City.  I can’t disagree.  I had the Scottish salmon with scallion cream cheese on an everything bagel and it was gone way too soon.  It was delicious.  I’m not sure which was better, the salmon, the bagel or the cream cheese .

For as crowded as it was, the service was fast and very friendly and the food was excellent.  I will definitely be back here.

Russ has one of the best bagels in town, a massive variety with plenty of fish options as well. Opt for a garlic bagel stuffed with extra shmeare and add salmon, onions, capers, and a spoon of some caviar. The bagels can take a real stuffing, and it is delicious. Highly recommend

The first time I bit into their lox and goat cream cheese sandwich I cried on the street. Since then I make a concerted effort to stop by every single time I visit NYC. The LES location is worth the wait, the staff is a well-oiled machine and so kind, and everything they make is an absolute delight. Side note: I’m lactose intolerant and the goat cream cheese is a lifesaver.

Yum! It’ll be packed when you visit, surely but the wait isn’t long and the service was great! Quite a big selection of bagels and fish and cream cheese to choose from here. Make sure you take a number when you first walk in - that’s how they work through the line. You can buy merchandise and even caviar here too! We had the lox bagel with tomato, onion and caper ( all of which you pay extra for so be sure to only order what you absolutely want on your bagel so as to not be over charged for something you’ll just pick off) it was really good. We will definitely be back!

yelp.name: Russ & Daughters
yelp.address: 179 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Dirt Candy
google.address: 86 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
One of the best dinners I’ve had in NYC. An exquisite and quite reasonably priced prix fixe menu. Loved the creativity of each dish - the real standout was the shaved cauliflower.  While the restaurant decor is a little worn, it’s all about the food here.

Love that there is a seasonal menu, may have to come back again!

The food was really mediocre; I don’t understand the hype. Yes, it was colorful and showcased a nice play with vegetables, but it lacked quality. A few dishes were overpowering. I loved their carrot pizza though!

$105 with tip included is relatively cheap for a Michelin restaurant. The dishes were hit or miss. The tomato donut was surprisingly the best while the corn pasta my least favorite. Opposite of my expectations. Great service

DirtCandy is a vegan/vegetarian Michelin star restaurants in NYC. It is a non-tipping establishment. Overall my experience was average, not really worth the money spent. Total $272 for 2 people tasting menu + two teas.

Ambiance - is nice and simple, lighting is quite dim. There is an open kitchen in the middle, where you can see the chefs preparing dishes.

Staff & service - staff is very warm and friendly, explained the dishes and answered our questions patiently. Service was quite quick, they brought the next course as soon as we were done with current. We got two complimentary dishes as well during the five course meal :)

Now coming to the food
Complimentary welcome item - we got carrot mousse served in a savory crunchy cone. It had different textures and flavors.
Presentation- 9/10, taste - 9/10

First course item - lettuce dish. Nice burst of flavors and lots of textures from creamy to crunchy.
Presentation- 8, taste - 9

Second course - tomato dish. Nice pairing of donut, feta cheese and tomato jam
Presentation- 8, taste-9

2nd complimentary item - it was clear broth with sesame seeds and turnip flat noodles. It was quite tasteful as well.
Presentation-7, taste -8

Third course - corn dish. This dish was also good. Had few corn chips, corn soup, cilantro and little pasta bites.
Presentation-6, taste -8

Fourth course - Eggplant dish. Liked the coconut curry and outer crust of the dish, however I didn’t like the texture of the eggplant filling. It also lacked seasoning in the filling.
Presentation-7, taste -4

Fifth course- Caramelized onion ice cream
Definitely a novel concept. Onion ice cream is sandwiched between choco chip cookies and served with framboise (raspberry sauce). If you eat ice cream on it’s own, you can definitely taste onion flavor. It wasn’t really something that I would go again for. But with the cookie and raspberry sauce, onion flavor gets masked nicely and is not overpowering. But I am glad I tried this wild flavor of ice cream 😄
Presentation-7, taste - 7

This was my first experience at a vegetarian only restaurant. I was very excited to try it and looking forward to the tasting menu experience to be able to try many dishes.

Each course was smart, creative, tasty, and filling. I didn’t miss the meat at all! I had a seat at the counter so I enjoyed watching the talented chefs cook during my meal.

Check it out if you enjoy vegetarian dining. But don’t miss it even if you aren’t strictly vegetarian.

google.name: Supper
google.address: 156 E 2nd St, New York, NY 10009, USA

review_snippets.text:
The food was fantastic! Note it was cash only. This limited what we ordered since it was apparent when we made our reservation. It was a bit loud inside. But the lighting and friendliness of the staff was absolutely delightful.
Loooved the lemon pasta. The pesto gnocchi was also very good! And the Monday risotto was fabulous!
Note some items on the menu were day specific. Overall, very tasty! We will go again!

The gnocchi was perfection and easily the best Italian meal I've had in some time! The staff went above and beyond to make it a special occasion for our group. Wonderful wine selection (we had the super Tuscan). Definitely worth getting off the beaten path and exploring! Can't wait to go back!

Love supper.  Hidden gem.  Owner told us the mozzarella was flown in from Italy this morning.  Been here 20+ times.  Get beans and bread. Garlic, lemon pasta, priest strangler, veal parm, salads and soups are great.  Eat here

This was the best Italian meal I have ever had, including the ones in Italy. Everything was on point. Watching the kitchen work was inspiring and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The white beans were sensational. All for a price that didn't feel like Manhattan. Cash only.

Lemon spaghetti is great! Tiramisu is good!
The complimentary beans and bread are a bit disappointing. (I didn’t even take pictures of them.) The beans are very garlicky and there is way too much of it. And the bread is not even focaccia. Some kind of hard-crusted sour-doughy type of bread. Not the best. Overall, the bean + bread don’t add much to the experience. I just peck on them out of guilt and sense of duty. I’d rather have nothing.
They only take cash. (No credit card)

google.name: Phở Grand
google.address: 277C Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Classic Vietnamese fair in the Chinatown area of downtown NYC. In my opinion, this is the place you want to go if you want a no frills experience, just solid good food.

This time I got Shrimp Summer Rolls & the Grilled Pork Rice Vermicelli salad. This is perfect for a hot summer day. All delicious!

Great. Seafood noodle soup was delish so was the fried spring rolls and grilled pork chops.
Mango drink and mango smoothie was amazing

Good food! Flavorful dishes and fast service. Small Vietnamese joint with reasonable pricing. However feeling a bit bothered - the owner somehow insisted the store was closed and we should leave even though customers at neighboring tables were still eating.

20 years ago, this was one of the better, of the rare Vietnamese spots. This was when non-Asians thought Vietnamese food was Panda Express. Yeah, you did - Karen.

It’s rather pedestrian these days, but still solid. No longer a destination, but if in the hood- it’s a relatively cheap option. Prices have practically doubled since I first came here, but so has almost everything else in the city/ world.

Price to portion: standard
Destination: no
Repeat offender: only when I’m in the hood and the craving hits
Big portions. Spicy and well seasoned. I got the Obama plate (lol). Differences in prices are outlined on the menu (card vs. Cash)

yelp.name: Pho Grand
yelp.address: 277 Grand St, Ste C, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Sauce Restaurant
google.address: 78 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We had a wonderful evening! Very cozy ambiance. The food was amazing and the service was excellent!  Thank you for the great memories!

The restaurant is dope with lots going on, excellent music and comfortable seating. Great for large groups and celebrations, definitely something to be noted as that’s hard to find in Manhattan without breaking the bank.

Service was awesome, never felt like we were rushed to finish or give up the table. Drinks came quick and food was sizzling hot.

Food, food was great, was more comfort/family style Italian. The thin crust pizza was good but just felt too thin, almost a little cheap thin. Go in on Tuesdays for an all day happy hour as well. I think for the price and being in Manhattan this is a great find.

Great art deco, NY vibe with a touch of rustic coziness.
Warm cookies at rooftop
Mushroom pizza
Lasagna
Bolognese
Chicken Parmesan
Salmon
We had a group of 10 and everyone enjoyed their entree selections.
Staff was friendly and attentive.
Seating was a bit awkward as 5 persons on bench across from 5 in chairs. Difficult for bench people in middle to exit.

New York has hundreds of Italian restaurants claiming to be the best, but this place can take all the bragging rights!

Meatballs are tender and delicious and can be served in either traditional Mariana or vodka sauce. The double garlic bread was absolutely delicious, super cheesy and full of garlic!

The Sunday gravy with home made rigatoni and meatballs tasted just like some ones grandma made them! But the chicken parm stole my heart with saucy spaghetti.

To end it all the ricotta doughnuts were the most perfect sweet !

We stumbled into this place looking for pasta and this place looked cute. There was no wait on a tuesday evening. And then, we walked in they were blasting hip hop - which was a fun surprise because it kind of has the interior decor of a old bnb. And then, our meals were so delicious and our portions were huge - the pan seared salmon was probably one of the best I've had!

google.name: Golden Forest
google.address: 4628 353 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I really enjoyed my beef and broccoli dish from here! So fresh and yummy. The beef was really tender too. Also some really nice people work here. Please support their business!
This is worst don’t west your money and time with worst behavior and food. This is so unhygienic.

This is the Best Chinese restaurant in the Lower east side hands down. I've been going here for 25 years and the food is still amazing. These bad reviews is not for the food or service. It's because people don't understand inflation and if not are super picky.We all have those kinds of people in are lives either friends or family 😭

Ordered chicken wings and pork fried rice from Golden Forest and couldn't believe how tiny the wings were. Seriously, they looked like baby/mini wings. 1 normal wing. 3 baby wings. Felt totally ripped off for the price I paid. The rice was okay, but that couldn't save the meal. Can't recommend this place until they fix the portion sizes.

I can't Walk and this restaurant refuses to deliver my food!!
If you are disabled don't order from here!!!!!
They only deliver to the better neighborhoods and don't take credit cards so they don't have to pay much taxes

google.name: Bacaro
google.address: 136 Division St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. The food is fantastic. The fritto misto is a hit, and the eggplant parm is excellent. The salads are always fresh. Everything on the menu is good. The service has always been wonderful to me and my family. It’s a blessing to have a restaurant this good nearby. Many surrounding restaurants have wine lists that are heavily, if not entirely, focused on natural and organic wines. These are great for people who enjoy stemmy, funky, and fizzy wines. Bacaro, however, offers an extensive list of classic Italian wines, which is a nice change from the natural wine trend that has taken over the Lower East Side.

When I got there they couldn’t find my reservation which I made through Resy even though the details were correct and they acted as if they were doing us a favor for still taking us in. Then they sat us down at a ‘shared table’ even though there were tables for 2 that were still empty. We ordered the stracciatella with figs and it came without figs… I raised this to the waitress and she went to “check” and didn’t come back until 20 minutes later, so I asked another waiter and very nonchalantly said “Didn’t they tell you? We’re out of figs”. I asked if we could see the menu and the waiter rolled his eyes at me. Then I ordered a medium rare steak but it came very rare, almost seared and it tasted like nothing. Very disappointing experience with inexperienced staff who clearly couldn’t care less. I hope the owner of this restaurant turns things around or I don’t see it surviving very long.
The atmosphere was great! While the food was okay, the dishes could have used a bit more flavor, and the pasta wasn't as fresh as I'd hoped

To start the atmosphere is awesome. We sat in the basement and it was very cozy and unique. The service was amazing. The wine was all Italian. She got the chicken and it was crispy and lovely, she also got the potatoes, again, lovely and perfectly cooked. I got the mussels as an app and the sole filet with broccoli. The broccoli was the highlight for me as its prep was perfect. We got deserts which we normally don’t do, she had the lemon sorbet and again, excellent, I got panna cota, excellent. If I had a complaint, the music was eclectic and sometimes a little loud and just jumped genres a bit much…if I had to complain. But I’m giving this 5 stars.
Very solid Venetian food served in a spot with great ambiance. Squid ink pasta is hard to find, and this is a great spot to get it.

google.name: Mehanata Bulgarian Bar
google.address: 113 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This is definitely the worst night club I have been to. I don’t recommend anyone coming here because first of all when we made the line to enter, we had already paid for a $40 admission ticket. Then when scanning the tickets, they charged us $10 per person to drink inside in the bars. It made no sense because they never specified that in the ticket to pay for the bar and were changing the prices for everyone. So don’t come here and don’t trust the people by the line asking you to pay for something. Everything was a complete rip-off. Also inside didn’t have decent music and the place didn’t look good.

Very fun place to have a few drinks and let lose on the dance floor. Love the decor. It has three floors which is also nice, need to check out the top which appears a bit smaller.
The bottom floor looks nice has a stopped pole a bar also and a "ice cage" where you take shots. Some that you pay extra for.

Mehanata Bulgarian Bar is my new favorite spot in NYC. Already recommending to everyone I know. This bar is unique and you will find another like it in Manhattan. This bar truly appeals to everyone especially those that need a break from the concrete jungle every now and then. Bartenders are awesome at what they do. The offer many types of cocktails and we can't forget about the vodka ICE CAGE!  Forget about dating apps and get your butt down to Mehanata. Live life.
The atmosphere is cozy, got a nice vibe but the meat sandwich was goddamnnnn so good
They refused to give us tap water, even when we reminded them that doing so is against the law. The barman told us that they were sorry but it was the manager's order not to provide free water.

google.name: La Caverna
google.address: 122 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
I recently visited a Taco Tuesday joint. The tacos were bursting with flavor, showcasing fresh ingredients and creative combinations. What stood out most was the bartender’s expertise; they crafted unique cocktails that perfectly complemented the meal. The attention to detail throughout—from the presentation to the ambiance—made for a delightful dining experience. A must-visit for taco lovers.

However,

Fruit flies were near the bar, it’s just one of those things you notice when going to a place.

The food itself was amazing and fresh! All you can ask for in a taco hotspot.

My friends and I have been trying to come here for a week and now we finally came here and they accommodated me for bottomless margaritas which made my night! I really appreciate the service and the food! My friends truly enjoyed the margaritas and I loved the food especially the chicken tacos. very simple and flavourful. The aesthetic is very unique and we had very comfortable seats. I would highly recommend coming here after all our troubles trying to come here for our whole trip.

The food in this place is nothing short of phenomenal. At first, we came for the Taco Tuesday discount, but we certainly stayed for the cozy, cave vibes. This place was so reasonably pieced and cool to hang out in. We will be back for another delicious dinner!

We went for dinner on a Monday so keep that in mind. This place is well decorated and definitely looks like a cave, which is cool. The drinks were not so great and the food was ok. It definitely felt like they were understaffed since the waitresses were all running around trying to make sure everyone was being attended.

Not that expensive for a restaurant in nyc.  Located underground in a CAVE-LIKE space.  It is not a real cave and is fake.  They have a bar in the middle and tables lined on the outside. Reminds me of the Rainforest Cafe, but mature.  Beautiful place to eat.

We came at 9 pm on a Wednesday.  Online they said they close at 10 pm but upon arrival they said they kitchen closed at 9:30pm.  We felt extremely rushed as they were cleaning up at 9 pm.  There were 2 other tables eating.  Towards 9:30, a couple came in for drinks but they said the bar closes soon and they can only order one.  They spent 10 minutes there then left.

Our waitress rushed everything and moved so fast she forgot to give us napkins and utensils, the other guest was eating a quesadilla with their hands.  Finally we got her attention and she apologized.

The food was okay but didn’t blow us away.  We went the night of my birthday and we were looking for a good meal to celebrate and it was overall quite disappointing.  To give them the benefit of the doubt, they had an hour left until close on a weekday.  The waitresses just wanted to go home.  The drinks were strong and weren’t that good.

Not worth the hype.

google.name: Bar Belly
google.address: 14 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Bar Belly is a happy hour dream! My friend and I stopped by and were so impressed with the amazing deals. I enjoyed a couple of beers, a glass of Prosecco, and we indulged in a generous helping of oysters — all at an incredible price. The oysters were fresh and delicious, making it an unbeatable value for seafood lovers.

The atmosphere is lively and bustling, with a vibrant crowd that adds to the charm of the place. Even though it was busy, the staff kept everything running smoothly, and we felt well taken care of. If you’re looking for a spot with great vibes, fantastic happy hour deals, and tasty bites, Bar Belly is a must-visit. Can’t wait to come back!

Good spot for happy hour in lower east side. Oysters were 1$ and the provide house popcorn which was seasoned great. Cocktails were pretty good and the atmosphere was lively. Ideal spot to come after work and chat

Loved the ambiance, music, and friendly bartenders! Super extensive cocktail menu, great for a date or a night out with friends! Complimentary truffle popcorn was a plus too!

4.5/5 Punch Card
4.5/5 Pineapple Express

Second visit during Happy Hour and we greatly  enjoyed it!

5/5 $1 Oysters -- some of the best HH oysters I've  had in the city. The soy dipping sauce was so unique and paired so nicely with the oysters!
5/5 Casanova - refreshing  with the perfect hint of floral flavor
4/5 Star Dust
4/5 Squarepants

BEST!!!! BAR!!!! IN THE CITY!!!! Been coming here regularly for 3-4 years. To start, the service is purely unmatched. The team will make you feel right at home - the biggest standout of all is the service. The menu though??? Something for everyone, from the most chill beer drinker to the fanciest of cocktail lovers. And of course the vibe??? Amazing variety - some nights dance party, some nights live jazz, some nights ultra chill. Open late but also a great time when you come early. Did I say best bar in NYC?? Good, cause I meant it and it’ll never change!!! BAR BELLY FOREVER

Imagine an intimate bar; dimly lit, ample seating, and an eclectic food menu that has everything you could want while sharing food with friends or a date. Well, that’s what bar belly is like and I’m so happy I ended up checking this spot out recently. My friend and I decided to grab drinks here on a weekday. We didn’t have a reservation and most definitely did not need one. Once we arrived we opted to sit at the bar. We had come during happy hour and were excited to have the opportunity to try some dishes and drinks out. Noted with beer but also tried the Casanova cocktail which tasted more like a vodka based summer drink. When it came time to food we dined on their tater tots and prosciutto pizza. All great for sharing! I’d totally recommend this for a more intimate occasion if you do end up visiting.

yelp.name: Bar Belly
yelp.address: 14 B Orchard St, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Cafe Katja
google.address: 79 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This was a pleasant surprise at the end of a seven day visit to Manhattan. We'd had a lot of mixed results with restaurants on this trip, and when we saw that this was in place with a lot of other restaurants, we had our doubts. Turned out to be a great restaurant with tasty food. We're fond of German cuisine and have it often. Service was also great. I was a bit surprised that the server had never heard of Schnitzel ala Holstein, but theirs was good.

We had dinner at this charming Austrian restaurant on our trip to NYC recently. The Frittanen soup, trout, Beef Gulasch and Kale Caesar salad were all delicious. We sat outside to enjoy the mild weather and soak up the atmosphere.
Great beer and sausage.  This place is a staple, come hungry and thirsty.  Sausage sampler, spatzel, cabbage, carrots, meatballs

When I come here, I am treated like family. The service is incredible and the food is incredible. Long live this very special, authentic spot. Nothing like delicious Austrian food and dessert with a nice beer and schnapps to wash it down. Ambiance is on point and makes you feel like you are not in the US.

Loved cafe Katja! Been here a few times and the food was always good. This time we had the schnitzel and the jägerschnitzel and they were both delicious. Extra point for our server who was willing to accommodate the last minute change to our order. We were lucky to be seated next to their semi opened kitchen, and it was fun to see their very efficient kitchen operation (also super clean kitchen!). Around spring time they also have specials with white asparagus, we will have to return and try.

google.name: Sticky Rice
google.address: 85 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: An unassuming little noodle bar. Great classic cocktails with an Asian twist. The food all slaps, upbeat music and super nice staff. Really chill place for a drink and a snack.

We came here with a large group with my cousins upon the recommendation of a local shopkeeper.

The place is very cute and not huge, and the decor is fun, with colorful lanterns and a beautiful painted wall.

Their service is very good. They were friendly and filled our water attentively, and it was a bit humid, so they kept the door closed and kept the AC in the space.

The food was fantastic!

I really loved my dish, the salmon fried rice. It had large chunks of fried salmon. The papaya salad was delicious too, not too spicy and so flavorful.

The Singapore noodles were delicious, but not what I was expecting. This is an egg noodle like fettuccine with soy sauce and oyster sauce. It tasted great, and I'd probably order it again, but just FYI it isn't a curry dish with Angel hair noodles!

The curry fries were yummy but I'd probably not order it again, I would prefer to keep the curry sauce separate for dipping.

Overall, 5 stars!

Walking around Orchard street I thought of going to Katz’s deli on Houston. But there was at least an hour wait — for a frigging sandwich. New York is simply overrun with tourists. Anyway, I walked back down Orchard getting hungrier by the second. I don’t know why I chose Sticky Rice, but I’m glad I did. Delicious Red Curry, cold beer, friendly service, good vibe. No tourists (except me — though I used to live here). What’s not to like?

We were expecting a lot based on the reviews, but honestly, it was pretty underwhelming. We ordered the pineapple fried rice, and the server asked if we wanted chicken, shrimp, or beef. Thought it was just a choice, but turns out shrimp was an extra $4, which wasn’t mentioned. Also, there was like one tiny piece of pineapple in the whole dish.

The mango sticky rice was alright, but nothing special—we could’ve made it ourselves. The banana rolls were just meh.

The vibe was off too. They were decorating while we were there, so it was messy, and even though we were the only ones in the restaurant, the server didn’t really care. She barely paid attention to us and was busy talking to another staff member.

Overall, the food was just okay. Not bad but nothing special. Definitely wouldn’t come back or recommend it.

My colleagues had a gathering here. They reserved a long table for us - a party of 12. I had their iced coffee. They used robust coffee with sweet cream. It was strong. For food, I ordered their salmon and shrimp with green curry. Their green curry is actually spicy and I like that. The rice is a mixed with purple and regular rice. Towards the end, they gave us sticky rice with mangos on the house. It’s a personal preference but I personally think their food and drinks are a bit sweet. Everyone had a wonderful time.

google.name: Home Sweet Home
google.address: 131 Chrystie St # 1, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Went out on a Saturday night and had an amazing time. The bartenders were fast and so attentive even though the place was packed, not to mention the drink prices were so reasonable. Loved the music and definitely will be going back soon

A super fun bar that has a clubby basement vibe. Beware coming during the summer, because it gets HOT! The drinks are always so strong and affordable, and depending on the DJ the music can be either mid, or the best in town.

Love it here. I love to start my nights out in LES here. I remember coming here a couple of years ago for the first time for a goth event that was hosted here and fell in love.

Get the frozen margs!!

EVIL BOUNCER!! Love this bar so much and have been going for years but when we tried to go last night the bouncer was charging a $10 cover, all good we paid, he took our money and then said actually $10 more to go in. We said no that’s too much can we have our money back and he wouldn’t return it. Never heard of anyone doing that, really disappointed cause usually it’s a fun spot.

Really fun bar, but you guys have a phone thief problem. Both my and my friend's phones were stolen from our bags while dancing and other people I've talked to have either had their phones stolen here or know of someone who has

google.name: The DL | Best Rooftop Lounge NYC
google.address: 95 Delancey St 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I attend a special event for Gay Pride, The Bliss party. Everything about the day/evening was spectacular. The staff was amazing. The event organizers were great and security was awesome. Each person I had contact with, that was involved with putting this on, was so great. Shout out to, Irene. The space was nicely done, especially the rooftop area. The food was amazing. I recommend this place for events, or just a great dinner. I recommend the Pork chop, NY Strip, and Trout. Dinner on Ludlow is spectacular.

I attended a private event and while the hosts of the event made sure the atmosphere was great, the service was subpar. The bartenders tried their best to keep up, however, the drinks were not full. It’s not about the price as you expect to pay a decent price for a drink ($21 w/mandatory gratuity included) but the glass was not full.

Another caveat, it was very muggy after a rain. There needs to be more air conditioning along with fans. Coupled with a full house, everyone was HOT. I was told that it was not sealed; when it rained, it rained outside.

Also, is there wheelchair accessibility? There are a lot of stairs and no elevator access.

9/7/24 two black door guys wouldn’t let us in because we casually said “well that’s stupid” to demand us to walk around thru a totally empty rope of a lines down the block.  As in zero people in line, “hey you go down and walk thru these ropes.” Said to call the bank if we wanted our 100 dollar tickets refunded. Apparently only people he knows are only allowed to go in without tickets. As we saw a few of his friends go in without proof of tickets. I suppose we were not supposed to witness this. Hire better people or continue to lose money.

I came here for my friends bday party. The entrance was not difficult and they also provide coat checks. The dance floor is nice and also fun music. The drinks is also very tasty and order a lot. We also reserve a table and the guards are pretty strict not letting other people enter which is nice. The bathroom is terrible but overall a nice place for fun

I came here on a Friday night and the vibes were great. The drinks were descent and of course Manhattan priced, but the DJ and atmosphere made it worth while.

I will say there are a ton of steps up to the roof so make sure you are prepared for that. I witnessed someone trip, but thankfully they or no one else was hurt.

If you want to dance this is a great place. There are also VIP tables in the back.

google.name: Jadis
google.address: 42 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I had the loveliest birthday dinner here! The owner/chef and service was fabulous. They made me and my 17 (!!) friends feel incredibly well cared for. The food was delicious as was the wine. Highly recommend booking for large parties here - the process was smooth and very rea$onable. 10/10!

So i personally didn’t have the food but friends did and it looked and smelled great.  The service was great they was on point.  The drinks was spectacular. This place embodies Asian cuisine loved it definitely a sleeper 💗

Such a lovely place! I came for some happy hour drinks and a snack. I also needed respite from the heat. The drinks were good, the snacks nice, the atmosphere charming and comfortable to be there by the bar as a solo visitor. I must say that the service was fantastic and it felt really like the staff were on top of everything. Professional, warm and attentive. I highly recommend it.

4 stars overall because the service was wonderful and the prices reasonable for New York. Great for a larger party. Tiger shrimp and charcuterie plates were lovely. Excellent and well priced selections of natural wines.
Adorable outdoor seating, large wine selection (although I do wish they had a Sancerre by the glass) and the escargot is the best I’ve had outside of France. Will most definitely be back.

google.name: Grey Lady
google.address: 77 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: My first time here, much better management than when it originally opened. The staff were wonderful, friendly and vivacious, mixing a wild array of colorful drinks. The  high ceiling add to this bright and light filled interior. The oysters are a must, I had a verity and the taste was distinctly different. A great place for drinks after work.

This place is a fantastic restaurant! 🍴 Grey Lady 👵 offers a wonderful selection of delicious dishes! 🍽️ Their Roasted Cauliflower, Hanger Steak 🥩, Truffle 🍄 Fries 🍟, and Chocolate 🍫 Lava 🌋 Cake 🧁 are amazing! The staff 👨‍🍳 is friendly and the service is quick. ⏲️ They have a private room perfect for corporate 💼 events and meetups! 🤝 I wish I came here more often!

Excellent food and menu selection at the Grey Lady. Staff was extremely nice and service was excellent. Back rooms are spacious and spotless with separate bars in each. Atmosphere is awesome - $1 Oysters and Happy Hour was a blast.

Lovely patio seating with fun cocktails on a summer night!

4.2/5 Be My Juliette -- super sweet and peachy!
4/5 Espresso Martini - solid and very standard , nothing to home about
3.8/5 Nantucket Lemonade -- wish it had a stronger blueberry flavor

Love Gray Lady!!!! the vibe is great, a lot of people always so be mindful if you want a quiet vibe. it’s right on Delancey so it’s heavy foot traffic and near actual traffic. the oysters were great and the beer on tap was good too. loved the fries too. def recommend for the happy hour!!! I took my mom and she loved it

google.name: Tre
google.address: 173 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Great food! Great Vibes! Ally is dope host! Unfortunately, she was only covering for someone. Will definitely come back for Taste n Toast Thursdays and I will come back to to try their brunch. Heads up, if you pay with card it does cost a bit more compared to cash. Enjoy!

At last we’ve arrived in New York and it was time to indulge our tastebuds. We stumbled around the “burbs” for half an hour until our yearning for Italian took over.
We landed on #treitaliano - a quaint Italian restaurant with the most lovely ambience. We were greeted by the delightful Aly who is an asset to this establishment. She’s customer focussed, knows the menu well and preempted our next order. Her recommendation of the home made gnocchi was was spot on. Her colleague Debora was also delightful and another asset to this restaurant.
The meals were a good portion size filled with a depth of flavour that stayed on the palette for some time.
We skipped dessert but it was tempting. Time permitting, we will return.

Notes: kid friendly but couldn’t see any high chairs. It’s New York so parking will never be great. Dietaries can be catered for is requested. The background music was set at a good level that didn’t interrupt our conversation.

#newyork2024 #thewanderingreviewer
#usa2024 #newyorkitalian #treitaliano #newyorkrestaurants #newyorkrestaurant
#italianfoodnewyork #newyorkitalianfood #ludlowstreetnyc #trenewyork @trenewyork

Such a shame for a restaurant with amazing food. I felt that the waitress doesn't cater to black people when I arrived. I didn't feel welcomed by her. I will have a picture of her. I came here specifically because I looked online and saw they had a toast and bubbles special on Thursdays. I was super excited to try it but was disappointed by how the waitress treated me because of my skin color. I came alone only 20 minutes after they opened and it was very empty. The waitress sat me in the back. I asked to change my seat because there was no one there and she told me she couldn't cause there were tons of reservations. Another waitress had to assure her it was okay to change my table. I did the toast and bubbles and ordered a side of fries in which was not free I told her I was willing to pay full price only $12 I heard her whispering to the other waitress can we do that. I was very confused because I didn't ask her for a favor the fries cost $12 in addition to the special and I told her I was willing to pay for it cause I can afford the extra money so I could not understand why she asked that question. Overall food very good but I will not return if she still works there as she is racist. I left within 1 hour and it was not busy as it was claiming to be. She didn't even have the decency to give me the check she asked another woman who was not white to give it to me and collect it from me while she stood around doing nothing. To the owner fire her because black people have money too and if this is how she acts as a store manager at a jewelry store I would not want her to work for me!

Amazing hospitality from the staff who go above and beyond! Their entire menu is so amazing, especially the drinks. I loved their appetizers and pasta that me and my girl were eating off each other’s plate. The ambiance is nice and cozy, I would definitely come here again!

Had a lovely experience here for the Taste and Taste Thursday night menu!

Bottomless wine for 2 hours - 1 app, entree and shared dessert. Bruschetta was amazing as well as the burrata - both very fresh and flavorful.

The carbonara and pesto pasta were amazing and a great portion size. Tiramisu was also a nice size and sooo light and fresh.

Ambiance of the place is beautiful- dimly lit, good music & amazing service. Highly recommend

google.name: Sammy's Roumanian Steak House
google.address: 112 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Good food though pricey. Particularly liked the chopped liver. Very loud. Entertainment can be a little off color.

The food was amaaaazing, BUT you'll be paying steakhouse prices here. Totally worth it given the super fun atmosphere where at some point people were dancing on the chairs! (Dani Luv was playing and keeping the mood up for everyone!). The meats were mindblowingly and the frozen vodka bottles will get you dancing very quickly.
Good vibes, but the food was so devoid of flavor or any seasoning that it too was an existential experience. For almost $100 a person, you’d think at least some of it would at least go to salt.
A lot of food, a lot of schmaltz, some dancing. Too loud to talk to the person next to you. Terrific chopped liver. Crazy amount of steak, surprisingly good.

If you want to have a fun filled fantastic evening, run  don't walk to Sammy's. In addition, the staff and management do everything to ensure that you will have a great experience.  Shout out to Rona who was communicative and responsive.

google.name: The Skinny Bar and Lounge
google.address: 174 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I hosted my birthday party for about 90 people at Skinny Bar, and it was a fantastic experience. Crystal was extremely helpful in reserving the bar and securing drink specials at no extra charge. We also made a last-minute request to rent the top floor, and Riley was great in making that possible. Thanks for the amazing time! Overall, I highly recommend Skinny Bar if you're looking to host!

I hosted my birthday party here and it was literally the best night EVER! Crystal was so easy to work with and was able to give us recommendations on which space/drink options would be best for your group. The bouncers, bar staff, DJ, honestly everyone at the venue was so incredible!! I would 100% do it again!
Not gonna lie wasn't expecting much on a Sunday afternoon. Dope place with amazing staff (Maddison 🙌) and music play list!

My friend and I did a Pulsd deal for 2 entrees and 2 hours of brunch drinks. I got the chicken and waffles, she got the lox and eggs Benedict English muffin. Both were really fantastic. For unlimited drinks, each drink was pretty strong (we tried the spritzer, the mimosa, and the screwdriver). The staff were also really friendly, cool and attentive. I'd definitely come back here. For a Saturday brunch, it was really relaxed.

Skinnys is definitely one of my favorite places to visit after a long stressful day at work or during the weekend. Great atmosphere, drinks and food. Have to give a big shout out to the staff , as they are always courteous , attentive and positive. My favorite bartender Pablo is always there to make my favorite drinks and put a smile on my face. The rest of the staff is amazing as well, they are always on top of things especially Pamela who is one of the best servers. Overall 5/5 stars, definitely recommended if you are by t LIC piers and are looking for a great Latin vibe with great food, drinks and staff.

google.name: Poco NYC
google.address: 33 Avenue B, New York, NY 10009, USA

review_snippets.text: My husband and I came into Poco after we couldn’t get into Beetlehouse and let me tell you…. We’re glad! The food at Poco was absolutely delicious. We ordered the churrasco, spicy shrimp, wings, fish tacos and lobster Mac and all of it was amazing! To top it off, we had the best server! Joe was awesome! He recommended food, drinks and was very attentive throughout the night. I had no idea what I wanted to drink and after 2 questions Joe figured out exactly what drink I needed in my life! We’ll definitely return for the food and the service! Thanks Joe!

Had such a wonderful time here celebrating a bachelorette party! Gorgeous atmosphere, so bright and welcoming, good music…and the service was delightful! Our server Joe was very attentive, fast and friendly…and THe fOoOoOd…girl. So good.

Been coming here for over a year and hands down one of the best deals in the city on Thursdays ($3 tacos, $25 margarita pitchers that’ll knock your socks off) plus a fun vibe and plenty of space. But it’s even better because of the staff—special shoutout to Avery who’s professional, efficient, loads of fun to kiki with, and makes customers feel at home from day one. Ask for her if you know what’s good for you!

Service was AMAZING!! Food and drinks were great, the deal for the bottomless dinner was insane! We would come back anytime and would recommend it to anyone!! Also they brought us going away shots just as a bonus!

Actually I meant to give 7 stars for food. Holy crap the place blew me away. To me it had the feel of older east village, thank God. Exceptionally happy and friendly staff but the most amazing part was eating their absolutely delicious food, I had the calamari and the skirt steak, my companion had the sliders also a juice and a beer. Bill was less expensive than many Staten Island restaurants and was far better. Can’t wait to go back!! Thank you Poco NYC.

google.name: Souvlaki GR
google.address: 116 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Been here a few times -Their spicy feta is truly one of the best foods in NYC. Their pitas fall flat in my opinion, but everything else is incredible, my friend ordered the lamb and it was delicious and worth the price! I got the lemon soup too which was good and the Greek fries were a good large side portion!
Feels like I’m in Greece for real, food is pretty good and fresh. Wine also really tasty and the place is charming.

Came here during lunch but ordered from regular dinner menu. We got spanakopita, lamb skewer, wrapped lamb gyro and fries. Menu states that spanakopita consists of feta and ricotta, though it just had spinach that tasted more like Horta rather than spinach because it was a bit bitter.

We said to the server that spanakopita lacks any cheese.. Meanwhile, our server confirmed with the kitchen that there should be cheese, which we did not find in any of the three pieces of the spanakopita. Service from the FOH on that issue 1/5.

Remaining items were fine, not the best or any authentic Greek style.. Lamb skewer is dry, like overcooked. Fries were good.

After the meal we were not asked about coffee/tea/ dessert. Instead they asked us if we want the check.
We got it and they included tips.
No matter the service I always tip at least 18%, but they are not supposed to be included if the party is less than 6 people (and it was just the two of us).
No matter the language we speak, it is not correct to immediately assume we are tourists :)

Anyway, don’t recommend if you want authentic Greek food.

*would be great to improve spanakopita and work a bit on service.
Attached is the spanakopita foto, please show me where is the cheese.

I stopped by after work, and got the spanakopita. The taste was good, not great. I was disappointed by how small it was. And it’s not traditional. It’s spinach in fried dough. Not expecting that at all!  I was hoping for the filo dough spanakopita. Way over priced $15. This is not made with filo pastry.

I really wanted to love this restaurant. It looks so cute and quaint inside and close to where I work! but the food needs some improvement. I ordered the Greek Salad.
