I have had better salad at Greek diners. First it was just a plate of tomatoes and cucumbers. A few onions a bit of feta cheese and a few olives. It was pricey too do I was expecting a few nice slabs of feta, and where were the stuffed grape leaves? Where was the lettuce even? Huge slices of tomatoes. Why can’t you slice them smaller? The best ever was the taxiki with grilled pita bread. That was very delicious. My cousin had the lemon soup which was very eggy tasting for some reason and not much flavor otherwise. Aside from the pita and taxiki sauce everything  was underwhelming.

google.name: Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya
google.address: 187 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We wanted to try a different sushi spot for a change and decided to have dinner at Blue Ribbon Sushi last weekend.  The restaurant is on the second floor and in a very vibrant downtown location for those who are familiar with SoHo.  I enjoyed all the recommended house favorites from the half lobster roll, yellowfin tuna, etc.  even the edamame was delicious.  The ambiance is welcoming and lively.  Our server was a bit busy so we ended up placing our order with another server who was also friendly and made some good recommendations.  It was an overall good experience and we would visit again in the future.

Dope spot for some authentic sushi. Izakaya has a great ambiance. This team is very friendly and accommodating from start to finish. Blue ribbon friend chicken was amazing, so crispy and well seasoned. The sushi was well prepared and there are a ton of combo options so that you are able to try a little of everything.

Our reviews had over 52 million in the last 12 months.  We do not get paid we just love to eat and have fun.  We really love Blue Ribbon Sushi Izakaya.  The food was great, the service was awesome, the room was lovely and the food was really good.  I do not know Japanese names for the food we ate so let me just tell you in my own words.  The scallops on a skewer were really buttery and had a wonderful sauce.  Same can be said for the steak on a stick.  The sticky rice with spice tuna and avocado was delicious but it is not really spicy.  Everyone loved this dish.  The fried chicken is also great because of the sauces.  One is a hot sauce and one is a gently warm honey sauce.  We loved the veggie fried rice with egg.  The sushi was very good as well.  My favorite was the salmon which had a lot of flavor and melted in your mouth.  I loved the eel wrapped in cucumber.  Desserts were very good, we loved the banana split as well as the chocolate bread pudding.  They have espresso and all the other coffee drinks.  Each was great.  Very lovely evening.  We made our initial order then added to it after we decided how full we were.  Online there is a pdf menu but the non-pdf menu on the website has photos of every dish which we found very helpful.  Be prepared to go up a lot of steps when you enter, but it is worth it.  Also has a nice bar area.  Check out all of our reviews and look at all the photos below. If we do not like it we do no review it so all of the ones you see are places that are fantastic. Follow us if you like. We had over 52 million views in the last 12 months and we thank you for that. We don't get paid, we just love to eat. Be sure to click on "RobH" at the top of this review to see all of them and to follow us if you like good food and FUN.  If we do a review it is because we love it.

Upscale izakaya, very nice interior. Food was pricey.

Yaki short rib was a little tough but the flavor profile was good.
Spicy tuna crispy rice was not as crunchy as I would’ve liked.
Karaage was good, not super breaded which was good.
Bone marrow fried rice was overhyped - did not really taste any bone marrow or oxtail. Also really oily.

There was also a fly in the bar area 😵

A very classy Japanese restaurant with the dining area located on the second floor. We were seating right by the entrance which provided a nice view of the lanterns that lighted up the stairs coming up. We had a sushi and sashimi combo and sashimi deluxe. Not overly heavy and it was a nice way to eat some healthy food to end the night without breaking the bank.

google.name: Hi Thai
google.address: 123 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This is my favorite lunch spot when I worked down there. Pad See Yew with chicken is amazing, and their Pineapple Chicken with Fried Rice is on point. I've had the green curry dish, great if you like spicy food.  Super friendly staff. Don't know why they don't have a higher rating. This is a solid Thai spot.

I want to give it 3.5 stars... if the food had been above par I would have said 4. Food was good, but pretty standard. Standard prices. They do offer nice portions for the combo meals. I like the decor and presentation of alot of the items as well.
The pad thai is delicious and very flavorful. My friends have ordered the drunken noodles and have loved their order as well. Highly recommend.

Wanted to like this place as it's advertised as woman-owned but they burnt my entire dish and didn't say anything. By the time I got home it was too late to do anything but the look alone was something they shouldn't have served and the taste even worse. Go elsewhere.

A great night turned into a DISASTER!!! THEY LOST MY FRIEND'S CREDIT CARD. The waitress doesn't know where she left it and she said she may have even have GIVEN IT TO SOMEONE ELSE. They're don't care, no real apology or actions to do ANYTHING! They have cameras, but they're not willing to look. There's no manager around, just 2 waitresses. I hate to give bad reviews, but I just want everyone to BEWARE! DON'T LET THEM IRRESPONSIBILY LOSE YOUR CARD!!! It's a major issue and someone can make charges on it that you can't get money back for! A wonderful girls night to farewell a friend is COMPLETELY RUINED because of the INCOMPETENCE and IRRESPONSIBILITY OF THIS PLACE'S STAFF!!!

google.name: Two Boots Pizza East Village
google.address: 42 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA

review_snippets.text: Very rarely do you have vegan options that don't feel like a step down from everything else. Those 9pm slices also still popped off, testing fresh out of the oven instead of stale and disappointing. Good ingredients, and great artisanal flavors that give such variety. Would def go again

Completely turned off, by a pizza shop I have been to many times. Especially since I’ve grown up in LES. I went in for a cheese slice, I asked how much and stated I would be paying in CASH so that I would not be charged tax, because that is the STATE LAW, if you are paying in cash tax is not charged, you can give the flat price. When I explained this to her that I’m not paying with card so why is she charging me tax, she began to say that’s what the owner makes them do. I just payed and stayed silent because at this point I was beginning to get frustrated. So not only was I over charged from the original price of a cheese slice, I get my slice and she literally burned the entire crust/breading of the pizza it was brick hard from being burnt, but I take a bite of the slice and it’s literally dripping of oil like as if it had an entire bottle on it which is absolutely disgusting. All in all, I was over charged, given a burnt / oily disgusting slice. I will never return to this establishment. An absolute rip off. I will attach images so you can see how oily this slice is.

Surrounding areaa:  Located in lower Manhattan. Great area with lots of different choices. I LOVE pizza, so I decided two boots

Customer Service: The young lady was great. She greeted me as soon as I walked in, smiled, and took my order immediately.

Pizza: I ordered the Grandma. Although it was heated up, it definitely wasn't fresh.

Lady behind the counter was really great! Steered me towards trying something other than just pepperoni since they had a lot of different kinds. Had a couple of different slices and some garlic knots. Pizza was good, knots were a bit too on the greasy side. Overall though, really enjoyed it.  Neat atmosphere too.
Delicious vegan pizza at a great price. The staff is friendly, the restaurant is well taken care of. I highly recommend the vegan white pizza it was just as if not better than a regular white pizza.

google.name: Kossar's Bagels & Bialys (LES)
google.address: 367 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Kossar’s Bagels is a Lower East Side institution. Known primarily for their bialys, Kossar's has expanded its menu to include some of the best bagels in the city.

The bagels here are everything you want from a traditional NYC bagel: chewy on the inside, with a perfect golden crust on the outside. Whether you’re opting for a classic plain bagel or something more adventurous like an everything or sesame seed bagel, the quality remains top-notch. Their bagels are always fresh, often warm from the oven.

Kossar's offers a wide variety of spreads and toppings, from classic cream cheese and lox to innovative flavored cream cheeses that add a fun twist to your breakfast.

The vibe at Kossar’s is casual, with a no-frills, old-school atmosphere that emphasizes the food. There’s also plenty of space to sit and enjoy your meal if you’re not taking it to go. One downside is that it can get busy during peak hours, especially on weekends, but the wait is always worth it.

good bagel! big and doughy with good density and classic NY flavor. skimpy on cream cheese though! and the spread of toppings not great, bald spots of cream cheese on my bagel= sad. and don’t get the coffee.. no. not good. also a LOT of plastic waste. why!? way behind the environmental times with everything to go so only single use right into the landfill cutlery and plates. common people. really?

so come for your bagels but ask for the cream cheese to be spread well on both sides and get your coffee around the corner. enjoy 😉

Bagel (bialy) felt underbaked. Plenty of seating. Nice spot. Wide selection. They’re known for bialys, but TBH the regular bagels seem better.

Plenty of cream cheese options. $7 for bagel w cream cheese, average market rate. Fresh pressed orange juice, though👀

Last time at this place. They either make you wait way too long, or get your order wrong. Last week I walked out without my bagel after it didn’t arrive after a 10 min wait. This week I thought I’d give them another chance and ordered a bagel with plain cream cheese. Got home, bagel was all squashed and full of chive cream cheese, which I hate. Binned it. Also their “cream cheese” is watered down with margarine. Every little cent helps, right guys?

Apparently this place is the oldest bialy maker in nyc. Unpopular opinion but I don’t see the difference between a bialy and bagel here other than the bialy is smaller. Its like a mini bagel. It was good especially with scallion cream cheese but didn’t see the hype with the difference in a bialy. Overall, I had a good experience and would go back. Not sure I would go out of the way though.

google.name: Elevate
google.address: 93 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Excellent vegan options! So delicious!! A must try when visiting Bakery Square!

This is a typical hotel lounge and restaurant - not really anything to boast about. The decor was somewhat confused for a restaurant serving mostly Asian fare - it was a bit tiki lounge meets sports bar. My friend and i got there on the later side of the evening, and there was only one other table occupied. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The portions, although well made, were a bit small for the prices. We enjoyed our time there, and we were allowed to linger over our table until closing time. All in all, I would rate the place as a pretty run of the mill hotel restaurant, but with a very kind staff and decent food.

Subpar service.  Waiter was not familiar with the menu, couldn't tell me when the fish is shipped in, and had to redo my order because they were out of items.  Also took them 45 minutes to serve me edamame (I think he forgot).  I was one of 2 tables being served in the restaurant.  Tuna was good,  yellowtail and salmon were "fishy" (apparently not stored/handled at proper temperature).  I won't be back.
Awesome spot gotta check it out!!
Great happy hour drinks!!

google.name: Cocoron
google.address: 16 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Their garage is the best I've ever tried.
The noodle was also really good I needed to eat everything!

However, one of the staff told us to wait outside when we got there while there were plenty of seats inside. The other server came out and asked us why we were waiting outside. I think they need to communicate more effectively. But the food was good and I am going to visit again.

This place had closed down during the pandemic, and I always wanted to try it. Passed by and noticed it was open again. First time coming, and unless you are close to the window seating area, the lighting is very dim throughout. The steamed chicken meatballs had a coating of rice on them, which had an interesting texture. The dragon soba noodles came with nibblets of eel, and the Mera Mera dip soba noodles came with a heat flame to keep the soup warm which was a nice contrast against the cold soba noodles.
The signature mera mera sesame ramen was pretty good, but the Japanese style curry subs and the mochi fried rolls were bland and unidimensional, pretty disappointing.
The place is a little congested and I don't know why it is cash only. The only good thing is dip soba noodles and many vegan options on the menu. I wish they kept the option of credit card as well.

1. The food is decent, I would only recommend the soba and nothing else. The Stamina Don is not a “Powerful Bowl Dish”or “Gut-Busting, it is bland and not spicy.
2. The portions and taste of the appetizer was not worth the money to try.
3. The service was excellent, they rearranged the seating for our large group in a small restaurant.
4. The atmosphere was nice and homey, on busy days it can become crowded.

google.name: Pig and Khao
google.address: 68 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
October 2024:
Stopped by for a team dinner and we had a great time.

We started out with drinks. I had a local hazy IPA from a can. Was good. Beer options were pretty good.

We decided to go with the family style option. Favorites of mine were the papaya salad, the sisig platter, and the duck! I did not get photos of all the food but those three were standouts for me!

For dessert, I had the donut which was very tasty. Service was friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back again for more delicious food 😋.

Got invited to go to dinner with some mates and his friends and this place did not disappoint! A party of 6 (reservation) - seated quickly and the vibes in this place were amazing. Great music - not too loud, a few throwbacks - and the service was phenomenal. We decided to do the group deal for 6 that had the soups, 4 large plates and some small plates plus we got a few sides. As a vegetarian- the papaya salad, long beans and brussel sprouts were amazing- but that was in addition to all the other dishes. The pork, beef, seafood and chicken slayed. Plus to coconut rice was heavenly and unlimited! The dishes were brought out in the perfect timing possible and empty plates cleared immediately. The drinks were so good and also came out in record time. Honestly I would come back here in a heartbeat. If you’re in the area be sure to check this place out. Will def be back to try their brunch!

quite disappointed as the first time my friend went here, she said it was decent!
brunch menu was a bit limited but they have a good bottomless deal.

the best thing we got were the powdered donuts, with pandam dipping sauce! everything else was wayyyy too salty, spicy, & tart (lime). we were seated in the back room where it was set 65 degrees with speakers blasting right above us, so it was hard to talk with the table. overall fun spot, but can’t justify the food

The food is great. The atmosphere is fun. The only reason I ranked it down one notch was because it's so loud in there. Hard to have a conversation without yelling.... But the food yes, absolutely all the way !! I love the creativity and the spice is perfect!

Pig and Khao is an amazing restaurant dishing out some beautiful Southeast Asian fare. The P&K chicken wings and the Spring rolls were delicious. The Khao Soi, Hainanese Duck and the Whole fried fish for the mains was fabulous and super delish. And the Turon as the dessert was a great finish to this wonderful meal. Paired with great cocktails and mocktails, Pig and Khao, truly is a great place to check out.

google.name: Wolfnights - The Gourmet Wrap
google.address: 99 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: First time trying this place and it was really good. We ordered the Dire Wolf and the Carnivores Delight and both were delicious. There are some squeeze bottles at the pick up counter and the green sauce was spicy and great with the wraps.

It's not a bad place to grab a bite, but honestly, for the price, the wait time, and the tight space, I would expect the food to be phenomenal. It was pretty average and kinda sloppily made. It took much longer than expected, and overpriced in my opinion. Your local bodega or Chipotle could do the same much faster, with equally good outcome. The smash seating area is charming, though limited,  and don't get me wrong, the food is good! It's just not $15.00 good. Especially when the employees seem to be bored, or not care about being there at all.

The purpose of this review is not to hate or harm this restaurant in any way, shape, or form. That being said, I hope you take this review as an informative review.

Atmosphere: This place is roomy enough to move around. Clean for the most part. The decor is okay, compared to what it used to look before, they haven't changed much.

Service: Honestly, service can vary. Sometimes, it would be exceptional or just acceptable.

Food: Having ordered a couple of times here, I can conclude that their food is pretty good. I mean, there can be a couple of small things that can certainly not be to everyone's liking, but for the most part, their food is pretty good. This last time I ordered the Howling Wrap, which personally is enough for a quick bite since it is filling. I like the way they make their doughs, right on the spot. However, if you wait a bit long to eat it, the dough could turn as if it is uncooked making it less flavorful. There are no issues with the rest of ingredients. Their sauces are on point as well.

Prices: This is another thing that would not be to everyone's liking. Yes, their prices are high. However, I acknowledge their location and rent is not cheap there. I also acknowledge that their food is tasty. Therefore, their food's quality and flavors are worth paying what they cost. (If they raise their prices a couple of bucks more, then it would not be worth)

WOW!!! What can I say…. I Love This Place!!!  In my opinion….” Beautiful People” work her. I don’t know them personally (YET), however as per my last two visits it was a “PLEASANTLY PLEASING “ visit. Very communicative and friendly!!! Thank you for feeding me while I’m at home with a SPRAIN ankle!!!! 😎  There is a swing here as a seat. Who would dare sit there to eat?????? lol

So many great pics on their Instagram. This is no doubt a foodie's favorite spot. Their wraps are GINORMOUS too. The service was amazing. The workers were really nice and you can tell, they weren't just there to work, but they really care about their customers. The food was not only delicious but the creativity and effort put into each wrap was so warm. Not only were they offer some sweet photogenic wraps, but delicious ones too. We cannot wait to come back.

google.name: Makabely
google.address: 51 Columbia St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Food portions are small for the price and drinks taste flat also the restaurant lets non customers use their chairs to sit ways away from their place just to sit and hang out

This pizzeria is good. but hours are vary bad morning to 7 o’clock is closing time, but never put their gates down. The old lady who is the Spanish food is rude should be removed please fix your times at pizzeria should be from morning to 8:30 PM so people to buy food when they come from work and people who can’t cook

Makabely formerly known as Columbia Pizza.
Its not going to be mistaken with a high class pie joint, but for the price, its not too bad.
We usually get the margarita or lasagna pie.

One of the hoods best kept secrets!!! Cheap eats @ it’s best ... Latin food (Cuchifritos) = various fried foods mostly consisting of pork in Puerto Rican Cuisine. Add to that pizza, beef patties, & all the goodies that are associated with the artery clogging deliciously flavored food that we all love. Steak, ribs, chicken, all hot & fresh ready for consumption. Here’s an example, I ordered spaghetti & steak for lunch $6.00 with a bottled water, are you kidding me ??? Where I live you couldn’t even get the spaghetti alone for that price !!! The taste was amazing, the steak was so soft it fell apart in my mouth, no chewing needed . All kidding a side, put this place on your to do list .

Nice neighborhood spot for pizza that’s been here for a while. Seems they’re now Champion Pizza Columbia. Considering what’s available in the area it’s a good reasonable choice for a quick bite. Price good for what it is and options around here without having go to a chain spot with similar price range.
Staff here still nice. That neighborhood drama never disappoints though. 🤣

google.name: Cafe Himalaya
google.address: 78 E 1st St, New York, NY 10009, USA

review_snippets.text:
I'm new to Tibetan food, so I was really excited to try this place that I keep hearing so much about. The food quality was great and the prices were right.

To start, we got the beef momos and the tangtsel salad, which was basically a pickled cabbage salad with some nice spices mixed in. Also got the chili chicken, which was a great mix of tomato-based saucy and spicy (don't forget to drizzle the lemon!) My only criticism would be that the chili chicken dish was that the dish was mostly crisp and not enough chicken. Will be back to try some other dishes from the menu.

This is a New York City mainstay. Getting fresh ingredients and good home style cooking in this town is NOT EASY. This place has had it down for a long time, no nonsense. I am vegetarian / vegan and this place is perfectly accommodating. It is a simple dining room, perfect for a quick bite with friends or solo. Tip generously!  Not a lot of gimmick-free restaurants left around. Love the Tibetan vibes. Potatoes, egg noodles, dahl soup etc. always hit the spot. Ginger tea.

Ordered the beef momos which were pan fried to perfection. Filling was delicate and delicious. Beware, they are juicy. The beef Shapta was rich and spicy and the star of the meal. the sauteed noodles had a hint of spice as well. Amazing food at a great price.

This hole in the wall joint has been on my list for a long time! Definitely worth the hype! The food was sooo good! We got the pan fried chicken momo, chili chicken, Thai iced tea and paratha. All of it was excellent and so affordable! Service was fast and so attentive. Definitely will be back and highly recommend.

Like sexy redd said, 5/5 this place is a TEN!

This is by far the best place I have ever been. I have tried four dishes. chili chicken 8/10 chili shrimp 7/10 , and fried noodles (Gyathuk Tapka) 9/10 and last, but definitely not least chicken momos 100/10 , which are pan fried. I absolutely love that best momos in New York City. I would definitely recommend I would goback definitely.

google.name: 88 Palace
google.address: 88 E Broadway, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
You don't go for the surroundings. You go for the spectacular dumplings and steamed buns. The menu is very small, only 7 items, and nothing is vegetarian. They focus on sweet and meaty steamed buns, packed with flavor and so so juicy.

Best part...nothing is more than $5!

Had chicken legs -this was soft and soaked in soup, vegetables, rice and other foods I forgot their names. Good price and they tag their food in alphabets, and stamp the ticket - left on the table for each order you make. It's summed up and payed for when you're done. It's my first experience in a Chinese restaurant, went there with my friends, the experience was not bad.

This place is not easy to find. It is located on the second floor of a small building. They serve dim sum at 9:30 a.m. The dim sum are carted around in steam carts. We tried some favorites: shrimp harkow, chicken feet, sticky rice with meat, shrimp and beef rice rolls. We also tried some "new" (new to us) dim sum and we were not diapponted.

We were pleasantly surprised with the tag price which came to about $15/person with tip. Service is very good, staff is friendly. BTW, they will not accept credit card for less than $25 (before tax).

Typical dim sum restaurant, not a single tourist as far as the eye can see. Local hot spot, Despite me getting there just shy of the lunch crowd it was packed wall to wall. Good selection great taste, cheap eats walk in hungry walk out full job done .
Fantastic place for dim sum every day but best in weekends when almist full. The truly "local" experience and very resonable prices. The beef and pork ribs dim sum is world class

yelp.name: Fu Zhou Wei Zhong Wei Jia Xiang Feng Wei
yelp.address: 88 E Broadway, Stall B45, Stall B45, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Domino's Pizza
google.address: 196 Stanton St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
The last time ordered from This Dominoes location on Stanton Street my pizza along with desert and appetizer comes smashed. The delivery guy the last time literally smashed my delivery in my face being that he felt my 20% tip on a card was not enough for him. I always tipped cash and on the card.
I did not make it a big deal, but after three times it’s unacceptable. I called the location to speak to the manager and he did not want to rectify the situation properly and sent the delivery guy entered to my building illegally without my authorization and harassing us on my ring Doorbell camera. Which I have recorded.

They food is always cold and even despite that i still order. After being a long time customer there was an error one time on the apt number. I didnt think nothing of it till the next time i tried ordering and they refused to service me food, i couldnt believe it. All over a one time error. not worth the money AT ALL! Terrible service!

I recently ordered a dbl cheese, pepperoni, black olive pizza, I saw when it left the store it finally came 1 hour & 20 Mins. later and it was only 1.6 miles away. All I got after calling the store twice was "He's on his way". The ultimate insult was opening the box only to find in NO way a dbl toppings pizza but a regular pizza. I took a photo, you be the judge...
Poor customer service, horrible place… I hope the pizza worths the two hours wait. If know it’s this bad I wouldn’t come… First and last time.
Ordered on Postmates. Took like two hours. Couldn’t get the store on the line. Just bad!

google.name: Remedy Diner
google.address: 245 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: we had a nice breakfast with the family and were completely happy and satisfied. Waiters are super friendly and attentive. Fast serving, great food and an authentic diner ambiance. Will come again.

We ate breakfast here 3 times when in NYC for 2 weeks. Really great classic diner. I loved the homemade crab cakes and my other half  ate something different everythime and said it all tasted delicious. Service is fast and friendly. We really enjoyed the vibe here. Lovely local place!
The salmon was so good with the mixer veggies... amazing 🤩.The Shirley Temple was an entire experience. I would definitely go back.

Ended up having breakfast here because the diner we planned on going had an hour and a half waiting line, and Remedy Diner turned out to be a jewel in East Houston Street!!!
Food and Service were superb!!!
Will certainly come back next time we are in NY!!!

Food was fine, but pricey for the quality. Where does a diner get off on charging $25+ for most entrees? The service also left much to be desired. Our server didn’t have the best understanding of the menu, and other staff in the restaurant were curt and short in every interaction. There are plenty of good diners in NYC- no reason to visit this one.

google.name: Iggy's Keltic Lounge
google.address: 132 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
This is the kind of place that ought to pop into people's minds when they think of a proper New York dive bar. The music is ace, the beers and shots are cheap, the conviviality and conversation flows. Amy and Chris in particular are great bartenders.

For a place to talk to all and sundry or just to sit and have a quiet drink, you could do far worse than head here.

Wow. Walked in to order a beer for myself and my wife, and the service was absolutely awful. Despite us clearly being over 21, they still asked for ID, which was fine, but things took a turn when we didn’t leave a tip. The server actually shouted at us—completely unprofessional.

What made it worse was the obvious homophobia from the server, and yet there's a queer flag behind the bar. It’s shocking. I've worked in New York and never experienced anything like this.

We don’t let people like this affect us, but if you're in the area, there are plenty of other fantastic bars that deserve your business. There are multiple stories here from others who’ve been scammed. Save yourself the trouble and avoid this place.

NOW THATS A DIVE 🍺🍻

If you love drinking, you’re gonna love Iggy’s. My buddy and I went here the other day and holy moly did we indulge ourselves. The beer flowed freely and the conversations were good!!…until they weren’t.

Later in the evening my buddy express some political beliefs that were really telling and, unfortunately, are grounds to cut him off. So in a lot of ways, Iggys is a sad place for me. But at least it’s one of the most fun sad places I have.

Thanks. Keep it up.
This is a great Dive Bar in the Lower East Side.  The bartender, Chris, was very cool.  The decorations were fun.  The prices for the drinks were reasonable.  The vibe is laid back and friendly.
terrible, terrible service with an attitude for some overpriced, watered down drinks. I’m praying I don’t get charged twice.

yelp.name: Iggy's Keltic Lounge
yelp.address: 132 Ludlow St, at Rivington, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Wa Lung Kitchen
google.address: 557 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We moved to Brooklyn years ago but anytime we are anywhere downtown around lunch/dinner time we do a pickup.  Best General Tsao's, Crab Rangoon, and iced tea!
The food at Wa Lung Kitchen is amazing, however the in-store experience isn't the best, but I recommend it! They really make up with the quality of their food.

I always order just plain broccoli with white rice but today I purchased sesame tofu with broccoli and brown rice. I must say it is very good but they were a little cheap with the broccoli and heavy on the tofu. Next make it balance out! Other than that their food is good. Disclaimer: photo reflects already eaten broccoli but there were like on 5 pieces originally!

They have no consistency, the food is good one day, overcooked another day and can take forever to get. The food is WAY over priced when ordering online versus walking in or calling in.

Edit: I just can't do it anymore. Ordered shrimp and broccoli with garlic sauce and all I can taste is GREASE. I tried putting soy and duck sauce on my food like I typically enjoy and I despite that I could only taste grease. Won't be ordering from here anymore.

Hands down best take out Chinese food in Lower East and possibly even in Chinatown.  They make everything fresh and the food is very clean and sauce is light and not overly thick.  I personally love their hot and sour soup and think it's one of the best in NYC.  Love their beef and broccoli or beef and mushrooms.  Homestyle cooking it's great.  Thank you Wa Lung!

google.name: The Mark Hotel
google.address: 25 E 77th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: The service here is impeccable! We were in NYC and stayed here for an anniversary celebration. It was spectacular! Glasses of Champagne when we arrived for our anniversary, turn-down service each night with sweets and water for the evening or next day, and super helpful/friendly front desk (shout out to Kiwi Maria). The location is wonderful as it is close to Central Park and museums. The bar here is also great and energetic with yummy cocktails and food. The doormen and housekeeping were perfect. In other words- impeccable.
Only had breakfast from outside, did not stay in the hotel. This is really upscale clean neat hotel in Upper East side. I really like the restaurant service and attention to detail.
I feel this place is very old and dated. It's a beautiful hotel. It definitely needs some sprucing up the room services. Disgusting food is terrible here.
It's one of my favorite hotels, the patio is also great for having brunch or dinner.

This is a review for the bar. Although I’ve recommended the hotel to out of town friends because it’s so special. They are on point with all details and it’s absolutely stunning. Fun crowd in the main and restaurant bar, great service and fun ambiance. The hotel has bikes out front a cart to Bergdorf’s. I’ve had dinner here before and both experiences were stellar. Love the outside seating area and terrace too. Oh and you can get your hair done,

google.name: Park Lane Hotel New York
google.address: 36 Central Park S South, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Traveled for work. Great value for location, appreciate being able to find an affordable yet quality stay for my business trip. The beds were very comfortable. Shower was comfortable, but the way the doors are designed the floor gets soaked which I'm not a huge fan of. Staff were friendly and helpful where needed. All in all would recommend, if looking for a budget friendly option and within decent distance of sights.

Beautiful hotel and extremely comfortable beds. For a hotel marketed as luxury I would expect crisp details. The heating unit is very old and loud that it woke me up several times (I’m a hard sleeper). The website clearly states the rooftop dining area opens at 7 am but when the door was locked staffed told me it’s actually 7:30 and the website was inaccurate.

This hotel was absolutely amazing. We had the panoramic park view room and it was beautiful. No issues with air conditioning I even had to turn it down a little because it was so cool! The guest service staff was very attentive and sent up anything we needed promptly including a crib for our baby. The room was big enough for him to crawl around and have a great time. 100% recommend.

The hotel’s location was fantastic! As a runner, being able to just cross the road and run in Central Park was a major highlight.

The room was always cleaned well by housekeeping.

I also loved having breakfast on the rooftop; the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Special mention to Dwight, who brought a positive and welcoming energy every morning.

Overall, the entire staff was respectful and made my stay enjoyable.

I have stayed at The Park Lane several times when I go to the city for business.  The location is perfect.  The staff is always very attentive and the accommodations are wonderful, especially if you have a Park view.  The rooftop bar, Darling, is a wonderful spot to enjoy a drink after a long day.

yelp.name: Park Lane Hotel
yelp.address: 36 Central Park South, New York, NY 10019

google.name: Daniel
google.address: 60 E 65th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: My husband and I went to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. What a special treat. We opted for the 9 course and wine pairing. The food was excellent. The staff was super friendly. The explanations were clear and our asking questions was received with grace and excitement to share more knowledge. We were even taken to the kitchen to capture a picture and presented with a menu booklet commemorating the date. When another milestone moment comes, I wouldn't hesitate to return. I didn't take many pictures because I wanted to just be present, and it was so with just experiencing the scene. Thank you for making this such a special evening!

Our evening at Daniel NYC began on a high note with a warm welcome and a stunning ambiance—certainly among the city’s best settings for fine dining. We opted for the seven-course tasting menu with wine pairings, hoping for an unforgettable culinary journey. However, as the evening progressed, the dishes fell surprisingly short on flavor, leaving much to be desired in taste and creativity. Additionally, the service, while polished, lacked genuine engagement. Some servers seemed to be going through the motions, delivering rehearsed lines rather than showing true attentiveness to the guests. While the setting is exceptional, the overall experience felt more style than substance.

I consider one of the best restaurants in the whole world. Firstly the interior designer is impressive with such a nice taste for art and the wood panels in organic lines. It’s sublime, you feel that you are in an Italian Palazzo, but a modern one. The staff is beyond friendly, they are well prepared. Sydney was very certain and confident about the wines and made the right choices for both of us. I love to find people passionate about what they do in life, this makes a huge difference. We chose the option in the menu with 5 courses, all them extremely well presented and deliciously each one. We only missed a piano as background, but the atmosphere was so welcoming and the other guests so respectfully quiet that we felt honoured to be in the middle. Highly recommend this restaurant for everyone that wants a nice dinner and gastronomic experience in French cuisine in Manhattan. My partner is French, and he approved everything and agreed with my feedback. We will definitely will return next time in NY.

This was undoubtedly the best dining experience of my life. We were celebrating our first anniversary. The food, the service, the surroundings all equaled perfection. Every staff member made us feel special. Our waiter answered every question with a level of professionalism that comes with years of trained knowledge. Chef Boulud even came over to check in with us after the meal. The five course tasting menu was phenomenal , it was so hard to make our choices. For anyone that has an event to celebrate this is your place!

Our experience at Daniel was top notch. The staff were friendly and engaging.  The atmosphere was gorgeous and the food exceeded our expectations.  We did the 9 course tasting menu with wine supplement.  The pairings were superb.  An excellent evening all around.

google.name: Central Park Boathouse
google.address: EAST 72ND ST +, Center Drive, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: A surprisingly great place to dine for lunch on a beautiful fall day. We were visiting New York and decided to walk Central Park. We walked in without reservations, put our names down and grabbed a seat at the bar for about an hour wait (Sunday). The views are beautiful and the outdoor patio is quite nice if you are seated in a nice spot with a view. During our time the sun was a bit direct and I saw a few diners had to stand up from their seats to dodge the sun. We enjoyed  the prawn cocktail, crab cake and chicken liver mousse. Their martinis and Bloody Mary’s are fabulous!

Stunning view and experience! This place while offered a great view of the lake on Central Park, the food was okay. I would say one should 100% experience this restaurant as it was rather stunning. The downside is a bit of service and value for dollar. We got seated in the only spot that had direct sun, but that was okay as it was a beautiful day. I would def return due to the location and overall experience this restaurant has to offer!

Had a delightful lunch at a the Boathouse after a relaxing walk through Central Park. Did not manage to get a table by the window but the lake was still visible. Food was flavourful. The entrees of jumbo shrimp and stuffed mushrooms deserve special mention.

Great location with stunning views, very friendly staff. I ordered the salmon and the ice cream for dessert - both were quite good but I wish it was more value per dollar, especially with the salmon as only cucumbers were given as a side. I would definitely say this is the place for a special occasion!

I rented a boat for $25 per hour. There was a bit of a wait—about 20 minutes in line. Unfortunately, my boat had some issues halfway through, and it unlatched from the row, which made it a bit challenging. Despite that, the views were fantastic.

yelp.name: Central Park Boathouse
yelp.address: E 72nd St And Park Dr N, New York, NY 10021

google.name: TAO Uptown
google.address: 42 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text:
My experience at TAO was quite mixed from start to finish. Here's everything you need to know. If you have a reservation for a specific time, you might not be seated right away. You could end up waiting at the bar for at least 15 minutes before getting a table. The waiting area is overwhelming and loud. However, once you're seated, you'll find yourself in one of the most incredible dining interiors in NYC. The atmosphere is incredible, though the restaurant is very dark and loud.

As for the food, I think it's good, but the prices are quite high. Keep in mind that it's easy for two people to spend over $300. I recommend trying the chicken lettuce wraps, the crispy cauliflower, and the spicy tuna. For drinks, their strawberry wine vodka is delicious. The overall dining experience is great, and the service is very fast. However, there's pressure to leave within an hour. My party and I were ordering and eating at a normal pace, but we kept being presented with the check even though we weren't finished. All in all, this place gave me mixed feelings, but I still think it's worth visiting at least once. Would I go back? Probably not.

The ambience at Tao is awesome! Has a zen feel to it and makes eating a relaxing experience. The fusion Asian food offered were delicious and creatively presented. The lunch set is really a must try! Love the place… will definitely visit again!!

Incredible place in all aspects. Food was top tier including the desert. The ambiance was very cool with Asian style vibes. The servers were very accommodating and professional. Shout out to Genevieve from Tao Corporate, we love working with her.

The food was amazing!! The service was very fast, and we loved everything we ordered, especially the desserts—the orange cake and the dessert with the smoky effect were outstanding. I can't wait to come back to this fancy restaurant.

A very nice restaurant in uptown area.  Food is good.  The main attraction is the Buddha.  Haha.   The lobster fried rice is really good same as the fish skewer.   Likely the second floor or top floor will give you a better view of the restaurant

google.name: Uva
google.address: 1486 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: Went to this place for dinner. They really got a big place inside also have outdoor sitting. I ordered gnocchi pasta, seafood soup. The food served at good temperature. Also the taste was good too. However, they made the place so dark with low light that it’s not giving a good ambience.

Wonderful resturaunt and a fantastic experience! The waitress was charming and kept the flow of food at a steady pace so that we weren't overwhelmed by all of our food options, making the meal a steady four course experience. The food was fresh and delicious in flavour, perfectly cooked and prepared. This is a wonderful date spot and one I would gladly recommend to my friends!

The restaurant by itself is pretty cute, the ambiance is really nice although it may be a little dark. The food is delicious, every single entree and starter is amazing. I recommend the fried artichoke and the gnocchi. We loved everything, the desserts are algo pretty good and rich in flavor.
Got back late after US Open.  This restaurant  is great. Pizza was wonderful.  Got the super pizza and the special dessert.  It was a great meal. Great service also

We had my bridal shower in UVA's wine cellar this past weekend and it was amazing. Giacomo and his team were so accommodating and lovely to work with and helped us set up. Everyone raved about the food and the cellar was incredibly cozy and easy to decorate for our event. Can't recommend enough!

google.name: Lady M Cake Boutique - Upper East Side
google.address: 41 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: An inventive take on a multilayer cake using crepes. Very creative flavor combos. We tried the chocolate as well as the tiramisu slices. Iced lattes were life restoring! Service was attentive and professional. A little "slice" of the EU on the upper East Side.

The cakes are great & it used to be a fave of mine but the service is terrible. I ordered multiple items to-go & I wanted to eat a few bites of one before I heading to a work meeting but, despite the place being completely empty, the staff refused to let me sit down unless I wasted my life giving them my time for full table service. So, I stood out in the street to take a bite instead & now I’ll never eat anything from LadyM again because it just left me thinking poorly about the brand. There are plenty of other brands out there now making mille crepes & I love the Chinatown bakery variations

This place is amazing! I fall in love with their cakes in Honolulu. So when I came to NYC, I went their for my fav pistachio cake, but unfortunately it was seasonal addition so they didn’t have it. I decided to try their most popular cakes: signature, matcha and chocolate. Delicious 🤤 my fav is chocolate, matcha was interesting and the signature was too sweet for me, but anyway very tasty. The place itself is small but very cozy. Delicious coffee and tea. And excellent service! I highly recommend you all to try their delicate cakes! And I hope they will open their place in Miami ♥️

When we visited, they didn’t offer indoor seating, which was disappointing as we wanted to try the crepe cake right away. However, we bought two pieces and enjoyed them at home. They were amazing! Both the pistachio and signature flavors are perfect desserts. They're not overly sweet, allowing you to truly savor the taste of crepes and cream. Moreover, they're not too buttery, so you don’t feel overwhelmed with calories after having one piece.

I had a disappointing experience at Lady M. I went in with my baby, who was peacefully sleeping in the stroller. The cashier rudely told me to leave the stroller outside, with no apology or understanding. I even offered to sit in a corner to avoid disturbing other customers, but the cashier dismissed me, saying it was a rule and there was nothing he could do as an employee. The lack of courtesy and flexibility was frustrating, and it left a very negative impression.

google.name: The Regency Bar & Grill
google.address: 540 Park Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text:
#RegencyBar & Grill is my neighborhood “#GoToPlace”-YOU MUST meet #Executive Chef Manjit who enjoys speaking to guests: #Relationship-building #Querying: #favorites, #likes, #dislikes! - even on wknds!! when most chefs are off. Tonight-to my delight-Alec, Sous Chef returns from Paternity leave -sharing his wee munchkins photo. AND I am most excited to see Newly recruited Sous Chef Julianne who worked with Manjit on his former culinary team. Brava!! Brava!!
My colleague and I enjoyed the appetizer house specialty: crab cakes- followed by amazing tender sweet broiled salmon and lobster. Can’t resist desserts:  cheesecake and tasty hazelnut ice cream. A seasoned waitstaff continue to exceed my expectations with welcomes and little touches of service kindnesses throughout our evening! I Love ❤️ our Regency “Experiences”!! Congratulations to Manjit for his promotion to “Food & Beverage” Manager..Well deserved!!,
We look forward to returning soon!

From the moment I sat down, I felt uncomfortable, but I thought perhaps it was me being bourgeoisie (I frequent a lot of upscale places in the city). Then, not only did I watch the bartenders have conversations with everyone around me and make me feel invisible, food took forever to come, and I was POISONED! By the time my dessert came, I was too sick to enjoy it 😮‍💨 I ordered the very mediocre Crab cakes and had to be walked to get in my car due to being ill. Spend my weekend sick and ended up in the hospital. Dizziness, nausea, irregular breathing... you name it. I don't recommend it for people of color especially.👎🏽 Out of over a thousand reviews I left on Google, I never had to leave one like this and hate having to do it, but never experienced this in NYC ever and I'm a native Manhattan resident!

I was really excited to go here because I am a big Housewives of New York fan and they always go here in the show. We sat at the bar and had a couple drinks that were ridiculously expensive. Like, comical. Decided not to get food because the vibe was just off. The patrons around us were insufferable. I finally worked the nerve up to ask the bartender if the housewives still come around and I could tell he was NOT happy to be asked that question. Like geez my bad dude, at least feign some interest. Glad I went just to say I did it but I would not go back. Ended up getting dinner at Carnegie Diner and it was fab.
Absolutely loved the service first off Stefan! Three egg omelette was awesome, I also opted for salmon to be included. Belgian waffle and the breakfast sandwich are great choice’s as well.

I was excited to visit but underwhelmed by my experience. First, the service was poor. I had to ask for water refills, ask for coffee refills, ask to have my plates removed. Second, two slices of basic, non-artisan cold white toast was $13.00 while 3 slices of over cooked bacon was $14.00
I hardly think $30 for that was worth it. The $23.00 oatmeal was cooked in water not milk. lukewarm and crunchy, very unenjoyable. The coffee was served with milk not cream and I had to request that. The eggs Benedict over salmon was good.

yelp.name: The Regency Bar & Grill
yelp.address: 540 Park Ave, Loews Regency New York, New York, NY 10065

google.name: E.A.T.
google.address: 1064 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: I bought ice cream and two pieces of cake(Coconut and Radpberry). Ice cream was fine but there is a GREEN MOLE inside a cake. Please be aware when you visit this place. Don't risk your life.

My boyfriend and I were meeting up with my in laws to visit the MET for his birthday. We were all pretty hungry, & my boyfriend and I had walked past E.A.T a few times, so we all decided to check it out. Even though it was a busy weekend, they sat us immediately. The staff were friendly and very attentive. The menu had a variety of options, but not an overwhelming amount. The food was amazing and came out quickly. I tried motza ball soup for the first time and was very impressed! Since it was my man’s birthday, they gave us complimentary cookies and sang “Happy Birthday”. It was a wonderful lunch with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Another great part is that you can grab a pastry to go or come sit inside for a nice meal. Will definitely be recommending to friends and family! 🗽🩵

Lovely café two blocks away from the MET. I took refuge from the rain here and I have to firstly appreciate the great service, they were all so quick in bringing my order even though it was pouring outside. The macchiato for me was perfect, a good, strong coffee like I enjoy, and from all the patisserie options I couldn’t decide! I tried a raspberry scone and it was great, not too sweet, not to buttery, as a scone should be.

Nasty nasty place ! 28$ for a Ham sandwich??????

I honestly have no idea how  they are still in business!!!???

All the reviews on this place are absolutely horrible because it’s all true!!!! I hope they relocate or adjust the prices!!! I really doubt they will adjust the prices. They have to take everything off the shelves and readjust the whole business model.

This place is absolutely a scam, never buy food or drinks. I was in a rush and the cashier didn’t say the price out loud so I assumed it would be relatively priced, but was shocked about the price.

That’s probably how they scam most people when they are in a rush .

I hope this place gets shut down honestly .

Also attaching a photo of the disgusting sandwich

Idk how they have decent reviews on uber eats..The prices are criminal, they’re charging $30 for the probably worst BLT I’ve ever had. I’ve had better sandwiches at airports before. Absolutely ridiculous. Don’t order unless you’re craving stale bread, dry turkey or tasteless cheese.

google.name: Phoenix Park
google.address: 206 E 67th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: Phoenix is good as a sports bar, but fails as anything else. The staff is super unfriendly to the point of belligerence and disappears for hours. We ended up having to go to the bar for drink and food orders several times. The food is also not great. The wings, while large, were just doused in red hot sauce, leaving them soggy and way too vinegary. The nachos were huge and looked a bit better. Beer selection was average, but nothing special and slightly disappointing for NYC. The only non major brand offered was Lagunitas which isn't exactly a tiny craft shoppe these days. The others were all domestic staples that were not at all exciting. I guess it is supposed to be a traditional Irish pub which is supposed to allow for a rougher atmosphere, but I just found it slightly dirty and sticky. The patrons are not people you'd want to associate with for the most part and a few verbal scuffles broke out toward the end of the night. There are better bars in the area.

Your typical Irish Pub/Sports Bar, it's a lot bigger than it looks from the outside. Service is decent, but not anything to really get excited about, and it can get a big crowded in the front when Hunter students stop by. The burgers are tasty, especially the BLT. Be aware that you'll probably have no phone service if you go to the back. Overall, a nice place to grab a drink, especially since there aren't a ton of bars in the area.

Great Happy Hours, Great Wings(HUGE BTW), Next to a cheap parking garage. Pool table and outside patio are a bonus. Bartenders are always great, Waitresses can be a hit or miss. This was one of my stops during my bachelorette party, The girls working that night paid the bar drunk to molest me via lap dance, good times..good times.

Guy below me couldn't sound anymore like a pompous douche.
Came to watch Iceland make history against France (albeit in a losing effort). Brian, the bartender, was phenomenal. The food, drink, and atmosphere were great.

When I was a newby to nyc I was like a fish out of water. I saw the mets neon sign in the window I had to go in, all in all its a great place, the service is outstanding and (whatever
they did to the menue ) is magnificent.

yelp.name: The Phoenix
yelp.address: 160 E 65th St, Apt 7C, New York, NY 10021

google.name: Land of Plenty
google.address: 204 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: We have been coming to Land Of Plenty for years. The food is always fresh, with the characteristics dishes of Szechuan cuisine. Service is attentive and efficient, and the owner is kind. My favorites are Dan Dan noodles, soup dumplings and braised fish fillet with peppercorn.

Our favorite GO TO for Chinese food in the city.   The food is consistently tasty and the service is always fast.  Price is very reasonable and we love the friendly professional people who make this restaurant exceptional!  Thank you! 💎

Love this place for the lunch specials. Some of the best stuff are the szecuan dishes like mapo tofu, dried string beans, etc. The pork belly with with water chestnuts is a dinner favorite. The smoked duck fried rice is great too. One review said the food is microwaved, heck no. They're fast and well prepared. for a busy lunch. Good service always.

I think this is the best Chinese spot I’ve ever been too.  Good quality entire (quality ingredients) ,massive menu,  appetizer and green tea for $13. I’ve tried a few things and they were all good.  And the service wow the food comes out before you even order.  Just keep in mind they are very efficient and want to get you out they don’t waste any time and are not very patient. Despite the popularity the place is massive so rarely ever a wait.  Very well run restaurant.

One of the best places for lunch especially if you're in a hurry and need to head back to work.

Land of Plenty doesn't mess around. You're in and out! With that being said, the food is always solid.

Get yourself some chow fun and, well, have fun. 🥢

google.name: Shake Shack Upper East Side
google.address: 154 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: I got the seasonal truffle burger and a smoke shack with French fries and a peach and cream shake. Everything was very good. I enjoyed the burgers, the patty was nice and juicy. They also have a generous amount of cheese. It definitely passed my string test. The flavor was nice. I also really enjoyed their shake. It got real peach chunks in it and that was just wonderful. I also didn’t know that they had people bringing the food in a tray to you in the restaurant, and that was very nice.

We had an amazing experience at Shake Shack! The place has plenty of seating, the environment is super clean, and the staff are incredibly attentive and quick with everything. Everyone was so friendly, which made the experience even better.

We ordered a mix of things — a chicken burger, a regular burger, fries, a milkshake, and their lemonade sweet tea combo — and everything was absolutely delicious. The fries were especially great, and the condiment station was well-stocked and spotless. The overall vibe was just friendly and welcoming.

One tip: if you need to use the washroom, make sure to keep your receipt. Overall, this Shake Shack gets a solid 5 stars for great food and fantastic service!

From the moment I walked in, I immediately knew it wasn't going to be a good experience

1. The cooking station immediately behind register, one was cooking and the other cleaning at the same time.
2. Nothing but grease on the cooker, when I say grease I mean never seen that much before
3. Order came wrong, grease and the patty only cooked on one side so the other side was open and falling apart, told them sauce o. The side burger drench in it and soaking grease
4. They replaced the order and messed it up a second time, only one patty, I originally ordered a double
5. The bum came like it was soaking in grease, you know what a sponge look like when it soaks up water that was the bun, I could not and will not eat that. Not even burger kind or Mcdonalds produce the level of oil that was draining out. Patty pressed and cooked only on one side. This was not it
6. Immediate refund
The experience is amazing. This is my third time at this location. I won’t go to another location. Always fresh, fast and the customer service is 10/10. Thank you for good quality food.

Shake shack serves a solid smash burger. The smoke shack and the shack burger are both good choices. If you’re looking for more flavor, get the smoke shack. Otherwise, the shack burger is your classic BLT cheeseburger. The cookies n cream shake is delicious! Fries are average. This location has tons of seating, both indoor and outdoor. Fast service!

google.name: Maya
google.address: 1191 1st Ave., New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: My husband and I have been dining at Maya for many years. The staff is so welcoming! The food is delicious with an abundance of flavors. It's also beautifully plated. We also love those delicious classic frozen margaritas. Yum! It's a great place to have a celebration too.

One of the best tapas-style restaurants I’ve been to and my new favorite Mexican restaurants! We did the bottomless brunch (it was a great value) and each dish was uniquely delicious. My standout dish was the short rib flautas, I loved it so much that would ordered it again and again.

We visited Maya for the bottomless brunch and we loved the experience! I researched a lot of places offering brunch in NYC, but I picked Maya because of their unlimited entree choices in addition to the unlimited drinks.
We had the full 90 minutes and service was excellent throughout. They were quick to refill our glasses, take our orders for food and even let us know when to place our last order.
The drinks were great, I personally loved all the mimosas. The food was amazing.. loved the portion size and the quesadillas were my favorite. We tried all the food we wanted on the menu.
Overall, we loved the ambience, service and the brunch experience in Maya. Will happily come back for another brunch.
Great spot for brunch. The service was very attentive, and the food was excellent. As a Mexican, I can tell you it tastes like it should, and that’s not easy to find in NY.

Went for the bottomless brunch. Soooo worth it and so filling! Unlimited food, the drink options are great- they let you choose between lime margaritas, flavored mimosas, and bloody marie’s. The waitress was super friendly and made sure we got to try all the dish options on the menu. Probably could’ve been slightly more attentive to filling up our drinks more but because we went during a busy hour- 2:30 pm, it’s completely understandable and still, we deff got a bang for our buck!

google.name: Cafe d’Alsace
google.address: 1703 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

review_snippets.text: I’ve been craving some good French food and discovered this UES gem. While they do offer a lot of French classics, they also serve a few dishes specific to the Alsace region, which makes it somewhat unique. Service was professional and the place has a lovely atmosphere. While it was pretty busy when I went, it wasn’t loud. And all the dishes I tried were wonderful. The salmon tartare starter was delicious and I enjoyed the mix of fresh and smoked salmon, topped with a dollop of caviar. For my main, I got the duck character, a hearty mix of duck confit, duck sausages and sauerkraut. I love duck and this was so good! And finishing with their creme brûlée, I must say theirs is very very good,, creamy with lots of vanilla. I’ll definitely be back!

As someone who loves French cuisine, I was curious to try Cafe d'Alsace, so my husband and I went there for dinner on Saturday—and it exceeded our expectations. The food was absolutely outstanding. All the dishes we ordered were flavorful and perfectly prepared. One highlight was their complimentary bread—round, with the flavor of cheese bread and the texture of a croissant. It was absolutely delicious!

The restaurant’s interior was beautifully designed, with elegant colors and furniture that created a cozy yet refined atmosphere.

Service was excellent—friendly, attentive, and professional throughout the evening. We're so glad we made a reservation, as it was bustling!

We thoroughly enjoyed our evening at Cafe d’Alsace
on the Upper East Side and will definitely be returning soon!

I had a wonderful dining experience during Restaurant Week. The menu was impressive, and I particularly enjoyed the rich flavors of the pheasant sausage and the delicate seared skate fish. The restaurant's atmosphere was charming, and the staff provided impeccable service. Definitely worth a visit in the future.

We’ve been frequent visitors to Café d’Alsace, and once again, we had an amazing experience. Everything was just as delightful as we remembered. We can’t wait to come back! The food was fantastic, and the hospitality was exceptional, especially David’s warm service. A huge thank you to the entire team for consistently making our visits so memorable!

A really lovely French bistro with good Alsatian classics on the menu, and a wide selection of Alsatian wines. A great buzz but not packed. Excellent service. David was the best! We’ll definitely go back and highly recommend.

google.name: Starbucks
google.address: 1128 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: Sat in the restaurant after purchasing my coffee and was on the phone I saw this lady standing near me pretending to use her phone. She asked to put headphones on or leave im guessing she was someone who works there which is awfully rude . Not the first time the staff was rude to me here will definitely not be returning. Starbucks is coffee shop I’m confused how it would be a problem being on the phone while you enjoy your drink

I’m the first person that walks in at 7am and the rest of the customers were all females before me. Everyone got their sandwichs and drinks before me and for some reason and I don’t understand why. Also, Amanda had a bad attitude with me and she burnt my pesto sandwich, terrible customer service.
I'm trying to avoid this location becouse every time I go, the service and attitude are the worst. Better to go on 63/3rd staff are way nicer

There is an amazing barista working over there - Jasmine (at least that’s what her necklace said 😁).
My daughter wanted some kind of fancy TikTok drink, so our order took time & the next customer was already rude behind us, but the barista was very calm & helpful. Amazing customer service in this Starbucks! 🙏

Updating this Starbucks from 4 stars to 5 stars - what it is lacking in a slightly dated interior it makes up for in efficient and friendly service! The pickup counter and in person ordering are both consistently on time and limited wait, after months of ordering here.

Let’s highlight the good stuff!

First off, big kudos to the friendly crew making your caffeine fix a breeze. The servers here bring some genuinely warm vibes, turning your visit into a little coffee catch-up. Plus, if you’re on the run, you’ll appreciate the magic they work to get your drinks out pronto – no waiting around.

In a nutshell, this Starbucks, with its friendly faces and speedy sips, bags a solid four stars. A bit of cleanup charm could easily make it a top-notch spot for your next coffee adventure.

google.name: Quality Meats
google.address: 57 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Quality Meats is a chic dinner spot that’s always on our list when staying by Central Park. The service is fast and amiable. Everyone seems like they want to help. The food is excellent. We ordered the bone in dry aged sirloin, the shrimp cocktail, the porterhouse meatballs, and the chocolate cake stand for two adults and one 5 year old discriminating New Yorker. The oysters were delicious also. All of the options were excellent. Dirty martinis to boot. Overall excellent dinner experience.

I like to go here for a solo date night every few weeks or so. The bartenders are phenomenal and really make my night out great. The food is great. The MEATBALLS. eat those. Cocktails, vibes, food, it’s really a great date night spot. By yourself or in a large crowd they seem to get people sat but if it’s more than just you. Make a resy.

the service here is amazing - our servers edgar and alejo were very attentive and made our experience wonderful! the food was good - i would recommend the truffle butter service (for steak) and corn brulee, however, the double tomahawk steak and steak tartar were just average. the atmosphere is also really comfortable - but the dim lighting made it hard to take good pictures. overall, 5/5! ⸜(*ˊᗜˋ*)⸝

My husband and I flew in from Boston to try this restaurant! It was by far the best choice! The waiter Lewis was so attentive and informed about all the food. The food was absolutely delicious. George the bartender was awesome as well! We felt welcomed from start to finish! Will definitely try again.

Excellent upscale restaurant with great service. Food is generally great, however my steak was medium well on the one end and rare at another, like it was grilled vertically ((
Otherwise great experience

google.name: Trattoria L'incontro
google.address: 1572 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: I used to love their Astoria restaurant. I'd been going there for over 15 years. This is the first time I've been new L’lncontro since they moved to Manhattan and everything has changed. Compared to Astoria, the restaurant is smaller and uncomfortable with many tables crammed into a small space, and the delicious freshly baked bread had been replaced by mediocre bread. One of my favorites, the lobster salad, was as delicious as ever, but Branzino had changed from a simple yummy grill to a tomato sauce flavor. Napoleon used to be filled with banana cream but now replaced with lemon cream. No more strawberries on top. Too bad, because for the past 15 years this has been my #1 favorite restaurant in NYC. It's changed from what it used to be, but it's definitely still at a high level.

I almost don't want to share how much I enjoyed L'Incontro by Rocco because it's crowded enough and I intend to go back often! We started with the white radicchio salad and the egg yolk large ravioli followed by the 32 ounce Porterhouse & the pistachio gelato with orange zest.- I mean everything was insane.  So good. Just perfection. Bravo Rocco!!!
Fantastic experience. On the pricier end but really enjoyed. Highlights were the veal ragu, gnocchi, tiramisu, and crème brûlée.

I came here last night with two of my friends and we were very impressed with the customer service here. I've always seen this place, but never stopped in but I've been craving authentic Italian food. We made reservations for 5:30p which was clutch because after 6:15p on a Saturday this place was packed! To start the customer service was phenomenal and I was impressed with how the waiters remember all the specials because there were so many. They also checked on our table often to see if there was anything we needed. Now for the food, they have a Flatbread that comes with a red sauce to start which is very appetizing. We got the fig salad which was perfect to start along with the steamed clams. For my entree I got the Ravioli and I'm glad I did. Overall this meal was so satisfying that of course I wanted more. Happy most of all with the service. Thanks for having us and thanks for an amazing 1st time experience at your restaurant.  I'll definitely come back soon.

We wanted to love this place bc it’s in the neighborhood, but the service was bad. The waiter was impatient, and the thing that really turned me off was that he packed our leftovers, chicken parm, fish, and the creamed spinach/potato side, together in one small container, which looked extremely unappetizing. I also felt the desserts were just very average. The wine list was good though.

google.name: Club A Steakhouse
google.address: 240 E 58th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: Our dinner at Club A Steakhouse was outstanding. My wife and I shared the porterhouse for three, and it was hands-down the best steak I've ever tasted—packed with flavor and incredibly tender. We kept the appetizers light with their burrata, saving room for the main event. The service was fantastic, attentive without being intrusive, which made the whole experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend for a memorable steak night.

Fabulous dinner!! Amazing service!!  One step in front door, and you know you're in for a treat as the cheesy funk of dry aged beef searing in the back takes over your senses. Bacon was fantastic, crab cake was definitely one of the best we've had as there was basically no filler at all. Strip steak melts in your mouth, and the Chilean seabass is what dreams are made of! Amazing complimentary dessert as well! Will definitely be back next time we're in NYC!

I took a business associate, plus one other, for dinner at 'Club A Steakhouse' when in New York and the whole experience was first class.  The ambience and greeting on arrival was great, as was the decor and vibe.  A great menu with some top quality dishes to choose from and impeccable service from our waiter.  I was also impressed by the fact that the restaurant owner, Bruno, was in the restaurant talking to, and serving, guests... A nice touch that was appreciated, a very lovely man and one that deserves to have a successful restaurant such as Club A.  I had the Shrimp Cocktail, the NY Strip, with sides of Broccoli, Creamed Spinach and Onion Rings, shared with my dining partners who both had the Chilean Seabass.  Everything was delicious and to a very high standard.  We did not order dessert but Bruno presented us with a dessert sampler platter and all of the desserts were amazing.  The costs for the meal was US$294 (including tax but before tip) which was reasonable compared to other American Fine Dining Steakhouses I have eaten in over the years.  I can't recommend 'Club A' highly enough and I take my hat off to Bruno and his whole team for providing such great ambience, service and food.  Thank You.

My partner and I have dined at Club A several times over the years. We decided that Club A is the best steakhouse in NYC. :)
The restaurant is beautiful, the service is always pleasant, great cocktails, great wine selection, and the food (notably the steaks) are excellent. The complimentary dessert is always a nice touch!
A great spot spot for a nice dinner.

Absolutely phenomenal service. Many complimentary items and dishes. Owner visited each table and greeted every customer. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. Greatest steak I have ever had and atmosphere is absolutely fantastic. Beautiful live jazz and great restaurant design. One of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Perfect!

google.name: Café Boulud
google.address: 100 E 63rd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: You can see the staff’s passion reflected in their outstanding service and the beautifully designed restaurant interior! The food, while being mostly good, was not super memorable and I personally don’t think it was worth the price point this restaurant operated at. The two friends I went with also agreed. Good flavors, beautiful interior, excellent service overall

It's exactly the high level standards of everything that you should expect from a Daniel Boulud restaurant.  The Sommelier Simon is fantastic as we're all the wait staff.  There wasn't one bite of the 7 dishes we tried that wasn't thoroughly devoured they were all so good.  The house made sausage, clams and pasta were the highlights.  The wine list is exceptional.

We had one night in NYC. We chose Chef Boulud for our one dinner. We were disappointed. The risotto was under cooked. The duck skin was soggy. The snapper was beautiful on the plate, but it lacked flavor. The waiter was not very attentive. For the cost, not the night we were hoping.
UPDATE: The manager reached out to our party and discussed our experience. They really cared about what we had to say. They have also compensated us for our experience, which was very appreciated.

My dining experience at Café Boulud was exceptional. The foie gras terrine was rich and  beautifully presented, and the bass was cooked to perfection, with complex and rich flavors for both. The attentive service made me feel completely at ease as a solo diner.

Good food but even better service. Came early around 5:30PM on a dinner night and the space was quaint and intimate.

Food: recommend the canard miel-safran (duck breast). Personally did not love the bar en paupiette sauce meurette (black sea bass) it felt flavorless without accompanying sauces and essentially mashed potato.

Dessert: highly recommend the Tarte noix de pecan, it comes with an incredible maple whiskey ice cream

google.name: The Stumble Inn
google.address: 1454 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text:
I love to stumble in to this place.
First of all the whole staff are great Hugo is the man!
Maddie if funny and very attentive.
Ashley is superb at her job as well before my drink is over Bam there the next one :D
The food is excellent they got awesome happy hours daily must go to place.
Awesome local sports bar with pop r&b music played. Mid week evening great alcohol prices ;)

​​

​​Stumble Inn, located at 231 Hamburg Turnpike in Bloomingdale, New Jersey, is a cherished local bar and grill known for its welcoming atmosphere and classic American fare.​​ ​​Patrons often praise the establishment for its friendly staff and cozy environment, making it a popular spot for both regulars and newcomers.​​ ​​

​​The menu features a variety of comfort foods, including burgers, wings, and bar pies, all prepared to satisfy diverse tastes.​​ ​​In addition to its food offerings, Stumble Inn boasts a well-stocked bar with a selection of beers and spirits, catering to a wide range of preferences.​​ ​​

​​Entertainment options at Stumble Inn include a shuffleboard table, dart board, and pool table, providing patrons with engaging activities to complement their dining experience.​​ ​​The bar also hosts live bands on select nights, adding to its vibrant and lively atmosphere.​​ ​​

​​For those seeking a relaxed and enjoyable dining experience with a touch of local charm, Stumble Inn in Bloomingdale offers a delightful combination of good food, drinks, and entertainment.​​​​

Used to come here when in was Moe's back on the old days. It's a little different, but it's basically the same vibe. Service was good and place was clean. Nice and spacious with a good beer and cocktail selection. Worth a stop.

If you're a fan of college-y bars, this is your spot! This place is under the same ownership as Downtown social, so very similar vibes.
I will say their kitchen is open late, and there's a nice separate section for sitting and eating.

google.name: The Penrose Bar
google.address: 1590 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text:
A truly exceptional brunch spot! I can highly recommend the birdcage, south of the border, and the pickle martini! If you like pickles, that is

The salmon crispy was absolutely exceptional! And my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed the steak and eggs, side of tater tots, which is the go to, of course. Also, the chicken biscuit was extremely moist, and saucy the chicken was cooked perfectly and not dry! We will be back !! Gotta check out dinner

The ambiance is marvelous! Low lit, with upbeat music playing nonstop. Grace our server is amazing and so sweet. Newly renovated space gives me a SPEAKEASY vibe! Great for networking, parties, and events. Food of course was 10/10- try the Apple Cider/ Hot Toddy! I really liked how friendly the staff was and the location is very convenient. I’m coming back with all my girlies.

I had an amazing boozy brunch at The Penrose Bar! The Bloody Mary and orange mimosa were perfectly crafted, and the avocado toast with smoked salmon was fresh and delicious. Our waiter and bartender were incredibly engaged and hospitable, making us feel so welcome from start to finish. Highly recommend for a fun brunch with your girls. Five stars!
