As a native new New Yorker, I have high standards for bars. However, after being at Penrose bar for the first time, I can honestly say that it is instantly one of my favorites. The ambiance, good crowd, delicious drinks, and food were so delicious! Definitely can’t wait to return.

Penrose bar on the upper East Side of Central Park.
We ordered the fried chicken sandwich, the beef flat burrito, bang shrimp, grilled Brussel sprouts.
And some beers.
All in all, it was a decent joint with good service, and the food ok, but nothing ground breaking.
I had 2 small gripes, I thought the friend chicken was a tad dry and the sprouts a tad too salty; other than that a solid overall bar experience.

google.name: Akami
google.address: 1773 1st Ave., New York, NY 10128, USA

review_snippets.text: Came for a quick lunch as it is right around the corner from my hotel. Nigiri and sushi roll were bland. Miso soup was also quite lacking. Fish was definitely not as fresh as I would expect at a sushi restaurant. Wegman's to go has fresher fish. Rice was dry/hard.

Always great service, especially on work days when things are calm and food 🍱 is coming quickly from the chef 👩‍🍳.
This is the better option for sushi 🍣 in the neighborhood, because of the size, price and quality.

I really enjoy their lunch rolls, they are fresh and delicious and they have a great variety to choose from for the lunch menu. I really enjoyed their shumai and everything else I tried. The dressing on the salad is fresh, zesty and tasty. They always get my order right which I appreciate a lot because this does not often happen and so I really enjoy their delicious food. I want to try some other combinations so I can try more variety from the menu. The value is pretty great as well for the location. Everyone is very friendly and helpful and I really enjoy ordering the food knowing that it will be fresh and delicious. I’ll keep going there and would recommend that place.

I ordered the shrimp bento box. The shrimp looked like it was seasoned but really needed more flavor.  I really wanted to add salt. Same for the tempura.  Sushi was pretty good as was the salad and soup.  Portions were good.  I expected more.   Oh well. Service was great though.

Great little sushi and Japanese restaurant. They offer a fantastic lunch deal for $10.95 where you get soup, salad and a bento box with your choice of protein, rice, dumplings and a small sushi roll. Service was fast and polite.

google.name: Tony's Di Napoli
google.address: 1081 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: We came here the night before running the NYC Marathon. It was the perfect place to fuel up on carbs! It was a nice, big, family friendly restaurant with plenty of space for our large group. We had one of the specials and it was seriously so delicious. I loved the Caesar salad! My only critique is the service was a little slow. I had a Diet Coke and was never offered a refill, despite being charged $7. Anytime we wanted something we had to track someone down. That being said the staff was friendly.

A MUST! We arrived without a reservation, had a big lunch, and everything was perfect. Great cocktails, delicious starters, HUGE portion of pasta, and the BEST branzino I've ever had. Considering the location, quality of food, and portion sizes, the prices are VERY reasonable!

Wow, talk about quality and one gets what one pays for. I participated in an event sponsored by the host and Upper East Side Mommies and Tony pulled out all the stops. Just look at this spread! Don't let the size of the spread distract from the quality, as one expect compromise when it comes to bulk.

A fun atmosphere, attentive wait staff and an open bartender is all Tony needs to make this place a success. Who's Tony? Just ask.

We stumbled opon this place randomly while out for a walk, I’m so happy we found it! We had some amazing ravioli from here + the service was quick and amazing, the restaurant was also very well air conditioned which was definitely needed on a hot day. We will definitely be back!

A lucky chance find while walking on the street. It was so good we came back the next day! We enjoyed the salads and pastas, service was great too. Their portions were big - my husband and I just shared the small salad and pasta between us. Already looking forward to going back to NYC and Tony’s!

google.name: Lips Drag Queen Show Palace Restaurant & Bar
google.address: 227 E 56th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: We celebrated our 32nd anniversary on the last night visiting NYC for the week.  Lips was just right.  Heidi Ho was hosting.  She was fun, energetic and engaging!  The food was amazing. Seriously, the BEST Salmon I've ever had in my life!  Our drag waitress was Lauren and she was very hospitable and attentive.  She also did a great drag number!  Will visit again next time we are in NYC!

Roxy our server was so sweet and attentive. Then when she took stage she was fierce! We loved everyone that performed and that was working that night. The made my daughter’s 18th birthday so fun. The food is so so, the drinks are strong and tasty, but we all know you are there for the show and they don’t disappoint you! We did the glamour show on Saturday night. I highly recommend it!

A fabulous experience! We went for the Saturday brunch and show. I had expected the food to be mediocre and the drinks watered-down. But to my delight, the waffles that came with fresh berries and syrup were delicious. My friend's omelet was in point. The drinks were strong and kept coming. The show was a lot of fun with sashaying and dancing queens and risque banter. Miz O was my favorite. She embodied Whitney Houston! The staff was friendly and attentive. The hostesses will exchange larger bills for one dollar bills for you to give the dancers. People who were celebrating birthdays and engagements were given crowns. It was a lot of fun and I would go back.

i can't say enough good things about LIPS! i went for a friend's birthday with a huge party of people (19) and they were so accommodating to all of us! the show itself was so fun, great music selections and had all of us DYING of laughter. the food was amazing too! everyone in the place looked absolutely beautiful and you could tell how much love, care, and passion is put into every performance. 10/10!!

I was here yesterday. It was my first time and I can't describe how great this place is. My friends and I had a great time. I will definitely be back. Thanks for making my birthday the best. Cheers to all the drag queens. I'll be back soon. Sincerely, Margie.

yelp.name: Lips Drag Queen Show Palace Restaurant & Bar

google.name: Shake Shack Upper West Side
google.address: 366 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: This is a great Shake Shack. As soon as we entered the manager Natasha greeted  us at the door and lead us to the kiosk to order our food. The restaurant is clean and the food was delicious. It was my birthday and Natasha made me feel very special. I will definitely be returning here, and I love this area.

Table seating is limited. Place your order at the kiosks. Lower level has an odd smell to it. Very limited staff interaction. My sandwich was messed up. Clearly this location is in demand, the line was to the door the whole time we were there. Cheese fries were good.

The hamburger is tasty, only if you don't take into account the burnt patty.  Little place to sit, no straws and napkins in service.  Given that during visits there was a queue to the very entrance, but it was surprising that it moved quickly, that is, the staff works very quickly.

This Shake Shack is located right next to the American Natural History Museum, that’s why we decided to stop here to grab a quick lunch before heading in.

The staff immediately welcomed us with a smile and directed us to the kiosks to order. We just had a couple burgers and fries.

Everything was good, not sophisticated or anything, simple but good! The fries were swimming in cheese which for us was a bit too much but that’s absolutely personal taste.

We paid roughly 20$ for a satisfying and filling lunch, great stop!

My grandson and his friends and I ordered in kiosk and until now I checked my receipts on my email that I noticed that they added tips of $6.14 which I did not approved.
Since I didn’t need help ordering I don’t think it should be added in my order and also preparing my food it shouldn’t be a tip unless a large group and large order then I would give a tip.
Truly yours

google.name: Orsay
google.address: 1057 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: What a treat! Great large restaurant with old french flair. Outside or inside you will be very happy. Service was outstanding with everyone working as team. Now for the food. Presentation was excellent for all dishes. We tried the liver mousse and french onion soup, steak and fries. Eggs with salmon and had to try dessert. The liver mousse was my favorite. Creamy and rich. Steaks were perfect and fries crunchy salty. Soup so good but the desserts ohhh the desserts just yum.

If you ever wanted to have a dish at a French restaurant that says "we think you are stupid Americans " then get the salade niçoise at Orsey because it is an absolute insult to food, to its customers and to any true French food.
It seemed that the whole plate was rearranged and kept in the sub-refrigerator. It was that cold.  The beans were mush, the tomatoes were soggy, the egg tastes like vinegar, the potatoe was actually so hard it cracked when I bit into it and the bed of greens were marked with brown tips cut off.
The thimble of tuna it's was a tartar (some places it is not) was unremarkable, but I ate it anyway because I wasn't going to throw 35 bucks out the window.  The bread was tasty but cold, and the butter was too cold to scrap and spread.
It's been a minute since I've been here, and it's a one and done for me.
Nice room, pleasant people at the door, and a great bartender.

First French restaurant, crossing it off my  world taste list.
Walking in, the vibe was very tense mainly from the other guest. I could practically feel the racial barrier xD.
I had the lunch special steak 6oz and friesinstead of the 8oz, a wise choice because I didn't even finish it before my lunch break was over.
I asked for medium well but I guess that's just medium here? Compared to Golden Corral, I preferred GC's.
Fries were a delight, the steak sauce was tasty and very creamy, so please explain any dietary restrictions to the person that takes your order. BE LOUD AND CLEAR ABOUT IT.
I wish they had some mocktails on the menu, would've loved something fruity with that steak. I settled for ol reliable lemonade.
The Cokes and Sparkling water came in cute glass bottles, I wanted to take em and turn them into vases. Gotta be quick.
I didn't have a chance to order the tartin dessert since I was late, will come back to try it another day, maybe a creme brulee if its on the menu :9
Large attractive French restaurant with indoor  and outdoor seating. Restrooms are on second floor, a busy long narrow steep staircase. No changing table.

Came here for the first time to try out their monday night special: Prime rib. Experience was quite disappointing.

We arrived at 530pm.  We ordered 2 orders of the prime rib, both to be made Rare. They initially brought us two steaks and claimed they were both rare.  However, what showed up was one steak about medium and the second one about medium-well.  They were not fooling anyone. The medium-well piece was also the end piece. We confronted the manager that the steak was definitely not rare as ordered. An endpiece can almost never be rare in principle.  As per the butcher who cut the steak, they said they must cut the prime rib slab in order from the end piece start, and cut towards the middle regardless what temperature the patron is ordering. They stated we were the first person ordering the prime rib that evening so we get those first two pieces starting from the end.

I have NEVER heard of this being a case for a steak serving establishment that we get no choice for the temperature of the steak. I'm not sure if this is the truth or were they just looking for the sucker that didn't know what proper steak is supposed to look like.

If they can't honor the steak rare or medium-rare, they should state that right before ordering or upon arrival of the dish.  They brought us two overcooked steaks and if we didnt speak up they would just leave it which i find unprincipled. The management did come by to apologize that the whole prime rib slab was more over cooked than usual Mondays. However, the tone of the apology was a bit defensive. At that point they recommended us to order something else. However, we already got settled at the table with an infant so we did not want to leave midist of dinner time for the sake of our infants sleep/feed schedule. The conclusion is we had to succumb to eating overcooked steak.

This place is also not stroller infant friendly.  They would only seat us outdoors away from the main restaurant or the corner seat near the bar.

The prime rib was supposed to come out on a cart and the steak is supposed to be cut in front of you. However, we did not get to see it given the outdoor seating we were forced to sit in.

BOTTOM LINE: I would not recommend the prime rib if you are particular about how your steak is prepared.

google.name: Dallas BBQ
google.address: 1265 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: Dropped by for a quick bite with Dallas and was pleasantly surprised. The place has a fun, vibrant atmosphere with fantastic decor. I'm not usually a fan of franchises, but this one really stood out. We only had time for a frozen beverage, chicken wings, chips with guacamole, and an Alabama Slammer. Everything came out quickly, was full of flavor, and hit the spot perfectly before tackling the rest of my day. Sorry about the pics It looks so good we couldn't wait to eat. 😂 And as you can see it was tasty like I said

To each their own my date loved it but i hated food was not fully cooker eavry veggie i had was hard like really hard and my chicken was pink also hard and a pound of bbq over my chicken it was awful but the cornbread i did loved

We have not been to this restaurant in 10 yrs and it was a little disappointing. Sticky wings and tempura never disappoint and our waitress Leah was very pleasant n nice. This place needs a remodel  the bar was trashy, my Mom said she walked past the kitchen it was a mess, the bathroom was trashed,  the ppl who clean tables need to check around table for trash on  floor and when we walked out  omg all the trash outside around the restaurant is ridiculous.
I would not recommend sticky wings or rib. Just sweat and sticky sauce. No savory.  Baby back ribs are okay with drinks..

My favorite dish is the fried chicken wings - plain. They are super crispy and HUGE. I bring my own bottle of hot sauce with me. I love their cornbread too. Instead of dessert, I order their alcohol-free frozen drinks. They taste like ice cream. OMG....

google.name: Club Macanudo
google.address: 26 E 63rd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: Three of us came here to celebrate  a birthday and its a nice cigar lounge. Decor is good.  However the  servers are very cold. They serve drinks by measuring them. We had to order more than 5 rounds of single malt to really enjoy our cigars. .  I have never been to a high end bar which doesn't  have free pour. Food is nice.  Overall its a decent place. Not sure if I will be back.

We got a table for 4 on Dec 30, 2023 for cigars and drinks.  Nice corner table and it was very comfortable. We had such a fantastic and memorable night. The club had high quality cigars and made great drinks. I loved the design of the club. It’s a high end design, while maintaining a chill and laidback vibe.  Lastly - excellent service by the team. Super attentive, warm and welcoming. Very well done Samantha, Mohamed and the rest of the team.  We’re looking forward to our next visit!

Hats off to William! 👏👌👍

We came for one cirgar and stayed until close.

The service from William was excellent, and he was very knowledgeable.

Excellent ambience and vibe.

The cigar offering is very impressive.

It is a member club. With a $40 minimum spend for walk ins.

They do provide private cigar safe for members.

Love this place wish we could come back again.

I went there twice during my short stay in Kuala Lumpur, the cigars collection is very good and nice selection of wines and spirits too.
I’ll definitely be back and thanks again to the manager, very friendly and kind.

The service was lovely, however It was first buying a cigar here and I went and bought a La Gloria Cubana Churchill for 34 bucks. However!!!!! The real retail of a single one is 11 dollars and tax. Never again. The photo is real retail price. Unbelievable.

google.name: P.J. Clarke's
google.address: 915 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text:
Fantastic,  historic tavern in the heart of Manhattan. Real old world vibe. The  most delicious onion rings/strings I've ever had! The bartender was super cool, and even the locals were chatty and really interesting.
I absolutely love this pub - hopefully I can visit again.  If you're  in N Y just go.

First time coming  to this historic restaurant.  We got there  at 11:45pm on a Tuesday, close to kitchen closing.  The manager was the nicest guy, greeting us with a smile and said if your hungry we will keep the kitchen open for you.
Thinking  it was an Irish  bar  I  was surprised  when he offered  the best shrimp  cocktail  or  oysters, Clams on the half shell. He also recommended  the best  pint of  Guinness.

We took him up  on his  Guinness.  It was the best Guinness  I ever  had, creamy  and fresh  I highly  recommend  it.

Next I ordered  the clams  on the half shell. I was shocked how good and fresh they were  . We also got the shrimp  cocktail  it was huge, the biggest  shrimp  I  had seen.

My  main was the beer  battered  Fish and chips.  Again , it was cooked perfectly  with a delightful  crunch  and flaky  fish  inside.  I never expected  this kind of quality  food at midnight.  We all were  full  and happy at the end of out meal.  You can't go wrong here, can't wait to go  back  again  soon.

We were sat right away without a reservation on a Saturday night, but the restaurant was still packed! The oysters were great, and the lobster roll was great too but the cheesecake stole the show. Highly recommend!
We had a great experience with my friends at this historical place. The Cadillac burger is the best! Definitely we will visit this place again

Speak easy vibe in NYC with great music, food, and drinks. Makes you feel like you’re one of the Goodfellas while you take down some of the best burgers around. This place is holding strong since 1884 and rightfully so. Looking forward to a return trip soon.

google.name: JG Melon
google.address: 1291 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text:
Cute place with a bustling atmosphere. We were seated outside quickly, and the staff was very friendly. We hadn't noticed it was cash only, but they kindly directed us to an ATM across the street at Wells Fargo. Our food arrived quickly.

If you're craving a classic bar burger, this is the spot! My partner and I both had the Bacon Cheeseburger. While it didn’t blow our socks off as some locals claimed, it’s definitely solid bar food if that’s your thing.

Classic New York burger spot cooking up one of the best in the city.

Started with the cottage potatoes which were good, but got a cup of the chili which was great. Tons of flavor and seasoning; definitely try it.

The burger was big and juice; the best part was the char on the bottom that brought out an extra level of flavor and texture.

Must stop on any NY food bucket list

I won’t beat around the bush - it’s a bit expensive, the cash-only bit is an inconvenience, the waits are long, and the food really didn’t blow me away. So why 5 stars? Because I don’t care. This place has an energy and a stuck-in-time vibe that draws you in. In a city filled with avant-garde smashburgers with kimchi, it’s places like this we rely on to keep us grounded. It’s honest, it isn’t pretending to be innovative or new. It’s getting hard to find places left in Manhattan that feel like real, old New York. Places like Minetta Tavern or Caffe Reggio, and of course, JG Melon. Some complained about rude service, and okay, the older male host can be very short and come across as rude to someone not from the city, but he isn’t. He’s just an authentic New Yorker.

We visited this burger place on a weekend, and there was a bit of a crowd. They told us there would be a 45-minute wait and wrote our name down, but luckily, we were called in just 5-10 minutes. We ordered the bacon cheeseburger, and while it wasn't as mind-blowing as some of the reviews suggested, it was still a solid, tasty burger. One thing to keep in mind—be sure to carry cash as they only accept cash. Overall, a good experience!
Absolutely worth the wait. The chili and cottage fries are a killer combo. The cheeseburger is perfect. I could sit here and drink martinis all night. In fact, I did. :)

google.name: Naruto Ramen
google.address: 1596 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

review_snippets.text:
FANTASTIC ramen at a super affordable price! (Around $15 each) and the portions were huge.

I got the tan tan, boyfriend got one that has a vinegary egg broth in it (we forget the name but it started with an S) and he loved it. My tan tan was perfection. The noodles were so bouncy and fresh, perfectly al dente. The food came out in literally 10 minutes too!!

My ramen was comparable to some that I’ve had in Japan. The broth was insanely rich and flavorful and we are definitely coming back!!

The naurto ramen was amazing not too spicy and great flavor. I also appreciated being able to change the pork for chicken. Waitress was very nice. Space is a little tight but over all it’s still cozy.

Absolutely amazing!! Me and my family have been searching for a ramen place that tastes like what we had in Japan. And when I tell you this ramen tastes exactly like what I used to order in Okinawa. I mean it tastes exactly the same down to the T. It’s definitely worth the wait and I would recommend. I wish we weren’t from out of town. I would be coming back LITTERALY every day. :)

The vibe of this place is really unique and I’m glad they stuck with the more authentic seating arrangement of having a bar where you watch them make your food—which provides some light entertainment while you wait. The staff was nice and consistently checked to make sure everything was good or to refill the water. The food itself was just amazing, the pork fried rice wasn’t too greasy but managed to stay filled with flavor and the edamame was perfectly salted. The ramen was great, I had the miso ramen which had a flavorful, salty broth. The pork was cooked excellently and the combination and quantity of toppings were satisfactory. They also have a great lunch special.

The place is small, I wouldn’t recommend it for kids, or large parties, is more of a small party experience. Had to wait to be seated, since the place was packed at 10:30 pm on a Saturday, we the food was worth it! We had the Miso soup, Chicken teriyaki, Cilantro Bomb ramen, gyozas and all of them were amazing. Being the ramen the star of the night. Good portions, fare prices. The seating area is at a bar watching the cookers get your food done. The service was very good, diligent, with quick response. We loved it. Would come back for the ramen.

google.name: Via Quadronno
google.address: 25 E 73rd St, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: Beautiful atmosphere with indoor and outdoor service and delicious food! The pasta was unreal and everything tasted so authentic! The service was excellent! I highly recommend Via Quadronno! Can’t wait to go back already!!

Disappointing.

The Bresaola panini was incredibly dry and a very small portion. Think just dry meat on toasted bread.

I was looking forward to the lasagna as this place had authentic feel. Unfortunately the lasagna was burned and had a very strange / old taste, and despite the picture is an extremely small / shallow portion for $30.

Aldo, be aware that this place automatically charges an 18% service charge.

Good coffee and an interesting idea of the menu, but mediocre execution. When you order panini it comes with nothing, not even a single chip. I understand that they are trying to mimic Italy, but it doesn't even look like an Italian panini. Don't get me wrong the panini is ok, but you are eating a very dry sandwich without anything else.

Went here after MET.

Pasta ($30) and paninis ($17) quite overpriced and only okay. Tiramisu was quite good but little expensive ($14). Asian owned instead of traditional Italian. Service was good but very casual dining.

This was an abomination to Italian food. We literally had italian tourists next to us laughing at us. This is such a disgrace to people that come here thinking they will receive Italian cuisine but then receive some type of revolting painini in front of them. DONT COME HERE!

google.name: Scalinatella
google.address: 201 E 61st St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: Truly an experience every food connoisseur should enjoy. Ambiance felt warm and exclusive. Service was beyond anything else on the City. Food was unique and boasted some of the best flavors I’ve ever tried.

Great upscale family style Italian restaurant. Can’t recommend it enough.

Go there, but expect to spend a pretty penny.

All of food is way too good that I had to over rate more than what we experienced.
BUT, I must say that verbal menu must be written with each price.
All most $200 for fish over $100 for pasta are TOO MUCH.
Also the system of waiters must be improved.  He was asking what drinks to order 4 times to me while my friend is in a restroom. No rulls at all!

"I recently visited this restaurant for a dinner meeting and was left quite disappointed by the experience. After a ten-minute wait, we were finally approached by the captain who alone was permitted to distribute menus, which oddly only listed about a dozen items. Instead, he insisted on reciting over 20 specials, leading to some confusion and necessitated repetition.

Despite opting to order from the regular menu, the captain served and charged us for individual pieces based on the number of attendees, rather than per dish as ordered. For example, instead of one Caprese salad, we were served—and billed for—seven separate portions at $15 each, without regard for whether everyone wanted it. The quality of the food, including the mozzarella, was also underwhelming.

Additionally, we received multiple unwanted dishes, further inflating our bill. The establishment itself was in poor condition, with torn chairs, unclean bathrooms, and malfunctioning fixtures.

Concluding the evening, we were presented with a handwritten bill totaling $979, a stark contrast to what one might spend at high-end venues for superior service and ambiance. This experience was unfortunately memorable for all the wrong reasons. I have dined at many of New York's top restaurants and have never encountered such practices. I believe future patrons might appreciate a forewarning of these issues."

Food was good. Bolognese was little bit salty. But still good.  size and  grounded meat sauce are generous. Also they offer complimentary small appetizers.  I liked Dover sole. Since Dover sole is my favorite fish, I have been tried Dover sole at many restaurants in NYC.  The way it’a cooked is simple since I ordered plain one. It was great. It’s more difficult to cook delicious food with simple cooking method or no sauce .because there is no way to fake it. In this respect, Dover sole was great! And I expected to be higher price since many reviews complain about over price. Well.. price was fine ,compared to other restaurants in NYC. At least here , taste is good. There are countless restaurants in nyc pasta is $ 40 , but tastes terrible.  And white truffles are fancy ingredients itself. Not surprising charge $100. (I did not order, i saw from the menu). And dover sole was $98. And .. dover sole is commonly over $80 ,easily go up over $ 100 anywhere in nyc .

Issue is the service. They are friendly. However The way of manner is not refined . Too rush , no apologies for interrupting our conversation . Extremely obsessed with taking dirty plate away. I think they believe taking plates away  is the most important role as a server. Service did not match for price.
But again, food is good!

google.name: Philippe Chow
google.address: 33 E 60th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: I’ve been to many Chinese restaurants in NYC, but without a doubt, Philippe Chow is the best one I’ve had the pleasure of dining at. I tried the chicken dumplings, chicken satay, and the spicy fried rice paired with sweet and sour salmon. Every dish was exceptional, and the portions were perfect. Highly recommend this spot if you’re looking for top-notch Chinese cuisine in New York.

This is the second time I've been to this restaurant. I'm a picky eater, but everything was wonderful. When I first entered, I used the restroom. I noticed there was a candle in front of the soap dispenser. I'm clumsy and generally look out for hazards as a result. It made me nervous. After requesting that the soap and candle be swapped, to avoid any potential accident, they fixed it immediately. The service was on point.

My table mates shared the peking chicken and I went for the tofu and mixed vegetable stir fry, but with black bean sauce. I cannot say how the chicken tasted as a vegetarian, although I tried the wrapping with cucumber, scallion, and sauce. It was delicious. My tofu and vegetables were great. The tofu was extremely soft and flavorful.

Before we received our main courses, we had appetizers. I must say that all of the appetizers were incredible. Noteworthy items for me were the scallion pancakes and cauliflower bites. If you have an issue with salt intake, you might want to ask for less salt on the cauliflower as they are quite salty.

I don't often come to fancy places, let alone a place as fancy as this. I like to make fun of how they refill your water glass so quickly. This time, I got less than a minute on how long it took to fill an empty glass. Mike got to my sister's water glass at 45 seconds!! When we came last year it was around 3 minutes for that server back then. Speaking of water, make sure to specify whether you would like tap water or bottled water. We thought the bottles were refilled, but were made aware that every new bottle cost $11 when Mike gave us one "on the house." Thankfully, when we asked for another bottle taken off because of the confusion, they not only comped one more, but another one on top of that. I was pleasantly surprised by the generosity in their service.

If you enjoy Chinese cuisine, this is a great place to go. They truly elevate the experience. I felt like a prince.

The BEST Asian meal I had this year and it’s not even close. Other than the short mix up in the beginning where it took them a bit to find my name on the reservation, everything else was TOP NOTCH.

The service was great, I loved the ambiance, enjoyed the drinks, the food came extremely quick and was absolutely delicious.

Every bite I kept trying to think which day I would be coming back, it was that good. The trick by adding lo mein to the chicken salad wraps (with the sauce) was a HEAVENLY COMBO! The Crispy Beef was too good and the Filet Mignon was PERFECTLY cooked. I wasn’t sure if I was going to like it cut into pieces when I got but geeeeeeezzzzzzz that was the best Filet Mignon I had this year. I got it medium and idk who or what cook it in the back… I swear it was Ai, it was so dang good. Dessert was great too!

This might be Top 1-3 meals I’ve had this year.

Overall had a good experience. Went for the hype but probably wouldn’t go back. Quality of the food and portion was really good. The taste depended on what you order. Pecking duck, chicken satay, green prawns, sea bass, walnut shrimp and the red velvet cake was delicious.  We tried almost everything cause we got the Crown pre course menu.

I enjoyed the vegetable lo mein and the the duck and cilantro dumplings. The food came out pretty quickly and all of it was delicious 🤤😍. The service was great and quick to meet any requests. I would dine here again.

google.name: Bamboo Sushi
google.address: 5602, 1280 1st Ave. #5602, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: I will never in life order from this place again. I ordered food from this place and when I took my food out of the bag there was a maggot crawling on the side of the container. Thank God I didn’t eat anything and noticed what I thought was a grain of rice moving. Never again!!! If I could I would add a video.

My favorite hidden gem. The staff (specifically Jack) is so sweet and remembers us every time we walk in as well as our go to order. We have our favorite spot in the restaurant and all the fish is so fresh. Prices are unbelievable. We usually get the sushi platters. It's the best way to go. Love it here!!!!!!

Update: year later! Incredible sushi this tome with the special rolls and seaweed salad.  Service and pandemic were honestly on point.

Came here yesterday for lunch… Could say I had an overall OK experience as the service was really good the sake was priced accordingly and they gave a large Sapporo.  I did the three rolls special which I would highly recommend however one of the fish and the white tuna being in particular was not very appetizing did not taste fresh so it kind of ruined it for me

If you are looking for a nice place to eat great food, I highly recommend Bamboo Sushi, hands down one of my favorite places to eat when I finish my college classes.  Apart from finding delicious food, the staff is charming, and the choice of music is excellent.  I 100% recommend the rolls.

Worst sushi place ever!!! I’m so disappointed! The sushi obviously looks like it’s gone bad already, why are they even serving us rotten food?? The sushi is rotten ok fine, so I ate the gyudon beef bowl instead and it taste rotten too!!! I paid $25 for this?! I end up throwing away everything, I’m very disappointed I just wanted to get some lunch on my break time and end up starving instead and wasting my $25! I highly do not recommend this place! Serving rotten food and overpriced for the quality of there food!

google.name: Gotham Pizza
google.address: 1667 1st Ave., New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: I recently visited Gotham Pizza and was blown away by how delicious their pizza is. The crust is perfectly crispy, the sauce is rich and flavorful, and the cheese is just the right amount of gooey goodness. I also took advantage of their lunch special: two slices of pizza and a soda or water for only $6.00. It's an incredible deal for the quality you get—definitely a steal! Whether you're in the mood for a quick lunch or a satisfying slice, Gotham Pizza is the place to go.

Continuing my hunt for the best regular slice on the UES, and tried Gotham Pizza on this beautiful Sunday night in June. Ordered a regular slice and a margherita slice, and they were fair.

Just meeting NY standards, and I’d give their regular slice a 7.1/10. The marg slice was also fair, probably a 7.4/10. The crusts on both were nice and thin, but the flavors weren’t anything super special. They were good, but not great. They didn’t take my pants off, or whatever the kids say these days.

Good pizza, but not the slice that will win the top spot for best regular slice.
Amazing pizza for a great Price! Can’t go wrong! Had the Margarita Pizza, which was delicious, then been back here almost every evening while my 10 day visit to New York!
Their vodka sauce is SO good. I personally really enjoyed it and don't get the bad reviews. Definitely a bit pricey but it was worth it!

Visited Gotham Pizza today.  Its wasn't near as good as I was told, in fact I was disappointed.  On a scale of 1 through 10, I'll give it a 5. It has a roomy inside dining area and wasn't busy.  You can dine inside if yours vaxxed, I didn't see any tables and chairs outside.  The prices where $8.95 for 2 pieces....just wasn't worth it.  Will I go back??  No, I will not be returning.
Gotham Pizza is located at 1162 1st Ave.  In New York City. 10028

google.name: Hanabi
google.address: 1450 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: The Tokyo fried chicken, California roll, tempura bento box is a good value at $18.24 (tax included). They also have lunch specials for less than $15. But it may better to get takeout as Hanabi is quite small (8 tables for 2) with no real ambience.

Been coming here for almost 2 years and I travel all the way from Harlem or when I’m on the way back. The service is excellent, fast and the food is excellent. Make sure you get that lunch special during the week!

Great Japanese restaurant with extremely reasonable pricing especially considering the location. $13-$15 for a bento box is almost unheard of in this area. I can finally indulge in my favorite food without going broke! This place offers a large variety of dishes, their own delivery service (which costs slightly less than third party delivery companies), and the food is excellent with generous portions. The staff are very nice and eager to please.

It seems they mostly serve take-out and deliver orders as the atmosphere in the restaurant itself leaves much to be desired. They also serve dine-in meals using only plastic which was a turn off for me. Hopefully they will be able to make some improvements in the future.

In regard to their delivery service, we only waited about 30-45 minutes before they were at our door and the food was hot and fresh unlike DoorDash or other delivery companies which tend to make stops along the way. Overall, I highly recommend this place. It is a hidden gem!

I’ve lived near this place for years and it has been my consistent takeout joint. The place is Chinese owned and operated, quality is fresh and the staff works quickly. My partner who is vegetarian also loves their options and I take it as a good sign that I’ve never gotten sick of or sick from eating here. The menu is crazy extensive, they offer a variety of different types of Asian cuisines outside of sushi, from pad thai to ramen, bentos and donburi bowls. Would definitely recommend the sushi rolls over some of the noodle dishes. It’s not a glam place to take out of towners, but a simple, no frills, solid takeout option after a long workday-kind of place with some seating if you don’t want to deal with packaging. Last note is they close well before 10, generally around 9:30-9:45 at the latest for orders and you’ll definitely not be allowed to dine in after 9:20.

[iBrowsing] for any Japanese restaurant in Manhattan that serves an ‘unagi’ entree or Donburi was particularly rarer than it’s availability overall anywhere. So, the lowered price menu on this Unagi Donburi was very satisfactory. One decent sized unagi coated with a generous amount of teriyaki sauce over a type of rice which was not a standard Japanese variety.,The restaurant is small and has several tables though very outdated and basically on average, adequate for its purpose. It’s a nice family owned business, not authentic Japanese per se, but they do a really brisk business for its location on Second Avenue. Recommended if, it’s something quick and easy for grabbing a quick fixed meal, for sushi or other deep fried selection. The tempura was not at all the same in pricier places but, palatable at best.

google.name: Sushi of Gari UES
google.address: 402 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: Shocked to have off tasting sushi and rolls.  Neither one of us could manage to eat more than one piece and it was quite unpleasant after that.  Never got sick but we were pretty queasy.  Manager took $50 off the ~$275 meal.   Won’t be back again and that saddens me because it was good in the past.

This isn't a very big place. We sat at the bar. One of the things I noticed was that the sushi chefs were prepping a lot of sushi orders for delivery.

We tried the omakase ($166) per person. We spent $400 for two omakase and a glass of wine. We had 15 pieces each.  The sushi was not great, but very pricey. The pieces came at a very fast pace. We were full. In general I'm not a huge big fan of omakase since I don't know in advance what I will be getting.

We won't be back.
One of the best sushi in town! We had omakase and all sushi pieces were like artwork! Its very pricey but you get what you paid for. Highly recommended!

Sushi from NYC's old school sushiya, Sushi of Gari. It once it held a one Michelin star but not anymore to my knowledge. It is definitely one of the restaurants that started the sushi culture in the early 1990s for New Yorkers and still keeps its class to some level. For sushi perhaps, I have had better looking ones, however, the full umami flavor from its aged fresh fish was another level. You can copy the look, but the flavor was unique and this place had that depth. Of course out of their own pride or dignity, they are too cool to offer miso soup or a maki along with the nigiri. Nonetheless, I think you still need to try it at least once. I personally found their sautéd tomato garnish over the salmon nigiri very interesting. It was such a surprise how much umami flavor came out from pairing the salmon and tomato. Also, the funniest part is that the $140 sushi omakase comes with fresh wasabi, but the $40 something chirashi comes with cheap soulless dry wasabi lol...you definitely get what you pay for here....or a bit less.

Speaking of the chirashi don, even though you are getting low quality, gloomy wasabi, the fish on top of the sushi rice are still very pronounced. The snapper was aged well, as I chewed a few times its flavor hit my tongue. For the akami, I usually feel that it is bland compared to other tuna cuts, but not from here. It is definitely a nice and economical way to taste aged fresh fish flavors.

I see many reviews of disappointment with the food or service. However, it is worth trying in my opinion.

We did the omakase. Everything was very good. We had three people at a table of eight with dietary restrictions and they were very accommodating. A lot of omakase chefs will not accommodate dietary restrictions.

google.name: Le Pain Quotidien
google.address: 1131 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: First off, I will say that the mint lemonade is an absolute must. I will get it once a week. It is not too sweet, perfectly tart, and so fresh. The brownies and tarts are delicious. On the downside, my dining in experience was sub-par. Service was pretty slow, and the food was just ok. I much prefer the bakery items. The French cream donut was also sort of a miss for me, it tasted old. Not sure if that’s how it was supposed to taste or not. Nonetheless, high stars for the lemonade and other baked good items. Also, the man working at the bakery register is always very pleasant every time I stop by!

We are tourists from the Bay Area, and we met a friend for coffee and a bite to eat here on a beautiful Fall Saturday afternoon, and this place was packed! Feels like mostly locals for the most part. Not too much to say about the food, and it felt short-staffed at the time, but it happens.

Disappointing Visit to Le Pain Quotidien
My recent visit to Le Pain Quotidien fell short of expectations. While we were promptly seated, it took a significant amount of time for our server to acknowledge us. Once we ordered, the portions were surprisingly small, especially considering the price. My tomato sandwich, for example, left me feeling unsatisfied. To make matters worse, the iced matcha latte had clumps of undissolved matcha powder, and getting the bill took another long wait. Overall, the slow service and underwhelming food quality detracted from the experience.

The communal table experience.

Had the mashed avo on sourdough toast, a fresh fruit salad and an Iced cappuccino. The food is very good.

At first I had to summon a waiter to take my order, however, after year service was good.

Good quality food that tastes fresh is something that just can’t be beat! I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and mozzarella melt and the iced matcha latte. Also, sitting at the community table was so much fun! They have outlets so you can charge your phone and a lot of people had their laptops and were doing their own thing. It was a really nice experience!

google.name: Jackson Hole
google.address: 232 E 64th St A, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: For the portion sizes and quality, the prices are totally worth it. If you’re craving a satisfying, old school burger, Jackson Hole is a must-visit. I’ll definitely be back soon!
Whoa... I had a ball coming here. The food was terrific. The burgers were humongous. Loved the service. The staff was great. The atmosphere was excellent.

Cool place!!! I love the Western theme. I settled on The Brie Berry Burger - a brie cheese, bacon and blueberry compote burger. Very interesting, but didn't have a sharp counter point to the cloyingness of the blueberries; the bacon and patty disappeared into the compote and the bread got soggy. Still, it was fun and different than anything I've had recently. Fries were pretty standard. I really enjoyed the peanut butter shake. That was really delicious. Service was oddly aloof, inexperienced, the type where they call you "boss".

I would definitely return and wish I had several lifetimes to try everything on their extensive menu.

Not related-

Mind your conversational topics when you go out to eat. A couple next to me were talking about problems in their NYC apartments after they finished their food and I before I begun mine. I have a strong stomach, but it's still uncouth.

Wow amazing Truffle Gouda cheese burger 🍔 and BBQ Truffle Gouda cheese burger with curly fries, sweet potato fries also fantastic Mac and cheese!! Chicken tenders with waffle fries was also amazing!! Best burgers in NYC!!!
Really cool vibe for this place. Great variety of food. Pickles brought to the table instead of traditional bread was a nice touch. Food was delicious with very generous portions.

google.name: Domino's Pizza
google.address: 1841 1st Ave., New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: The wings were the most disgusting things I ever tasted. I’ve never had worse food in my life. A total waste of my money. The wings were cold, slimy, and raw texture. Absolutely disgusting.

There was only one employee in this store. I entered the store. I wasn't greeted. I wasn't acknowledged until the person before me had got their order, but it was as if I didn't exist. I waited for about 10 minutes before the employee even acknowledged my existence. Probably will not return.

I placed the order and the pie took 1 hour and 50 mins to show up. And the Dominos is only five blocks away. If I wasn’t working I would’ve picked it up myself. Delivery guy shows up speaks no English. I just wanted to make sure if my pie was warm he left with my food. I had to call back again to let them know.
Dominos should bring back the deal if you don’t bring it before 45 minutes your pie is free !!! Just got my pie instead of having a pepperoni pizza Ir came out to be pepperoni and ham Smh.. 😑
Terrible customer service. They don’t greet you as you walk in the door and they are extremely rude very unwelcoming staff

I went in there to order a pizza and I noticed that none of the employees had on gloves. So I politely asked the guy may he put gloves on to make my pizza. With a deadass face he told me no … mind you prior to him making my pizza he was on the phone, touching the computer screen and didn’t wash hands. Then when I complain and ask for a refund everyone wants to speak in Spanish … they will NEVER get a dollar from me again. Poor service, unsanitary

google.name: Nobu Fifty Seven
google.address: 40 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Highlight for me was the crispy rice with a caviar. You can’t go wrong with these two. The rest of the dishes were pretty good but we were a bit puzzled by the squid pasta as the serving wasn’t really substantial as an entree dish and it tasted like wok-fried veggies. So wasn’t really pleased by that. Decent soju too. You come to Nobu for the scene but not to have punchy Japanese dishes.

Phenomenal meal with custom made dishes by the head chef.   This was a busy Monday night, but the team made us feel like we were the only ones there.

Truly a memorable experience.

And the sake was unreal!

Went to Nobu 57 for their 30th anniversary special. Upon arriving on time, we were told that our table wasn’t ready yet. After tables have been set up, we thought it would be omakase experience by the bar but were sat on table. Which was totally okay. The issue was, they were quick to get our orders but the time it took for 5 dishes to arrive took a lot longer than expected. There were gaps as long as 30 minutes just waiting for the next course. The staffs were very quick to remove the finished plates off the tables but for the next menu to come out there were numerous awkward time gaps between. The guests next to our table left after being upset. We managed to receive all our menu and took us about 2 hours. The staffs did apologize every time our dishes came out but still was not something I expected.

Worst part is when they come out with the dishes and explain the menu, you cant hear them even though they are right next to you. The music sound and restaurant noise made it impossible to hear the explanation. We just ended up nodding our heads and eating and guessing. Reminded me more of a bar due to the loud noise and music.

Food was good but wait time and atmosphere were far different from what I expected. Wouldn’t recommend this place if you are looking for an authentic (or close to) Omakase experience or Japanese food. For just a casual dinner out, would recommend.

Nobu 57 in NYC delivers an exceptional dining experience from start to finish. The ambiance is sleek and sophisticated, perfect for a special night out. The food is simply outstanding—every dish is beautifully presented and packed with incredible flavors. The signature Black Cod with Miso and the Yellowtail Jalapeño are absolute must-tries. The sushi is fresh and melts in your mouth. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations throughout the meal. Though on the pricier side, the quality of the food and the overall experience make it worth every penny. Nobu 57 is a dining experience you won’t forget!

This place was worth both the hype and the price. The food was outstanding!! The sashimi was so smooth and tasty and you can definitely tell they use fresh fish. For lunch I got the lunch box which came with a little bit of everything. I Personally got the salmon bowl but they had like 4 other options as well. Highly recommend this place if you get the chance.

google.name: JoJo by Jean-Georges
google.address: 160 E 64th St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text:
It's not funny but funny in a sad way . One of the best meals I had in the 80s was at the Drake Hotel, when Jean Georges was the chef, with a group of my fellow staff from the River Cafe. We were blown away. It was so good.

The last time I ate at JoJo was probably in the 90s since I'm rarely in the upper east side. But I've certainly been to other Jean George restaurants downtown and many of the places the Tin building.

Hence my shock at some of the dishes we had the other night at JoJo.

Pinky toe crab dumplings sounded amazing, but were thoroughly disappointing when it hit the table. It looked like a bowl of beige liquid. The lemongrass flavor was very one note and overwhelming. The dumplings were uninteresting. There was no garnish. Just a sad looking dish.

The Greek salad with beets was almost worse. Any NY diner makes a more appetizing and certainly more generous Greek salad albeit without beets. It was flat and skimpy with an acrid dressing.

Ridiculous at a restaurant of this "caliber" and cost to ask how a guest wants the fish done and then not cook it the way they asked for. For the record medium rare was requested and well done was how it arrived.

My charred duck was indeed blackened but the skin was not crisp. It was flabby and inedible.

The only decent dish was the chicken. Although the potatoes tasted briny which was odd, but may have been the intent.

The waitress accidentally showered us with champagne which she was very apologetic for. It may have been a blessing since they comped the terrible appetizers as a nice gesture.

It's crazy to me that a chef with such a great reputation let's his staff drop the ball on keeping up his standards.

Oh, and the acoustics were crazy loud. So noisy.

I’m really impressed with this place! The small plates are beautiful, each one different, and the decor is elegant，just right for someone like me👸🏻 The appetizers were flavorful, though the chicken wasn’t the best. But for a restaurant week menu, there’s not much to complain about. The service was great, I’ll definitely be coming back to here

My husband and I dined at JoJo many times, and it continues to be one of our favorite go-to spots, along with other Jean-Georges restaurants.

As someone who mostly eats organic food, I truly appreciate that JoJo emphasizes mostly organic, clean, and locally sourced ingredients. This commitment to quality highlights the restaurant’s focus on freshness and sustainability, making it an excellent choice for anyone who cares about what they eat.

The warm, casual atmosphere at JoJo creates an inviting space for any occasion—whether it’s a relaxed date night or a casual dinner with friends. The service is consistently exceptional, with friendly staff who always make us feel welcome.

Overall, JoJo delivers a delightful dining experience that we look forward to enjoying time and again.

The food here was very good. The salmon was top notch and cooked to perfection. The upper floor was just lovely being inside a townhouse. The service although very nice, was slow, where they checked in on us way too much in the beginning and then disappeared for an hour with no update. It's August, but it was uncomfortably hot in there. I enjoyed my meal very much, but wouldn't rush back.
This place is so cute!! I love the vibes and it was so nice for a girls dinner. It’s just pricier though. And I wasn’t blown away by the food or the service. But overall a nice experience

google.name: Patsy's Pizzeria
google.address: 206 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: The staff treated us with respect, and the food—salmon and chicken—was delicious. The salmon was cooked just the way I wanted it: well done! The outdoor seating or the upper floor might have a better view, but the ground floor doesn't offer anything special, so it's best to just enjoy your meal :)

AMAZING!! Delicious pizza and awesome service! Visiting for the US Open. Stopped in after meeting some locals and they highly recommend Patsy’s. We’ll be back!!🎾🍕🗽
Thank you, Marcella and team!
I love rigatoni bolognese.  I have had it in dozens of restaurants. At patsy's, the sauce was so salty it was almost inedible.  The rigatoni was perfect, though.
Owner Jennifer is great. Happy time with my sister here. Wonderful people, place and food. Slow stewed 6h beef is amazing

Went here for the first time with some family. We ordered the margarita pizza to start and then I had spaghetti and meatballs for my entree. The pizza was delicious! The crust was nice and thin and the sauce and cheese were delicious. The spaghetti and meatballs were very good! Just a personal preference I would have def liked the pasta more aldente and less sauce. The staff was super friendly and nice. Will def be back!

google.name: Aquavit
google.address: 65 E 55th St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: I got the lunch tasting menu. The food was a bit underwhelming for a 2-Michelin-star. Nothing was bad, but nothing stood out either. The best dish was probably the king crab leg.  Maybe the dinner tasting menu is better? Service was excellent. Ambiance is upscale and thoughtful.

Creative, elegant & impressive. This is an award-winning restaurant with good reason. The service was impeccable & the food was truly next level. Really incredible dishes and also appreciated that the portion sizes were just right. I often get too full mid-way through tasting menus and can’t fully enjoy the remaining courses, but this menu really thoughtfully prioritized flavor & uniqueness over scale.

Came to aquavit with a large party for a special occasion, and overall it was great. The food is exceptional, and at the end of the day, that’s what really matters. The Arctic birds nest is perhaps the greatest thing I have ever eaten, on top of it being a piece of art.

The service was pretty poor for a restaurant of this standing, but that may be because we had a large party. Nevertheless, when you pay the money you do for an experience like this, you hope for something a bit more special. When I think of the “experience” I want from a restaurant like this, I’m not sure aquavit lived up to that, but the food was incredible and is worthy of the praise and price tag.

Fantastic experience at Aquavit. Came in for a celebratory lunch and they were very welcoming and accommodating of dietary restrictions as well. Service was superb from start to finish.

Bread service was a great way to start. The cute little gluten free loaf comes with a side of olive oil and is delicious! The butter is fantastic as well.

First course: we had the herring and king crab Skagen. The herring was good and the dish was well balanced even though ours was dairy free and went well with the gluten free crackers. The king crab Skagen was a standout - essentially a perfectly executed king crab salad on a delicious buttery brioche bun.

Second Course: the cod was an absolute stand out. Our expectations was high given its nordic cuisine and fish forward and even then they were exceeded...the cod was beautifully cooked where it was moist inside but somehow still maintained a nice crust. The flavors were perfectly balanced and we couldn't stop raving about this dish. The Wagyu short rib was decent but we wouldn't really recommend it and would advise to stick to the fish forward dishes here...ours was a bit dry but the seasoning and demi-glace was on point.

Dessert: the artics bird nest is a thing of beauty and as delicious as it is pretty. Flagship worthy and honestly transcendent. This is a dish that cannot be missed. They were kind and also gifted us with a complimentary chocolate dessert which was also very good.

Our server was the perfect balance between being friendly and warm while still delivering Michelin level service and attention.

Food was beautifully presented and well executed. We really enjoyed our meal and will definitely be back with our daughter as she loves seafood.

Thank you for such a memorable experience and lunch team Aquavit!

I treated myself to the chef's tasting menu, and couldn't be happier with my experience. I was a bit worried I would regret spending so much money, but the morning after, I am still feeling elated. The flavors were spectacular, especially the sauces. The crab and duck really stood out to me. The wine pairing is a really nice addition to the experience and I even got a princess cake for my birthday. The parting gift was a nice touch. Overall, spendy but worth it in my opinion. I also dined solo and was warmly welcomed and not made to feel weird for being by myself.

google.name: Alice's Tea Cup
google.address: 102 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: I love Alice’s Tea Cup. Typically, I’m on the East side and I’ll go there but today I wanted to get scones to go and I was on the West side. This location seems nice. I was in a hurry and couldn’t stay for tea today but the scones, specifically, the pumpkin scones with the clotted cream and jam are my favourite. I highly recommend it as well as sitting down for a nice cup if tea when you’re in the neighbourhood. They have a nice variety of teas.

This little cafe is adorable! Alice in Wonderland themed! My friend and I had the "Mad hatter" Tea for Two. This includes two types of tea, two types of sandwiches, 3 types of scones and a dessert that also came with mini macarons and cookies. The price was very reasonable for two people. You can also order take out!

This is one of our favorite spot for our family in our neighborhood! Must experience especially for a little one. Ask for fairy dusk and wings.  From the staff to the decor to the tableware, the details just make this place is so magical. Scones are on par with London and selection of teas are amazing. Our daughter ask to go here every year for her birthday. Such a special place to spend time with family and paint with our travel painting kits!
Great place with great service. You can have a cup of tea here, or buy tea leafs to brew at home. The staff knows a lot about each type they sell so don't be shy to ask questions.

Went for my daughters birthday and it was very nice quaint place, very clean. Staff was super friendly and helpful with suggestions. The food came out pretty quickly and everything was nice and fresh. They offered to go cups if you don’t finish your hot tea, they don’t rush you to leave. They definitely don’t put the receipt down until you actually ask for the bill definitely a go to place if you have a tea lover.

google.name: Le Pain Quotidien
google.address: 861 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: The food was good. I tried the Sunny bowl and was surprised at first by the presentation and second by the flavor. Everything worked so well together and each bite just got better and better. They have nice things in the menu for kids and adults. I would love to bring my kids to try the mini pancakes. They definitely looked amazing.

I have never been more frustrated waiting for a to-go sandwich in my entire life. I placed my order, paid for it, and stood there for 15 minutes before the staff realized that they simply forgot my order. I then waited for another 15 minutes for them to simply heat up a simple sandwich. This is absolutely unacceptable and I hope NO ONE goes there again.

Lovely staff, good food, tasty bevs - BUT my latte should not be so hot I can’t drink it for 30+ mins.

Firstly it’s painful and potentially dangerous, and the latte is not an accessory to carry for my commute.

This is a regular consideration that café staff should be mindful about.

Schedule an order over an hour ahead, then when it's supposed to be here already, they tell me there's no more. You'd think it'd be a good idea to save what someone already paid for on the side.
They asked me to cancel on my end, but I couldn't, and when I called back to tell them, they literally hung up on me.
Very upset.

I stopped in here for the third time  at the 370 lexington avenue location on the way to an eye doctors appointment next door I grabbed a French cream donut after seeing it on their advertisement outside looked so delicious I had to grab one!!. Last time I came here on my 2nd visit I had a chocolate muffin with a medium coffee which was also delicious!!. Service is fast as well!. Oh yeah the hot chocolate Definitely goes well with the French cream donut!!

yelp.name: Le Pain Quotidien
yelp.address: E 72nd St And 5th Ave, New York, NY 10021

google.name: Bella Blu
google.address: 967 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text:
• One of the few truly authentic Italian restaurants in the Upper East Side.
• My favorite spot is the table next to the window.
• The food is consistently delicious and the ambiance is cozy.
• The interior decor is interesting and eye-catching.
• The staff is always friendly and welcoming.
• The owner is frequently present on the floor, ensuring a high-quality experience.
• An excellent choice for everyday dining.

Our favorite meal on a recent long weekend visit to the city.   The food is authentic Italy.  We were with a relatively boisterous group and our waiter rolled with it.  He was a lot of fun.  The food is truly marvelous.

Good Italian restaurant on the UES
Pretty decor, good service and delicious menu

Superb ambiance, a true feeling of Italian hospitality in a fun way. Loud, welcoming, over the top and even extravagant. The food was great (we had octopus and buratta) but the service was even better. We had a minor inconvenience during our dinner and waiters went out of their way to make up for it and make our dinner memorable (they did not have to).

Nice place with a very good wine list.
Food very good, fresh, and perfectly cooked.
Comfortable, table correct, and a bit just in space. Tables are too close to each other.
I can't give five stars because prices are high and speaking about wine absolutely out of order.

google.name: Famous Original Ray's Pizza
google.address: 811 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: Everything was so good. The pizza is something I will dream about. The people working were very nice. It was a lively atmosphere of people just hanging out enjoying their lunch. Consistently busy but didn’t have to wait. Had a beer and a slice. Will be back.

Good tasty pizza.  I do recommend if you're hungry and need a quick bite. Slices are large. Nice selection of toppings. The dough was a bit too thick, which made it taste a little raw. Thank you to all the workers. It is so hot in there, my brain almost melted.

Not exactly the original ray's, but with is infamous name, they sling decent pies like most other pizza shops in the city.

I've stopped in here several times for a slice. It's pretty close to quintessential nyc pizza. I appreciate that they go beyond just plain and pepperoni.  Garlic knots are pretty good too.

Nice enough guys behind the counter and any slice is good as long as you ensure it hasn't sat there for too long.  I've had a miss or two. The oven reheat can only do so much.

Came here today with my chorus group visiting from Virginia and absolutely disgusted with the service and the food provided. If i could give the service zero stars i would, cook was so rude to my chaperones as well as my classmates. They didn’t even fully melt cheese on the cheesesteaks. The cook started to yell at us when we didn’t answer quick enough if the food was “to-go or for here”. They started just throwing out to go food in bags with a paper plate. Cook just had an overall disgusting attitude and we were nothing but nice. They were forgetting orders, getting an attitude when we were correcting them, raising their voices. My pizza wasn’t bad, but the service was absolutely unacceptable and my classmates dishes were forgotten, carelessly thrown into bags, aluminum foil was cut and lodged into pepperoni rolls, and the list goes on. very disappointed.
In a city of exceptional pizza, this was average. Decent price, good size, if you're walking by it's perfectly fine to stop and grab a slice, it's not a destination pizza.

google.name: David Burke Tavern
google.address: 135 E 62nd St, New York, NY 10065, USA

review_snippets.text: We stopped by here during restaurant week for their unorthodox set up where patrons sit side by side like at a bar. The mussels were well seasoned and tasted great. Both the tartare and the scallops were crafted well and rich in flavors. I look forward to coming back here again

Excellent service, we had tuna tare, tomato salad, bison short rib pasta. Excellent all around. Our server bartender was amazing. Drinks perfect. Ac was not working well, the high tops where not ment for sitting and chatting as two old friends. You had to sit side by side. Dave being a big fellow, these seats sucked. Ac out fail. But u are one heck of a chef and the food was amazing. David is probably the only chef id allow to get away with these short comings as a restaurant owner & chef. Kinda ridiculous, big guy.

Very nice experience at the David Burke Tavern, we visited during restaurant week. The food was nice, and the staff friendly.
The salad was very tasty, then we had the swordfish which was a little overcooked and the chicken BLT sandwich, bacon was a tad bit dry and felt also overcooked.
We did not get dessert.

Classic beautiful townhouse made restaurant  bar.  Pork chop with mussels etc excellent , salmon delicious and steak tender.  The waitress was a little off and forgot my bday even though my wife told them 100x...

Mussels were so well seasoned and a delight. The tartare and scallops - Both dishes were exquisite- bursting with flavor. It was our engagement celebration and they brought out champagne to begin with. We had the halibut and the Kansas City strip steak for entrees. Both were done really well and delicious. My review will encompass service and drink choices since I came in for happy hour. Decor and service were top-notch; also quite surprised to see this tavern literally next door to my office. Layout includes a very long bar with seating opposite and more seating upstairs. The drinks menu is also quite long-a number of beers and cocktails. I had a couple of their beers during happy hour for half price. Service was professional, friendly; the staff was very well dressed. Looking forward to returning to try the food menu, in particular considering that David Burke is just blocks away.

google.name: Kimpton Hotel Eventi
google.address: 851 6th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

review_snippets.text: Very nice room with lots of stuff to do around the hotel. The one thing I don’t like about this Hotel is that the Taxis are $120 dollars to Newark. This is an absurd price I was able to get first class tickets on Amtrak to the terminal for less and faster. Another thing I like about this location was that it was in a not busy place. I didn’t hear that much noise at night compared to when I stayed at other hotels in New York. But overall a nice place if I come back to New York I might stay in this hotel but will not be taking the taxi

This is my new favorite hotel in Manhattan!
My wife and I stayed there last week.  From the minute you walk in the door the people are so friendly.
Our room was very comfortable, clean and well appointed.
Great neighborhood too!

Disappointing Stay – Not Up to Kimpton Standards

I recently stayed at the Kimpton Eventi for a few days, and unfortunately, it did not live up to my expectations. Having stayed at other Kimptons, like the one in Paris, it’s hard not to feel that comparing them would be disrespectful to the other properties.

While there was a large team of concierges, most of them were indifferent throughout our stay. They rarely greeted us or opened doors, often too busy chatting or on their phones. The exception was the team members who helped us with our luggage on Monday, 21st October around 5 PM, genuinely nice and helpful.

The breakfast was a huge letdown. The complimentary options were extremely limited—just a croissant with fruit or an American breakfast. I waited 40 minutes for my order to arrive, only to be told that the delay was because I ordered hard-boiled eggs, which apparently take longer to prepare. As for elite members,  was surprising that not even a complimentary bottle of water was provided in the room, aside from a $10 bottle of still water for purchase.

One of the most frustrating aspects was the charge for storing our luggage after check-out—an absolutely ridiculous policy. The room itself was very basic. No coffee machine, no blankets, and the pillows... To make matters worse our room was located next to the cleaner’s storage room, which meant banging doors starting early in the morning.

The few positives: we had an amazing view from the 21st  floor, with a great view of the Empire State Building. The cleaning staff was also very friendly.

While the hotel is in a walkable location for many Manhattan sights, the area itself felt noisy and a bit tacky, with street vendors constantly trying to sell you something. If I were to return to New York, I’d probably stay in Chelsea instead, where the food markets and restaurants seem quieter and offer a better overall experience.

I’m a travel advisor so I’ve had the opportunity to stay at numerous properties. I love the Kimpton Hotel Eventi because its staff goes above and beyond for guests. Will, Robert, Athina and Tizul provided excellent personalized service to me during my stay. The hotel itself is lovely and all requests were met with kindness. The room was immaculate and the restaurant food was delicious. I highly recommend this hotel to visitors of NYC.

My Wife and Daughter stayed last week and they did like the location (the main reason we chose it) and the the rooms were nice but my Wife asked that I specifically mention the great service from Celine at the front desk.  She was friendly and professional and offered lots of good tips.  I hope Kimpton hooks her up if they read this :)

yelp.name: Kimpton Hotel Eventi
yelp.address: 851 Avenue Of The Americas, New York, NY 10001

google.name: Park Lane Hotel New York
google.address: 36 Central Park S South, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Traveled for work. Great value for location, appreciate being able to find an affordable yet quality stay for my business trip. The beds were very comfortable. Shower was comfortable, but the way the doors are designed the floor gets soaked which I'm not a huge fan of. Staff were friendly and helpful where needed. All in all would recommend, if looking for a budget friendly option and within decent distance of sights.

Beautiful hotel and extremely comfortable beds. For a hotel marketed as luxury I would expect crisp details. The heating unit is very old and loud that it woke me up several times (I’m a hard sleeper). The website clearly states the rooftop dining area opens at 7 am but when the door was locked staffed told me it’s actually 7:30 and the website was inaccurate.

This hotel was absolutely amazing. We had the panoramic park view room and it was beautiful. No issues with air conditioning I even had to turn it down a little because it was so cool! The guest service staff was very attentive and sent up anything we needed promptly including a crib for our baby. The room was big enough for him to crawl around and have a great time. 100% recommend.

The hotel’s location was fantastic! As a runner, being able to just cross the road and run in Central Park was a major highlight.

The room was always cleaned well by housekeeping.

I also loved having breakfast on the rooftop; the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Special mention to Dwight, who brought a positive and welcoming energy every morning.

Overall, the entire staff was respectful and made my stay enjoyable.

I have stayed at The Park Lane several times when I go to the city for business.  The location is perfect.  The staff is always very attentive and the accommodations are wonderful, especially if you have a Park view.  The rooftop bar, Darling, is a wonderful spot to enjoy a drink after a long day.

yelp.name: Park Lane Hotel
yelp.address: 36 Central Park South, New York, NY 10019

google.name: Connolly's
google.address: 121 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Awesome little Irish pub.  We visited a couple times due to close proximity to our hotel.  Drinks on the 4th floor roof was kind of fun just to be outside and look down the street.  We ate here as well and enjoyed the food.  Great menu.  Fun place.

It's the place to go when visiting New york, 121 West 45th Street right beside Times Square. Premises are clean and tidy, food is wonderful and staff are great and if you are lucky enough to run into Bernie (the host with the most) he will regale you with stories from past, present and even future and not a crystal ball in sight, He is kind with his time and generous to a fault, The world needs more Bernie's . An amazing experience. 5 stars all around See you all soon  ....

What a great place.  It's huge too.  Great food. Great staff. Bernie is awesome. Collects challenge coins and patches. (Military, LEO, Fire, etc)
Great pub atmosphere.  My new fav place in NYC.

My wife and I were recently in New York from Scotland and Connolly's was my favourite place for a beer!

They have so many beers on tap, the staff are very friendly and the atmosphere is relaxed and chilled.

The patrons were also more knowledgeable about football (soccer) than they were in some other establishments that I watched the Euros in!

THE COOLEST PUB!! Great service, we were on vacation and it was a weekday and the joint was hopping! Food was fast, hot and delicious. We will be back for sure when we return to NYC! Oh the balcony view is super cool!

google.name: Oohu Szechuan & Canton Cuisines
google.address: 128 W 36th St., New York, NY 10018, USA

review_snippets.text:
I had a great experience at this restaurant. The food is super authentic Chinese, and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients. The fish dish, topped with green onions, was especially delicious – cooked perfectly and full of flavor. The other dishes we tried were tasty, with a nice balance of spices that made everything feel genuine and satisfying.

The delivery was quick, and the prices are extremely reasonable, especially for Midtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly and made us feel comfortable from the start. Overall, it’s a fantastic spot for anyone looking for authentic Chinese food without breaking the bank. I’ll definitely be back.

Recommend dishes: 葱花鱼，干锅牛蛙，爆炒腰花

This restaurant was a fantastic find! The dishes were packed with authentic flavors—spicy, savory, and full of that signature numbing sensation that Sichuan cuisine is known for. Each dish was beautifully presented and had the perfect balance of spice and freshness. The ingredients tasted top-notch, and the seasonings were bold without overwhelming the natural flavors. If you’re a fan of Chinese food, this place is a must-try! Highly recommend for anyone craving real  Chinese food!

This place knows how to bring bold flavors to the table! I ordered the *Spring Bamboo & Beef Casserole*, which was so homey and delicious—the beef was super tender, and the bamboo had a nice crunch. The *Green Peppercorn Fish* stole the show for me, though. It’s spicy in the best way possible, and the fish was incredibly fresh.

The *Boneless Pork Knuckles* were packed with flavor and practically melted in my mouth, and I really enjoyed the *Stir-Fried Kidney*, which was seasoned perfectly without being overpowering. The *Frog Dry Pot* was a fun surprise—it’s loaded with spices and made me a fan of frog meat! Overall, a fantastic meal with great service and a cozy atmosphere. Highly recommend if you’re into authentic Sichuan flavors!

The service is excellent, the staff are very friendly, the place is very clean and comfy. It is so hard to find a good restaurant like this around Manhattan. Love the spicy level, perfect for my level of spice. This place might be a perfect spot for Mark Wiens, who loves spicy foods and travelling around the world. Mark Wiens needs to try this place out.
