My friends, family, adults, and kids are very happy with the food. Not all foods are spicy. There are non-spicy foods for kids too. And you also can request the spicy levels that you like. This is definitely the spot for family dinner events and lunch with friends. I would rather eat healthy foods here than eat other quick foods outside.

I visited this restaurant last night with some friends, and we ordered a few dishes to share. The Young Bamboo & Beef Casserole was super comforting, with tender beef and fresh bamboo that soaked up all the rich flavors. The Green Peppercorn Fish really brought the heat with those Sichuan spices—spicy but so addictively numbing. The Boneless Pork Knuckles were surprisingly soft and flavorful, with just the right amount of kick, and the Stir-Fried Kidney had a unique, earthy flavor that grew on me with each bite.

The highlight for me, though, was the Frog Dry Pot. The spices were spot on, and the frog was cooked perfectly—not something I’d typically order, but I’m glad I tried it. Portions were generous, and the staff was attentive. Definitely coming back to explore more of the menu!

google.name: Carmine's
google.address: 200 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: I love the family style food, it's so easy to share different items with friends and family. It looks somewhat like a traditional Italian restaurant and it was packed to the brim, lots of tourists due to the location. The service was good, it can be a bit erratic when they get super busy but they are doing their best. We ordered several different items and they were all delicious with generous portions. We also ordered the Titanic dessert and it was a massive pile of ice cream, brownie, strawberries, and whipped cream. It definitely hit the spot.

This place came highly recommended. We made reservations for 6 pm. Crowds were waiting outside. Once we got in we were told they were running behind. We didn't get seated until 6:30. Unfortunately we got seated at a busy spot and all evening long I kept getting my seat bumped. Our waiter brought over a basket of bread plus two glasses of prosecco for our anniversary dinner. Our waiter was very helpful in advising us on what to order. He recommended chicken marsala over spaghetti, just one order to split. It turned out the plate could have fed four people. It was good. The portion size makes up for the expensive dish since it is huge. It was hard to hear but it was a lively atmosphere.

We all loved the place. It was Sunday morning, so good thing that we made a reservation as it was totally packed. Our table for 6 was ready within 5 minutes or less, however our server took like 15 minutes to come by and get our order. We loved the calamari and the artichokes, got the special with 4 different pastas and the veal. All to share. Everything was delicious. We will definitely come back on our next visit to NYC. If it's your first time, beware of the amount of food on each plate. We were 6 and couldn't finish it all.

You should make reservations. Place is packed! Pretty loud too with all the people and music. Food is really really good. Bread basket is a pass. Bread needs to be warm to be good as it came out cold. Fried Calamari is tasty. Chicken cutlet was good too...wish it was crispy though for texture difference. Now the Rigatoni Country Style pasta was amazing. I could just drink the sauce lol. Everything is large portion sizes so be prepared to come with several people or take a lot home for left overs.

Visited Carmine's in a span of 2 weeks, still did not disappoint.

There was a large crowd and really need to wait, so make reservations as much as possible to avoid disappointment.

Service still awesome, food still massive and generous!

Overall, a great experience before heading home!!

google.name: Bryant Park Grill
google.address: 25 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

review_snippets.text: Omg! the place was so good! It was an accidental find for a traveller like me. I went to Bryant Park to see the Christmas lighting and it started raining and I found solace on this restaurant as it’s bang opposite to the park. It’s gorgeous from inside. We had a crab cake which was delicious and ordered  seafood pasta which had clams, scallops and prawns. This one was very good too. And the best part was the dessert- called as chocolate tart but it’s actually a lava cake which was nice crunch on the outside and gooey inside. The ice cream had some crunch too. We ordered one more because it was so good…the restaurant was closing down but still they managed for us. Great service too! Will come back soon!

This was our third or fourth visit to the Bryant Park Grill, and it certainly won't be our last!  We always enjoy our meals here.  There is inside, outside, and garden dining.  We had a party of 7 and everyone enjoyed their meals.  The food is always delicious!!  Conveniently located in Bryant Park, it's definitely worth a stop!!!

I strongly believe that Bryant Park Grill is worth visiting primarily for its stunning outdoor seating area. The food, in my opinion, is rather average and nothing to write home about. On the other hand, I must commend the staff for being extremely welcoming and efficient. If you plan to enjoy the outdoor seating during warmer weather, my recommendation is to arrive early for lunch. Personally, I find the food to be quite bland and definitely overpriced. However, if your goal is to savor an appetizer and a drink while taking in the views, then this is the ideal spot for you. If you're solely interested in finding food around Bryant Park, you might want to consider visiting L’Adresse American Bistro or Los Tacos 1 instead.

A Fine Dining Experience at Bryant Grill
Bryant Grill provides a sophisticated dining environment with attentive service. The restaurant offers a classic American menu with well-executed dishes.
The portions are generous, ensuring guests leave satisfied. While the overall experience is enjoyable, the pricing might be considered high for some.
If you're seeking a reliable option for a special occasion or business dinner, Bryant Grill is a solid choice.

OMG this place is amazing. Mr Loyola attended to all our needs. All his recommendations were on point. He was super friendly and welcoming.

The entire staff are nice and welcoming. We can definitely see they have a chemistry in please the customers.

All the dishes were delicious.

google.name: Grand Central Oyster Bar
google.address: 89 E 42nd St, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text:
Food overall was quite mid. One thing to note was that the salad was decent. The prawn was plump and had a bouncy, tasty texture to it.

The New England clam chowder was quite salty and honestly, it tasted very similar to a canned clam chowder from the grocery store.

For the stores most popular item, the oyster pan roast, it tasted exactly the same as the clam chowder but less salty. It had 3 oysters in it and honestly, the meal felt too creamy when both the New England clam chowder and the pan roast are ordered. The pan roast didn’t taste like anything special and didn’t have a good wow factor to me.

Moving onto the service, our server didn’t seem very attentive. We got our water filled maybe 2 times throughout the whole meal and we were left with no water quite often.

Overall, it seemed like Grand Central Oyster Bar is a place with a great atmosphere, though it really fits the needs of a tourist which is a nice vibe and cool location. Wouldn’t fully recommend the food.

September 2024:Several years ago we had an incredible dinner here, but for some reason it did not quite live up to the memories. The New England clam chowder was good but not great. Last time I loved the Washington State oysters. They had three varieties of them here on this visit, they definitely had a distinct flavor from New England oysters but not quite the blow away flavor I remembered from last time. The service was fast and efficient, but the bench seats were so worn out that they were uncomfortable. The chairs were much better.

Our photo and video team had the pleasure of being a part of one of the very first weddings at Grand Central Oyster Bar! It was truly one of the most unique weddings we have been a part of, and the venue/restaurant staff were wonderful to work with on the day of! If you are looking for a laid back, intimate, and fun wedding evening, we recommend this space! And, the oysters were a HIT!!!!!!

Rêver Weddings

Holy Cow! Who knew you'd find such an awesome and renowned place. There's traditional restaurant table seats,  bar, and cozy salon. Seafood menu extensive focused on shellfish.  Great place to grab a drink and snack with friends or a full-on meal.

I used to work in Grand Central years ago and never dined here. Well, I finally tried the famous Grand Central Oyster Bar today and was impressed with the overall experience. I will say that lunch felt more like what you'd see at a higher-end diner, so don't visit here thinking you're going to a super fancy place. With that being said, the food and service were great, the place is historical, and I'd  definitely return.

yelp.name: Grand Central Oyster Bar & Restaurant
yelp.address: 89 E 42nd St, Lower Level, New York, NY 10017

google.name: Blue Fin
google.address: 1567 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: I found this place through Googling and decided to give it a try since the reviews were pretty good. I am a big fan of scallops and crab cakes, so I ordered the crab cake and seared scallops. The crab cake was okay, but the $43 seared scallops were awful. There were only four small scallops, which weren’t fresh or sweet; instead, they tasted rubbery and overly salty. Some of the worst scallops I’ve had—definitely not worth $43!Definitely will not come back again.

We decided just to grab some appetizers instead of dinner. We went with the crabcakes, calamari, bang, bang shrimp, lobster and crab roll and sea bass. All of the flavors were absolutely amazing and presentation was top-notch. Service was exceptional in the atmosphere was chill and inviting.

Had high, high hopes. But then “Sushi” eateries must meet very high expectations..: location at Times Square - perfect
Food - standard kind of Nigiri/Sashimi/Rolls - nothing really inventive of that would elevate the palate. Freshness is not so fresh (sorry)
Service - splendid - attentive
Atmosphere - modernish - fabulous LARGE sharp  slide-like screen pictures are gorgeous - love the ceiling  lights and oceanic theme (please DO
LOOK UP)
Presentation- nice and some things really nice
Summary
4.3-4.5 total
Why not 5/5
Freshness (no so fresh)
Presentations (standard - nothing unique)
Overall - a nice place to take friends when in the area or going to the theatres

This place was one of the hardest places I've had to rate. The restaurant itself is beautiful and I loved the jellyfish lighting.

We made reservations ahead. But while we were out exploring the city we received a text asking for a deposit to hold our reservation. We did not see it and when we got there our reservation was gone. They did still get us in which was great.

Our waiter seemed very nice but maybe a little nervous. He might have been new. After we had already ordered and started eating we noticed that people around us were being told the specials of the evening. We were never told of any specials. Everyone else so seemed to be getting bread and we never got bread. Two of us had steak which was absolutely a 5 out of 5. Another member of our party had chicken which was dry and overcooked. The blueberry cheesecake for dessert was phenomenal.

One member of our party had finished their steak but clearly had a large dish of mashed potatoes sitting in front of them. A woman, not our waiter, came up and scooped away his plate, knife & fork without asking if he was down or even pausing. Another member of our party gave him our extra fork to finish his potatoes. He pulled the side plate up where the dinner plate used to be and was working on the potatoes. A few minutes later the same woman came through and scooped up that dish and took it away even though it was half full. He was done eating so it was okay but we found the behavior very strange! It didn't seem very busy and they were a lot of empty tables but we definitely felt like we were hurried right out of there!

The building was beautiful and I'm glad I got to experience this place once but I probably would not go back. Pretty expensive for what we got and I felt very rushed.
Service was very slow, even after letting our server know we had a show to see. Entrees were just so-so for the price. Enjoyed the Blue Fin sushi roll. No time for dessert.

google.name: Shake Shack Theater District
google.address: 691 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: I yesterday had the pleasure of dining at shake shack and it was a delightful experience. Aside from the perfectly cooked shroom burger and the cheese fries, the cashier was very friendly. This restaurant is kind of the one that makes you feel comforted and happy. It was super nice to have a delicious burger in a cold windy night.

Lovely burgers and chips. Got it recommended by my Spanish friends back home and they were right :) Fast service and tasty food. $18 dollars is a bit overpriced if you ask me but I am European... I feel NY is very dear in general...

Visited after several years and the food is still as good as I remember. The double shack burger has two smashed beef patties with American cheddar cheese. Delicious! The cookies and cream malted milkshake was soo good. Fries are just average. The service is decent. Did not appreciate being asked to tip multiple times when placing the order. I was going to tip regardless, but basically  being forced to is never a good thing.

Stopped by Shake Shack with high expectations, fueled by some fantastic memories from their Korea locations. Unfortunately, the experience here didn't quite measure up. I tried the Shack Stack along with two limited offerings. Korean Style Fried Chicken Sandwich and the Korean BBQ Burger. While the Shack Stack was somewhat decent enough to try, I wouldn't rush back for the burgers in general. The BBQ Burger and Chicken Sandwich were particularly disappointing. The BBQ Burger had a slight hint that reminded me of Korea, but overall, the quality of the burger didn't live up to expectations. As for the Chicken Sandwich, it lacked any real connection to the Korean flavors I was hoping for. Real miss on execution for both. Another downside was the service. The attendant seemed somewhat reluctant to assist us, which didn't help the situation. It's a reminder that not every experience can be perfect, even in a city known for its incredible food scene. There are always exceptions, a sign of the human element in every establishment. This location might be a hit for some, but the miss for me.

The food was fantastic, as expected. Everything was fresh and made to order, so do give them a few minutes to prepare your food. I loved every bite of the burger, and every sip of my cookies and cream shake. Try to avoid visiting late in the afternoon, and instead get your brunch here in the morning if you don’t want to wait in long lines

google.name: Ellen's Stardust Diner
google.address: 1650 Broadway, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text:
I visited two days ago. It was a weekday but we were waiting at least 30 minutes. I am not a fan of long waits but it’s worth it.

The servers are also the performers and they have talents!! I didn’t know the songs they’re sining but i really enjoyed it.

The food has great taste. I would recommend the “crispy wing”. The sauce was really good.
You should be aware of that tips are already included the price.

If you’re looking for high class food, this place isn’t for you. It’s standard American fare and it’s a diner. Still not a bad hamburger to be found in the house.  The waffle fries they serve are good.

However, it’s the singing that overshadows the ordinariness of the food.  I don’t think there’s any other place in NYC, outside of being at a Broadway play, that you will be captivated by some amazing talent.

Yes, you’ll be crammed into a seat with someone to your immediate left and right giving you little room to move. But once the staff breaks out in song you won’t care.

Your food will come fast. Your server is very attentive. And they throw a 20% tip into the bill that goes to all staff

But make sure you give an extra tip that is collected in special buckets they will pass around.  This goes to help the amazing talent that sings.

Server said: “You don’t come here for the food. You come to be entertained!” This is bang on accurate. The food is regular pub grub and was lacking flavour on all counts.

The entertainment was like no other place. Amazing singing and atmosphere. The place was buzzing. The servers are the singers and they sing to the whole restaurant while they serve. You are immerse in entertainment. It’s pretty cool actually.

No reservations allowed and the wait was almost an hour long. I’m not a fan of long waits so I’d likely not go again but glad I went once. One other negative was the push for tips. They literally pass a bucket around while you are eating and then ask for a tip with the bill.

Visited 13th Oct evening around 7:30pm
We waited over an hour, but it was worth it.
Be prepared to be entertained by the extremely talented waiting staff.
Delicious food staff extremely talented. They even sang “Happy Birthday”  to me & several others. What an amazing atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit but would recommend planning your visit in advance due to wait time as your unable to make reservations.

Not really a 50's vibe as described or advertised. More like a karaoke restaurant where your servers all take turns singing random songs from random genres. The wait was a little long with the lime going around the side of the building but it seems to be normal and not bother anyone.  The food was okay nothing to boast about. The breakfast potatoes are plain ol tots. Not sure we'd return it's more of a try it once type of place. A cool experience nonetheless.

google.name: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse
google.address: 1221 Ave of the Americas, New York, NY 10020, USA

review_snippets.text: What an amazing experience we had while visiting this restaurant. The service was out of this world. Our waitress Amanda went above and beyond to make our visit so memorable. The food was so DELICIOUS. We will definitely visit again.

I loved the atmosphere here but the food was just alright. The steak was chewy, the appetizers were just alright, but the service was great. If you wanna come here to bring a date, it’s a nice restaurant.

This place owes me nothing! Wow! A perfect 10. A wonderful restaurant with absolutely perfect service and the food is beyond. Worth every penny and we cannot wait to get back and enjoy again.

Went to dinner with friends to celebrate and we ordered it all, starting with the special cocktail- The VIP. Yummy. Tuna tartar was my hubs favorite. Wedge salad with excellent blue cheese is always my favorite. Filet mignon was superb, but the surprise standout was the château mashed potatoes- unbelievable. The warm butter cake is not to be missed. And The lemon cake is also a nice surprise and is large enough to feed 4!

I have been there twice in the past 6 months. The first time was in March. That experience led me come back again in September 2024. When I visited the first time, I wanted to have a nice meal and a wine just before I left NY. Bartender Dan was kindly advising me a meal that is not in the menu but was fitting perfect for what I was looking for. He then paired it with one of the best red wines I tasted. This welcoming, attentive and friendly experience led me to visit again in September. Unfortunately I learned that Dan passed away since the last time I saw him. I am very sorry for his absence and I wish his soul peace. His skilled colleagues keep the place in check. I will always visit this place to honour his memory. R. I. P. beautiful soul.

Del frisco is definitely different from what it was a couple of years ago and I now understand why it's very easy to get a reservation at this place.

They have plenty of tables available even on Friday evening.  They have a couple of staff who look like managers and will only take care of the table on rare occasions. Servers do not introduce highlights of their menu or make food drink recommendations any more.

Now for the food: steak is okay. I like the fact that they have a fattier cut. But they tend to overcook. It's also under seasoned.

Overall, I was not impressed by my latest experience at Del Frisco's and this place would not rank as #1 NYC given where they're at right now.

For tourists, honestly, the halal food truck just outside of the steakhouse is even more worthy than visiting here.

yelp.name: Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steakhouse
yelp.address: 1221 Ave Of The Americas, New York, NY 10020

google.name: YOTEL New York Times Square
google.address: 570 Tenth Avenue, W 42nd St At, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: The hotel was very clean and fairly new interior. The room was compact but very efficient with an expanding bed button so we could always make more room. We also had a fantastic view of the city! The staff was always wonderful anytime we needed help with directions, room cleanings, or whatever it was; we always received amazing service. There’s an amazing rooftop bar/indoor bar & restaurant that has great drinks and yummy food. There was always different entertainment events happening at the hotel too in the Green Room and even brunch events sometimes. It was so convenient to have all of that at the hotel in case we wanted to stay in. The hotel location was pretty decent, it was a 10 min walk to the subway or Times Square, which wasn’t too bad. We look forward to staying here again!

The rooms are what they are. It's a bed and a washroom. You can obviously pay more to get better, but if you are doing NYC properly, you are only there to sleep. I got on well with all the staff they are very helpful. The people in the coffee shop were great and made a brilliant English brew. Not many places do. The view was great

Avoid. Biggest rip off ever.

First of all, the rooms are in horrible condition. It looks modern outside and in the lobby, but you can tell these rooms are OLD. There's black mold in the showers, the faucet control fell off, the shower door doesn't stay closed, there's not even a bottle of water for you even though you paid $250 (with the stupid facility fee), there are weird stains everywhere. They also charge to hold your luggage which is $6 - the parking lot downstairs doesn't allow access to your car until you leave. The TV channels had 5 working channels. The outlets didn't work. The area around the hotel is bad too, there's lots of homeless if you head south. I can list more and more things about how bad this hotel is. Just avoid it and go to a Holiday Inn or something.

The one good thing is the bathroom water pressure is high. That's it.

Management and YOTEL should be ashamed about the state and condition of this hotel. But I guess they don't give a crap because they're serving unknowing tourists that go to this area.

Also, this hotel has the weirdest elevator design. Parking to hotel is one elevator, which is fine. Then you take the elevator to the fourth floor to get to the restaurant, THEN another elevator to the rooms. I've never seen a hotel with this unintuitive design for their elevator.

I will never stay at a YOTEL in any other city again either. Charging premium prices for essentially drive in motel quality. Absolutely awful.

Myself and my partner had a great stay at YOTEL Times Square. The location is fantastic, being a 10 minute walk to Times Square, and the communal areas are fine. The staff are friendly, and we enjoyed the espresso bar each morning. On the other hand, as others have said, the rooms are outdated, with sloppy silicone repairs in the shower, mould, and a general tired appearance. I would recommend staying here, if you are able to get a good deal and if you are only going to use the room as a place to sleep.

YOTEL - Convenient, but in Need of Attention to Detail

YOTEL offers a good, central location and a modern vibe that initially gives a strong impression. However, with closer inspection, wear and tear become apparent, hinting at overuse and a need for better upkeep. The furniture and fittings, once impressive, now feel slightly worn. It would make a difference if the hotel manager focused more on maintaining these aspects instead of overlooking them.

The lobby’s atmosphere is mixed; while the setup is stylish, the staff often engages in loud, personal conversations, creating an unprofessional vibe. As a guest, overhearing unrelated chatter isn’t the warm welcome one expects. Politeness and professionalism should be prioritized to avoid feeling like one is experiencing “street-level” interactions inside a supposedly refined space.

The room service team does a good job with cleaning, but the pillows had an unpleasant smell—I’d recommend bringing your own if sensitive. Additionally, aimed at eco-friendliness, is frustrating—guests expect efficient amenities, especially when paying for a comfortable stay. Most visitors already have a strong environmental conscience and customers would appreciate a more thoughtful approach.

In general, YOTEL has a solid foundation but would benefit greatly from attention to detail, staff training in etiquette, and improvements in maintenance. The experience has potential, but execution could be stronger to make guests feel more valued and comfortable.
🔴 Note: The sound insulation is very poor.

yelp.name: YOTEL - New York
yelp.address: 570 Tenth Avenue W 42nd Street, New York, NY 10036

google.name: Morton's The Steakhouse
google.address: 551 5th Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text: Celebrated a friends birthday here and this place was so amazing. The drinks were amazing! The steak was delicious! cooked absolutely perfectly. The sides were all delicious we all shared within the table. The atmosphere was really amazing. We had to wait a little bit to be seated and toward the end almost felt a little rushed which is why I give this place a 4/5 stars. Still would recommend.

1- Food =  4.5 /5. Very good.  Prime Ocean Platter and Bacon were both well prepared and of good quality.  Dry Aged Porterhouse which was on the special menu was definitely prime steak but lacked the dry aged flavor that I’m accustomed too. Steak was still very good and I’d order it again.  All 3 sides were tasty and sharable. Martinis 🍸 were good.  Almost forgot about the very good fresh bread and soft butter they serve while you wait for your food.😋😋.
2- Service = 5/5. Excellent  cerebrating our anniversary we were greeted with happy anniversary as soon as we checked in.  Our waitress was friendly, attentive, but not pushy and always smiling. 😊. Thanks Sara.  They actually took an amazing Photo of myself and my wife in which they handed to us in a happy anniversary card which we both loved and appreciated.
3- Ambiance =  5/5. Excellent. Classy modern design.
4- Reservations = 5/5 Excellent. Booked with OpenTable the day of.
5- Value = 5/5. Food was excellent as expected given this is a high end Steakhouse, but the service and the staff were extra special. We would definitely recommend and will 100% return.

I felt the need to share the excellence of Morton’s Steakhouse. Matt, our server was invaluable— his professionalism, kindness, and attention to detail were beyond expectation.
The food was a journey of on its own as my eyes almost popped out as I embraced the notes and layers of flavors that danced in synchronous notes like a performance at an orchestra!
I will definitely love to visit again! I had the scallops wrapped in bacon and the dry-aged steak for main course.

Morton's was amazing!!! My wife and I went last night for our 24th wedding anniversary, and it was one of the best meals we've had out in a while.
First thing we didn't make a reservation, (not recommended because we were lucky) so it was one of those "Let's give it a shot on a Saturday night". We were seated basically as soon as we walked in with the most pleasant host and staff. Needless to say, the food was amazing! They made the night extra special with an amazing desert and a personalized card with our picture!
Absolutely delicious, the service was amazing. We ate an rib eye, creamy spinach with french fries.

google.name: Keens Steakhouse
google.address: 72 W 36th St., New York, NY 10018, USA

review_snippets.text:
Arguably one of the best steakhouse in NYC and maybe one of the best I have ever tried. Keens Steakhouse owns the largest collection of churchwarden pipes in the world with origins going way back into the 17th century! Today, Keens is the only survivor of the Herald Square Theatre District. It’s a very sophisticated, warm, and enchanting environment upon entering the doors and you’ll immediately be in awe of the history of this brand with a strong showcase of their churchwarden pipes collection. There is a space just for cocktails and also 2 levels for big and small groups to dine in. Reservations in advance is highly recommended. Service staff is very efficient, friendly and helpful. We got our seats in less than 3minutes; not much waiting to be done.

We split the porterhouse for two with a group of 4 and added on the mutton chop, which at a whopping two and a half pounds, is a sight to behold. Meat was tender, crusty and flavorful even when cooked to their medium well preferences. Creamed spinach was decent; oysters were very very fresh and enticing. New York Cheesecake was a superb ending to our meal as well. It comes with a hefty price tag but worth the indulgence and experience for sure. Wine menu is extensive as well even though we skipped the pairing for the evening. Super decent experience on overall and would recommend.

Keens Steakhouse is a remarkable dining destination that beautifully combines exceptional cuisine with a rich historical ambiance. The mutton chops were the standout dish of the evening—absolutely worth every penny. They were cooked to perfection, tender and bursting with flavor, making each bite a true delight.

The staff at Keens were a pleasure, demonstrating a deep knowledge of the menu and the restaurant's storied past. Their recommendations added to the experience, ensuring we made the most of our visit.

The ambiance is nothing short of incredible. The historical surroundings create a unique atmosphere that feels both inviting and nostalgic. I particularly loved the clay pipes that adorned the ceiling, a fascinating nod to the restaurant's legacy. Dining here is not just a meal; it’s a journey through time, with every bite evoking the history that surrounds you. I highly recommend Keens Steakhouse for anyone looking to enjoy a memorable dining experience steeped in tradition.

Keens Steakhouse is a New York City institution that truly lives up to its legendary status. The moment you step inside, you're transported back to a bygone era of elegance and sophistication. The dimly lit, wood-paneled dining rooms exude a classic charm, and the attentive service adds to the overall experience.

The star of the show, of course, is the steak. The quality of the meat is exceptional, expertly cooked to perfection. The sides, particularly the creamed spinach and the crispy fries, are equally delicious. Don't forget to indulge in one of their famous mutton chops - a truly unique and unforgettable dining experience.

The wine list is extensive, offering a wide range of options to complement your meal. Whether you're celebrating a special occasion or simply enjoying a night out, Keens Steakhouse is the perfect place to create lasting memories. We visited in September 2024 and would highly recommend.

Every time when I’m craving a steak it’s always Keens. Classic and famous NYC steak house. I have been here many times. The food and service is amazing. They have plenty of seat so walk in is easy.

My favorite appetizer is baked blue cheese puff. I like to eat it with the complimentary bread. So so good ‎(◕ᴗ◕✿)

For entree we love prime rib king the size is good for 2 people. The meat is great quality and juicy. Perfect cooked. Mushrooms side is very tasty. It has a little bit tangy favor.

I finally got to try out Keen's this past Sunday and it did not disappoint! The bartenders were great! Professional and sociable! I had their famous Mutton Chop and it was an incredible cut of meat! Thanks Keen's for a fantastic time!

google.name: Pershing Square
google.address: 90 E 42nd St, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text: Classic New York layout and atmosphere here. Wonderful service. Serves plenty of business-goers for breakfast before they begin the day around the buildings and also those looking for a quick shot of coffee. We had breakfast here and in particular the eggs set - was well done overall though nothing too fantastic I would say. Very American style and a good decent one at a pretty reasonable price. Alfresco dining also available. It can get pretty noisy indoors as well due to the morning crowd. Located within Grand Central Terminal and very visible once you exist via 42nd Street. Heard their waffles are great too; will be back to try in the future and maybe for lunch!

I’ve been dining at Pershing Square since it opened in the late ’90s, and it’s still one of my go-to spots, even now, when I no longer live in the NYC area. Conveniently located across from Grand Central Station, I find myself stopping in not just when I have a train to catch, but whenever I’m in the area. The menu may be limited, but I see that as a focus on quality over quantity. They always have a great wine selection, and the service is consistently attentive. Sure, I could go to ‘fancier’ places, but what keeps me coming back is the welcoming staff, the excellent food, and the attention to detail that Pershing Square is known for. I truly hope they’re around for as long as I am.

It's fine. I was expecting more from the food given the atmosphere and the prices. But, it was pretty standard. The orange juice was good, however not $10 good (especially when I can go to any juice bar in the city and get a larger one for the same price or cheaper).

I got the eggs benedict and it was good, solid even but was pretty standard for what you'd expect. The eggs were slightly overdone so not as runny as I wanted but can understand that poaching perfectly at scale is a tough skill.

The service is amazing, everyone was very attentive and nice. The aesthetic is also great.

Such a cute place right outside of Grand Central Terminal. My friend and I had breakfast here and their French toast was delicious. Our server was very kind and kept the coffee flowing and was very attentive. There is also a place to check your baggage if you need, which was very helpful for us since we were heading to the airport after!

Excellent, kind and attentive server George, nice ambiance, spectacular location on E.42nd street directly across the covered  street from the beautiful and Majestic Grand Central Station.
Food was well presented and delicious, speciality drinks were also good and well presented. Skirt steak was a little under cooked at first, but came back at the perfect temperature, and was delicious.
The place gives you a sense of going back to an earlier period of time in NYC, but with modern amenities.
I would highly recommend a city visitor to try this place out, and having worked in NYC for many years, I can honestly say it’s a good place with good value.

google.name: Hard Rock Cafe
google.address: 1501 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text:
Awesome place; but they are so used
To have many visitors that they don’t bother to please the clients. I had a bad experience with the manager REX; I made my reservation to enjoy the time at the restaurant; we had a good meal but
When I was starting to drink my last beer;
The manager called us to leave the table
As they had another reservation; come on; we were finishing and I was not the entire night at the table; not more than 1.5hours (maybe less; I’m being conservative here). Note: the bill was more than $250 dollars.

In resume; they have so many tourists at the restaurant that they don’t care to treat
You well.

The place is amazing; but I will never return due to the bad service; I don’t wanna be in a place they don’t care for the client.

The place was very clean , staff was very friendly and professional.  Service was top notch . However I ordered a BBQ bacon burger w/ fries . The fries were luke warm and the burger was very dry as if it was for photogenic purposes only .... one reason is because of the mass amount of non stop orders going into the kitchen . This is a tourist location unlike any other Hard Rock location.  I believe the burgers were par grilled . The food came out pretty fast because it was already prepared before I ordered. I know not to order sandwiches on. Busy night at this location . The margaritas were delicious @ $15 blue moon beer @ $12

We had an amazing time at Hard Rock Cafe! We ordered off the “Summer Special” menu, which was a great deal—an appetizer, main dish, and dessert for just $45. The food was fantastic! We started with the nachos, which were loaded with toppings and perfect for sharing. For the main course, the 1/2 rack of ribs was tender, flavorful, and fell right off the bone. And to top it all off, the NY cheesecake was creamy and delicious—a must-try for dessert lovers.

The staff was friendly, the service was prompt, and the rock-themed ambiance made it a fun dining experience. Highly recommend stopping by for the Summer Special deal!

Had dinner here. Wish we didn't.
Yes I am a Unity member so we use to visiting Hard Rocks. Big mistake.
Classic burger fully plain, nothing on it at all with fries and BBQ sauce.
Burger, very very very well done.
Classic burger arrived covered in cheese. Eventually found someone to take it back. Second time burger had no cheese but was fully pink. Again, eventually found someone to take it back.
Third time it was correct minus the BBQ sauce. Again, eventually found someone to ask to get it for us.
My wife had chicken gougons and chips,. Gougons didn't taste right so she left them all, not taking chances with chicken.
It was our most expensive meal but definitely not worth it.
Won't be back.

I really had a great time at this Hard Rock Cafe! The restaurant offers top notch service - friendly and helpful staff and food that’s perfectly made and presented. It’s aways to walk around and see what they have on display. I had the Messi beef burger. It was divine.

google.name: Red Lobster
google.address: 5 Times Sq, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Fantastic Seafood and Atmosphere!

My friend and I visited the Red Lobster at Times Square while on a trip from Montreal, and it was amazing! The location is perfect, right in the heart of NYC, which gave us an exciting vibe as soon as we walked in. The seafood was fresh and delicious—especially the lobster and shrimp dishes!

Our server was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed. The famous Cheddar Bay Biscuits were a highlight, and we kept asking for more. It was a fun and memorable experience, and we both felt it was the perfect spot for a seafood feast while exploring the city.

Highly recommend for anyone visiting Times Square who wants great seafood and a lively atmosphere

This is a really big location with an elevator and stairs to the second floor dining area. Ate here while visiting NYC. Server was pretty goood and food was decent. Manager was very friendly and even gave our table a complimentary dessert. The restaurant was clean as well.

Decided to buy some of their famous Cheddar Bay Biscuits to go. The hostess/ greeter is very nice and works quickly. She had to call someone to take my order. It took about 10 minutes for the other person to come down to take the order. After taking the order, it was another 25 minutes for the order to come out. I only ordered biscuits (no seafood). There was only one chair (that wasn't in the first floor sitting area) while waiting. You have to walk around toward the back to pay for the order. They don't accept tap to pay for payment. This includes: Apple Pay / Google Pay. You MUST have the physical card or cash to pay. They did not warn me before. There is a sign by the register in thr back. For those that were dining in and were sent to the second floor, the elevator wasn't working so they had to go  up maybe 1.5/2 flights of stairs.

We experienced a great meal with tasty lobster with nice staff. No rush with a bill on the table directly after you swallowed your last bite of food. Food was great and the drinks were very nice. My hands were very sticky so I asked if I could use the shower to clean myself, staff have never heard this before and laughed out loud. I can recommend this restaurant if you visit New York!

Very nice evening with my friend.  Waitress was nice.  I think she was busy, so she didn’t attend to us very often.  We made a reservation.  I think this location is a bit more expensive than the normal locations.  They have a mandatory 18% gratuity.

google.name: Sophie's Cuban Cuisine - Midtown West
google.address: 21 W 45th St A, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Went here with my coworkers to get lunch. This is the second location I've been to and the line is a bit long during lunchtime but goes by quickly. Their green sauce is really good and def recommend getting a platter. The shredded beef was tender and was flavorful. The empanada esp the beef one hits every single time!

This place is insufferable.
Different location same stank attitude.
The cashier lady was walking away while I was at the register trying to order empanadas. I had to flag her down WHILE IN HER FACE to get some service.
I asked for the 3 empenada special. Chicken.
She gave me 3 beef. She just threw it so angrily in the bag and didn't give any utensils or green sauce.
Note to owner: Your female workers have deplorable customer service.

The beef empenada isn't even good. I should've just gone to Wendy's.
Excellent Cuban food! I loved the meat and the plantains in particular. I wish there was more seating for lunch, but it's still worth bringing back to your home or office.

As a reviewer, I always hope for a great meal, especially at a place like Sophie’s Cuban Cuisine in Midtown West, but this time, it just didn’t hit the mark. The food, unfortunately, lacked the vibrant Latin flavors that are supposed to be the hallmark of Cuban cuisine, leaving much to be desired.

I ordered the Chicken Platter, expecting a flavorful and satisfying meal. Instead, the chicken was undercooked and lacked the seasoning that would normally bring it to life. It was a real letdown, especially considering the potential of this dish. The sides were just as uninspiring, failing to deliver the bold, comforting flavors you’d expect from a Cuban restaurant.

The only bright spot in my meal was the can of Coke that I had with it. It’s disappointing when the best part of your dining experience is something as simple as a soft drink, but that’s how it went.

While the service was friendly and the atmosphere decent, the food itself fell flat. I hope Sophie’s can bring back the authentic, rich flavors that make Cuban cuisine so special, but based on this experience, it’s hard to recommend this location.

I have been going to Sophie’s for years and the food never disappoints!! I got the shredded beef stew this time and it was just as good as always, especially with the green sauce, which is a little bit spicy (not too hot though). I will definitely come again.

google.name: Olive Garden Italian Restaurant
google.address: 2 Times Sq, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: My first time at the Oliver was 10 years ago, the first impression was very good, nice vibe, I came here to celebrate my friends in NY with me. 10 years later I bring my husband ohh boy, restaurant dirty, all tables was a mess, poor service, my drink came when I asked for my bill!!! food is decent nothing spectacular, it’s a simple restaurant not fancy at all, u can see the food is cheap, salad, bread, the past in general, well a place to go just once in life. Totally different from the last visit. Please, employees of the restaurant, do your job and do a deep cleaning everywhere, specially the entrance, it’s needs to be cozy and first impression is always important. Can imagine how dirty the kitchen is?

Went here for the Unlimited Pasta Bowl and it was amazing! My waiter, Josue, was very kind and attentive. We were sat in the very back with an amazing view of the Times Square Staircase and we worried they would forget about us but were quickly proven wrong. Josue was a great host and I will definitely return for his service alone. The food tasted great and the pasta bowls had a great amount. The spiked strawberry lemonade was delicious as well. We were a party of two so wait time was not a problem. Would recommend.

I recently visited Olive Garden in Times Square and had some mixed feelings about my experience. To start, the soup was overly salty, which significantly impacted its taste.

However, the restaurant's location is perfect for those looking to take a break from walking around the area or who want a quick meal. The atmosphere was comfortable, and the service was quick and friendly.

Despite these positives, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant for a fancy dinner or a special dining experience. It's a decent option for a quick and light meal while touring Times Square.

Never Ending Pasta Bowl did not disappoint. I ate at the bar upstairs in the main dining room Sunday evening 9/22. The bartender ( who was busy making drinks for the whole restaurant) was attentive and wonderful. Answered all my questions and made some great recommendations. Food came out quickly and was hot. The salad was crisp and the bread sticks were warm. All around a great meal and experience.

We loved eating here, we went back twice!
Food was tasty both times service from Francisco (sorry think that was his name) was top notch, such a lovely young man, very attentive! We had a great chat with one of the supervisors from Scunthorpe, helps we were Brits and had common ground!
It's well worth a visit if you love pasta!
Recommend the Tour of Italy - see pick!

google.name: Stout NYC
google.address: 133 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA

review_snippets.text:
We visited restaurant on Sunday. It’s pretty empty which is good for us so we can relax. Food is really good! We absolutely love it. We order dozen of oysters, chicken wings, chicken pot pie, and apple pie ( really recommend; not too sweet, just right amount of sweetness) all were very tasty.

Shout out for my 2 lady servers. They are super busy cause they must have covered the whole restaurant just two of them. They were very friendly and service-minded ( Sunday, Aug 25).

Would come back again.
Great place to eat and drink.  Wonderful atmosphere, great food and a nice selection of different beers.  I hope to go back next time I have an event at MSG.
Came for the Tyson and Paul fight. Madison and Terry were very attentive and did a great job of keeping up with the crowd. All of the staff was very hospitable.
Excellent service and delicious food! Top tier restaurant, I’ll definitely be coming back soon!

We went there for game 7 of NY Knicks as the played away. Fantastic atmosphere during the game. Felt like in MSG at some point when crowd cheers for the team. Food surprisingly good. I had a burger which was very good and good size for me, however might be small for some. A friend enjoyed a dozen of wings, spectacular. Guinness well poured, did not feel watery, creamy.  Service relatively fast. They ask you to pay with an app at the table, which is a novelty for a European who I am.

google.name: The View Restaurant & Lounge
google.address: 1535 Broadway, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text:
Cool experience combined with high quality food.
I recommende you to go to this place if you want to go on a date or to celebrate something big. The food options were extensive and the new york stripe I took was really good.

First time in NYC! Traveling with some friends who had ate at previously and highly recommended The View. They had attended prior to the epidemic and experienced the revolving floor that added to the dining appeal.

Sad to say that the floor no longer turned and menu was set, everyone eats the same thing, so hopefully you liked everything being served on the menu because there are no substitutions. In exchange for the revolving floor, you got a “show” of a miniature chef preparing each course that they bring out to you.

While the staff was friendly and attentive and the meal presentation was cute, we were stunned and less than impressed by our enormous bill. For two people the bill was well over $400 which was more than our round trip flights to the city!! We were totally shocked and thrown off by this, as was our friend who had been a patron there before! She said that every about this experience had changed and was nothing like she remembered and wanted to share the experience again with us.

Beware before booking your reservation as this is NOT budget friendly and you will want to make sure your taste buds align with the menu. This is not something I would recommend to a friend as I am sure there other nice eating establishments that would cost far less!

Very disappointing. First of all it would be important to inform the clients that tables are maximum for 4 ppl. If you are more than four you will be separated if you want to enjoy the virtual show. Unacceptable especially if you are a family with kids because the family will be split.
Secondly the level of service is very poor and the personnel is clearly non trained for a supposed high-level restaurant. During the waiting time for the preparation of the table, the personnel offers you a cocktail (nobody told us what it was, and I have assumed that it was a Spritz, but not sure! Nothing have been offered to our 3 kids) and some appetizers. They put everything on the desk at the entrance and don’t go through the various clients.
Food quality is medium-high, but clearly no wow. Wine pairing is a nightmare. The wine chosen for every dish is simply horrible..Unacceptable for Europeans! Please allow clients to chose a bottle of wine or to pay more to have better quality.
At last, we wait 10 minutes (!!!) in a queue to have the elevator and go out…we were waiting for a lady from the restaurant with a badge which allows to call the elevator. Crazy!
Animation and virtual show was funny.
At the end the price is too high for what you get. And giving a French sounding name to the restaurant will not improve the quality.

This was our second time here with our family, but the first since Covid and the first since La Petite Chef. The bottom line is while still a superior restaurant, the price does not reflect much more than the payment to restore the spinning restaurant mechanism that makes "the view" worth it in the first place.

Please note, and if you've seen our other reviews, you know that, at All Set Vacations, we pride ourselves on providing true and transparent editorial content based on all my years as a journalist and educator.

We paid $1200 for this experience.

Definitely arrive early. We shared drinks a snack in one of the lower floor restaurants first because we read that it might not be enough food, it definitely was enough food and the wine at dinner was also enough alcohol to suffice anyone.
By arriving early, we enjoyed three different appetizers. They were ok, but mostly breading, so, nothing special.

The show is cool, but, as a photographer and cinematographer/media person myself, felt a bit dated. Essentially, there is a ultra high resolution projector above your table with four specifically placed circles that mark your plate. That way the projector can the two-dimensional animation at the same time to all four place settings. It's a simple two-dimensional cartoon chef that runs around and you enjoy his antics for a few minutes as he prepares what you're about to eat and then the food is served right afterwards. That's pretty much it. It was cool but nothing that was mouth dropping or eye opening other than just being a novelty. It would definitely be worth a look to do it once but not sure if it warrants the heavy price tag. I'm not sure if I would recommend coming here just for this part alone. However, the food, plus this experience, depending on your preference for something different could make it worth it.

Now for the food itself at dinner. The food was amazing, but, heavy! How anyone can say they didn't feel they ate enough is beyond me! The cream base on many dishes filled us up and we definitely felt it! The portions are fine. I did a little digging and looked up each one of the pairing wines individually. They are all very highly ranked and we're all delicious. We have more of a preference for red and we know a bottle of stag sleep alone is a $100 bottle. So having two glasses of that was wonderful. Put that together with all the other ones and if you're a wine person, this is like having a high-end flight. I also included a picture of the menu to see all food and beverage offerings.
The dinner courses were fantastic, fresh, and served perfectly. The lobster included a portion of a tail and one claw (would have loved more of that for the price like half of a normal 8 oz tail or skip the rubbery claw even though it helps the presentation). The beef short rib was very tender as well. The first course, again, solid, and the desert was complex and balanced.

So....let's lay it out and see if it gets an 'All-Set' seal of approval.....-after the breakdown.
Let's be generous and assume each wine glass costs $20. For my wife and I, that would be $160 total.
Let's give the first course a $20 price on a normal menu, that's $80 for all four of us.
Second course $30 each normally, $120 total.
Let's assume each main entree of short ribs would be a max of $50 each- $200 total.
And dessert, $20 each or $80 total.
So... for 4 people, 2 adults and 2 kids:
That's $640 for a really wonderful dinner for the four of us at a decent high view of the other tall buildings in the area. ( remember, it's not spinning currently). Add in a tip of 130 and that's $770.

That's essentially a markup of $430 that is likely paying for the projector and, from what we learned, management to save up to turn the spinning motor back on!

Final thoughts: if you can rationalize the extra costs for the experience, do it once but, without the spinning view, the view ( name of the restaurant)! isn't great. But, the food, drinks ,and service is worth $640, but not $1200!

We came to NYC for my sister in laws graduation from NYU, decided to come here before going to a broadway show and got some apps and food, the cheese plate and focaccia were absolutely amazing, but the part that really stood out for us was when we asked our server Kazi to take a photo of us, he took us outside to get much better photos that I will cherish for the rest of my life! He was so sweet and kind and I am just grateful that we got to meet him, we had a lot of great service out there, but he by far went above and beyond and just was a genuinely wonderful man! Thank you Kazi! Hope to come see you again the next time we are out there!

google.name: The Capital Grille
google.address: 120 W 51st St, New York, NY 10020, USA

review_snippets.text:
This place was recommended for our anniversary dinner and it did not miss. The young lady that took our reservation was great and she took time to decorate our table for dinner.

Our server Ray from NJ was awesome and made sure we were taken care of during our dinner.

I feel super grateful to have the wonderful dinner with Superman!

The lamb was incredibly tender, and the clam chowder was creamy and delicious. We chose a very healthy Spanish dish, and it was absolutely yummy.

Thank you for the memorable experience!

And there is a bar outside of the dinning room. Highly recommend if you prefer fine dinning at the quiet environment.

10/10 rating.

There for pharmaceutical presentation; host at the entry professional & humorous! MaîtreDean and waiters were at their best very accommodating and the food was excellent. I had the Sea Bass as I am a seafood lover, but don’t take my word for it go explore the venue yourself! Thank you to THE CAPITAL GRILLE 💋

A bit overpriced but much nicer than other restaurants. We had a lovely time and our waiter Tony was amazing. The steak we asked for was medium rare and it was a bit too cooked (more like medium to medium well, not red in the center anymore) but we hate to send steaks back as we know they simply throw those out. Otherwise, the taste and flavors were simply fantastic. Would visit again for an occasion!
The food and wine were amazing! Plus, the staff and manager (shout out to AJ square)  made my 60th birthday experience so very special with some unexpected treats! Overall atmosphere was great!

google.name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
google.address: 234 W 42nd St 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Visited on a Sunday with my 6 year old nephew. A nice place to spend sometime with a kid and have fun. The games are decent, and the pricing is as well. In total we only spent $60 and I feel like that was enough to enjoy the experience, the prizes for tickets at the end was a plus. The place can be a bit loud, so if you’ve got sensory issues please keep that in mind.

The food was actually very delicious! We got the wings and they were fresh and tasty! Our server was very attentive and friendly. The only thing was the food did take a while to come out but not a big deal. We also played some games but some of the games were out of service or the credits needed to play were just a bit high. We went through $20 in like ten mins. But other than that it was a good experience!

This Dave n Busters actually IDs people with kids 1st one I've been to that did that. Otherwise it was a great experience. They have a big dinning area as well as a private party room. They have game machines that actually work. It's located in the heart of times square you'll love it!!! My family came down from Colorado and we had a blast.

John and Jhon are both so attentive and provided the best customer service. Food is always a hit and the drinks were hitting me even more. Didn’t feel like we were at Times Square at all. Felt like I was introduced to Dave and Buster personally

Had a great experience at Dave and Busters. Wasn’t expecting much as it was in Times Square but our server unfortunately I forget his name was lovely and attentive. Food was good and the arcade itself was alright our favourite machine was broken but there’s nothing we could have done to avoid that.

yelp.name: Dave & Buster's New York City - Times Square
yelp.address: 234 W 42nd St, Fl 3, New York, NY 10036

google.name: Ai Fiori
google.address: 400 5th Ave #2, New York, NY 10018, USA

review_snippets.text:
My husband made a reservation for dinner on my birthday, and we had the chef’s tasting menu. Everything was absolutely delicious! I'm usually sensitive to the smell of lamb and don’t often seek it out, but the lamb chops here were incredible. The hamachi sashimi melted in my mouth, and the halibut was perfectly tender with a refreshing sauce.
The servers were incredibly kind, checking on us throughout the meal and even wishing me a happy birthday. Thanks to them, I had a truly wonderful night!

We were incredibly impressed by the Michelin stars awarded to this restaurant! Our visit was absolutely delightful, thanks to the exceptional service provided by the attentive staff. They went out of their way to make our anniversary celebration truly special, surprising us with a scrumptious cake. Along with this thoughtful gesture, we were treated to a meticulously crafted multi-course menu designed to showcase the delicious flavors of the season. It was a truly memorable dining experience that exceeded all our expectations.🫶🏻❤️

One of our favorite dinner atmospheres in Manhattan.  Amazing food, perfect service and a menu worth traveling for. Not only did my wife and I get engaged here but we came back 3 years later on our honeymoon.

Overall we had a good experience.
Great cocktails. Good food (excellent desserts, meat had lots of nerves, not really tender despite being rare).
There was an error in one of our orders with the kitchen which derailed a bit the rhythm of eating with the other guests but this was corrected fairly quickly and they left the wrong dish to be shared, which was nice.
Our waiter was knowledgeable and helpful. Cleanliness of the table throughout the dinner could have been more regularly addressed.
Fairly priced menu.

Pretty mediocre quality (thought the pastas were honestly just ok) and the value for price was bad. Atmosphere was a bit stuffy too. Thought the risotto was undercooked as rice was not fully cooked. The salad, however, was fantastic. Probably won’t be back.

google.name: Del Frisco's Grille
google.address: 50 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10020, USA

review_snippets.text: The location is absolutely stunning for content outside the restaurant in the area, due to Rockefeller Center. The food was incredibly delicious, perfectly seasoned, and absolutely fantastic. The ambiance was just okay in the restaurant, not the best. It's definitely not a place where you can feel overly romantic or kid-friendly. On second thought, maybe a little more on the romantic side, the place was very dark. However, my son and I enjoyed it, so we ended up paying $120 for three courses - an appetizer, main course, and dessert - which was definitely worth the price due to it being restaurant week in NYC.

Celebrated my birthday dinner at this location. The food was very delicious. The staff was very pleasant and efficient. However, the women's bathrooms.
Less desirable for a high-end restaurant. Management definitely needs to come up with the way to keep their bathrooms clean and fresh.

Super great place to grab lunch. We actually ate here twice. Fries were great. Diet Coke came with a lemon slice which was fun! Great service. Outside seating and clean bathrooms. Garden salad was huge!

Double cheeseburger, truffled Mac and cheese and steak sandwich were also ordered by our party. Will definitely return!

We were  celebrating our 8th year wedding anniversary and decided to go there. The place has  a romantic sitting with dim lights  We were seated in no time, and the server came a very nice young man with a very sexy accent 😀 my husband ordered  the wet wings, and I got the dry one. We were both very pleased. My main meal, which was  half of chicken  with marsh potatoes and a  side order or cream spinach and spicy  margarita drink I was about to eat my chicken when I realized whatever sauce on it was  EXTREMELY salty i scraped it off but by then it had were to the potatoes and and to removing some, I was full and took some home and warm it up the next when I realized the chicken was not  cooked to my satisfaction which I did not realize while there due to the lighting Anthony ordered steak and asparagus and a glass of red wine. He was very pleased the place was very clean and the service was fantastic . I probably would not go back due to the lighting being so dark as even when ordering I had my reading glasses on and had to use the light from my phone to see what's there but if I should go back if my husband wants to go the only thing I will ordered is the wings.and the spicy Is margarita.
It's a bit pricey but manageable ifgour visiting for the first time. The waiter is really so friendly and helpful. Forget the crispy Brussel Sprouts. They are overcooked.

google.name: Becco
google.address: 355 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text:
I was so excited to eat here because I’m a big Lidia fan, and it did not disappoint! I knew she would hold her restaurant to a standard.
My veal with capers and lemon sauce were delicious. I also got the pasta trio added on. The gnocchi was the best I have ever had. It melted in my mouth, and I’m sure it’s homemade. Serving sizes were generous.  We had a reservation made for shortly after they opened. When we walked in the door, the executive chef I believe, even said hello to us. We were seated promptly and service was excellent!
I do not understand any negative review of this establishment! I’m from the Chicago area and next time I’m in New York, I would definitely come again.

This is a great restaurant that is actually much bigger than it looks.  2 floors of dining area to accommodate plenty of guests.   Nice staff.  Clean facilities.  Daily specials.   The star is the all you can eat pasta option.   James Andrews reviewed this place and really liked the all you can eat pastas.   Card payments are accepted.   Highly recommended.   We will definitely be going back.

Had a lovely dinner at Becco! We ordered the chicken Milanese and pork chops, accompanied by a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. The food was delicious and came out quickly, which we really appreciated. Our waiter was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. For dessert, we enjoyed the cannolis and cappuccinos, which were a perfect way to end the meal. The only downside was the noise level – it was very loud, making it hard to hear each other at the table. Overall, great food and service, just be prepared for a lively atmosphere!

Lidia's flagship NYC restaurant serves up authentic Italian dishes. Sinfonia di Paste is a trio of pastas plus a choice of Caesar salad or vegetable/seafood appetizer. This is a wonderful special and very affordable. Great for pre theatre dinner or post matinee.
We both got the Sinfonia and tried both appetizers. Delicious and generous portions. The Focaccia was fluffy and served with a white bean dip.
The restaurant was bustling after a Sunday matinee and the service was attentive and friendly.
Highly recommend this iconic Italian eatery.

Great selections on the menu. It was hard for me to choose. I had the three meat lasagna and not only was the portion generous but it was delicious.
Our waiter was top notch. Attentive , polite, prompt and he had great knowledge of the menu.
Big thumbs up for Becco.

google.name: burger joint
google.address: 119 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: A hidden burger heaven. You have to walk through the hotel and inside a red curtain to find the burger joint. I recommend a single patty classic cheeseburger since the slice of meat is thick and filling. The fries is also a generous portion I recommend to share as well. I highly recommend the place.

I recently visited Burger Joint in NYC, known by some as one of the best burgers in the city. While the location is unique, hidden behind a red curtain in the lobby of a luxury hotel the experience overall didn’t live up to the hype. The burger itself was disappointing: the meat lacked flavor and tended to fall apart, and for the price, I expected much more. There are definitely better options around the city for less. In my opinion, this spot is more of a tourist trap than a must-visit burger joint. Not worth the spend!

Amazing hamburgers, very simple-easy to read menu, service is terrible, staff are rude and rushy, they assume that all people eating there know their system. Please tourist coming to this place, notice that the restaurant is hidden, it doesn't have street facade entry,  you will need to get inside the Thompson hotel, and behind  Red Curtain, there is the place.
It's expensive for what you get, expect to pay 30-35us for a drink with a burger and fries.

Burger Joint is a literal hidden gem tucked away in the boujee Thompson Hotel. To find it, you have to walk past the glitzy lobby and through hidden red curtains that lead you to an old-school burger haven. This charming spot offers a simple yet fun dining experience that we absolutely loved.

The ambiance is laid-back, reminiscent of a classic diner, creating a cozy atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. After indulging in extravagant meals around New York, it was refreshing to sit down and enjoy perfectly cooked, straightforward burgers.

Their menu features toasted buns, deliciously seasoned patties, fresh toppings, and crispy fries—all washed down with a drink. You can’t go wrong with such a classic combination!

Customer service was fantastic, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. Dining at Burger Joint became a memorable part of our trip, proving that sometimes the simplest meals leave the biggest impression. I highly recommend making a stop here for a taste of nostalgic burger bliss!

A perfectly located restaurant 😂
It’s behind a curtain, which gives us curiosity.
There is completely no sign that leads to that restaurant.

The restaurant it self is great. Has a SICK wallpaper, and nice lights.

The food, I ordered a cheese burger.
The cool thing is, though, you can customize your burger. I posted a picture of the customization of the burger, if you like to see.

Overall it was a good experience for me and my family! 😁👍

google.name: The Lambs Club
google.address: 132 W 44th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Wanted a nice fancy meal before a Broadway show and found lambs club. The service was fantastic, as well as the drinks. The food was tasty but not amazing and for the price a bit disappointing. The steak was good but the sauce lacked, and the potato was quite small, being smaller than the onion! The desert was quite in my taste with a berry jelly.

The service was incredible and the waiters were so nice. It is a really cool chill area with a fire. The buns are delicious but I don't recommend the steak tartare. The halibut and duck are so good and the desert is amazing

Arrived early for breakfast- no one in the place yet. But took 35 minutes to take our order. The place was soon packed. No coffee refills, no salt/pepper on the table, forgot our bread order, took forever to get it. Great atmosphere. Knowledge about dietary restrictions. Food was very good. Need to work on service.

This is a very nice upscale restaurant on Times Square. I had a girls dinner with my friend. We had a really nice warm welcome and pleasant experience. The staff made sure we are comfortable and attentive. They came to greet us by our name to ensure our services are taken care. Indeed, knowledgeable and would recommend us options that cater to our taste buds. Every staff were highly professional. We will definitely come back again and let people know that the food are amazing as well!

Christian, our waiter on our last morning breakfast was HORRIBLE! The two previous breakfast went great, but we had a different waiter those morning.  Christian probably been scamming other customers,  we just happen to call him out on it.  We had vouchers each morning for breakfast.  I believe they were for $38 or $39 each of us, each morning.  We only had oatmeal and juice and he charged us the full amount of each voucher and INCLUDED his tip on top of that , so he could maximize his tip.
The other morning no tip was ever added.  We  tipped  cash the other two mornings. Christian told he was required to add tip .  We asked for a manager and Christian told us the manager would not be in until later that afternoon.
Management should look into Christian past checks to see if he has SCAMMED other customers.  Not a good look for a restaurant to have.  Having a server over state a bill just to gain a bigger tip and mandatory  a 20% tip

google.name: Green Symphony
google.address: 255 West 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Green Symphony saved the day with deliciously healthy food while visiting Manhattan for the weekend. The food was excellently prepared, giving me gourmet taste on a budget. Customer Service was above and beyond that I don't find everyday in establishments. What a breath of fresh air!

What an absolute oasis in Times square! I was looking for healthy and vegan and this place was absolutely perfect.

I was hungry and rushing to the theatre so no pics but I had a rice bowl with an Indian vegan curry and two sides more tofu and cucumber salad. They offered brussel sprouts for no cost that day.

Also had a made to order fresh juice.

It was my first time there and the lady taking my order was patient and helped me understand how to order.

Downside is no bathroom 😔 but that’s kinda normal in this area.

Absolutely delicious food AND I feel great afterwards because it’s HEALTHY.
This is an example where taste is NOT sacrificed for nutrition.
Bonus: there’s a cute little dog there on the weekends!

I took a quick stop at this place for a healthy breakfast to start the day. I had their Tofu and Avocado Wrap and it was so good. I love the inside of their place as well. Highly recommend because they offer Vegan and Gluten Free Options.

Healthy food oasis in touristy mid-town Manhattan! Thank goodness for Green Symphony: perfect for a shake or juice, salad, sandwhich, soup, or make your own custom bowl from their extremely fresh and tasty hot and cold bar. Their house made vegan treats have been a favorite for 15 years. A must for any vegan or vegetarian or anybody looking for healthy food in midtown!

google.name: Trattoria Trecolori
google.address: 254 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: We went there on a Sunday around 6 pm. The place was pretty packed and we waited in a waiting list for around 30 minutes because we did not make a reservation. (We went to walk at Times Square in the meantime). When in the restaurant we sat on the second floor and all looked pretty tight. The servers were very attentive with everything we needed. We ordered wine, a platter of cheeses, hams and prosciutto as well as fried calamari as an appetizer which was all delicious. For the main course we ordered gnocchi, ravioli, spaghetti carbonara, fettuccine Alfredo and chicken Parm and all were delicious. In conclusion all was amazing. Pretty good restaurant.

When we arrived and look the outside it doesn’t seems very nice but when we entered the restaurant it’s very nice and cozy.

Our waiter Jose was professional, friendly and helpful. Food was awesome! Five star for sue!

Excellent service, and equally good food! If your server recommends a special, get it! It's not like places that put on a special because they need to move product. It's because they got something special for a particular dish on a particular day. Every course was fantastic. Servers are fabulous, and the menu offers a selection for every taste.
Excellent in all senses! Clean and comfortable, great service, fantastic food. Feels like Italy.
Food tastes great. Server was difficult to call and bill had overcharged deserts we didn’t order

google.name: Birdland Jazz Club
google.address: 315 W 44th St #5402, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: I ordered Mac n cheese and my partner ordered a goat cheese salad and everything was very good, The drinks were also good. The service was also very good. The music was great I really liked it, It was very talented and professional musicians with lots of charisma and a sense of humor. Would definitely go again

Jazz club dating back to 1949!
Even though it was open mic night with no scheduled performance, we enjoyed the impromptu performances!

Had cocktails and glasses of wine with Birdland Sliders and a flavorful pasta dish. Good to note that, besides being a premier jazz club, they pay attention to the quality of food & beverages

What a find! So glad we looked for Jazz clubs and came across this historic place just off Times Square. Not only was it an incredible musical experience, but the food and service was right up there as well. And it turns out that the cheap seats were some of the best seats in the house. We bought partial view seats for the Monday night Vince Giordano and the Nighthawks. I just wanted to hear live music, and didn’t really care if we had a great view. Well, Vince Giordano was on bass about 3-4 feet away from our table, and we got to see him up close and personal. He tore that bass to shreds. Not to mention killed it on vocals, MC, Tuba, guitar…amazing.

Everything I order is delicious
The performance was good, too. I'm thinking about going there next time I come to the band. I arrived at 4:30 and went straight in, but I didn't get such a good seat because there were people waiting for me. If you two go together, I think we can get a good seat :)

We heard a FANTASTIC performance by Vince Giordano and the Nighthawks. I’d been wanting to see them perform live for years and we were happy to get the chance at Birdland, the iconic Manhattan jazz club that opened in 1949. Wonderful intimate venue, with excellent food and drinks, and friendly, efficient service. Our table, at the back row, was probably only 30 ft from the stage! Vince is bubbling with enthusiasm! He and the group perform 1920s jazz with such joy and energy, that we are already looking forward to the next time we can see them in person.

yelp.name: Birdland
yelp.address: 315 W 44th St, Ste 5402, New York, NY 10036

google.name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse
google.address: 4 Park Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA

review_snippets.text:
Wolfgang's was great, they were able to accommodate me as I was in a hurry omw to the airport.
Walked in at 4, out by 4:25
Medium rare bone-in ribeye was cooked to perfection and really a nice treat.

We loved this restaurant!!!!! After seeing the Empire State Building,  we googled best restaurant nearby and they did not disappoint. One of the best steaks I ever had and we are from Texas. Great wine, atmosphere and service.

The porterhouse that we got was cold and tough. It looks fine when you look at the outer part of the steak but the inside was cold and felt like it was not even cooked thoroughly. Although we did say we wanted the steak to be medium rare, it felt more like rare but “cold”.

The overall service was ok but didn’t exceed my expectations as this is the fine dining steakhouse in nyc.

The atmosphere was great though.

This Park Avenue steakhouse is Wolfgang's original restaurant and our favorite of all the locations, mainly due to its history. The ceilings are beautiful, and the service/food is top-notch like all of the other Wolfgang's locations. I know I've said this before, but Wolfgang's absolutely make the best steak sauce that we have ever had!

I ordered a Prime NY sirloin steak, cooked medium rare. First, the complimentary bread arrived, but it was cold. Shortly after, the steak came out, and as you can see in the picture, it was closer to rare, with the inside still cold. Since I had high expectations for one of the top three steakhouses in New York, the disappointment was just as big.It seems like they used frozen meat without properly thawing it first.

google.name: Havana Central Times Square
google.address: 151 W 46th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text:
Ordered take out from here on Nov 5th
Got their meal deal that included a soda, half a Cuban Sandwich, and Salad (with balsamic vinaigrette). Also got yellow rice and beans. I will note they have a $13 minimum when ordering take out.
