The meal deal is 8.99 so added the rice and beans to make it past the $13 minimum. It was 13.99 plus tax but still a good deal. You get plenty of food. Everything has good flavour. Picking up is easy, just had to wait in the waiting area but the hostess let's you know when your food is ready. She was friendly. Will definitely order from here again

I went here on Saturday August 17. The food and drinks were delicious ! I had never tried Cuban food before and I enjoyed it a lot!

The only thing I have to say what that it was a bit crowded and hard to walk through because there were so many people. Little space to walk through. But everything else was great really enjoyed coming here and I recommend it to everyone!

The food and the drinks were delicious. The atmosphere was festive and welcoming. We were seated at quite a small and tight  table setting, but didn’t feel uncomfortable. The waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. Altogether it was a very positive experience and nice experience. Prices are high though for the ambiance. It’s still quite a touristy place and a bit warn down, but I left 5 stars understanding that the location dictates the prices. Also the prices were the only thing to disagree even for New-Yorker, otherwise the service and the food was great.

Came for dinner. First time here. Everything was delicious. The chicharrón de pollo was not what we expected though. Chicken was not crispy at all and had a lot of tendons. The limonade needed sugar. Not sure if it’s a local thing but it was water and lemon juice. The live music was nice and the atmosphere too. Kudos to the guy picking up the tables. He was very attentive and works really hard making sure the table is always clean and ready for the next round of food/drinks. The Cuban sandwich was the best I have ever had in my life and I’m a Cuban born in the island! The mojitos were amazing! Awesome that they can be done with Havana Libre rum. Also loved the empanadas….Definitely worth the visit!

I’ve never had Cuban food before so I don’t have a comparison but as a first time experience this spot was great. We came in on a Sunday evening in which is a little busy but we were seated quickly as a group of 4 adults and two toddlers.

The staff was incredible. So friendly, attentive, and helpful when I needed some crayons for our kids to use on the coloring papers.

The food portions were perfect for one. The 12 and below portions blew me away; they were similar to our portions which was awesome because our kids were hungry!!
Flavor was good, we really enjoyed our meal.

google.name: McGee's Pub
google.address: 240 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Legen ... wait for it dary. Filled with entertainment, Irish Pub that inspired How I Met Your Mother series. There are lots of references on Menu, stuff around the walls. Overall, it was a nice experience. Highly recommend you making a reservation specially for evenings. Enjoyed the atmosphere. Definitely a must visit places with friends.

McGee's Pub is the bomb! It's got that perfect vibe for hanging out with friends. The drinks are solid, the food is tasty, and the staff is super chill and friendly. Plus, the whole How I Met Your Mother theme just adds to the fun. If you're looking for a cool spot to grab a beer and relax, McGee's is the place to be!

Nothing super special, but a good and fun pub. Drinks were decently priced but needed mixed better. We had some of the how I met your mother cocktails and the spinach/artichoke dip appetizer. Server was friendly.... But it's really really loud and was difficult to hear each other. Not bad, but it's really just another pub.

McGhee's Bar is a true gem in the heart of NYC, especially for fans of "How I Met Your Mother." Stepping inside feels like stepping onto the set of your favorite show, making it a must-visit for any fan or fun-seeker!

The ambiance is warm and welcoming, perfect for enjoying a night out with friends or grabbing a casual drink after work. What really stands out, though, is the incredible selection of affordable beers! It’s refreshing to find such great prices in the city—there's something for everyone, whether you’re a craft beer aficionado or just looking to sip on something classic.

The bartenders are friendly and attentive, always ready with a recommendation. I also loved the laid-back vibe; it’s the kind of place where you can relax and truly enjoy your time.

McGhee's is not just a bar; it's an experience! If you're in the area or a fan of the show, do yourself a favor and stop by. You won't be disappointed!
fantastic irish bar with friendly staff and they serve pink gin which for some reason in NYC is not easily obtained

google.name: FIG & OLIVE
google.address: 10 E 52nd St, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: 5pm starts seating upstairs. They have a few appetizers and small plates and entrees. They are all pretty small so good for one person or get multiple to share. We had a light bite. Beet humus and the lamb & couscous with the fig and olive drink. All was amazing flavors and the right amount of spices.

Good Mediterranean Food I had in a while.
1. Definitely try to truffle croquettes!
One of the best croquettes I had
2. Good ingredients
their olive oil is really fresh and amazing, making their food also amazing.
3. Wait time was too long
It took 40minutes from appetizers plates taken from main dish served.

Dining at Fig & Olive was such a pleasant experience from start to finish.

Every single item on the menu is crafted to perfection with the highest quality ingredients, intricately added to each dish. Everything is there for a reason and tastes absolutely amazing.

Even the salad was one of the best salads we ever had.

Keep in mind that the food takes some time to prepare, but I guess that’s how you know that everything is being made fresh!

Do not miss Fig & Olive!

I have dined at Fig and Olive multiple times over the years, and it used to be a go-to spot for me, whether it was for a leisurely lunch or a late-night dinner. However, I think that the restaurant has lost its charm in recent times. While the service remains impeccable, I find that the menu and overall food quality are no longer up to par. The prices are high, but the dishes are underwhelming. The appetizers, on the other hand, stand out and overshadow the main courses. It's disheartening to see this decline, but I believe there is still hope for the restaurant to regain its former allure.I have visited Fig and Olive a few times over the years. In the past, it used to be one of my favorite spots for lunch or a late dinner. However, I feel that this place has lost its touch. Although the service is still excellent, I believe the menu and the food quality have declined. The food is expensive, but it's nothing special. The appetizers are the highlight, outshining the main dishes. It's disappointing, but I still believe there is potential for improvement to restore it to its former status.
We went for happy hour, decent food & nice cocktails. The service was really spotty. It’s a  place to get a bite when visiting Moma

google.name: STK Steakhouse
google.address: 1114 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: What an amazing night! I’m big on customer service and  I honestly have no complaints. The food and drinks were delicious. Our server Rio was great! He was very attentive and made sure we had a great experience. We are definitely visiting again soon!

Went here for a bachelor party with 9 others to celebrate and have a nice steakhouse dinner. The experience started out strong, and our server was very nice and informative. As the night went on the service got worse and worse. They bait you into ordering their still Fiji water bottles and then don’t bother to continue to ask you if you’d like another, instead they keep bringing them to the table, open them, and then charge you. 5 people at our table ordered the seafood and shellfish platter for $56/ person. There wasn’t even enough food on the platter for each person to have one of each of the items. A few other people ordered additional apps that he forgot to put in, so they never got them. Overall food was okay, steak was cooked well and sides were good. But for the prices, we all agreed we had better steak before. As the night went on our server was no where to be found. He offered us espresso on the house and then forgot about it, so we waited 30 minutes. Overall not worth the almost $3k check for this “upscale” steak house. It’s unfortunate, because I will probably avoid this place in other cities now.

Amazing food and atmosphere, crowd is mixed I wouldn’t say the classiest crowd ever but then again a lot of places have mixed crowds. Definitely lots of birthdays going around when I was there. Service is absolutely excellent, met a very nice waiter called Rio who really made my night pleasant and took care of everything since I was dining solo. The beef ribs were absolutely succulent and the oysters were to die for. A bit on the expensive side but definitely worth it. The cocktail that is a signature there and that I adored contains Saint Germain (elderflower liquor) and is at the top of the cocktail list.

Had Mariana as my server, so sweet and recommended my new personal favorite the porterhouse! Mariana was sweet and patient with us and had great recommendations for me and my partner. The creamed spinach, bread, steak, fries all amazing! Would highly recommend to anyone in the city! Thank you!

Here’s a review based on your experience:

My friend and I decided to try STK Steakhouse after seeing an Instagram ad offering a 50% discount for veterans, and I have to say—it exceeded all expectations. From the moment we sat down, Lorena, our server, was phenomenal. She broke down the menu in detail, helping both me and my coworker get a full picture of what STK had to offer.

I already knew I wanted the tomahawk steak, and Lorena was on board with our plan to order two separate ones (because, let’s be real, we’re big guys). The steaks were incredible—juicy, perfectly seasoned, and cooked to perfection. We also ordered lobster to go with our meal, which was delicious and paired well with the rest of our platter.

Lorena’s service truly stood out. She was attentive, ensuring our drinks were always refilled, and her warm demeanor made the experience even better. It’s rare to find someone so dedicated to customer service, and because of her, we’re definitely coming back.

The food was outstanding, and I have to mention the drink I had—it was called “Bonded and Free” (or maybe the other way around), but whatever it was, it definitely gave me a buzz, which says a lot for a big guy like me. All in all, STK Steakhouse is a must-visit for anyone looking for top-tier food and even better service. Highly recommend!

yelp.name: STK Steakhouse
yelp.address: 1114 Ave Of The Americas, New York, NY 10036

google.name: Nobu Fifty Seven
google.address: 40 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Highlight for me was the crispy rice with a caviar. You can’t go wrong with these two. The rest of the dishes were pretty good but we were a bit puzzled by the squid pasta as the serving wasn’t really substantial as an entree dish and it tasted like wok-fried veggies. So wasn’t really pleased by that. Decent soju too. You come to Nobu for the scene but not to have punchy Japanese dishes.

Phenomenal meal with custom made dishes by the head chef.   This was a busy Monday night, but the team made us feel like we were the only ones there.

Truly a memorable experience.

And the sake was unreal!

Went to Nobu 57 for their 30th anniversary special. Upon arriving on time, we were told that our table wasn’t ready yet. After tables have been set up, we thought it would be omakase experience by the bar but were sat on table. Which was totally okay. The issue was, they were quick to get our orders but the time it took for 5 dishes to arrive took a lot longer than expected. There were gaps as long as 30 minutes just waiting for the next course. The staffs were very quick to remove the finished plates off the tables but for the next menu to come out there were numerous awkward time gaps between. The guests next to our table left after being upset. We managed to receive all our menu and took us about 2 hours. The staffs did apologize every time our dishes came out but still was not something I expected.

Worst part is when they come out with the dishes and explain the menu, you cant hear them even though they are right next to you. The music sound and restaurant noise made it impossible to hear the explanation. We just ended up nodding our heads and eating and guessing. Reminded me more of a bar due to the loud noise and music.

Food was good but wait time and atmosphere were far different from what I expected. Wouldn’t recommend this place if you are looking for an authentic (or close to) Omakase experience or Japanese food. For just a casual dinner out, would recommend.

Nobu 57 in NYC delivers an exceptional dining experience from start to finish. The ambiance is sleek and sophisticated, perfect for a special night out. The food is simply outstanding—every dish is beautifully presented and packed with incredible flavors. The signature Black Cod with Miso and the Yellowtail Jalapeño are absolute must-tries. The sushi is fresh and melts in your mouth. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations throughout the meal. Though on the pricier side, the quality of the food and the overall experience make it worth every penny. Nobu 57 is a dining experience you won’t forget!

This place was worth both the hype and the price. The food was outstanding!! The sashimi was so smooth and tasty and you can definitely tell they use fresh fish. For lunch I got the lunch box which came with a little bit of everything. I Personally got the salmon bowl but they had like 4 other options as well. Highly recommend this place if you get the chance.

google.name: Tick Tock Diner NY
google.address: 481 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

review_snippets.text:
Right by Penn station, convenient, touristy, long wait, fast service, noisy, crowded, difficult to find seats, they have some long tables in the center of the restaurant where people get to share tables. Family and large groups friendly.

Price is on the cheaper side. Service was very efficient as for taking orders, but afterwards the foods did take awhile to come out. To judge the food by a diner restaurant quality it was pretty good.

Definitely recommend this spot if you don’t have anything else pre planned.

For New York, prices are reasonable and it’s in a cool diner setting. Food however is very basic, theme park quality mass produced and served on plastic plates, canteen style. Not authentic American diner style, although reasonable in price, very expensive for the quality of food. Would recommend looking elsewhere.

The food was pretty good honestly. You come in and you’re sitted it’s busy but you usually get quick service I went around like midnight. The only reason I rated 4 stars is because the prices I paid around $20 for my Nutella French toast and we tipped. But this a great late night spot especially If you’re  coming from a concert.

It’s located in one of the retail spaces, which are part of the building which houses the Wyndham New Yorker Hotel.  🍳Portions were small but the food quality was good. Pricing was not so-focused on delving value, as one expects with a diner, but not to the point that it was overpriced. There wasn’t a host there to seat you, so you sort of have to do it on your own. The waiter was the kind of person who is there for decades and knows the business of being a server to the point of being an institution within the industry - but not because it is how the business operates. He did what he could to make the best of the experience, but it’s clear he knows why people aren’t too happy. Very much a no-frills arrangement. However, ambiance was really modern and lively. It was here that Nick Jonas performed his hit “Bacon” live, together with Ty Dolla Sign at the 2016 VMA’s.

The only thing this place has going for it is it's location.  We ordered chicken tenders, a Buffalo chicken sandwich, mozzarella sticks, and 2 shakes. Almost $80.  Now, I'd be ok with that if the food was any better than what I'd expect from an old hospital or third rate amusement park. If this was Chuck E Cheeses then I'd say I got what I expected. But this place had a higher bar.

The mozz sticks were passable. At least, they were when they arrived as they were still kinda warm?

Had to ask 3 times to get my water refilled. Asked for ranch when I ordered the tenders, got nothing.  When I asked for ranch again, I got buffalo sauce.  The chicken itself was terrible. No flavor, and again, kinda warm?  The fries were ok if you like soft, soggy, flavorless fries.

Tried some of the buffalo chicken grilled cheese sandwich. Different chicken, oddly, and marginally better. The buffalo sauce could have been straight vinegar for how potent it was. And again, warm. So warm the slice of American cheese that made this a grilled cheese sandwich wasn't even melted.

We were seated quickly, but then the staff turned into ghosts. Place wasn't all that busy, either.

Not sure how this place gets high marks in anyone's book.  Avoid. Taco Bell Cantina or White Castle are right up the road.

google.name: The National Bar & Dining Rooms
google.address: 557 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

review_snippets.text: The food was great. Manager changed our table because it was too loud for my boyfriends hard of hearing parents. Get the mussels! You won't regret it.  The steak tartar was amazing.
Delicious. Tad pricey. Around 20 for breakfast I believe. It was in Manhattan so all good. Nice upscale breakfast for great photos. Minutes away from a nice walk to Times square.

Wait staff are eager to please.  Food is hit or miss during brunch.   Colombo coffee a plus- nice and strong; no choice of nut milk though.  Do not order the oatmeal-  very watery, even the great toppings selection that comes with it cannot make up for the lack of substance.  Egg dishes come in big portion; good size plate of chicken sausage (tasty too). Seat near door to bathroom /hotel lobby is very drafty, avoid.w

The burger itself was delicious but the service could have been better. I was meeting with friends from out of town so were chatting a bit and before taking a look at the menu. At a certain point I think our waiter forgot about us? In any case, the food was on point.

Delicious food, interesting menu, delicious cocktails. The staff was very friendly and easy to work with. I had to change tables when I was joined by two people. Shrimp Cocktail had lovely, firm, large shrimp, and the Caesar Salad was one of the best I've had anywhere.  Delicious Manhattan.

yelp.name: The National Bar and Dining Rooms

google.name: Café China
google.address: 59 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

review_snippets.text:
Delightful Lunch Experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Cafe China. And thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The overall experience was outstanding, thanks to the delicious food, cozy atmosphere, and attentive service.

Our bartender, Edward, provided exceptional care, ensuring our lunch at the bar counter was memorable.

The menu offerings did not disappoint. Standouts included the savory Ma po tofu, flavorful purple and white rice, perfectly cooked string beans, and tender shredded chicken with yellow chives.

The spicy cucumber appetizer, however, fell short of expectations. Instead of the anticipated spicy kick and perfect marinade balance, it consisted of fresh cucumbers topped with a few red peppers, lacking flavor and seasoning.

Despite this minor misstep, I highly recommend this place.

Reservations are essential, as wait times can reach 40-60 minutes. Our bill totaled $112 for two people, including six dishes and hot jasmine tea – a reasonable price for the quality and quantity.

Kudos to the team for the elegant business card design, reflecting the restaurant's attention to detail.

Our rating - 4.5/5.

Thank you and good luck.

It's a decent place for some Chinese and it's a pretty big space so we had no trouble being seated. The food was ok but suffering from the usual pitfalls of being very oily or fatty (especially the scallion pancakes). I only got through half of my portion of pork ribs before surrendering to it in shame.
A strange point I had to mention about the shiitake mushrooms stir fry is that it has an ingredient in it that somehow numbs your mouth and leaves behind a strange, dry aftertaste. It's likely I'm just too white for these ingredients but I felt it's worth mentioning for other equally melanin challenged folks who may want to visit.

Came here for an early dinner a few days ago and from the food to the drinks to the service to the ambiance, this place is amazing. We were helped my Alex who made great recommendations, especially because some members of our group had dietary restrictions. I think the stars of the show for me were the eggplant and green beans, the mapo tofu, and the fried fish! Everything came out hot and fresh. We also had cocktails— mine was a Corpse Reviver #2 which was beautifully balanced and tasty.  It complimented the food nicely. My friends were also really pleased with their drinks.

If you’re going to dine at cafe china, I would recommend coming with people who want to share— family style is definitely the way to go here :)

Jul 24

Dinner 4 of us

All very delicious food

Service 9/10 quick but maybe because we are seated near the kitchen. See below.

Ambience 7/10 maybe because we are seated at  behind near the kitchen and under the stairs but overall the decor are nice. And the place is big inside.
Our first time there. It was great at the bar and also at the dinner table.  Service was great and food was tasty. Some of the dishes can be a little too spicy for some.

google.name: fresh&co
google.address: 363 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

review_snippets.text: What a hidden gem in Chelsea!💎🥰 I stopped here because I was looking for a fresh food restaurant close-by. I have been delightfully surprised by not only how tasty the food is…but also by how lovely the staff are💖😘They have been so inviting and sweet😍 Gave me so many recommendations for dinner. You can choose from hot food, soup, the salad bar or dessert🧁Yacht rock music also makes the atmosphere special 🎶🥰🛥️Definitely a do over and will definitely visit again very soon🥰

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

“Fantastic service at Fresh & Co. thanks to Anna and Joele! Both were incredibly friendly, efficient, and made sure I had a great experience. The Falafel Wrap is so delicious! Both ladies are such and asset and vibe!!
Looking for somewhere to eat and we came across this healthy spot. Walked in a the smell of spices and delightfulness ticked my nose.

I so wish we had found this place sooner. We stopped for breakfast and there were great GF options (including bread) for my husband with celiac. I had the keto energy bowl and it was GREAT!! I  wish I had taken a picture because it was a beautiful dish. This was also the cheapest place we ate and everything was so fresh. GF options are more difficult than we anticipated in NY so I highly recommend this place!.

We have been eating there for a while now. The food is really good. The staff is really nice. They give us advice for what to pick (they have great taste). I really love this place. I would love to eat there more. But I only have a small amount of time. Thanks for the great food and service!

google.name: Oceana
google.address: 120 W 49th St, New York, NY 10020, USA

review_snippets.text:
I’ll start by saying that I usually never leave reviews . But Oceana deserves all the stars 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
I found this place by accident when I looked for a pre Broadway birthday dinner for my mother in law . I’m so happy I did, because we had the best experience. I booked the table for 6pm on a Saturday on the same day. We were greeted by staff, they asked if we’re seeing any show after, they made sure they take care of us before we needed to head out for a show. All of the staff members were very attentive and kind. Sommelier for wine pairing painted pictures in my head when telling about beautiful regions that made my wine taste even better.
We were intrigued by the menu and wanted to try everything. So we went with 4 course chefs tasting menu. The portions were perfectly sized to be able to taste everything they bring. Every single meal and wine pairing was beyond this world!
Our kids couldn’t care about anything else than pasta and pizza, which they happened to have on their kids menu. It was a nicely prepared food, unlike anywhere else where they don’t put effort into kids meals.
. It was also refreshing to be in a place with a good family sized tables, where it’s not too dark, loud and crowded unlike anywhere in NYC. Perfect for a family dinner to enjoy a dinner conversation with loved ones. I would go back every day if I could , couldn’t recommend more! Thank you!❤️

We booked for 5pm in order to make our Broadway showtime. The maitre d', sommelier and service staff were all very attentive and efficient in getting us seated, served and out the door on time. We tried our seafood fried, raw and roasted. So good.

The food was excellent, but the service was disappointing. The servers were too busy, and we had to wait 40 minutes just to place our order. Even though there were plenty of empty tables in the main area, we were told a reservation was required. So, we had to make a reservation on the spot. If you plan on going on a Saturday night, be sure to reserve in advance.
The hanger steak medium rare is cooked to perfection. The oysters are fresh. The olive oil cake was delicious! Even the complimentary bread is excellent. Had a great time. Service is excellent.

Highbrow, elegant food that hits the spot. The swordfish ceviche had firm texture, bright flavor and a genera aura of freshness. The chicken was a little dry despite the jus. I ate the greens and I don’t usually like greens. The Pumpkin Spice Espresso martini was nice (although the one at Temple Bar is my favorite right now). The restaurant has a somewhat upscale interior but it’s past its prime.

google.name: Victor's Cafe Cuban Restaurant
google.address: 236 W 52nd St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text:
Really good food!! Every dish was superbly delicious. We emptied them in no time. Loved the plantains.

Waiters were quite friendly and energetic. Restroom was clean. Pricing was fine. Music of moderate volume. Decor was cute

Continuing my birthday party at one of my very favorite Cuban restaurants. This place is the real deal. My croquettes  were savory, creamy and crispy. My mojito was like liquid candy. My paella is what a paella should be, a taste of the ocean while sitting in Manhattan. This is and has been one of my very favorite places for authentic Cuban food. A must do on anyone’s list.

I'd heard about Victor's but could never go. So, on a Friday, my husband and I went. The host was friendly and seated us quickly, although we did not have a reservation. Our waiter was patient and engaging as this was our first visit. I had the encrusted snapper and my husband had chicken. We ordered drinks and I liked that the Mojito didn't have a strong alcohol flavor (a sign that it was mixed well). There was a family at the next table and the dad had oxtails. His food looked so good that I took a picture.
The downside was that we mixed up my desert order so I had to send it back for the correct item (it was still missing the coco ice cream). The flan de huevo was basic. Each table receives white rice and black beans. I prefer my black beans more seasoned. Then there was the cost. For gaucamole, 2 entrees, 2 cocktails, 1 bottle of water for the table, and one dessert, it cost about $200 (including tax and tip).
Victor's will be a treat because weekly would be over $800 a month for two people.

Victor’s Cafe located in the theater district is Outstanding! The food is exquisite, atmosphere can be both energetic and tranquil, service is impeccable.  It’s  exactly what you need when enjoying their amazing entrees and appetizers.  Bonus they can accommodate large parties

Lechon Asado was excellent.  Moist, plentiful and tasty. Lechon means baby pig, so that kinda scared me, but I couldn't really tell the difference between peril and this. They accommodated my "no cilantro " request (because it tastes like soap to me). Chose to accompany the pork with the seasonal vegetable option which came out as a sizzling cast iron of broccoli,  Brussel sprouts, carrots, onions, mushroom and peppers.  We'll worth it.
Overall cost very reasonable.
Don't drink but the alcoholic menu seemed extensive with lots of named choices on the cocktail menu.

google.name: Sushi Yasuda
google.address: 204 E 43rd St, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text: I really wanted to like this place, because my friend recommended it to me. But I have had better omakase experiences that left me wowed and tastebuds dancing. The sushi was fresh and tasty, don’t get me wrong. The experience just lacked something and the price point didn’t make me feel like it worth it overall.

Spent a few nights in NYC with the besties for one of their birthdays. I was already spending an omakase amount rate every night at the hotel by the 9.11 memorial, and seeing New York but I wanted to try at least one decent, renowned sushi spot since I heard New York has some of the best sushi in the US. This place was the most affordable Michelin star restaurant on the guide at $170 for 15 pieces vs $400+ at other spots. Which meant I was able to order additional items from the a la carte menu as well and be satiated. My friends and I had no complaints for what this restaurant offered. Service was top notch and the fish tasted great

This spot is amazing. You don’t find many michelin level sushi spots that offer a la cart ordering, never mind takeout. Ambiance is stellar and food is a 10. Only downside is that they don’t have any meat lover options, so it makes it hard to come here with my boyfriend who doesn’t eat fish.
This place was great! A great price point for amazing fish. Very fresh tasting and the service was phenomenal! Highly recommend.

Chef Shige is a master of his craft. My husband had a memorable birthday celebration at the omakase bar. Chef even accommodated a vegetarian omakase, allowing us both to participate. The place is clean and beautiful. All the staff, right from when we entered until we left, were all conscientious. Solid five-star experience. I highly recommend this place for special occasions.

google.name: La Masseria NY
google.address: 235 W 48th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: La Masseria was a nice dining experience. I came with some friends while in town on business. Waiters were friendly, service was about what you would expect for a restaurant of this caliber however, I do think it is generally overpriced for the value. Fortunately, my group dined off the restaurant week menu and saved a few bucks. There are a variety of interesting authentic Italian dishes and fascinating La Masseria takes on others. Tiramisu was amazing, the chicken was flavorful, my water was never empty. Overall, I would return if only to try a few more dishes.

Brought my dad for dinner during Father’s Day weekend.  We were greeted promptly and sat inside towards the back. Our server Alejandro was extremely attentive, kind and helpful. We ordered the salad with the balsamic vinegar, he had the fettuccini special which included squid ink pasta, crab meat and shrimp, and I had the veal scallopinie. For dessert we ended with tiramisu, espresso, a cappuccino and the cheesecake. Everything was delicious and the portions were great! Would definitely recommend.

We chose this place because the reviews were great and it was open late! Sometimes when a restaurant is open late you don't get incredible quality but this wasn't the case here. All the food we ordered was incredible. We were especially blown away by the ravioli and the seafood risotto. The service was impeccable too. Would definitely come back here if it was late and I wanted reliably good italian food!

My family enjoyed the most amazing Italian dinner.  Prior to seeing Ibsen's 'Enemy of the People' at the Circle in the Square Theatre, my siblings & parents (a party of 8) experienced delicious, authentic Italian cuisine.
Wonderful service (our waiter was the best), atmosphere & attention to our every request.
Every bite was Italian 'comfort' food at its best!  The seafood risotto was a highlight!
We could not have had a better experience for our first group dinner in NYC - thank you

I had a wonderful dinner here before I went to see the Outsiders on Broadway! The bartender, Alexander was very helpful and we had a nice conversation! The food is phenomenal! I’ve been here a few times and it’s always amazing!

google.name: The Yale Club
google.address: 50 Vanderbilt Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text: The Yale Club is an extraordinary place that offers a perfect blend of elegance, tradition, and modern comfort. The facilities are top-notch, from the well-appointed rooms to the fantastic dining options. The Rooftop Dining Room is a personal favorite, with stunning views and an impressive menu. The staff is incredibly professional and attentive, making you feel welcome from the moment you arrive. It’s the ideal setting for both business and relaxation, with a range of amenities that cater to every need. The Yale Club truly embodies excellence—I highly recommend it to members and guests alike!

Stayed two nights and had lunch on the roof.  Rooms are clean, but a bit worn (isn’t everything in NYC).  Staff are incredibly professional and prompt.  Lunch on the roof was wonderful and the view was amazing.  Great experience

The Yale Club is amazing. Attended a wedding there recently. Stayed overnight: room very updated. Terrace reception area has great views and great for mingling. Ballroom for dinner was excellent. Nice size dance floor, really good bartenders, excellent and attentive waitstaff (thanks Eddie). Food was very good. Overall, an amazing experience. Front desk staff could not have been more accommodating: my wife had a dress zipper issue I could not fix. Three of them jumped in to fix the issue and make the evening memorable.  Now that is first class service above and beyond. Thank you.

Excellent atmosphere, excellent location across the street from Grand Central.  Wonderful variety of facilities--dining, library, gym, luxurious lockers, roofdeck bar, comfortable hotel rooms.  Only complaint is that it's too often sold out on rooms.

An exclusive club in Midtown Manhattan across the street from Grand Central Station for Yale alumni and faculty. I was honored to attend a networking event hosted by my High School in the Trumbull room. It was a nice event with great ambiance, but I was disappointed with the hors d'oeuvres. They seemed like quick easy to make items with little to no effort.

yelp.name: The Yale Club of New York City

google.name: Benjamin Steakhouse
google.address: Inside The Dylan Hotel, 52 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA

review_snippets.text: Really excellent. I ate at the bar and want to shout out G who was really great at introducing the food and making my party feel welcome. The atmosphere is excellent — staff and patrons are having a great time and the decor is authentic. I would come back with friends on a future visit to NYC if I wanted them to have a good time and a good steakhouse experience.

We had a fantastic birthday dinner with delicious steak, wine, and an incredibly fresh and tasty salad. The mashed potatoes and creamy spinach were amazing too! The meal for two came to $450, including tax and tip, and the friendly staff made the experience even better.

How does a restaurant of this caliber employ such an unprofessional waiter? Several items we requested never arrived. Does this place only pour the first glass of wine? We waited over 20 minutes with empty glasses, and in the end, we poured it ourselves. When the waiter saw us, he had the audacity to smile and ask us to wait for him to pour it next time. Are you kidding me?

Look, I get it maybe he was busy, and the space we were seated in was tight, making it harder for him to maneuver. I was willing to let that slide. However, what completely crossed the line was when he leaned on my clothes, which was hanging on my chair, while celebrating a birthday at the next table. I looked at him multiple times, but he avoided eye contact. And the fact that his greasy hands touched my clothes? That was infuriating.

This waiter looked like the youngest among the staff, and it seems like he needs to get his act together. Please, assign capable staff to all tables instead of reserving inexperienced ones for seats that feel like they’re meant only for people of color.

I still left an 18% tip, consoled only by the fact that the food was good. But frankly, the service was unacceptable.

Asked for steamed lobster, got a lobster that is grilled with lots of junk on it... When I ordered, I made a joke that I like it naked, what kind of misunderstanding can it be.

The manager finally came over and said there must have been a mis communication. The waiter disappeared，and waiter must have mis-understood me

NO, there's none, manager was awful, I got a second one, but it tasted like leather and frozen.

We also had steak, that was so overcooked.  I have been coming here for over 15 years every time I'm in town, which is few times a year. it is absolutely awful now....

I think everyone can have an off day, but the manager was the worst I have ever encountered. Rude, condescending...

Note I just realized I must have been going to their location inside the hotel.

.
Loud, too bright, one on top of another.

I visited here during restaurant week.
Restaurant was so crowded and staff were so busy.
I picked one wine from the list and asked if this was red wine, and the waiter said yes. But what he brought was white wine. Of course, he exchanged it quickly, but I saw his face was crumpled. I ordered 3 steaks, 2 medium, 1 medium well, but 2 medium well done were served my table. But the food was good, so I get 4 stars.

google.name: Bill's Bar & Burger
google.address: 16 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: Great burgers in a typical sports bar.  Very tourist crowd.  The margarita was decent.  The blue cheese was delicious.  A lively bar.  Best to come here with friends.

I had a great experience going with my family. The menu is diverse and the food portion is big. I recommend having the classic cheese burger with fries and a side of onion rings. The chicken tenders is very fresh & tasty. The sliders taste amazing and it comes with a good portion of Three pieces. I highly recommend going with a big crowd you will have a great experience.

I had the ultimate cheeseburger, and my husband had the classic cheeseburger. The portions were big, so we shared fries and onion rings. The food was delicious.
Also, our server asked if we had an event to go to because we were dressed up, and he pushed our order through so we would have time to eat and get to the event.
I would recommend this place if you're a fan of burgers, fries, and onion rings.

Top notch and tasty burger joint in mid Town!  I believe this to be a chain, but one I am very happy to have visited.   Great, flavorful burgers with lots of additional options to kick the up a notch.   The mozzarella sticks were delicious, and shakes were really special.  If it was in my neighborhood, I would visit regularly.

This is a real gem!  The service is fast and friendly.  The menu will make your mouth water.  Then the food arrives!  Very impressed.  Fresh and oh, so yummy!!  The Smores Milkshake is insane!!  A must try.  All of the food ordered by our table was excellent! Fresh and oozing with flavor.  The prices are extremely fair for the location.  We were pleasantly surprised by this restaurant!

google.name: The Russian Tea Room
google.address: 150 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

review_snippets.text: This is an iconic piece of Old New York and sadly, old vintage NYC is dying out. So before it does, take a trip to the Russian Tea Room. The food is amazing!!!  I’ve been to Russia and it’s even better here than there. During the Summer months it’s not busy at all and getting a reservation is easy. In the Fall it’s very busy and you can visit all four floors. The decor is like stepping into a Time Machine and the vibe is stunning. The service was also that of the past with every need being met by several different servers at every turn. I’ve always wanted to go to this memorable restaurant and I’m so glad I did. It was worth every penny. We 100% plan to go back for tea during the holidays.

Went with my mom and brother for a small afternoon snack. The service was incredible and the food was delicious overall (the best pierogis we’ve ever had!) I did find the chicken a little bit dry but otherwise everything was fantastic. The tea was unique and delicious and we really enjoyed the summer borscht. The decor was immaculate and took us back in time to an almost 1920s era of Hollywood glam. Be prepared to splurge on this delightful treat.

Over the top opulent décor. The most ostentatiously and lavish dining room my wife and I have ever set foot in. Might want to wear sunglasses to subdue the stunning surroundings (lol). It's fun to take it all in. The booths are fabulously comfortable and best of all, despite the décor, it is a sedate dining experience. My wife and I do not like loud and here the noise level is civilized. Your focus is on the food, not on the table next to you talking nonsense loudly. Staff is outgoing and service is faultless.

Surprisingly, at the time of this review RTR has a 3.9 star rating. It is much better than that, but I think I know the reason. Basically it depends on what time you go. Wife and I have eaten here a few times. The only time we have been disappointed is when there is an event at Carnegie Hall, which is next door, and it feels like the kitchen at RTR is overwhelmed. Get the food out no matter what. The food taste's like an assembly line dish as do the cocktails. Not bad, just mediocre. An example would be the time my wife had Vegetable Wellington, which was a thumbs down. Virtually tasteless. Same for the Sea Bass I had. Not terrible, but considering the price and previous dinners there it was very disappointing.  Super long wait to get seated as well even though we had reservations. Like a 1/2 hour wait. Other patrons were in the same boat. Lots of complaining and RTR was packed. On the positive the noise level was not annoying even though every table was taken and as always the service was impeccable. So the secret is....late lunch or early dinner.

Now the good. Our last dinner was an early one having made reservations for 4:30. A wonderful time and a great meal from start to finish. Not crowded and quite a few tables available. Appetizers where an RTR salad and RTR Borscht. Salad greens were fresh and the maple vinaigrette along with the goat cheese crumbles made for a perfect salad. My wife described the RTR Borscht as good as a friend's home made ( a recipe from "the old country" as in Eastern European) Borscht. High praise indeed. A beef pirozhoz was an accompaniment and was noted to be delicious. In the past we have also had Khinkali and Onion soup. Both were very satisfying. Main courses were Cotelette Kiev (chicken) and Potato Vareniki. The chicken was moist and tender with a wonderfully crisp and flavorful skin. The sauce was sublime and added just the right amount of pop to the dish. Fresh vegetables rounded out the dish. Delish and same for the Vareniki. Deserts, Blintzes and Crème Brulee, were very good. Although the Blintzes were satisfying the portion size was extremally disappointing. I'm almost never taken aback by portion size, but good lord two tiny Blintzes that would blow away if you sneezed. Would not order again. They were good, but not like they were the most shockingly good Blintzes that would justify their price. You've been warned. On the flip side definitely order the Banana Nalysnyky. Ten thousand thumbs up on that one.

The Russian Tea House is truly exceptional! The food is absolutely incredible, with flavors that are top tier. Their Russian dumplings were a standout, delicious and unlike any other dumpling I've ever tried. While the cuisine was extraordinary, it was the remarkable service from our waiter, the staff, and the manager that made the evening unforgettable for my mother, aunt, grandmother, and me. Their attentive and playful atmosphere transformed our first night in New York into a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The staff's warmth and entertainment made us feel special and welcomed. We will always cherish that wonderful evening and the amazing hospitality we received.

Love this place, In Manhattan's heart, a treasure rare,
The Russian Tea Room, a haven to share.
A century old, with stories untold,
A place where cultures blend, young and old.

Gilded ceilings, velvet drapes,
A luxurious atmosphere, that never fades.
Tea cups shimmer, saucers abide,
As savory delights, dance on the side.

Borscht and blinis, beef stroganoff too,
Flavors of Russia, in every dish anew.
Tea varieties, a sensory delight,
From Earl Grey to Jasmine, a flavorful sight.

In Carnegie Hall's shadow, it stands tall,
A New York icon, for one and all.
A place for artists, and dreamers to meet,
The Russian Tea Room, a timeless treat.

So let us sip, and savor the taste,
Of this beloved institution, in this NYC space.
For in its walls, a piece of history stays,
The Russian Tea Room, a treasured way.

google.name: Marseille
google.address: 630 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

review_snippets.text: Although we came in a few minutes earlier than our reservation, we got seated promptly without any problem. Everything was great from service to wine.  Our server, Selma was very helpful in picking out the best French Chablis. I am only giving 4 stars because the angus steak was tasty but tough. Everything else was delightful!  I would go back again!

I just arrived in town and my host selected this restaurant to celebrate. Everything was satisfactory, but not extraordinary. The mushroom soup was excellent, and the French onion soup was very good. Our party had the salmon special, the steak frites, and short rib. The steak was cooked as ordered but not quite tender enough, the short rib was tender and flavorful, but the salmon was a minor disappointment to the person  that ordered it due to the lentils it was paired with. We ordered an apple tart for dessert that was also very good. But, at this price point something should have been extraordinary. I will say that our primary server was very friendly and attentive, as were the supplemental servers. Our water stayed full without being requested and we were able to get people's attention without it seeming like it took any effort. The environment was comfortable and not too loud. All in all a perfectly pleasant experience, but not one that made us want to go back the next day.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Marseille Restaurant is a true gem! The ambiance is chic and cozy, transporting you to a French bistro. Service is top-notch with friendly, attentive staff. The food is phenomenal—each dish is a flavorful masterpiece. The Duck was outstanding, the pasta was perfectly cooked, and the cheesecake was a delightful finish. Highly recommend for an exceptional dining experience in New York City!

I was here for a restaurant week lunch with my clients. The restaurant is very elegant. Our food was delicious and the server Johnny M. was amazing. He went above and beyond and made sure we were well taking care of. I had the tomatoes salad for appetizers, a summer risotto dish for entrees, and a peach crostata with vanilla ice cream for dessert. All are very tasty & fresh. Truly enjoy my experience here and will highly recommend this restaurant for any client’s business lunch at anytime.

Very, very enjoyable lunch before a Sunday show. We especially enjoyed our server Ryan. He, as well as his assistants, were just wonderful!  The location of this restaurant is perfect!  Food & drinks were delicious. Thank you to all - we will definitely be back!

google.name: NOMO SOHO
google.address: 9 Crosby St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great location, clean rooms

Rooms very small. No service at all: no minibar, no bar, breakfast is a joke.

You book a “pay at the property” rate on their website to make sure they avoid the Booking’s commission because you know how expensive it is, yet they try to charge you card before your stay and decide to cancel your reservation a few hours after sending an e-mail in the middle of the night.

And last but not least, I have never seen such a bad hospitality. Front office staff very arrogant and   Not flexible.

I wouldn’t recommend that place.

Dear readers, this place could easily get five stars if it was not for the doors that separate the rooms being paper thin. Usually, when there are connecting rooms, the doors are thicker to avoid hearing every little thing,  it was as if we were in the same room with our neighbors.  I could hear every word that was being said, and it’s really embarrassing if you’re trying to have intimate conversations. On top of that, when we were asleep they would wake us up if they came in late…OTHERWISE it was in the best spot…so close to everything. We would walk everywhere, close to little Italy, Chinatown, Brooklyn bridge…if it wasn’t within walking distance the subway station was around the corner. The restaurant was beautiful, and the food was good as well. We had a great view from the 24th floor…I highly recommend it, just see if there are rooms without connections.

I was referred to this place by a friend who has only had good things to say, but it was severely lacking for us. The carpet in the room had stains and the bathroom needed some work. The shower looked to have had a glass door before, but we had a plastic shower rod hot glued to the floor to keep the water from running into the rest of the bathroom. We ate at the restaurant that evening and the food was not worth the cost. The morning luggage check attendant had poor customer service and we were concerned to leave our luggage with him. Overall, there wasn't many employees available for assistance.

Nomo SoHo Hotel shines thanks to Jeffrey's exceptional hospitality! His kindness, attention to detail, and genuine care made our stay unforgettable.

Stylish hotel, perfect location, and outstanding service. We'll be back!
Only wish is for their rooms to get updated.

Thanks, Jeffrey, for an amazing experience!

Stayed here for work and the lobby area was super elegant. Was greeted by front desk and offered a room upgrade. Was on the top floor with amazing views of New York. I found everything clean and location was convenient. Highly recommend.

google.name: Lombardi's Pizza
google.address: 32 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
They claimed to be the best pizza restaurant in NYC and it’s true! Pizza was wonderful love every ingredient in their pizza. Aperol spritz was a perfect drink for this meal. Will come back again for sure.
FYI: they take only cash and I recommend to withdraw cash in advance since the ATM machine in the restaurant takes extra charge.

Lombardi’s in New York is the pizza pilgrimage you never knew you needed. This iconic spot is said to be America’s first pizzeria, and after one bite, you get why it’s been around forever. The pizzas are absolute perfection – thin, crispy crust with a touch of char, topped with fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella that melts in your mouth, and basil that feels like it was just picked. The classic margherita is chef’s kiss, but honestly, every pie on the menu is a winner.

The vibe at Lombardi’s is pure old-school New York. The walls are filled with history, and the atmosphere is warm and bustling, like a true NYC institution. It does get busy, so plan for a bit of a wait, especially on weekends. But once that hot, delicious pizza hits the table, you’ll know it was worth every minute.

Now, heads up – the pizza is fantastic, but it’s definitely on the pricey side for what it is. You’re paying for both the quality and the history, so just keep that in mind. If you’re visiting NYC or even if you live here, this is one of those places you have to check off your food bucket list. It’s New York pizza at its finest – just with a bit of a premium!

Lombardi’s Pizza is iconic. The pizza was phenomenal and the atmosphere was cozy. However, the service was just alright. We ordered beers and asked for waters as well since we had been walking all day. The beers were brought out immediately but the waters never came, even after asking 2-3 times additionally over the course of the meal. We counted 4 other groups sat around us getting waters. The waters never arrived, even when we asked for some to go. It felt a tad bit disrespectful having to ask constantly, but maybe it was just an off night. Other than that, definitely worth the visit.

Absolutely amazing! Definitely make this a stop while in NYC. The owner & staff are so friendly and hospitable. We had such a great time eating & drinking here. The pizza is the best in NY! We will definitely come back again.

Such a great pizzeria to stop at. Service staff was friendly, and since we came in right before dinner rush, we were seated right away.   Be warned this place fills fast! The pizza would be well worth the wait, though.  Super fresh and tasty. One of my most favorite pizzas I've ever had. We ordered several pies, and each was amazing. You can't go wrong here.

google.name: Balthazar
google.address: 80 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: This was the best restaurant from our whole trip to NYC. We had made reservations before even landing in New York. It did not disappoint. From the food to the service everything was awesome. Everyone loved what they ordered. Worth every penny. Definitely want to come back.

A true NYC classic. With a French bistro atmosphere reminiscent of Parisian restaurants, the food and desserts were quite good. The steak with fries paired with a good red wine were to die for!. The service was good but felt a bit rushed considering the price point and quality of the place. Very nice wine selection too!

Went there with my wife and daughter and her roommate. First of all make sure you reserve. We had a reservation and our table was ready. Talk about a packed place.. This just adds to the atmosphere there which is just bussling with Conversational activity. Love it.... Ahhh the food... We ordered escargot, balthazar salad and seafood ceviche for starters and for main I had the new york strip, and my wife and daughter ordered the steak and fries and her roommate had chicken...The escargot were really yummy and the salad was delicious but the ceviche was the best quality seafood ceviche I have had in a very long time. As to the main meal, the chicken was tender and tasty, the steak and fries (both) were just right and I enjoyed the new york strip. The fat and meat were both cooked to perfection.... For dessert we had pavlova and ice cream profitrolls. The rolls were OK but the chocolate sauce was sublime, dark chocolate with just the right smoothness and taste... The pavlova was a disappointment to me. I have had better in so many countries and back home. The merengue was too too too sweet and the texture was off. Plus I am accustomed to a pavlova with cream and not a lemon/lime mascarpone.... Anyway, the desert was not enough to detract from the experience.  I had a great time with lovely company and excellent food.... A definite place to visit.

The thing I really like about this restaurant is that they close at midnight. I had a steak which was delicious and so tendered. They give you a really good portion of their French fries with it which is amazing. The atmosphere and service here is also fantastic.

The food was perfect! Drinks were strong enough  😊
The cherry tart with pistachio ice cream was unbelievably delicious.
Definitely will come back.

google.name: La Esquina Brasserie
google.address: 114 Kenmare St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom’s to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the underground speakeasy restaurant La Esquina. Reservation is required to access this one via a guarded door leading to the underground scene with cramped but very lively bar, restaurant and dj scene! Food is generally very good but nothing that particularly stands out as deserving five stars.

My husband and I both really enjoyed our food. The tacos were great and so was literally everything else that we ordered. I also loved my spicy cocktail, cant recall the exact name. The waiter was very sassy, but I wouldn’t say he was rude. I found the vibe to be great as I really enjoy people watching. We paid around 300 usd which isn’t little for a street place like this but I think it was worth it 🍹

Came on a day where there was a heat wave going on and the AC was not working properly. When we asked the waiter about what’s going on with the AC they said it’s not working too good due to the heat outside? This definitely put a damper on my experience because I feel like it would’ve been perfect had the AC been working, drinks were great and so was the food. The music was also good, they played a lot of Spanish music.

I recently visited La Esquina and had a fantastic experience. My server was amazing - attentive and friendly, despite the restaurant being busy. The food was great too, with delicious Mexican cuisine that left me wanting more. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a top-notch dining experience. Can't wait to come back!"

I loved the service at La Esquina. They were quite prompt and had attentive service. Especially the waiter Ozzy he was very professional. The food order came fast, I did not have to wait long for delicious food! Would defiantly come back again and recommend to friends and family to try out some fun Mexican food!

google.name: Katra Lounge & Event Space
google.address: 217 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We had a ball!! As always. But the food service has to get better.  My friend waited 2hrs for food. And I waited over 30 mins for my drink order to be taken. I ended up just going to the bar. But they need 3 or more servers on each floor.  It gets lit and packed quickly.  Again great spot to party tho. Just a few things need to be worked on.

Love the vibe. Vegetarian options are just the chickpea salad and a Mac and cheese side.
But had lots of fun with my besties.

Went there for the 2 for 1 happy hour on Friday. The bartenders were friendly and polite, the drinks are really made with top shelf liquor and the DJ was great! I had a henny lemon drop. The only little issue I had was, there wasn't much American finger foods on the menu. The menu was more Indian inspired.  I got chicken wings, which were fine I just wanted something that would be less messy to eat. Overall, I will definitely be returning.

Came here for after work holiday party with a group. We were welcomed with 5 star hospitality service  that made us feel super VIP. Everything from DJ to bartenders, hookah service, food was executed/ prepared with perfection. Katra Lounge, it's staff and owners know exactly what they are doing. No wonder why it's been around for so long. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!  🔥

Came here on a Monday for a holiday party hosted by someone I know. It's a small area but it's pretty cozy I think. The food and drink on the menu can be pretty pricey so I just ordered naan cause I wasn't looking to spend too much. It was really good and fluffy. There's lot seats and the bartender was pretty nice. It's a good place I think for a holiday party or get together. Would like to come back and see how it is on the weekend.

google.name: Macao Trading Company
google.address: 311 Church St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Came here on an early Friday evening with no reservations. Hostess sat us quickly. Within an hour the restaurant was packed. It looked like a nice ambience for date night. We just ordered a few apps. The glass noodles had lots of flavor. Waitress was nice and friendly.

Such a fun romantic place to go for a date night!

Good:
- The lobster noodles were amazing! I was blown away since the noodles were so tasty and chewy and also the sauce had so much flavor The lobster meat was tender and savory
- The dessert was so good the donuts were flakey and chewy and adding on the condensed milk was nice
- Very solid ambiance, dimly lit and private booths to eat

Bad:
- The place is pretty expensive!
- Took a long time to flag down waiters and get them to take our orders - nice servers though

Overall enjoyed the experience here and would come again! I liked he decorations mostly and the way it crafted an experience

We had an absolutely amazing time at Macao. Our bartender Dino was exceptional and  went above and beyond to enhance our experience. He not only crafted delicious drinks but also took the time to explain every detail.
If you visit, make sure to try the dumplings—they are an absolute must! The combination of flavors and textures was simply outstanding. We left Macao with great memories and will be back for sure!

Celebrated our 1year anniversary. The drinks, appetizers and entrees were amazing. Each plate they brought out was just leaving us speechless.
The ambience was relaxing.
Recommend this restaurant, it will not dissapoint🫶🏽

This place was awesome. We sat at the bar and enjoyed a couple of their specialty cocktails and shared some dishes. Recommend the mushroom appetizer and the Hakka noodles. Those were my favorite. African chicken was moist and flavorful. Octopus app was cooked really well just had seasonings that weren’t for me. The vibe in here is very cool and they played fun 80s music all night. Apparently have a night club that is hopping in the basement late night until 4am, but we just went for dinner. Bartender service was amazing. Recommend for sure!

google.name: Hotel Chantelle
google.address: 92 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Food presentation was on point. Eggs were perfectly cooked, and home fries well seasoned. The steak was decent, but overall the meal was good. The ambiance was charming, it effortlessly transports you into a quaint setting surrounded by beautiful decor, and the live music was a nice perk. Definitely recommend coming here whether it’s for two or a group. Service was spot on, and the drinks were decent.

Attended a Halloween burlesque event here. The show was amazing and the food and drinks were perfect. I absolutely loved that each table had a small dish of candy on it. The white truffle flatbread was decadent. I loved the paella and the chicken dish was very tasty and fresh as well. The strawberry margaritas were on point.

Hotel Chantelle... the building, the entrance, the indoor bar... nah... BUT walk up the stairs and WOW!!! Such a beautiful terrace!!! And yes!!! Drinks and party!!! Great experience! Food is delicious, drinks are fresh and chic. We didn't get the unlimited drinks for 1 hour and 1/2 cuz we wanted to try the beautiful cocktails. We had fun and great to be out with your girlfriends. Highly recommend for brunch.

I took my girlfriend on date night at hotel Chantelle and it didn't disappoint. I wish I could take away .5 star for no live band on Friday night

The foods & cocktails were great, especially we got a great online deal. The ambience was to the point, great bar flowers decoration, love the classic lamp post.

The dish highlight was charred octopus (starter) I would say 75% was cooked well the rest was chewy, but they were tasty. I tried pineapple express (it was great summer cocktail). The entree: Branzino and steak were good but not that special.

Overall highly recommended for the cocktails.

First time visiting here for an after work rooftop event, and I totally loved it. Fully stocked bar. Rooftop is spacious with ample seating. Dj played all the right hits to keep you grooving.  Restrooms were always clean, which is a plus for me.

google.name: Ferrara Bakery & Cafe
google.address: 195 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Went to Ferrara late morning during the week when it was not too busy in the cafe.

Got a double espresso and a lobster tail,  which ran me $6.25 and $12.50 respectively.   I'm not sure if the cafe prices are higher than getting it to go,  but $12.50 for a lobster tail is beyond overpriced even for a tourist location.

This lobster tail was perfection all around.. perfect flaky shell and the cream filling was about the best I've ever had.   Made me feel a little better about that price.     Friendly service from my server Carmelo.

Overall would recommend... just expect to open the wallet

There were tons of things to try here and take to-go. Even had a few dessert forward liqueurs for purchase.
Gave the chocolate covered cannoli a try. The shell was less crispy and crunchy than I was hoping for. This could be due to the thick chocolate coating it had to hold. Chocolate was great though. Filling could have had more chocolate chips in our opinion.
The lobster tails looked like something to try next time.

Cute place in Little Italy that we found via researching. It came highly recommended by locals for desserts. We stopped in and had coffee and dessert. The staff was super friendly and fun at the dine in section. Everything we had was amazing! Thanks to everyone who recommended it!

We liked the desserts we ordered, we just wished that the wait to be seated and served wasn’t 1hr+ and 40mins+, respectively. Unfortunately for us, we ordered a fruit plate and were served barely washed rotten fruits. Sometimes the service and quality of food spoils the whole experience. As such, we wouldn’t be coming back or recommending this place 😕

I just had to try a New York cheesecake while visiting NYC, and it was fantastic - light and fluffy for a cheesecake. I highly recommend it.

However, the gelato I had there was the most expensive I've ever had, and it wasn't worth the price.

Lastly, the single aisle for takeaway was very narrow, making it hard for customers to browse and for others to pass through to pay.

There's a little sheltered outdoor bench to enjoy your delightful treats if you do not want a full sit-down service inside.

google.name: Zest Sushi Izakaya
google.address: 249 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Phenomenal happy hour. The sushi is really good here. The ingredients are fresh and the rice is well made. The rose on the happy hour menu pairs nicely with the sushi. The owners and the staff are super cool.

Came in at 7 pm on a Friday, seated immediately. Ordered 2 appetizers and got them within minutes, then 2 rolls and drinks, and got them even faster. We were out of there by 7:20. Talk about speed! Food was amazing, great music and really nice atmosphere. Very very fresh and delicious sushi. Highly recommended

Zest Sushi is a cute casual spot located in the lower east side.

Possibly the best sushi happy hour deal I have seen in Manhattan, with a wide variety $6 rolls, appetizers, mini dons, fried rice, and drinks! You can find this deal every day between 4:30-7pm.

The sushi is decent for the price, and service is decent as well. Just note, they don’t take reservations and it is walk-in only, so if you want to take advantage of happy hour, you should get there at least around 6pm, with an anticipated 30 minute wait.

If you are super picky about your sushi, I wouldn’t recommend this place for you, but otherwise, Zest Sushi makes for an affordable dinner out!

Cant Miss This Spot!! Delicioso!! Got There at 6:01 was out by 6:22 . I wasn’t rushed it just Worked out perfect as a tourist trying to  see as much as possible in NYC. Got 2 Rolls A Fried Rice a Sapporo and almost drank 2 liters of Agua. Everything was delicious. I was seated immediately. My order came out in 2 minutes. It was bing Bang Bada Boom Perfecto! Gracias Zest. Happy Hour $6

Cozy izakaya style sushi bar with large fish and roll selection. wine and sake selection is accommodating for all tastes. Gyoza was cooked to perfection and the toro nigiri is amazing. Highly recommend for a comfortable and local Japanese spot.

google.name: Golden Unicorn
google.address: 18 E Broadway, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This restaurant has a long history and is well-known. They offer a wide variety of dim sum and Cantonese dishes, with many being quite good. However, since the menu is extensive, not every dish stands out equally. It's best to focus on their signature dishes recommended by the staff. Additionally, their service is professional, and the spacious dining environment enhances the overall experience.

The steamed and baked pork buns were great and flavorful. I found the dumplings to be underwhelming and as that’s my favorite part of dim sum I was bummed by this. I am not a big fan of the roving carts as it can take awhile to get certain dishes and the price of each dish isn’t known until the very end. I also found the carts to be stressful as it was hard to understand what servers were saying due to the noise in the restaurant and a language barrier. Service was also not great and we would have to flag down servers and repeatedly ask for things like water or sauces for the table. When we sat down we were provided with a pot of tea but no waters and we weren’t even asked about drinks. There were 6 of us and with tip with each paid $26, which is a great deal for the amount we ate. It was good for the experience but I personally wouldn’t go back.

A nice spot in Chinatown. We didn’t have to wait on a Friday evening. The food was really good here! When we went, there were only dim sum dishes available and a few options off of the normal menu. The chicken was delicious. The buns and dim sums were quite good. The staff is friendly. In terms of interior design, there is a little much going on.

Very fancy Chinese restaurant
In our case the food was nice and tasty
The only thing we did not like it is they do not have baby changing pads or any space for it.
My husband got the pork with Pekín spice and he really enjoyed  it
I had rice with veggies  and it was really  nice
The portions are big
The tea in the table it is exquisite

The very best dim sum in lower Manhattan. Golden unicorn has been a sought after lunch destination within my family since I can remember. It is a vast plane of tables being constantly circumvented by carts packed with the most delicious dumplings. There is always space yet never empty. The rice noodles are transcendent and the pig buns are as cute as they are delicious. Don’t let any new spot fool you, this 1996 top 5 restaurants in nyc NEVER disappoints.

google.name: Osteria Morini
google.address: 218 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Our dinner soooo good I’m so happy we went for my birthday. Our server Brahim was attentive and very friendly. We had a meat and cheese board as an appetizer which was 10/10. The parmesan Reggiano and goat milk blue cheese were so good and the meat we chose was very fresh. I had the cappelletti pasta entree which was over the top amazing, never had anything like it, and it came out super hot! My fiancé had the veal, amazing as well and a great portion. I can’t wait to go back here.

The location is good, and the menu looks decent, so we decided to step in for lunch.

Unfortunately, all three different meals we ordered were really bland! It is surprising, as pasta in general is not a difficult dish to make, at least to make it average level. The pricing is pricey, but that comes with the location, I guess. Not sure what the problem is here - perhaps too much is pre-prepared? Nevertheless, it is definitely not a place I'd return to.

Absolutely no complaints about the staff, who is friendly and attentive.

⭐️⭐️⭐️

Visited Osteria Moroni in SoHo, drawn by its fusion Italian menu. The food we ordered was decent - it hit the 'okay' mark but didn't quite dazzle the taste buds. However, the high price tag, especially for the wine and drinks, felt a bit steep.

Considering the location, some premium is expected, but just a few blocks away, there are spots offering more authentic and value-packed Italian experiences.

A fair choice if you're nearby, but there's more to explore in the area for Italian cuisine enthusiasts. 🍝🍷📍

I’ve been coming here for over a decade and love sharing this spot with friends. The food is always so good. Typically get a charcuterie board, steak and 1-2 pasta dishes for 4 people. And of course a bottle or two of wine. The gelato parmigiana (spelling?) is so good. Whipped up spreadable cheese. Prosciutto is cut when you order.

The food was very good. We had a board of meats and cheeses cut on the spot. The paste was fresh and yummy and the same for the meatballs.  The service was not so friendly or nice. And the vibe is ok but don't go in for that.

google.name: Rubirosa
google.address: 235 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Overall top notch pizza. The crust texture was too crisp for my taste, but still flavorful, and all the other ingredients were 💯
Great drinks selection, too. I got the amari flight for "dessert" and couldn't be happier.

Want a little bit of everything Italian? This restaurant is for you! The restaurant atmosphere makes you forget you’re eating right off the street and gives an intimate feeling like you’re dinning with friends and family! Bryan K was not only our server but our best friend by the end of the meal and it made all the difference. You can taste the love in the food. We still thinking about our dinning experience there. We HIGHLY recommend doing a split pizza to share and their dessert sampler was amazing. As an Italian, this restaurant has my blessing and recommendation. Thank you Rubirosa for making our visit so memorable.

The tie dye pizza is incredible. Different and unique but still a NY slice. Also tried the ragu and lasagna. Everything was great. Great music and atmosphere. Worth the trouble of getting a reservation. This whole place is a vibe.

Rubirosa was recommended by a friend who lives in the area.

The crust is an absolute delight. Each bite has the perfect texture and flavor. The cheese was also delicious and my favorite part was the sauces. I recommend trying the tie dye which has pesto, vodka sauce and marinara. The combination is well-balanced with the perfect ratio of each. So much care was put into making these pies!

It's nice and intimate inside. My type of dim-lit night stop.

Nicely curated pizza restaurant with terrific made to order thin crust pizzas. The flavors are outstanding and work well together. Nice wine list to compliment the food.  Cocktails and beer are also served.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

google.name: Nom Wah Tea Parlor
google.address: 13 Doyers St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Nom Wah Tea Parlor, located in Manhattan's Chinatown, is a historic and iconic dim sum restaurant that has been around since 1920.

Atmosphere
Nom Wah Tea Parlor exudes old-school charm, with a vintage diner-like feel and a cozy ambiance. The decor reflects its long history, making it feel like a step back in time. It's a casual, laid-back space that caters to a mix of locals and tourists.

Food
As a dim sum destination, Nom Wah offers a wide variety of traditional Cantonese dishes.
Shrimp dumplings : Delicate and filled with plump shrimp.
Shrimp ball : fried ball with shrimp like a fish cakes.
Pork buns : Soft, fluffy, and filled with savory, slightly sweet pork.
Turnip cakes:Crispy on the outside, tender inside, and full of flavor.
Egg rolls: Not your typical egg rolls—these are more substantial with a crispy shell and flavorful filling.

The food is fresh, flavorful, and made to order rather than served from carts, as is common in some dim sum spots. This guarantees the dishes are hot when they arrive at your table. However, some find the menu more limited compared to larger dim sum halls.

Price
Nom Wah is reasonably priced for NYC, especially considering its historic status and location in Chinatown. While not the cheapest dim sum in the city, the prices are fair, and the portion sizes are generous.

👍
- Authentic and flavorful dim sum
- Historic and charming atmosphere
- Reasonable prices for quality andlocation

👎
- Limited menu compared to other dim sum spots
- Service can be slow during busy times

Nom Wah Tea Parlor is a beloved NYC institution, offering a nostalgic dining experience with solid dim sum options. It's a great place to experience a piece of Chinatown history while enjoying some tasty food.

While in Chinatown, we found this small, charming restaurant with excellent ratings, so we decided to give it a try. The place was packed, and although we wanted a booth, we couldn’t sit there since we were only two people. The service wasn’t the friendliest, possibly due to a language barrier, but the food made up for it.

I’m not usually a fan of Chinese food, but my boyfriend is, and I’m glad we stayed—the food was delicious! The menu had photos and numbered items, making it easy to order. I’ve included photos of what we tried. Highly recommended if you’re in Chinatown!

This is a traditional Chinese restaurant that has retained the atmosphere of old New York. The interior is cosy, with classic decorative elements 🥢🥡

The staff are friendly, the service is fast and the place is clean. There are often queues after 6pm .

There is a fairly wide choice of dishes - dim sum, rice rolls, pork, rice and noodles. There is also a small selection of desserts.

🫖🍻 Drinks - a good selection of tea, Chinese and Japanese beer.

👍 Top dishes:
1. Shanghainese Soup Dumplings 💯. Chicken Soup Dumplings, the dough was thicker, so I liked them less.
2. Cilantro and Scallion Rice Rolls.
3. Pork Siu Mai are also interesting.
4. For dessert, the red bean buns are the best. The yellow ones are too sweet.

👎 I didn't understand the Shrimp and Egg-Fried Rice at all. There were only 4 prawns and a lot of liquid smoke (or something that gave such a strange smoky taste, but unfortunately in the worst way).
The Chicken Soup Dumplings was mediocre.

💲 The prices are reasonable considering the quality of the food and the atmosphere. But $14,5 + tax for mediocre rice with 4 prawns is too much. Yes, the portion is huge, but the satisfaction is 0.

Definitely one of my favourite places in Chinatown. It's worth a visit 🐉🥟🍜🥢

Nom Wah Tea Parlour is a Chinatown classic, offering all the dim sum staples—from tender chicken feet, steamed spare ribs, rice rolls, savory soup dumplings to stuffed eggplant and fluffy roast pork buns. But the standout here is the OG egg roll, a nostalgic favorite with a crispy, flaky exterior and a delicious filling of chicken and vegetables. This egg roll is heartier than most, fried to golden perfection with a one-of-a-kind egg batter.
