Nom Wah’s OG egg roll is truly special and a must-order. Visiting here is like stepping into a piece of NYC history, with flavors you won’t find anywhere else!

Atmosphere
typical old style Asian place
clean with some old pics
so the look is simple but acceptable for authentic Chinese food

Food
Was amazing! My inlaws have been visiting and this is the first time I finally found the time during this trip.  Am definitely coming back again when I'm in town!
I ordered so much food for 3 adults and 1 child 😆 Gave my 2 inlaws (first time there too) a mini lecture on what the different dimsum are. Thankfully they were daring to try everything except the chicken feet 😆
Each serving was around 3 pcs with some 4 pcs. So eventually I ordered a lot,  there were dishes we had to half so everyone can taste each.

Payment
They only accept AMEX or cash,  which almost disrupted my plan to eat as much as I can.  Luckily my BiL treated us to lunch,  but I did find I had enough cash despite my ordering around 8-9 dimsum and the total was a reasonable $63.

Bathroom
Used to 1st Men then 2nd Women,  but someone decided to put M/F pics so unisex.  Eventually decided to stick to the Women's on the right *unless you're desperate then go to the unisex originally Men's
Typical mostly Male users = stinks a bit and for was ewwww vs the originally Women's one

This place meets my expectations of what an authentic dimsum is from my childhood.  And as one who has traveled to enough Asian countries to appreciate not Westernized Asian food that usually ends up lacking in flavor and/or too thick wrapper for the dimsum.

google.name: Eileen's Special Cheesecake
google.address: 17 Cleveland Pl, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Yelp named this spot the #1 cheesecake in America, so I had to check it out! The staff was incredibly friendly, and they offer a great selection of flavors. However, there’s no seating or restrooms available, and while the prices are reasonable, the tart sizes are really small. If you prefer thick, dense cheesecake, you might prefer Junior's. But if you're into light, fluffy cheesecakes, this place will be perfect for you.

This small and cozy bakery sells great mini cheesecakes. With so many flavors options to choose from is hard just to order one. It’s so flavorful. I just wish they will add some seatings. Anyways, try stopping if you are in the area, you won’t regret it.

This is definitely the most addictive cheesecake I’ve ever had. It probably has a lot to do with how it comes in small bite-sized servings making you instantly reach out for another one. Maybe also because it comes in so many delicious flavors and you’d have to get through a lot of combinations to find your favorite. Or maybe it’s really just rich and tasty and perfect in so many ways.
Oh my gosh, all their cheesecakes look absolutely amazing! I really wish I could’ve brought some with me to Miami. I can’t wait to go back to this spot the next time I’m in New York!

Tried 4 flavors of their personal sized adorable cheesecakes - mango, coconut, pineapple, and strawberry.
Absolutely loved the mango, strawberry and pineapple cheesecakes, coconut was very mildly flavored as compared to the other three. The mango was the best !!!
The staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. They have all the cheesecakes on the display. The service is pretty quick, and the line moves quickly, so it is not much of a wait. They accept both cards and cash payments.
This is a cute and cozy shop, with limited space to stand and eat, so we ate some and packed some more for later. Their packing was pretty good too.
100% would recommend coming here to try their cheesecakes. The portion size is perfect, and it's not too sweet and the flavours are yummy, but not overpowering.
Loooooved this place so much !

google.name: Whiskey Tavern
google.address: 79 Baxter St A, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: I happend to find this place and I can’t explain how happy I am that I did! Everything about it was just such a vibe! The music! The bartender Allen! The food! The inside atmosphere! The spicey pickle back shot! They really have a good thing going on and I will def be back! Allen is top tier such a happy soul he likes his job and you can tell! I got the appetizer sampler and everything was fresh breaded and fried no frozen box stuff I was impressed crispy crunchy delicious!  Cheese pull!

Found this place by chance after crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing atmosphere, good vibes, happy hour deals are perfect, food is INSANE. Not only is the NFL playing but also they have movies on. Staff are so friendly and welcoming! Defo one of my fav bars in NY - we went back several times during our vacation

We came across this bar while our friends went to get their marriage license and stopped off for a drink afterwards. The staff there were really friendly and welcoming, so we decided to stop there again for one drink after the wedding the next day. On our arrival they made such as fuss of our group we ended up spending hours there, they made the day even more special. The bar staff are amazing people, especially Colin and Alex, the atmosphere and people there were also amazing. We had the best time and would definitely recommend visiting.

For years we’ve been looking for a place where we can go for after-work drinks/happy hour. Why did it take us so long to find this place? This is the best bar/pub I’ve ever been to. The atmosphere was amazing. They make you feel welcome. Their attention to detail in making you have a good experience is something I’ve never seen anywhere.

This is such an awesome offering in this area. Never had a pickle back but I could tell their pickle juice was absolutely legit! The service was stellar (super friendly, felt like they were part of our group without being intrusive at all). Would definitely come back and bring more friends.

google.name: Dim Sum Go Go
google.address: 5 E Broadway, New York, NY 10038, USA

review_snippets.text:
If you are genuinely looking for a dim sum experience like the Cantonese enjoy tea and snacks, then this place is not for you. It's designed for westerners who aren't familiar with Yum Cha and Dim Sum culture. When we went in, there were no other Chinese parties except us.

Food ingredient was fresh, except for a tofu skin roll we took home that we found a piece of plastic wrap. But, overall the flavor side was rather bland.

Service was good, and food came out fast.

We came for the Michelin guide recommendation and left disappointed as usual with Michelin guide restaurants.

I visited Chinatown with my friend and goddaughter who are Chinese so we stoped here to eat. They truly enjoyed the food and said it was very good! I ate the egg rolls which were also very good. There is a very large selection of dishes but they ordered from the list on table.
We happen to go during the time they were celebrating Chinese and American independence holidays.
The service was okay. What I hate about going to restaurants owned by Chinese or other foreigners they are not big on customer service. The people are never very friendly and hardly smile. I’m sure this is the culture but when people are friendly and smiling you always have a great experience.

Found the restaurant through Michelin recommendation.

We arrived a little before 8pm, an hour before closing, on a Sunday evening.  We was surprised to see the restaurant was still more than 50% full.  We got a table right away and started to order.

Tea: 1/5 star; very bland, no tea flavor at all.

Food:  4/5; highly recommend: 1)roasted garlic chicken: skin was crispy and meat was tender; 2)eggplant in garlic sauce: excellent texture - soft but not mushy and flavorful, also no pepper mixed in this dish! 3)pork soup dumplings:  3 pieces per order, each dumpling was bigger than other restaurants, plenty of soup inside the dumpling.

Service: 4/5; was quick and not pushy although it was one hour before closing time.

Overall, we had an enjoyable meal.

Simply amazing dumplings and buns. We also ordered the sticky rice and the Dan Dan noodles and they all tasted amazing. The service is great and they are all extremely attentive. The walk to the bathroom is terrifying as it’s in the bathroom but don’t let that stop you from visiting this famous dumpling shop.

Incredible food and very wonderful service. We got some rice rolls some dumplings some spring rolls and the waiter recommended the ginger beef because we were stuck on beef dish to get and that was the absolute right decision!! For dessert we got the sesame lotus balls and coconut cake which were all amazing. Reasonable prices for a Michelin star restaurant too!!

google.name: Café Habana
google.address: 17 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: This place was OK. I will do my research first before coming to this restaurant. The name is a little deceiving as is not a fully Cuban restaurant. They don’t have many of the typical Cuban food cuisine, however, we were surprised to find the food was good not the most delicious but it wasn’t bad. It had a good flavor I will say that this restaurant is more of a Mexican cuisine than Cuban. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and the corn on the cob was on point. We will definitely come back when we need a quick bite, but not when we need a full meal. The service was OK, but they seem to be overwhelmed by the amount of customers that the restaurant can handle we had to ask for napkins like three times also getting the attention of the servers was a difficult as they’re moving around a lot. The bathrooms are very tiny, the lighting is very dim, There is lots of posters and graffiti, but it goes with the neighborhood , I did not feel an AC running inside the restaurant so I am not sure if they run the AC during very hot days .Overall, not a bad place but again make sure you do you your research and check the menu before going in.
Very welcoming atmosphere, the customer service is quick and efficient. Credits to staff Mashell and Veronica they’re amazing! I’ve been here many times and the food never disappoints. 10/10⭐️

My partner and I ordered a steak burrito, corn, rice & beans, and quesadillas. We instantly noticed a lack of flavor in the quesadillas and my burrito. You'll need the sauces they gave to add some taste. Corn was the best. Soon after, the food did not sit well with my GF. The service was good, but we will not return.

From the moment we stepped in, the service was excellent, adding to the overall fantastic experience. The corn, acclaimed as the best in New York, lived up to its reputation and left us wanting more. And let's not forget the frozen margarita which was also very good although could have been a bit more booze forward.

Big Bro and I pulled up to Habana at 1:24pm coated in sweat after the mile walk, as it was the first real hot day of the summer. Even my all linen fit was futile against the heat.

We entered the non-descript 39 seat hole in the wall cafe with tiled floors, a handful of barstools and faux leather booths for seating, and ceiling fans being the only weapon against the heat. It was JUMPIN, but we got a seat right away as they turnin tables quick.

The interior is a little beat up, and I mean that in the best way possible. I've never been to Cuba, but Cafe Habana is authentically Latin American. It reminds me of small places in Mexico or Puerto Rico that don't look like much when you enter, but the food BANGS.

It’s a no frills place. Not like Tacombi though, don't get it twisted. Tacombi plays on Mexican culture, talking about the balmy beaches of the Yucatán and sharing the beauty of authentic Mexican culture with the world and then looks you dead in the eye as they charge you $6.98 before tax and tip for a tiny little fish taco with no sides. Don't get me started on Tacombi. Tacombi is like big pharma to me.

Enough about the opps, my b.

We ended up ordering the world famous corn, plantains, the cubano sandwich, and the marinated roast pork. The grilled corn, dressed in mayonnaise, cotija cheese, chili powder & lime was actually insane… I was initially like “damn this Equinox trainer has me paying $5 for some corn” but thank GOD I did. I forgot one of the few absolutes in life… CORN MAN GETS PAID!!

The cubano sandwich ($18.95) came with fries, which is a rarity in NYC these days. It consists of Citrus marinated roast pork wrapped in ham with swiss cheese, chipotle mayonnaise & pickle on a toasted roll. The pork was so juicy that little pork juice was squirting down the roll on every bite… that visual is crazy lol but it was delicious.

If you're reading this and don't live in NYC you're probably like "damn that's expensive he's trippin..." but this is par for the course in the city, and absolutely Nolita/Soho cheap.

I'm fascinated that a place like Cafe Habana exists in the Nolita/Soho area. I would expect it to be deep in Alphabet City or Union City. Idk. Cafe Habana is just so unpretentious, right smack in the middle of one of the most pretentious places in the world. New York City continues to surprise me everyday.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov_reviews

google.name: Starbucks
google.address: 80 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I've been going to this Starbucks for years. The staff is always friendly and the drink and food is just the way I like it. I love the location right across the bridge from Brooklyn, where I go visit for church when I stop in NYC a few times a year. I'll be back in November.

Spacious with good seating. And they have WiFi. Unfortunately, they only have one open electrical socket on a corner to power mobile devices. Like many places in NYC, electrical sockets have been blocked/made inacessible to discourage squatters/homeless users. Wish Starbucks would have official charging stations.

The dude simply refused to accept my $50  banknote, saying he can accept only 20 and lower. Is $50 not the money in the US anymore?that’s so weird. I had no issues paying with $100 in other Starbucks store
Super pleasant staff, great location that is walking distance to Williamsburg bridge. This Starbucks also has a restroom which is super important given the present dearth of restrooms in the city.
I asked for an ice chai tea latte and the gave me a warm chai tea not even a latte and when I asked for a new one because the messed up they still made it warm.

yelp.name: Starbucks
yelp.address: 157 Lafayette St, 157 Lafayette, New York, NY 10013

google.name: Congee Village
google.address: 100 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Food was great value for the price!!! Fried squid was a bit too oily so won’t order it next time. Supposed to be salt pepper fried squid but could not taste the pepper. Salted fish fried rice was oily too and no taste of the salted fish.

Other dishes were yummy and portions were large enough! Service was attentive and waiters had a good attitude for a Sunday evening! Atmosphere was peaceful but it would be better with some background music!

Overall it is good, I would stay away from the fried dishes as they are too oily.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Congee Village in Chinatown, New York, and it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm hospitality and immediately served a comforting pot of tea, which set the tone for the rest of the evening.

The food was simply outstanding. Each dish was bursting with flavors that were both rich and delicate, surprising me, especially since I’m not usually a big fan of Chinese cuisine. Congee Village truly changed my perspective. The variety and quality of the dishes we tried were remarkable – everything tasted incredibly fresh and well-prepared.

One of the highlights of our meal was the value for money. We were a group of eight, and the portions were impressively large, yet the prices were unbelievably affordable. It’s rare to find such a great combination of quality and quantity at such reasonable prices in New York City.

I highly recommend Congee Village to anyone looking for an authentic and delicious Chinese dining experience. Whether you’re a fan of Chinese food or just curious, this place is worth a visit. I’ll definitely be returning!

Referred here by a friend who loved congee. Right in Chinatown and when I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance. The menu was extensive but I only came for the congee. I was offered tea upon being greeted but I declined because I’m not having caffeine but thought that was a nice gesture. I got the pork and duck congee. YUM! The texture was creamy and the pieces of duck skin you get were so good. I ordered some fried dough that you can dip like you would with bread and soup. I added some of their chili oil and it gave it more flavor. I was definitely satisfied with this congee and glad I went!

Delicious ambrosial fantastic dishes. The fish is sooo fresh with the scallions. Clocking the server they don’t serve a good face (cuz it’s a chinese restaurant don’t expect white service) but they made sure you are fed enough food and not over ordering. They gave us a pot of daily soup and dessert for free!

The restaurant is not the cheapest option, but it offers a beautiful dining environment and delicious Cantonese cuisine. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to experience authentic Cantonese flavors. Many Chinese patrons consider it a favorite and return frequently. While it might be a bit pricey, the quality of the food and the overall experience make it worth the visit. If you appreciate fine dining and enjoy exploring different culinary traditions, this restaurant should definitely be on your list.

google.name: Gilligan's
google.address: 310 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
My friend and I stumbled upon this place on a Sunday evening while walking from SoHo to Chinatown, and it felt like discovering a hidden gem. The lush greenery and vibrant atmosphere gave us serious Miami vibes, a refreshing contrast to the sweltering heat of NYC right now. We were impressed by the quality and generous portions of the food and drinks. Speaking of drinks, they were excellent too! Frozen watermelon margarita is a MUST!

All food that we had is soo yumm! Beautiful and well decorated.
- East Coast Oyster
- Steamed Mussels
- Maine Lobster Roll
- Smashed Avocado

However, the service was a bit slow. While our server was friendly, it took us more than 15 minutes to order our second round of drinks, which was a tad frustrating. Understandably, they seemed understaffed given how busy it was.

Overall, despite the minor wait, we loved the ambiance and the delicious offerings here. Definitely worth a visit. Will be back!!

Cute spot, Chris provided amazing service!! It was much appreciated. Watermelon drink was good and our food (lobster Cobb, burrata toast, oysters) was delicious. Towards closing there were a few extra critters 🐀 running around so it was def time to go but otherwise, a great night out.

Really beautiful place, has a tropical feel to it. The service was good but did decline towards the end when it started getting a bit more busier. The food was delicious, minus the shrimp pasta it was a bit on the bland side. But everything else was so great. The menu is very minimal, which was perfect for us because we got to basically try almost everything in the menu. The drinks really were the highlight! The drinks were refreshing and just right for a nice summer day. Would definitely be back again.

10/10 for this fabulous plant oasis. I would come just to sit with the plants.
Drinks were delicious and appetizers were fresh and light.

Service sucks. Rude bartender with zero common sense. Hot as balls and bro wouldn’t bring me a water. Ordered the $45 raw steak. I brought it up to the bartender and he told me not much he can do. Lmao

Edit: menu says it comes with shoestring fries but it actually came with a side of lays potato chips. Once again bartender like “my b” bootleg Maluma mfer

google.name: Barrio Chino
google.address: 253 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Absolutely fantastic food! Everything was so delicious and we can’t wait to go back again! Had the guacamole and house made chips, steak tacos and enchiladas verdes along with a Paloma Margarita. Yum yum yum! Our waiter Justino was fantastic and very personable - can’t wait to go back again! Delicious!

The Al Pastor & Carnitas tacos slapped. Great ambiance and friendly bartender. We loved the tequila infusions and their mezcal list. Wish we saved room for more! We will be back next time we are in town.
We had the classic margarita, tamarind mezcalita, guacamole, tuna tostada and barbacoa (the reason I come here 😋). All delicious and authentic. Service was just ok. Server not as attentive.

The 🌮 Al Pastore are amazing!
Fidel, behind the bar is awesome!

Can almost never go wrong with tacos and Barrio Chino didn't disappoint. Arrived on a somewhat busy night without reservation. Outdoor seating was readily available. We had chicken, and steak tacos. You have a choice of ordering two or three tacos. You can only pick one type (chicken, or steak, etc). So we ordered two chicken and two steak tacos and switched one out. Servers were nice and attentive. The tacos came out fast and were delicious.

google.name: Supreme Restaurant
google.address: 100 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Delicious food for a very affordable price in comparison with other Chinese restaurants. Everything is delicious, dumplings with the fine dough, delicious shredded port with garlic sauce, baby bok choy with garlic. Second time here - to have lunch.

I loved the food! They sizes are good, it’s not oily and taste very authentic. Prices are affordable and waiter is friendly.

I would recommend this place if you are visiting China town.

This is comfort food. I've been going here for many years, and this place has not changed, which is a good thing. We ordered Scallion Pancake w. Aromatic Beef, Soup Dumplings with Crab Meat and Pork, and Seafood Pan Fried Noodles. Everything was delicious. Part of me feels like I should try different menu items each time I visit, but I always crave the same dishes. Hopefully I can continue to visit this place for many more years.

Service is always amazing, been coming here for years even before it was named this. The food has remained consistently amazing. The service is always impeccable and the prices are very fair. Best soup dumplings around.

My first stop whenever I am in New York. The dumplings, lo mein and fried rice are my favorite but everything here is amazing. Prices are good, service is quick and the food is delicious & hot! Cannot go wrong with this staple!

google.name: The Ten Bells
google.address: 247 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: We only got the charcuterie and cheeseboard, some sardines, and the orange wine. It was all good!

Really liked this bar. It's on a busy street that makes it fun to visit. And it being a wine bar was great - felt a little more upscale and mature. They had our group move from a dedicated table to the bar, and we actually appreciated the change as we got to be closer to the street. They also gave us lots of samples before we picked our glasses, which was much appreciated. Only negative - not a big fan of "natural wines".

Ten Bells!!

The place we met. The most amazing wine bar with great food and the friendliest service. Celebrating our wedding day here was a no brainer!  Thank you to everyone here for always making our visits special.

Beautiful place ! They have an outdoor seating all the way at the back. A huge dining room style table for shared seating and bar seating in the front. They have good choice of small plates and portions are literally small. I wish they had A/C in the seating area. It got humid and hot and we moved our tables to outdoor. Our server suggested a bottle for our table to pair with the food we ordered. Overall a decent experience.

GREAT happy hour option. $1 oysters and a $20 carafe of wine. The place got filled up at the bar pretty quickly, but it has a back room with a long table and an outdoor area. Might be my next oyster spot! (And will still come back for tapas too)

google.name: Starbucks
google.address: 72 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I understand it is a busy store. But a bathroom was such a horrible mess. You pay over 7 bucks for a coffee then expect somewhat decent bathrooms. I saw at least 5 people working at the counter. Could they take turns and clean the bathrooms?
I’ve come here one time in the past and had gotten an iced chai latte and it was great. The service here was pretty decent would maybe come back again in the future.
Very fast, friendly service and drinks was as you could expect for Starbucks!

Slightly confused as to why the employees don’t have common courtesy. Attempted to open the door at 5:30AM on 11/6/24, two employees made eye contact with me but the door was locked. They looked busy so I didn’t bother them. They clearly see me waiting right in front of the door but don’t say anything. At 5:40AM another customer comes and has to start banging on the window multiple times for them to sign through the glass that they’ve decided to open at 6AM today instead of 5:30AM as listed on the door and online. Completely understand things happen in a business. Employee could call out, short on supplies, etc. However, common sense and common courtesy would say to put a sign on the door or have a 5 second conversation with your customer waiting outside your door. Were they planning on having me wait outside for 30 minutes? If someone is going to get coffee at 5:30AM in NYC, they likely have things to do and can’t afford to wait around. Wish you all the best but not the brightest individuals working today.

This is a great Starbucks location! The space is clean, spacious, and modern.

Pros: The bakery is fully stocked, including the cold pressed drinks. The workers are fast and friendly.

Cons: No easy access parking before 6 pm. Limited in store seating due to tons of people planted for the day.

Overall, definitely worth a trip if you are in the area and need a refresher!

yelp.name: Starbucks
yelp.address: 157 Lafayette St, 157 Lafayette, New York, NY 10013

google.name: Loreley Beer Garden
google.address: 7 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: A fun night in a LES beer garden. We sat outside in the back, really the only place to be, and not gonna lie, people were getting hammered on the FABULOUS pumpkin ale (served out of a real pumpkin!) so it got pretty loud with the yelling and laughter bouncing off the walls. But everyone was having a good time! The three-warm-pretzels appetizer was delicious, best pretzels in a German resto that I've had in NY. Portions were large, food overall was very good, the waitress was professional and nice, we would definitely go back. A great place to bring out- of-town visitors!

This place wasn’t the best brunch I’ve ever had but it was still pretty good! The outdoor patio is decorated really nicely for autumn and their oktoberfest / autumnal brews were tasty! I’d say to try their side of potato salad as that was the highlight of my meal. Also big pretzel is great for sharing ! My friend liked the potato soup.

The ambience here is absolutely beautiful. Brandon was my server and he provided excellent customer service. He made sure that we were taking care of. I didn't have the food, but it looks absolutely delicious. I definitely recommend people coming back here.

Well-decorated/themed bar for Halloween! Really cozy and nice bar staff. We didn't get a chance to go to the beer garten, they didn't say why, the hosts just kind of shooed us to the bar but that's fine. Nitro cold brew martini was great and my fiance enjoyed his Pilsner. The german beer in stein is great. Good crowd, did not try any food just a quick stop and it was fine for that!

Discover the enchantment of Loreley largest heated outdoor beer garden in Manhattan Lower East Side . Immerse yourself in a winter wonderland with stunning decor that sets the perfect cozy and warm ambiance.
Whether it’s a gathering with friends or a romantic date night, this outdoor beer garden is the ideal spot. Indulge in their delectable brunch specials and savor the goodness of their delicious cocktails.

Featuring ⤵️
❄️Giant pretzel with bacon and cheese dip
❄️Steak and eggs
❄️Potatoes pancakes with smoke salmon and sour cream
❄️Hot cocoa
❄️Egg nog

google.name: Cafe Select
google.address: 212 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Giving this pace 4 starts because 1. when we went in the summer there was no AC, so it was a bit hot and 2. I thought my salad was extremely mediocre and was very watery on the bottom. We were there pretty early on a weeknight (around 6:30pm) and didn’t have to wait in line to get seated, but the spot looked pretty busy around 8pm. Overall, if you’re in the area and looking to grab something and people watch, this is a good spot, but I wouldn’t travel to eat here.

We merely stopped here for a refreshment on a very hot New York  City day.
Cafe Select had a nice menu but alas, we were still digesting our lunch. So a coke and a margarita were on the order.
Sitting up at the bar, out of the heat, we caught up on our plans for the rest of the day.
The decor is absolutely gorgeous, with eye catching posters and prints and bud lights sprinkled across the entire ceiling.
Had to take a photo of the Rolex clock mounted from the roof with Jim’s Omega watch in the foreground. Rolex’s fame of keeping accurate time didn’t hold up well against the Omega.
😂😂😂
If you come to dine, there is seating outdoors on the pavement which is enticing. That along with the funky decor and great customer service, makes #cafeselect one to put on your list.

#thewanderingreviewer#newyork2024 @cafeselectnyc  #caféselect #cafeselectnyc #omegawatch
Nice restaurant in Soho! The atmosphere is great, the food is good, the service is quick. I recommend and hope to return another day.

I was walking around and spotted the cool lights from the outside and decided to go in and have dinner here. The atmosphere was so lovely and Christmassy. I had the truffle burger and it did not disappoint. It was so good.

This place is so warm and cozy! Loved the atmosphere. The cocktails were amazing! I normally hate tomato soup but I got theirs and it was delicious. The staff was pleasant as well. I highly recommend this spot.

google.name: Home Sweet Home
google.address: 131 Chrystie St # 1, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Went out on a Saturday night and had an amazing time. The bartenders were fast and so attentive even though the place was packed, not to mention the drink prices were so reasonable. Loved the music and definitely will be going back soon

A super fun bar that has a clubby basement vibe. Beware coming during the summer, because it gets HOT! The drinks are always so strong and affordable, and depending on the DJ the music can be either mid, or the best in town.

Love it here. I love to start my nights out in LES here. I remember coming here a couple of years ago for the first time for a goth event that was hosted here and fell in love.

Get the frozen margs!!

EVIL BOUNCER!! Love this bar so much and have been going for years but when we tried to go last night the bouncer was charging a $10 cover, all good we paid, he took our money and then said actually $10 more to go in. We said no that’s too much can we have our money back and he wouldn’t return it. Never heard of anyone doing that, really disappointed cause usually it’s a fun spot.

Really fun bar, but you guys have a phone thief problem. Both my and my friend's phones were stolen from our bags while dancing and other people I've talked to have either had their phones stolen here or know of someone who has

google.name: Pianos
google.address: 158 Ludlow St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Classic Lower East Side NYC bar. So many other places didn't survive the pandemic but I glad this place did. Great venue to watch shows and dance upstairs. Their happy hour burger on an English muffin is my favorite.

While I did not try the food here, the frozen margaritas are pretty good ! I used a drink ticket for the open mic event that I was attending, but they also had a happy hour before 8 pm. I liked that they have music in both the front and back areas of the space. I would highly recommend this spot for someone looking to have a conversation amongst friends w/ music in the background. There's also some events held in the back for open mics if you're interested in performing !

Such a great vibe, and diverse, nice music, of all type, and different artists performance, with great talents, of all kind. Nice drinks, food smells delicious, and look lovely. Although i haven't tried any food as yet. I'm always full when i get there, next time ill leave an empty appetite to try it out. I been there 4 times already, and its always awesome.
Fire 🔥! The brunch food list is excellent, the prices are very reasonable, and the crowd is electric fun. Please, do yourself a favor and go. I'm definitely going back for more🥳 come and join me.
Had an amazing time here and we got shown some super awesome art. Will definitely go back if I visit NYC again

google.name: Blue Agave Pulquería NYC | Mexican Restaurant & Agave Bar
google.address: 11 Doyers St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: The this here were delicious. I highly recommend the shrimp tacos. The ambiance, wall art/murals and dance hall were all very Aztec and beautiful. My friends and I loved the DJ, the esters were friendly and again food was great. Now the drinks, I'd skip. I did not enjoy it at all. May want to change the bartender or drink itself. Not sure. 4 stars for sure.

Having a Latin place for drinks and food in Chinatown is a game changer. The vibe is cute and the classic essence of Latin culture. What makes this place a gem is the hidden pathway to get in there. Makes it more vibrant. The food was delicious! The tuna tortas were so good we had to go for two orders of them! The pitchers aren’t as strong as we’d expect, so if you want a good strong drink stick to what you know. I had to get the mezcal pina and that drink by itself did justice over the pitcher. I loved the music and the service was amazing. They were attentive without being too much and the servers knew their menus to recommend which tacos to get since I’m a taco fanatic. Like always I go for the birria tacos and they did not disappoint. Our favourite was the Aztec soup which is highly recommendable! The flavours that capitulate your taste buds are everything. Then we ended the night to their dance floor room to end the night, so if you want to have fun afterwards (post 9:30pm), then you’ll enjoy a night to eat and a good night for dancing. Highly recommend!
Didn’t try the food since we were bar hopping. The drinks were nice and strong. The Music was good and I liked the atmosphere. Will be back!

We (group of 4) had a sampler of four flavored pulques: mango, strawberry, pineapple, tamarind. We liked the pineapple and tamarind best. They do mix with white tequila (Puerta Negra/Black Door) to give it a little kick since the pulque's bottling process changes the fermentation process. We also tasted the original pulque flavor.

We ordered the Molcajete, which had chorizo sausage, steak, chicken, shrimp, and nopales (cactus), all sizzling in a sauce in the volcanic molcajete bowl. Also tasted the tacos al pastor. They served it with a good portion of diced sweet pineapple, and it wasn't greasy.

Service was great as they were constantly checking to see if we were ok, needed anything, and cleared the table of any used plates.

Fun Mexican restaurant with an underground bar. We ordered the Fiesta tacos to try different options. Surprisingly the best ones were the chicken tacos. There is a bar next to the restaurant with a fun vibe. It lightens up after 11:30.

google.name: Dirt Candy
google.address: 86 Allen St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
One of the best dinners I’ve had in NYC. An exquisite and quite reasonably priced prix fixe menu. Loved the creativity of each dish - the real standout was the shaved cauliflower.  While the restaurant decor is a little worn, it’s all about the food here.

Love that there is a seasonal menu, may have to come back again!

The food was really mediocre; I don’t understand the hype. Yes, it was colorful and showcased a nice play with vegetables, but it lacked quality. A few dishes were overpowering. I loved their carrot pizza though!

$105 with tip included is relatively cheap for a Michelin restaurant. The dishes were hit or miss. The tomato donut was surprisingly the best while the corn pasta my least favorite. Opposite of my expectations. Great service

DirtCandy is a vegan/vegetarian Michelin star restaurants in NYC. It is a non-tipping establishment. Overall my experience was average, not really worth the money spent. Total $272 for 2 people tasting menu + two teas.

Ambiance - is nice and simple, lighting is quite dim. There is an open kitchen in the middle, where you can see the chefs preparing dishes.

Staff & service - staff is very warm and friendly, explained the dishes and answered our questions patiently. Service was quite quick, they brought the next course as soon as we were done with current. We got two complimentary dishes as well during the five course meal :)

Now coming to the food
Complimentary welcome item - we got carrot mousse served in a savory crunchy cone. It had different textures and flavors.
Presentation- 9/10, taste - 9/10

First course item - lettuce dish. Nice burst of flavors and lots of textures from creamy to crunchy.
Presentation- 8, taste - 9

Second course - tomato dish. Nice pairing of donut, feta cheese and tomato jam
Presentation- 8, taste-9

2nd complimentary item - it was clear broth with sesame seeds and turnip flat noodles. It was quite tasteful as well.
Presentation-7, taste -8

Third course - corn dish. This dish was also good. Had few corn chips, corn soup, cilantro and little pasta bites.
Presentation-6, taste -8

Fourth course - Eggplant dish. Liked the coconut curry and outer crust of the dish, however I didn’t like the texture of the eggplant filling. It also lacked seasoning in the filling.
Presentation-7, taste -4

Fifth course- Caramelized onion ice cream
Definitely a novel concept. Onion ice cream is sandwiched between choco chip cookies and served with framboise (raspberry sauce). If you eat ice cream on it’s own, you can definitely taste onion flavor. It wasn’t really something that I would go again for. But with the cookie and raspberry sauce, onion flavor gets masked nicely and is not overpowering. But I am glad I tried this wild flavor of ice cream 😄
Presentation-7, taste - 7

This was my first experience at a vegetarian only restaurant. I was very excited to try it and looking forward to the tasting menu experience to be able to try many dishes.

Each course was smart, creative, tasty, and filling. I didn’t miss the meat at all! I had a seat at the counter so I enjoyed watching the talented chefs cook during my meal.

Check it out if you enjoy vegetarian dining. But don’t miss it even if you aren’t strictly vegetarian.

google.name: The Grey Dog
google.address: 244 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Grey Dog is a fantastic spot! I loved the cozy decoration and the welcoming atmosphere. We came during the last 30 minutes of brunch, and the food was still excellent. The pancake and fried chicken were crispy and delicious, and the breakfast bowl with French toast is a must-try. Plus, they have a happy hour starting at 4 PM, making it an even better place to hang out. I’ll definitely be back!

Great "live" place with a unique old design, good food(medium-sized) dishes
The toast served inside the dish?!
Good stuff,
Could change the toilet into two separate toilets to avoid the crowd.

We got a bit unlucky and the day we went it was down pouring really badly. And unfortunately the only seats available were on the patio so the seating arrangements were not fun, or comfortable. The chairs were also wet but this is out of the restaurant's reach. The food was decent! Not amazing and not bad, it was not a bad experience, but I wouldn't go again because it did not really give me that wow factor that I look for to return.

Dont forget to reserve a table if plan to come on a weekend. Packed! But food is great, service is fast and attentive. Pancake and french toast is moist , yummy. Our latte is strong they have good selection of coffee.

A friend and I came here not too long ago to try it out since we were in the area and it looked cool and we were not disappointed. It is a nice little restaurant and The food was excellent. The service was phenomenal, and our server was awesome and was very kind. Will be back again! Highly recommend!!

google.name: Phở Grand
google.address: 277C Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Classic Vietnamese fair in the Chinatown area of downtown NYC. In my opinion, this is the place you want to go if you want a no frills experience, just solid good food.

This time I got Shrimp Summer Rolls & the Grilled Pork Rice Vermicelli salad. This is perfect for a hot summer day. All delicious!

Great. Seafood noodle soup was delish so was the fried spring rolls and grilled pork chops.
Mango drink and mango smoothie was amazing

Good food! Flavorful dishes and fast service. Small Vietnamese joint with reasonable pricing. However feeling a bit bothered - the owner somehow insisted the store was closed and we should leave even though customers at neighboring tables were still eating.

20 years ago, this was one of the better, of the rare Vietnamese spots. This was when non-Asians thought Vietnamese food was Panda Express. Yeah, you did - Karen.

It’s rather pedestrian these days, but still solid. No longer a destination, but if in the hood- it’s a relatively cheap option. Prices have practically doubled since I first came here, but so has almost everything else in the city/ world.

Price to portion: standard
Destination: no
Repeat offender: only when I’m in the hood and the craving hits
Big portions. Spicy and well seasoned. I got the Obama plate (lol). Differences in prices are outlined on the menu (card vs. Cash)

yelp.name: Pho Grand
yelp.address: 277 Grand St, Ste C, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Parm Mulberry Street
google.address: 248 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: Came here for the rigatoni carbone, it was pretty good. We also enjoyed the fresh mozz with prosciutto. The arugula salad had fig in it, I loved it but my friend was not a big fan. The spaghetti and meatball was ok. We came here for dinner on a Saturday. The line was quite long, as expected. The guy worked at the door was good, attentive, and communicated well about the wait time. It was a small and busy place, but our waitress was patient and welcoming.

Our visit here was a good time! We got a chance to sit outside and enjoy the breezy, sunny day. We had the eggplant parm sandwich which was soo good with the sesame bread!! It was perfect to split with my husband! Then the rigatoni was fresh and well cooked. It was not as spicy as I thought it would be but it was tasty !
Pasta was overcooked, rigatoni was too spicy, waitress was inattentive, garlic bread was kind of dry but the bursts made up for it. Also my pasta had no cheese! Lovely atmosphere.

sat at the corner bar, it was so nice to be a little tucked away. we were helped by emma and she was absolutely fabulous. she delivered our food quickly. she is the best and i hope when you eat here she is working!

OH MY GOD! This is my favorite place in the city right now and I do my best to introduce it to all my friends and family. Parm on Mulberry St. is a tiny restaurant that serves some of the best italian cuisine in big portions at a reasonable price. Although their menu is on the smaller side, each of their dishes come out fresh, hot, and very tasty. I usually enjoy their pizza garlic rolls and mozzerella sticks for appetizers and eggplant parm platter for dinner. The best part is that all the platters come with a side of spicy rigatoni that is very similar to the one at Carbone. Basically, you get a 2 in 1 deal when ordering a platter.

Seating is very limited and it is crammed in the restaurant so be prepared to enjoy a hearty meal on a small table while bumping elbows with the person next to you. There are a couple tables in the restaurant and outside. There is also bar seating.

The staff is very friendly and attentive. They are good at making conversation and make you feel at home while you enjoy your meal.

This place is a must try!

google.name: Essex Market
google.address: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Fantastic assortment of food. Just needs more seating. Recommend the lasagna at this italian place/kiosk/booth (5 stars for this). Owner was super nice, too! Sorry the name escapes me at this moment.
It was my first time at the market since it moved. It looks great. However, they don't have a dumplings place inside.

Lots of cool shops and restaurants. My favourite Riverdel Cheese was replaced by Rebel Cheese. I haven’t been here in over 4 years. The guy behind the counter was helpful and patient. I wish they would bring back the caramalized onion. I still remember it from 8 years ago when Riverdel was in Prospect Heights just down the street from where I lived on St Johns Place. It was the impetus for me to go vegan after almost 30 years as a vegetarian.

A nice new building to go shopping. It is actually a kind of market but then permanent and inside. You can find everything from vegetables to fish. There are also tables upstairs where you can eat quietly with a view of the stalls or the street, which is great.
Amazing public market full of grocery vendors and quick eats places. It has lots of options for food from pizza to burgers and other unique eats. It has lots of seating space and good ambiance.

google.name: La Mela
google.address: 167 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
Very tasty chicken Parmesan with a side of pasta w/ sauce, and was all a good sized portion.

Charcuterie board with prosciutto, cheese & olives was a nice way to start off the dinner. Also tried the spaghetti w/ meatballs. The meatballs themselves were cooked well, but could use a little more flavor inside. Otherwise, the portion was also great.
La Mela is a must visit when in NYC. The best meal I've ever had. Food, service, and atmosphere are 10/10. Can't wait until I'm back in NYC.

La Mela in Little Italy, Manhattan, is an incredible dining experience, though I had slightly higher expectations given its reputation. While not a luxurious establishment, the food is truly exceptional—veal, chicken, and all the pasta dishes are absolutely delicious. The portions are generous, and the attentive service from the waitstaff and entire team is outstanding. I would highly recommend La Mela to anyone seeking fantastic food and hearty servings in a warm and welcoming atmosphere.

Absolutely amazing food. Legitimately the best eggplant parmesan that my family had ever had. The wait staff helped us choose the right combo of sauce and noodles to give everyone at the table the best experience and they knocked it out of the park. We were seated in the back room and it had a really cool glass ceiling.

Really cool restaurant. The owner is really nice, he came out and checked on us! We had the Chicken Parmigiana, which was really good. They had relatively quick service for how busy the restaurant was. Overall great place (+ they have outdoor seating as well) ! Would come again!

google.name: Mikaku Sushi
google.address: 85 Kenmare St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Came here for lunch from seeing good reviews on here, but I ended up disappointed. It's not bad, but it's not great either.

I ordered a salmon don, the salmon was alright, but the rice was dry and hard. It took a second to get seated, one of the waitresses was just on her phone while we waited to be seated (there were several open tables.) The waitress we did end up getting was really attentive though, and she frequently came to refill our water, take away plates, etc.

I think for the price it's fair, but I don't think I'm coming back here.

Very small but very good. Looks kinda sketch from the outside. Inside is clean and cozy with an extremely friendly staff. Really nice presentation and very fresh. I had the avocado salad for $6 and it was huge. 3 of us ate for $80. Also, very fast!
This Japanese restaurant is one of the best i have ever tried. The food is fresh and flavorful. I left satisfied and happy. Will be coming back here numerous times.

mikaku sushi was a pretty good experience for my friend and i. prices were insanely good for nyc, about the same i pay for sushi back where i currently live in central pa. we ordered the sushi for two, quality was good but our "chefs choices" were the most basic sushi you could ask for. overall, the restaurant is delicious with good service. be aware they do automatically add an 18% tip to your bill!

My favorite spot in lower Manhattan for the price.  They've upped their game.
Good service, good price and great food!

Fun fact.  This place has been here for 25+ years

google.name: Elevate
google.address: 93 Bowery, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: Excellent vegan options! So delicious!! A must try when visiting Bakery Square!

This is a typical hotel lounge and restaurant - not really anything to boast about. The decor was somewhat confused for a restaurant serving mostly Asian fare - it was a bit tiki lounge meets sports bar. My friend and i got there on the later side of the evening, and there was only one other table occupied. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The portions, although well made, were a bit small for the prices. We enjoyed our time there, and we were allowed to linger over our table until closing time. All in all, I would rate the place as a pretty run of the mill hotel restaurant, but with a very kind staff and decent food.

Subpar service.  Waiter was not familiar with the menu, couldn't tell me when the fish is shipped in, and had to redo my order because they were out of items.  Also took them 45 minutes to serve me edamame (I think he forgot).  I was one of 2 tables being served in the restaurant.  Tuna was good,  yellowtail and salmon were "fishy" (apparently not stored/handled at proper temperature).  I won't be back.
Awesome spot gotta check it out!!
Great happy hour drinks!!

google.name: Tacombi
google.address: 267 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: A very nice, simple, yet delicious Mexican restaurant. The location and decor were really to my liking and fit the whole theme perfectly. The food was plentiful but tasty and the service was lightning fast. All the dishes were super fresh tasting and light except the burritas which stood out as the only heavy and somewhat dry dish in the bunch and could benefit from some sort of sauce. The tacos and quesadillas on the other hand were really very good and I would happily come back to try the rest of them.

Great vibe and authentic atmosphere! Great food and very friendly and professional staff!
Loved the quesadillas and the agua fresca!
Recommended!!! Enjoy 😉
Sorry no pictures of the food…because the staff has been so nice to help me charge my phone!!!

Recently visited and had the fish taco and shrimp taco.
Both were excellent—well-seasoned, flavorful, and among the best tacos I've had in New York city.
The atmosphere is cool with great decor and music.
The service was perfect. Highly recommend this spot !

I feel scammed. There was a collaboration with a “Michelin “ star restaurant from Mexico City so I ordered the special item on the menu. What came were thinly sliced meats on a taco with NOTHING else in it. It did not even taste good. Felt like something you can pull out of a box in the frozen aisle and heat up. Is this some kind of joke or social experiment. Never trust any influencers again.

LMAO SCAMMERS!!. Did they claim it’s Michelin star taco?! They should refund me. It’s one SMALL pics of DRYYY meat with dry corn wrap. Charging $7 for ONE TACO, a pic of beef meat and bread. Hard to chew and tasteless. Worst restaurant in nyc and I live in the city. They did not provide sauce unless you ask. lol

google.name: Little Ruby's SoHo
google.address: 219 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text:
Little Ruby’s really impressed me. I went there craving a burger, but was blown away by their chicken sandwich. It was one of the better fried chicken sandwiches I’ve had in recent memory.

I was also impressed by how nice their little “outdoor”/curbside dining area was. It was very cozy and nice.

Service was good too! All around pretty happy with the experience. I’d definitely come back. If you do end up checking it out, you HAVE to get the fried chicken sandwich.

Nestled in the heart of SoHo, Little Ruby's is a delightful gem that perfectly blends charm and sophistication. The moment you step into this cozy eatery at 219 Mulberry St, you’re welcomed by a warm atmosphere and an inviting decor that feels both modern and intimate.

The menu is a delightful journey through creative dishes that highlight fresh, seasonal ingredients. I highly recommend the avocado toast—it’s a standout! Paired with perfectly poached eggs and a hint of chili, it’s a deliciously satisfying option for brunch. The coffee is equally impressive, expertly brewed and served at the ideal temperature.

Service at Little Ruby's is attentive without being intrusive. The staff genuinely care about your experience, making excellent recommendations and ensuring you feel right at home.

Whether you’re stopping by for a casual brunch or a cozy dinner, Little Ruby's offers an experience that’s both relaxed and refined. It’s a must-visit for anyone in the area!

Food here was absolutely delicious, I am not a fan of salads and I loved the salad here. To the point that I came back the day after to order the same item, would definitely recommend as a brunch place. Although spacing is a tad tight and there aren’t many tables, there could be a lot wait at peak hours. Servers may also disappear for a while if you are at the patio, so that was a bit of a struggle.

Place gets very busy even during early hours and for good reason. The place is cute, walking distance to good shops and of course the food is good.

Service was quick but maybe not the most friendly. They were not unfriendly though but just kinda lacking like meh lol not necessarily a complaint but rather just an observation. anyhooo, service was also prompt and orders came in correctly. Pancakes were verrry good! light, fluffy and delicious with great syrup! Avocado toast was nice and filling and the juice was refreshing!

I can see why its an easy go-to place for a lot of people and glad we were able to try it out!

We came here without a reservation during the middle of the week for lunch and were able to get a table in 15 min. The interior is simple but enjoyable as you can look out to the street. Service was friendly and the food was fantastic.  We got the grain bowl and burger here. The burger was solid and the sweet potato fries and aioli that came with it were tremendous. We ate every last bite of both of our plates and look forward to coming back and trying more of their items.

google.name: LuAnne's Wild Ginger
google.address: 380 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
We visited this restaurant with friends, eager to try something new. As someone who isn’t vegan but enjoys exploring different cuisines, I approached this experience with an open mind. The service was excellent, and the atmosphere was pleasant, which made for a welcoming start. Located in a bustling area, it's definitely in a prime spot.

When it came to the food, I have to be honest—I would rate the bibimbap a 5 out of 10. I'm a big fan of Korean cuisine and particularly love bibimbap, but this version didn’t quite hit the mark for me. It was also my first (and probably last) time trying tofu skin wraps. On a positive note, the portions are generous, so you certainly won't leave hungry.

While I may not return, I think this place is worth checking out if you're vegan. It offers a different take on some classic dishes, and you might just find your new favorite meal.

Big portions, ultra healthy, awesome value for money.

I live in Chinatown, and there aren’t many options for salads or vegan/vegetarian food. It’s great that LuAnne’s is within walking distance. The food reminds me of the meals that are served at yoga or wellness retreats - plant based whole foods that may be a bit “too healthy or bland” for some but still flavourful and will fill you up. Even if you’re not vegetarian, I would recommend stopping by LuAnne’s for a wholesome, hearty meal.

This was our first time trying LuAnne’s and it was a great experience. The place is super cute and the staff is really nice. We LOVED the eggplant in sweet basil sauce and the mango soy in garlic plum sauce (both sweet and saucy and delicious). The pho was also really good but there was a lot of noodles for the amount of broth. The mango raw thai salad was not our favorite but not bad and we didn’t like the stir fried prosperity platter - it was a little bland. Would definitely come again and try different things!

This wasn’t my favorite vegan meal. While I appreciate the effort, the mock meat we had was was dense and chewy, sauces were on the sweeter side, gravy flavor wasn’t balanced and the samosas were more like small thin savory pastries rather than the traditional Indian ones. The wild rice, though healthier, wasn’t the best complement to the gravy. The japchae was the only dish I really liked. I was hoping this would be a go to option for us with multiple locations in the city, but sadly no. It took a long time to get to us and when lukewarm and needs to be reheated, changes the texture and consistency.
Loved the low lit comfortable environment of this place and stayed awhile after my meal just to relax here. Tasty vegan options and fast, friendly service.

google.name: Casa D' Angelo - Nyc
google.address: 146 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: After a historic tour of Little Italy, my 2 best friends and I stopped in for a final meal before our flight home to Georgia. The service was impeccable and the food was excellent. Exactly what you expect from dining in Little Italy! We are outside and enjoyed the sounds of the city.

Such a great authentic experience! This restaurant is actually like visiting an Italian family in their home. The service was fluid, unobtrusive and filled with touches that are overlooked because it was done behind the scenes. The food was delicious and such a delight. The cheesecake was exceptional and they make everything in-house. Florin, our server, was one above amazing. Thank you so much for a great experience at your restaurant. Next time we are in town, we will be back!! Bon Appetito! 🫶🇮🇹🎉

We had many other food I didnt get to take pictures of but from what I had it was amazing. We started off with the meatballs, mussel, baked clams and pulpo (octopus) salad (its cold pulpo FYI). I had the seafood special with lobsters, mussels, baby clams and shrimp. It was good. One of my other guest i was with had shrimp scampi (only posted cause i try) and it was delicious as well. For dessert i got try cheesecake and crème brûlée. I would be honest the crème brûlée its way better if you had pick and choose out those 2 options. But both desserts were good. Florin the waiter is amazing guy, speaks few languages and is very catering ! Thank you for your service and amazing food. Would definitely come back !

After reading all the reviews on a restaurant near our hotel, we found this place.  The reviews were great.  Although we walked down little Italy and noticed quite a few restaurants were busy and lively; however we decided to go with this restaurant based on the reviews.  I was very disappointed.  I was there with my husband and 2 kids.  We orders the pasta bolognese, rigatoni a la vodka and the beet salad.  All the dishes were underwhelming and unsatisfying.  The salad was the most disappointing.  I would not recommend this restaurant since there are so many other options on Mulberry street.

Today Monday I celebrate the birthday of my beautiful wife in this amazing restaurant, which I heard good reviews from internet. The service, food, atmosphere was really good, specially the food with a delicious flavor.  Florin N our waiter really took care well of us, he make sure that have everything we need it and set up the table before hand, wonderful worker, friendly 😀  He took picture of us without asking to make sure we have a good time and good memories. We will be happy to come back 😊

google.name: Bacaro
google.address: 136 Division St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. The food is fantastic. The fritto misto is a hit, and the eggplant parm is excellent. The salads are always fresh. Everything on the menu is good. The service has always been wonderful to me and my family. It’s a blessing to have a restaurant this good nearby. Many surrounding restaurants have wine lists that are heavily, if not entirely, focused on natural and organic wines. These are great for people who enjoy stemmy, funky, and fizzy wines. Bacaro, however, offers an extensive list of classic Italian wines, which is a nice change from the natural wine trend that has taken over the Lower East Side.

When I got there they couldn’t find my reservation which I made through Resy even though the details were correct and they acted as if they were doing us a favor for still taking us in. Then they sat us down at a ‘shared table’ even though there were tables for 2 that were still empty. We ordered the stracciatella with figs and it came without figs… I raised this to the waitress and she went to “check” and didn’t come back until 20 minutes later, so I asked another waiter and very nonchalantly said “Didn’t they tell you? We’re out of figs”. I asked if we could see the menu and the waiter rolled his eyes at me. Then I ordered a medium rare steak but it came very rare, almost seared and it tasted like nothing. Very disappointing experience with inexperienced staff who clearly couldn’t care less. I hope the owner of this restaurant turns things around or I don’t see it surviving very long.
The atmosphere was great! While the food was okay, the dishes could have used a bit more flavor, and the pasta wasn't as fresh as I'd hoped

To start the atmosphere is awesome. We sat in the basement and it was very cozy and unique. The service was amazing. The wine was all Italian. She got the chicken and it was crispy and lovely, she also got the potatoes, again, lovely and perfectly cooked. I got the mussels as an app and the sole filet with broccoli. The broccoli was the highlight for me as its prep was perfect. We got deserts which we normally don’t do, she had the lemon sorbet and again, excellent, I got panna cota, excellent. If I had a complaint, the music was eclectic and sometimes a little loud and just jumped genres a bit much…if I had to complain. But I’m giving this 5 stars.
Very solid Venetian food served in a spot with great ambiance. Squid ink pasta is hard to find, and this is a great spot to get it.

google.name: The Original Buddha Bodai Kosher Vegetarian Restaurant 佛菩提
google.address: 5 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Great atmosphere in Chinatown. The waiter spoke a mix of Chinese and English, which made communication a bit challenging, but looking back, it was a fun and memorable experience. They have an enormous vegetarian menu, unlike anything I’ve seen at similar restaurants. The prices are super affordable, especially for NYC, and the portions are huge. We ordered one main dish for each (two people), but quickly realized that a single main dish would have been enough for both of us. Many other people were taking leftovers home, which would have been a good option if we weren't staying at a hotel. Highly recommended for anyone looking for delicious, filling vegetarian food.

Buddha Bodai is a reliable Chinatown staple for vegetarian food. Their dumplings and dim sum are phenomenal. You are served tea when you dine in. The dishes were all tasty, and I love that the gluten free options are clearly labeled.

This is a cute little restaurant serving vegetarian and vegan Chinese food. The place is bright and clean. The waiters are friendly and speak English. I've ordered many dishes and in my opinion, the vegan chicken is the best meat substitute! I find the vegan pork meat to be very soft and unappetizing. I really dont get why some people like it. The flavor is just okay. I recommend the chicken flat rice  noodle, pan-fried noodles with chicken, and chicken stir fried thin rice noodles. The chicken has a nice char flavor and texture is medium firm. The overall prices are moderate to expensive for what it is. Unlike most restaurants in the area, this place accepts credit cards, which is a major plus!

Very lovely vegetarian friendly restaurant! You’re served tea as you arrive, and the service is really nice as well as the atmosphere of the place.
Lots of options, as well as gluten free ones which is a major plus! I got the garlic Chinese eggplants and some chilli wontons. The eggplants were fabulous!
I think prices are a bit higher than what you can usually find in Chinatown, but still more than acceptable for New York. Knowing how hard it sometimes is to find vegetarian dishes, I will come back!

Really yummy food and friendly staff. Although the menu does not mention what is vegan or not, it does say if the plate has milk or eggs. The buns were great as well as the sesame fake meat. We got tofu skin with mushrooms that had a fun texture but definitely the least favorite plate. We got 3 buns, a main and a side and it was too much for 2 people. Maybe 2 buns and one main would’ve been enough.

yelp.name: The Original Buddha Bodai Kosher Vegetarian Restaurant

google.name: Da Nico Ristorante
google.address: 164 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text:
First of all, I want to say that the service was excellent. The waitstaff were very friendly. Our order was taken quickly and delivered just as fast, which was also nice.

Now about the order. We ordered a four-cheese pizza and a spinach salad. The salad was wonderful. Unfortunately, we had some issues with the pizza. Of the four types of cheese, I only felt mozzarella, which became quite rubbery when it cooled. I wouldn’t recommend it, as you won’t taste the Parmesan or Gorgonzola in this pizza at all.

The last pleasant moment was that we received a complimentary sweet treat at the end. That was great.

Overall, the atmosphere is wonderful. But whether I will come here again is a question.

This was a recommendation I'm glad we took. And ended up being to fuel for and great experience with my family.

The lady  who greeted us was GREAT  was very quick to accommodate our family which included a 5 month old with a stroller.

The food was AMAZING and very home cooked. My daughter had a hard time at another place we tried the food was alittle to kinky for her taste.

If you're looking for legit home cooked Italian food and a super friendly staff I'd definitely make this a stop

What a beautiful spot to eat!  The atmosphere is fantastic and so was the service!  This is a great little gem in the middle of Little Italy.  There seemed to be a bunch of locals enjoying there dinner there, which is always a good sign for a restaurant.  Our servers were very attentive and quick to keep our glasses full and ensuring we were enjoying our selves as well as our meal.  We had salad, bruschetta bread and three different pizzas.  The pizzas were apparently a personal size but they were big enough to feed at least two, we had lots of leftovers there was so much.  The pizza was very good, I don't think it makes a difference in which pizza you decide on, they make a great pie!
To our surprise after dinner they brought us a very good plate of fried dough with icing sugar!
There is a very nice courtyard out back.  We were very impressed with DiNicos and if I return to New York I will definitely go back!

This is a very good spot in Mulberry Street. There is a lot of competition and a lot of other good places.

We found their service was great, and the food was stellar. The muscles were good. 8/10 recommend. The tomato sauce is authentic and so is the pasta. The patio is also nicer than others.

Excellent Italian restaurant, which was expected given it's in Little Italy and it was recommended to us. I got the spaghetti and meatballs, and it was fantastic. The sauce was very good, and the meatballs were very dense. They also served us free funnel cake at the end which was nice.

google.name: Golden Forest
google.address: 4628 353 Grand St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I really enjoyed my beef and broccoli dish from here! So fresh and yummy. The beef was really tender too. Also some really nice people work here. Please support their business!
This is worst don’t west your money and time with worst behavior and food. This is so unhygienic.

This is the Best Chinese restaurant in the Lower east side hands down. I've been going here for 25 years and the food is still amazing. These bad reviews is not for the food or service. It's because people don't understand inflation and if not are super picky.We all have those kinds of people in are lives either friends or family 😭

Ordered chicken wings and pork fried rice from Golden Forest and couldn't believe how tiny the wings were. Seriously, they looked like baby/mini wings. 1 normal wing. 3 baby wings. Felt totally ripped off for the price I paid. The rice was okay, but that couldn't save the meal. Can't recommend this place until they fix the portion sizes.

I can't Walk and this restaurant refuses to deliver my food!!
If you are disabled don't order from here!!!!!
They only deliver to the better neighborhoods and don't take credit cards so they don't have to pay much taxes

google.name: Cowgirl SeaHorse
google.address: 259 Front St, New York, NY 10038, USA

review_snippets.text: Nestled in the easternmost edge of the seaport, just under the Brooklyn Bridge, you’ll find this inconspicuous little gem. They serve unpretentious Tex Mex sprinkled with seafood and burgers. I only tried the nachos but they were absolutely stellar. The beef was high quality, the guacamole was amazing and they make their own hot sauces. The green sauce was my fave. Sadly they don’t bottle the hot sauce for retail sale, or I’d purchase a couple. I can’t wait to return and try the burgers, I saw several of them hustled past me, one with gigantic fluffy onion rings. They looked as good as any burger I’ve seen. This place came highly recommended and it lived up to the hype. Great job.
Good atmosphere down by seaport for drinks and Mexican food. Food was decent. Served was great and my friends and I had a blast gettin a lil tipsy (like everybody in the club)

Loved the Seahorse decorations and the nautical vibe.  The place was hopping on Saturday.  I didn't try the food.  The prices on the drinks were very reasonable, especially for The Seaport area.  The service was good.  I have to come back to try their food and spend more time here.

There was hair in my quesadilla and that was it for me. Drinks were okay, took about 15 minutes for our orders to be taken after being seated. Wasn’t packed, low every server. Disappointing and I won’t be returning. I don’t recommend

Waitress very rude, throwing things, answering with anger. When I asked if everything was ok with her she said: “we’re understaffed , I’m alone today, how about that?”
Had just arrived at the city and went from the airport to this place with my family and was a terrible choice.

google.name: Bar Belly
google.address: 14 Orchard St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text:
Bar Belly is a happy hour dream! My friend and I stopped by and were so impressed with the amazing deals. I enjoyed a couple of beers, a glass of Prosecco, and we indulged in a generous helping of oysters — all at an incredible price. The oysters were fresh and delicious, making it an unbeatable value for seafood lovers.

The atmosphere is lively and bustling, with a vibrant crowd that adds to the charm of the place. Even though it was busy, the staff kept everything running smoothly, and we felt well taken care of. If you’re looking for a spot with great vibes, fantastic happy hour deals, and tasty bites, Bar Belly is a must-visit. Can’t wait to come back!

Good spot for happy hour in lower east side. Oysters were 1$ and the provide house popcorn which was seasoned great. Cocktails were pretty good and the atmosphere was lively. Ideal spot to come after work and chat

Loved the ambiance, music, and friendly bartenders! Super extensive cocktail menu, great for a date or a night out with friends! Complimentary truffle popcorn was a plus too!

4.5/5 Punch Card
4.5/5 Pineapple Express

Second visit during Happy Hour and we greatly  enjoyed it!

5/5 $1 Oysters -- some of the best HH oysters I've  had in the city. The soy dipping sauce was so unique and paired so nicely with the oysters!
5/5 Casanova - refreshing  with the perfect hint of floral flavor
4/5 Star Dust
4/5 Squarepants

BEST!!!! BAR!!!! IN THE CITY!!!! Been coming here regularly for 3-4 years. To start, the service is purely unmatched. The team will make you feel right at home - the biggest standout of all is the service. The menu though??? Something for everyone, from the most chill beer drinker to the fanciest of cocktail lovers. And of course the vibe??? Amazing variety - some nights dance party, some nights live jazz, some nights ultra chill. Open late but also a great time when you come early. Did I say best bar in NYC?? Good, cause I meant it and it’ll never change!!! BAR BELLY FOREVER

Imagine an intimate bar; dimly lit, ample seating, and an eclectic food menu that has everything you could want while sharing food with friends or a date. Well, that’s what bar belly is like and I’m so happy I ended up checking this spot out recently. My friend and I decided to grab drinks here on a weekday. We didn’t have a reservation and most definitely did not need one. Once we arrived we opted to sit at the bar. We had come during happy hour and were excited to have the opportunity to try some dishes and drinks out. Noted with beer but also tried the Casanova cocktail which tasted more like a vodka based summer drink. When it came time to food we dined on their tater tots and prosciutto pizza. All great for sharing! I’d totally recommend this for a more intimate occasion if you do end up visiting.

yelp.name: Bar Belly
yelp.address: 14 B Orchard St, New York, NY 10002

google.name: Jadis
google.address: 42 Rivington St, New York, NY 10002, USA

review_snippets.text: I had the loveliest birthday dinner here! The owner/chef and service was fabulous. They made me and my 17 (!!) friends feel incredibly well cared for. The food was delicious as was the wine. Highly recommend booking for large parties here - the process was smooth and very rea$onable. 10/10!

So i personally didn’t have the food but friends did and it looked and smelled great.  The service was great they was on point.  The drinks was spectacular. This place embodies Asian cuisine loved it definitely a sleeper 💗

Such a lovely place! I came for some happy hour drinks and a snack. I also needed respite from the heat. The drinks were good, the snacks nice, the atmosphere charming and comfortable to be there by the bar as a solo visitor. I must say that the service was fantastic and it felt really like the staff were on top of everything. Professional, warm and attentive. I highly recommend it.

4 stars overall because the service was wonderful and the prices reasonable for New York. Great for a larger party. Tiger shrimp and charcuterie plates were lovely. Excellent and well priced selections of natural wines.
Adorable outdoor seating, large wine selection (although I do wish they had a Sancerre by the glass) and the escargot is the best I’ve had outside of France. Will most definitely be back.

google.name: The Odeon
google.address: 145 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Overall loved this place. Loud, busy restaurant with great service and good food. Everything we ordered was very good: tartare, quiche, salad and omelet, but cinnamon donuts were our favorite!!! I would order all of it again but the 5 is because of the overall vibe of the restaurant. I can’t explain why exactly but it was just a great place to have brunch. Our server, I think her name was Macey but could be wrong, was great, attentive, friendly, funny and helpful.  Overall highly recommend and I want to return to try the grilled cheese.

Classy spot and the food was top class. We started with calamari which were excellent. We then had the Yellow Fin Tuna burger/sandwich! and the Lobster Roll. Both were delicious!  The service was also spot on. No rushing between courses which allowed us to enjoy the atmosphere and savour the food. We sat inside as it was very hot. They do have a small outside seating area but we were glad to be inside as you got the full impact of the restaurant! If you are looking for a taste of New York in classy comfort then definitely try The Odeon!👍

Impressed with how fresh shrimp cocktail was.
Very nice options for lunch
The service is the best part
Good drinks
Love so much

Classic NYC spot with great atmosphere. This has always been our main go-to for an after work martini, burger, and fries.

Bar seating is always fun!

The Odeon is iconic. It’s what NYC used to be and strives to become again. I’ve never had a bad bite here, doesn’t matter what you order. Our server was very charming and tended to us well.  Sit inside for the energy and scene, outside for good neighborhood vibes.

google.name: Spring Lounge
google.address: 48 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

review_snippets.text: I loved this shark themed bar.  The service is good.  The space is a good size.  Sarah and Eric were very nice bartenders.  The prices are very reasonable.  There were quite a few people already there and it wasn't even 2pm yet.  They open at 8am.  The atmosphere is laid back and welcoming.  I would definitely come back.

Lots of locals and completely packed inside on a Sunday.

Normal NYC prices at $7-8 a beer. Plenty of open outdoor seating but it was fairly cold in early March.

I only had one drink and never got to settle in/sit down considering the amount of people.

Def worth a visit to experience a neighborhood bar.

This classic New York City dive bar is known for its excellent beer selection. It's perfect for sitting outside on a nice day or staying warm inside with a cold beer while watching a snowstorm through the window.
