The only downside is that it has just one rather grimy bathroom, but that’s all part of the dive bar experience. If you’re bar hopping and plan to stop by Spring Street, it’s wise to use the restroom at your current and next stop before getting here.

A staple of NYC. Good beer selection. It's nice to sit outside when it's a good day, or hunker down inside with a beer during a snow storm and watch out the window.

The one downside is there's one bathroom and it's kind of gross, but hey it's a dive bar. If you're out bar hopping and going to head to spring use the facilities before you leave the current location and then the place after.

This is a really great dive bar, good pours and good conversation. The staff and patrons are all very friendly people, we had a really good time. This is a super fun place to have a cool beverage and spend a little time.  It reminds me a lot of the dive bars in New Orleans. The bar tender even bought me a drink!

google.name: Hotel Belleclaire
google.address: 2175 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: Just back from our second stay at the Belleclaire which was as wonderful as we remembered. The building is beautiful and the staff is so sweet and friendly. Perfect location near to the subway, the park and the history museum. Not crowded like a certain tourist area I will leave unnamed. The neighbourhood is gorgeous for wandering around, admiring architecture, dog watching and grabbing bagels etc. Rooms are small and basic but clean and comfortable. Really enjoyed the free walking tour offered by Streetwise. All in all don't hesitate, just book it.

My new GO TO HOTEL! The staff was so friendly and accommodating! The lobby was beautiful, and had a great vibe!
Our room was spacious, and very quiet so we had a great night sleep. They had great little touches that showed they care, such as the personalized note and complementary scones from the French bakery downstairs. The remote was wrapped in plastic, so we knew it was clean and untouched by others.
It was a great experience, and look forward to our next stay there!

We chose the Hotel Belleclaire as one of our wedding block hotels for our daughters wedding in early October.   The hotels location was perfect for our guests to experience NYC.    The suites and rooms were just what we wanted for our family and out of town guests.   Working with the sales team, hotel management team and hotel front desk staff was an excellent experience.   They made sure that our weekend was perfect in every way.   I would highly recommend this hotel.   Can't wait to stay there again on my next visit to NYC.

In general, the Belleclaire is a great hotel for visiting the upper West side of Manhattan. It's well designed, with real humans manning the doors and front desk. The elevators are prompt although very small. And there's a gorgeous staircase if you want to get your steps in. The rooms have some variability. So you might not get what you think you're getting. Given this is a very old building, it can come with problems. Our room had a leaky water valve that flooded the area in front of our toilet, plus a towel bar whose screw had come loose and popped off the wall, and a thermostat that wouldn't heat or cool the room, or even blow air. It's always good to ask for maintenance as soon as you see a problem, as the room cleaners don't check that level of detail. Desk clerks were really nice. We didn't make use of the breakfast vouchers because the lines were pretty long just for free coffee and pastries. If I could improve their rooms it would be with in room coffee makers and mini fridges.

We had a great time during our stay, the staff is very efficient and friendly. We had an issue with one of the guests and they handled it very well. The rooms were very clean and the daily cleaning was done very well. They are punctual when it comes to delivering the rooms. The location is perfect if you’re planning on visiting the Met or Central Park as they are very close to the hotel. It is located in a very central area, there’s a lot of restaurants and shops around. The walls are a bit thin, but overall we had a nice stay.

google.name: The Mark Hotel
google.address: 25 E 77th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: The service here is impeccable! We were in NYC and stayed here for an anniversary celebration. It was spectacular! Glasses of Champagne when we arrived for our anniversary, turn-down service each night with sweets and water for the evening or next day, and super helpful/friendly front desk (shout out to Kiwi Maria). The location is wonderful as it is close to Central Park and museums. The bar here is also great and energetic with yummy cocktails and food. The doormen and housekeeping were perfect. In other words- impeccable.
Only had breakfast from outside, did not stay in the hotel. This is really upscale clean neat hotel in Upper East side. I really like the restaurant service and attention to detail.
I feel this place is very old and dated. It's a beautiful hotel. It definitely needs some sprucing up the room services. Disgusting food is terrible here.
It's one of my favorite hotels, the patio is also great for having brunch or dinner.

This is a review for the bar. Although I’ve recommended the hotel to out of town friends because it’s so special. They are on point with all details and it’s absolutely stunning. Fun crowd in the main and restaurant bar, great service and fun ambiance. The hotel has bikes out front a cart to Bergdorf’s. I’ve had dinner here before and both experiences were stellar. Love the outside seating area and terrace too. Oh and you can get your hair done,

google.name: Central Park Boathouse
google.address: EAST 72ND ST +, Center Drive, New York, NY 10021, USA

review_snippets.text: A surprisingly great place to dine for lunch on a beautiful fall day. We were visiting New York and decided to walk Central Park. We walked in without reservations, put our names down and grabbed a seat at the bar for about an hour wait (Sunday). The views are beautiful and the outdoor patio is quite nice if you are seated in a nice spot with a view. During our time the sun was a bit direct and I saw a few diners had to stand up from their seats to dodge the sun. We enjoyed  the prawn cocktail, crab cake and chicken liver mousse. Their martinis and Bloody Mary’s are fabulous!

Stunning view and experience! This place while offered a great view of the lake on Central Park, the food was okay. I would say one should 100% experience this restaurant as it was rather stunning. The downside is a bit of service and value for dollar. We got seated in the only spot that had direct sun, but that was okay as it was a beautiful day. I would def return due to the location and overall experience this restaurant has to offer!

Had a delightful lunch at a the Boathouse after a relaxing walk through Central Park. Did not manage to get a table by the window but the lake was still visible. Food was flavourful. The entrees of jumbo shrimp and stuffed mushrooms deserve special mention.

Great location with stunning views, very friendly staff. I ordered the salmon and the ice cream for dessert - both were quite good but I wish it was more value per dollar, especially with the salmon as only cucumbers were given as a side. I would definitely say this is the place for a special occasion!

I rented a boat for $25 per hour. There was a bit of a wait—about 20 minutes in line. Unfortunately, my boat had some issues halfway through, and it unlatched from the row, which made it a bit challenging. Despite that, the views were fantastic.

yelp.name: Central Park Boathouse
yelp.address: E 72nd St And Park Dr N, New York, NY 10021

google.name: Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Upper West Side
google.address: 2450 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text:
I recommend making reservations if you’re going during weekends and during special occasions. Came here during the marathon weekend and it was packed! Otherwise, this location tends to have openings compared to Times Square.

Super big portions (family style) and good food. I highly recommend the antipasti selection. Can’t really go wrong with anything on the menu.

We had an amazing dining experience at Carmine's Italian Restaurant on the Upper West Side. The food was absolutely delicious, and the drinks complemented the meal perfectly. We enjoyed so much food that we had to take some home! The portions were generous, and everything was full of flavor. We truly enjoyed our dinner and will definitely be returning. Highly recommend for a fantastic Italian meal!

Wowwww each plate is large enough to share. It was so much food we had to pass on desserts. The wait staff and manager were amazing constantly checking on our table.

The manager even cleaned off plates from the tables which is amazing because normally managers stay in the back and it was great to see the interaction with everybody in the restaurand that she supported her staff by actually helping clear off tables and talking to the guests.

I give this restaurant 10 stars, and I highly recommend it. We will definitely be back.

Our waiter was awesome and took the time to explain how large the dishes are so that we did not overorder are food?There were 6 of us.We ordered three meals and we still had tons of food left over.

Carmines Upper West Side 91st Street on Broadway is a great place for larger groups to enjoy Italian cuisine.  The menu has all of the basic Italian food dishes. The selections are served family style. I think this adds to the conversation and family friendly atmosphere. The food is remarkably well prepared. I thought the spaghetti carbonara was excellent. It can be a difficult dish to get right. Some restaurants will take shortcuts that will impact the flavor of this gourmet dish. The rigatoni bolonase was ok. The Carmines salad and the cold antipasto were both wonderful dishes. My guests commented that they should not have filled up on the bread! The bread is very moist and tasty. However, the salads and the main dishes are pleantyful. I will repeat the advice from my guests. Do not fill up on the bread! Carmines is not a first choice for quiet dinnertime conversation! The place is full of chatter from the other tables. You will hear people singing happy birthday mixed with general crowd noise. Yes it can be noisy at times, but it is a happy noise that doesn't seem to get in the way of nearby conversation.  All in all, the food was delicious and the experience for my first time guests was a pleasant one. They were very happy with the food and the dining experience.

Love this place. Went for my birthday after the Guggenheim on a Tuesday at 5 PM. Danielle the server was great as was her support. Same with Crystal, the hostess. Huge portions for 3 people. Shared chicken Parmesan, lasagna and garlic bread with mozzarella. Will be back next time I’m in NY! Just wish they had craft beer!

yelp.name: Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Upper West Side

google.name: Magnolia Bakery
google.address: 200 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Just visited Magnolia Bakery and had to try their two famous treats: the banana pudding and a cupcake! For Banana pudding , the vanilla custard was smooth and perfectly sweet, with fresh banana slices that added a delightful counterpoint.

Magnolia offers a wide variety of cupcake flavors, so there's something for everyone. I went with the classic chocolate , and it was fluffy, moist, and delicious.

A few seats were available. The branch is located near American Museum of Natural History.

I finally made my way over to Magnolia Bakery! I got the classic banana pudding as well as the special (strawberry pudding). My favorite was the strawberry pudding. It was creamy, not too sweet and you can definitely taste the strawberry flavor and chunks. The classic banana was as equally delicious. Would I stop in and get it again? Probably not. It didn't really stand out to me. I would, however try out other specials and flavors.
My container also had little chunks of pudding all over it. Which I didn't particularly like. Overall if you love banana pudding and don't know how to make it. This is definitely your spot.

🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 Magnolia Bakery is an absolute delight! 😍 The ambiance is charming, and the service is exceptional. 😊 We tried their famous Banana Pudding 🍌🍮 and Key Lime Pie 🍋‍🟩, and both were heavenly! 👌🍰 The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the desserts were so fresh! Highly recommend for anyone with a sweet tooth. 🍬 Can't wait to visit again!

5STARS🎖️if ever in NewYork this is a MUST the place is out a storybook, small intimate &cupcake-cute. Located on the best part of the strip… such a vibe. I came back here a second time during my 2week stay😅😍🤤🤭🧁 I even forgot to take pics of the carrot cake it was so moist &tasty, also had some custard something 🫣 I just couldn’t wait to get the sweets in my mouth 🤤

Great bakery in a beautiful location, just two blocks away from Central Park! I have had a couple of their items throughout my time in the city, but I really enjoy the banana pudding!

I think the banana pudding is one thing that shouldn't be missed when in NYC!

google.name: Shake Shack Upper West Side
google.address: 366 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: This is a great Shake Shack. As soon as we entered the manager Natasha greeted  us at the door and lead us to the kiosk to order our food. The restaurant is clean and the food was delicious. It was my birthday and Natasha made me feel very special. I will definitely be returning here, and I love this area.

Table seating is limited. Place your order at the kiosks. Lower level has an odd smell to it. Very limited staff interaction. My sandwich was messed up. Clearly this location is in demand, the line was to the door the whole time we were there. Cheese fries were good.

The hamburger is tasty, only if you don't take into account the burnt patty.  Little place to sit, no straws and napkins in service.  Given that during visits there was a queue to the very entrance, but it was surprising that it moved quickly, that is, the staff works very quickly.

This Shake Shack is located right next to the American Natural History Museum, that’s why we decided to stop here to grab a quick lunch before heading in.

The staff immediately welcomed us with a smile and directed us to the kiosks to order. We just had a couple burgers and fries.

Everything was good, not sophisticated or anything, simple but good! The fries were swimming in cheese which for us was a bit too much but that’s absolutely personal taste.

We paid roughly 20$ for a satisfying and filling lunch, great stop!

My grandson and his friends and I ordered in kiosk and until now I checked my receipts on my email that I noticed that they added tips of $6.14 which I did not approved.
Since I didn’t need help ordering I don’t think it should be added in my order and also preparing my food it shouldn’t be a tip unless a large group and large order then I would give a tip.
Truly yours

google.name: Jing Fong
google.address: 380 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10013, USA

review_snippets.text: Loved it. Got my favorite (and hard to get) snow pea sprouts, soup dumplings, and fried rice. The duck my friend got was tasty as well. The people who worked there were nice and professional.

The shrimp, crab and spinach dumplings ($8.50) and the beancurd pork rolls ($9.00) were both excellent. The sautéed string beans ($11.95) was average. I personally prefer their Chinatown location (in terms of ambience and menu selection) but this one is pretty decent if you don’t want to trek down to Centre Street.

The pork chop, cauliflower, and the fried rice noodles are super super super salty.
The dim sum items are pretty good! And good thing is that many main dishes come with rice.
Service is below expectation. The waitress asked us once throughout the entire dining “how was everything”, but no response to our comment “these two dishes are too salty.”

For the first time in my life, I got to try out the lo mein and the shrimp fried rice was clean and not greasy and the pork shrimp and spinach dumplings were divine as well. Tiffany our server was very polite and engaging.

I enjoyed the atmosphere me and my girl were seated in a nice corner where we could people watch but yet it felt very private inside, which is a plus

Spend the night on the location before the shooting in early morning around UWS, moseying around the neighborhood and found Jing Fong.

First, let's order Tsing Tao beer to lift up my spirit, and I've ordered Steamed seasoned pork with tofu skin wrapped in coconut milk. I usually had this one every times when I stopped by Dim Sum place. but this was the first time that I had in coconut milk.

Second, was Fried pork chop. It was good but nothing special. But brown rice wasn't hot as it should be. Likely, I didn't get the best of Jing Fong tonight, I believed.

Anyway, what disappointed me was the timing. I've order appetizer for 10 mins and still waiting, however, the pork chop even served before appetizer.

I know this is not the end of the world, but I just want to spend sometime enjoy meal, and beer for the night. Nothing's wrong. Server was very attentive, friendly.

Probably I should try their Dim Sum next time, I've heard they have a good one.

google.name: Alice's Tea Cup
google.address: 102 W 73rd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: I love Alice’s Tea Cup. Typically, I’m on the East side and I’ll go there but today I wanted to get scones to go and I was on the West side. This location seems nice. I was in a hurry and couldn’t stay for tea today but the scones, specifically, the pumpkin scones with the clotted cream and jam are my favourite. I highly recommend it as well as sitting down for a nice cup if tea when you’re in the neighbourhood. They have a nice variety of teas.

This little cafe is adorable! Alice in Wonderland themed! My friend and I had the "Mad hatter" Tea for Two. This includes two types of tea, two types of sandwiches, 3 types of scones and a dessert that also came with mini macarons and cookies. The price was very reasonable for two people. You can also order take out!

This is one of our favorite spot for our family in our neighborhood! Must experience especially for a little one. Ask for fairy dusk and wings.  From the staff to the decor to the tableware, the details just make this place is so magical. Scones are on par with London and selection of teas are amazing. Our daughter ask to go here every year for her birthday. Such a special place to spend time with family and paint with our travel painting kits!
Great place with great service. You can have a cup of tea here, or buy tea leafs to brew at home. The staff knows a lot about each type they sell so don't be shy to ask questions.

Went for my daughters birthday and it was very nice quaint place, very clean. Staff was super friendly and helpful with suggestions. The food came out pretty quickly and everything was nice and fresh. They offered to go cups if you don’t finish your hot tea, they don’t rush you to leave. They definitely don’t put the receipt down until you actually ask for the bill definitely a go to place if you have a tea lover.

google.name: Lady M Cake Boutique - Upper East Side
google.address: 41 E 78th St, New York, NY 10075, USA

review_snippets.text: An inventive take on a multilayer cake using crepes. Very creative flavor combos. We tried the chocolate as well as the tiramisu slices. Iced lattes were life restoring! Service was attentive and professional. A little "slice" of the EU on the upper East Side.

The cakes are great & it used to be a fave of mine but the service is terrible. I ordered multiple items to-go & I wanted to eat a few bites of one before I heading to a work meeting but, despite the place being completely empty, the staff refused to let me sit down unless I wasted my life giving them my time for full table service. So, I stood out in the street to take a bite instead & now I’ll never eat anything from LadyM again because it just left me thinking poorly about the brand. There are plenty of other brands out there now making mille crepes & I love the Chinatown bakery variations

This place is amazing! I fall in love with their cakes in Honolulu. So when I came to NYC, I went their for my fav pistachio cake, but unfortunately it was seasonal addition so they didn’t have it. I decided to try their most popular cakes: signature, matcha and chocolate. Delicious 🤤 my fav is chocolate, matcha was interesting and the signature was too sweet for me, but anyway very tasty. The place itself is small but very cozy. Delicious coffee and tea. And excellent service! I highly recommend you all to try their delicate cakes! And I hope they will open their place in Miami ♥️

When we visited, they didn’t offer indoor seating, which was disappointing as we wanted to try the crepe cake right away. However, we bought two pieces and enjoyed them at home. They were amazing! Both the pistachio and signature flavors are perfect desserts. They're not overly sweet, allowing you to truly savor the taste of crepes and cream. Moreover, they're not too buttery, so you don’t feel overwhelmed with calories after having one piece.

I had a disappointing experience at Lady M. I went in with my baby, who was peacefully sleeping in the stroller. The cashier rudely told me to leave the stroller outside, with no apology or understanding. I even offered to sit in a corner to avoid disturbing other customers, but the cashier dismissed me, saying it was a rule and there was nothing he could do as an employee. The lack of courtesy and flexibility was frustrating, and it left a very negative impression.

google.name: Sarabeth's Upper West Side
google.address: 423 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: We celebrated my husband’s early Bday dinner yesterday at Sarabeth’s UWS location, and it was such a delightful evening! From the front entrance, entire staff were extremely friendly and courteous. We dined really early, so it was quite in the restaurant which was perfect for us. Food was great and drinks were strong and delicious. Everything was great but Chicken Pot Pie was our favorite. It was savory, creamy and rich. Chocolate toffee cake was extremely rich and delicious as well. Overall, a really pleasant evening thanks to wonderful staff and great food!

The restaurant week $30 two-course lunch was quite good. The watermelon and pumpkin seeds added textural contrast to the gazpacho, while the avocado gave it some richness. The doubled dipped crispy chicken was served on a bed of cabbage salad. The amount of dressing was just right but it could have done away with the cornbread croutons as there were not crisp or but rather dry and crumbly. Price-wise this offer is almost getting the first course for free as most plates are around the $30.

Showing it's age...  It might be Amazing for tourists, but the competition is stiff on the UWS.  Everything is showing it's age at this point, and it's time for a refresh...
Service was Good - but not Excellent, Good was Good - but not Excellent and Atmosphere is a little less than good with chairs that are loose, dirt in the corners and the crevices.
It's time to close down for a week, clean up, shape up and start fresh.  You guys are Better than this

Loved this place.  Very cute, intimate, peaceful place with outstanding food!  Michelle took great care of us.  I especially enjoyed the lemon and herb braised chicken with fingerling potatotes from the Restaurant Week special menu.  I hope that becomes a regular dish- so tender and the sauce was amazing! A new favorite place 😀

After a visit to the museum we stopped at this place for dinner because it looks nice from the outside.

Once inside, we started with some amazing cocktails. They also seemed popular at the bar, so an absolute recommendation here. For dinner we went for the fix menu. Everything was perfect and very delicious.

Too bad I don't live in New York or I would definitely be coming back to this place often

google.name: Gray's Papaya
google.address: 2090 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Well, this is a fine establishment for a hot hot dog 🌭🐕, on a hot day (and on a cold one).
I adore the toppings: this relish is the best made in the hot hot dog 🌭🐕 industry.
This is my second time here and I wish you good luck 🤞.

This place is known for its hot dogs, but to me, they just tasted like regular hot dogs—nothing particularly special. I also tried the Piña Colada, but it was so watered down that I couldn’t finish it after a couple of sips.

While the prices for hot dogs and drinks are fair, the quality didn’t really justify the cost, making it feel a bit overpriced. Additionally, the long line and the surroundings detracted from the experience. The neighborhood didn’t feel very welcoming, with homeless individuals frequently coming into the store to ask for money.

NY style service, but the hot dogs were the best I’ve ever had! Ordered just with mustard and sauerkraut, relish looked good too. Some condiments cost 75cent extra (mayo, chili, cheese).

I ordered pineapple juice, it was good, tasted natural. Wanted a coffee but hey we’re out of it. Stand up eating only.

Will definitely visit often if I lived in the city.

A solid NYC legendary place for hotdogs and papaya juice. The menu is simple, so the service is very fast and friendly, and they have a variety of juices to pick from. I find 2 hot dogs are good per person. Standing tables outside and inside for our quick bite. Enjoy!!
I got a hot dog with ketchup and a pineapple juice. The hot dog was good but too salty for my taste. I liked the pineapple juice though. Tables were kind of dirty but what more can you expect.

google.name: Talia's Steakhouse and Bar
google.address: 668 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

review_snippets.text: Comfortably served our party of 8 for dinner celebrating a graduation ceremony and birthday. Friendly service went above and beyond to make the evening special! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great - low, warm lighting and cute table lamps. Would definitely recommend!

I really wish I could love this place. And I want to support kosher restaurants. But Talia's is just lacking the attention to detail that is necessary for a great dining experience. There were just two, overworked waiters. We always had to flag them down. Brisket is supposed to be soft and tender -- we had to send ours back because it was hard and tough. We ordered a steak instead but both appeared on the bill. We should not have to worry about checking things like that. We had a large party and several appetizers and side dishes never appeared. We had to flag the waiters down for them too. Even getting our water filled was a chore. Wires were hanging out all over in the corner, it did not look nice. At the end the waiter handed me my credit card back. I asked for the receipt and he said there is no paper receipt but announced to the table how much the total charge was. Not cool. Maybe I could overlook one of these things, but put together it made it not feel like a special dinner out for the hundreds of dollars we spent. Next time my wife and I are making plans to go out we'll go someplace else.

It's a take out counter, and the savory lunch food I had was excellent, but the baked food and sweets were stale and not good, and the atmosphere was pretty gross.  It's filthy dirty in there and such a grim, paper plate type feeling.  We were looking for something nice. They should clean it once in awhile, repaint, get some nicer furniture.  Seems like it would be good for take out only.

My friend and I went to Talia’s for the kosher Haitian popup back in July. My friend keeps kosher but was also vegan, so we were looking for things to order that we would both want. We ended up with the classic stew, I got the meat version and she got the vegan. I tried hers and it tasted EXACTLY the same. You’d think that means they did such an excellent job replicating the meat flavors, but to us it felt more like the meat was an afterthought in the stew. They say they bring in chefs from these cultural backgrounds (Haitian chef was Haitian, their Indian popups have been Indian chefs) but to me it felt like they must’ve told her the audience can’t handle the full flavor of her food 🫣 I felt bad, as I’m sure she’s a great chef, but the food we tried didn’t have any strong flavors, and certainly none that stood out as unique to us. Our expectations were sky high as we both travel a lot and I eat dairy out, so we weren’t sure what we were expecting… I just think we were hoping for more brightness and shock value than this. In NYC, you can try an authentic dish on almost every street corner from a part of the globe you may have never heard of, but it’s the best thing you’ve ever had. Here, the food was fine and unassuming, but did not blow us away with any incredible flavors. I want to keep coming back to popups but please allow the chefs full creative control of their meals! We like Talia’s and I do not want this fi be seen as a negative review, but I would love for them to prove to us that their popups can be truly authentic. :)
(This same friend stopped being vegan and went to the Indian popup more recently and reported a similar experience).

Went to celebrate NYE at Talia’s Steakhouse last night. Service, food and ambiance was amazing. We went for their pre fixe menu and gladly enjoyed it. I ordered Ribeye well done and my partner ordered Chicken Marsala- was delicious and came out in reasonable time. Will definitely recommend and we will be back! Happy New Year!

google.name: E.A.T.
google.address: 1064 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: I bought ice cream and two pieces of cake(Coconut and Radpberry). Ice cream was fine but there is a GREEN MOLE inside a cake. Please be aware when you visit this place. Don't risk your life.

My boyfriend and I were meeting up with my in laws to visit the MET for his birthday. We were all pretty hungry, & my boyfriend and I had walked past E.A.T a few times, so we all decided to check it out. Even though it was a busy weekend, they sat us immediately. The staff were friendly and very attentive. The menu had a variety of options, but not an overwhelming amount. The food was amazing and came out quickly. I tried motza ball soup for the first time and was very impressed! Since it was my man’s birthday, they gave us complimentary cookies and sang “Happy Birthday”. It was a wonderful lunch with a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Another great part is that you can grab a pastry to go or come sit inside for a nice meal. Will definitely be recommending to friends and family! 🗽🩵

Lovely café two blocks away from the MET. I took refuge from the rain here and I have to firstly appreciate the great service, they were all so quick in bringing my order even though it was pouring outside. The macchiato for me was perfect, a good, strong coffee like I enjoy, and from all the patisserie options I couldn’t decide! I tried a raspberry scone and it was great, not too sweet, not to buttery, as a scone should be.

Nasty nasty place ! 28$ for a Ham sandwich??????

I honestly have no idea how  they are still in business!!!???

All the reviews on this place are absolutely horrible because it’s all true!!!! I hope they relocate or adjust the prices!!! I really doubt they will adjust the prices. They have to take everything off the shelves and readjust the whole business model.

This place is absolutely a scam, never buy food or drinks. I was in a rush and the cashier didn’t say the price out loud so I assumed it would be relatively priced, but was shocked about the price.

That’s probably how they scam most people when they are in a rush .

I hope this place gets shut down honestly .

Also attaching a photo of the disgusting sandwich

Idk how they have decent reviews on uber eats..The prices are criminal, they’re charging $30 for the probably worst BLT I’ve ever had. I’ve had better sandwiches at airports before. Absolutely ridiculous. Don’t order unless you’re craving stale bread, dry turkey or tasteless cheese.

google.name: Blondies Sports
google.address: 212 W 79th St, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: Recommended for wings, sports and groups! This is a great local establishment, it is relaxed, tons of seating (with a backroom) and leaps of TVs to watch any game that's on (ask the friendly staff for your pick!). The wings continue to be crispy. The bucket of 50 you can split into 2 flavors, we did mild and medium, but so many more and spicy levels. We enjoyed the new fried cheese curds, omg the aioli sauce is the best, sweet potato fries,  soft pretzels and chicken fingers. Enjoy, I always look forward to coming back here!!

Have been coming here 10+ years and the wings never disappoint. For wing lovers who want the full breakdown - always super crispy - not dry which is the most important. Great sauce to wing ratio and they’re fresh, never soggy. Dine in is always better than take out (this is a general rule for wings) and they have a large scale of heat levels to choose from. A bit pricey but worth it - the more you buy, the better the deal (ranges from 10-full buckets etc.

Otherwise - staff is friendly and the big scale sports games are usually on all the time, if not, there’s music playing. They have wing specials throughout the week and a pretty extensive menu outside of wings as well. You can sit at the bar or at tables, nothing fancy but that’s part of the charm.

From the moment I walked through the door, I was treated so fantastic by everyone who worked there. The host Jill made me feel welcome and special. I was able to watch the Mets and basketball at the same time. The place was totally packed, yet my waitress brought me a taste of an amazing ipa and the best wings in NYC. Stephanie and Chloe never let my beer go empty. Amazing experience in every way. Highly recommended.

Definitely a divey scene, but came in to watch a basketball game and there was a good crowd. Plus, if you are in search of the perfect Buffalo wings, I highly recommend this place. They were crispy without being dry, generously sauced, and great flavor wing sauce. 10/10 would come back for more
Great place to have  beer , some food and chill down after a long day. Great service as well.

google.name: 5 Napkin Burger
google.address: 2315 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: I visited on 10/25/24 it was fairly busy. The atmosphere was very cold when the doors would open, the breeze that enters does not allow you to enjoy the food. The server was extremely slow bringing the drinks, some of my party received their food minutes after each other. Many items that were ordered were forgotten and had to wait a while. The turkey burger was very soggy. The French fries were disappointing as they were not crinkled cut as pictured in many reviews. They were. Small hand cut fries over cooked and greasy. The meal was not as enjoyable as I would like. (French fries not pictured as they came extremely late to the table)

We went to dinner with my family, they have excellent service, Michelle served us and she was great 👌, she is very kind and helpful, it is difficult to find people like her. The strawberry shake is delicious, try it! Although everything was delicious; 100% recommended (and they have a children's menu)

I like the atmosphere, there is a burger place and sushi place together. Very interesting. I got the burger with bacon. I have to say delicious burger but a little bit too pricy. The fries are not included and the server didn’t mention it.

Edit: Greg reached out to me and invited my brother and I to visit again. It was a wonderful experience, great improvement from the last. The shrimp tacos were of course great, my brother and I had some drinks (him with a Shirley and me with the 5N X'SPREESSOTINI). The martini was delicious and I will definitely be back to try more drinks.

Mianna (Mia) provided my brother and I with great service, she was attentive and friendly. Definitely a great waitress.

Original: My brother and I had the crispy shrimp tacos and they were so good. Definitely a favorite.  Service Definitely needs some improvement.  My waitress wasn't the best but luckily the other servers were able to help me. Would Definitely come again though to try their drinks.

The food was pretty good. We ordered from the happy hour menu. The shrimp tacos were not the best. It was a tempura shrimp with a soft tortilla shell but that tortilla was hard and kinda stale. The taco is meant to be spicy but I got the spicy sauce on the side due to my battle with acid reflux. The taco left much to desired for $10 for 2 so I would try something different next time. The staff here has always been courteous and accommodating. The wings are my favorite. I wish you could order 2 portion sizes because I wanted more after these were done because they are so tasty. We also got an onion tower not pictured here but it was delicious nonetheless just make sure you eat it while it’s hot.

google.name: The Smith
google.address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: On another beautiful evening in NYC we decided to dine outside at The Smith. It was a great choice as we were treated so well and enjoyed excellent food. We started with two wonderful appetizers the roasted tomato soup and black truffle arancini. We then moved on to the steak and The Smith Burger. Both were prepared to our liking and the French fries and roasted squash sides were satisfying. We finished with the very tasty sticky toffee pudding and apple tart. Yes it was a good night at The Smith.

The food was delicious, with unique recipes that made each dish stand out. The cozy, lively vibe added to the experience, and the friendly wait staff ensured we felt welcome. Service was quick, making it an ideal spot for a great meal without the wait.

A restaurant where you can enjoy American style specialties like French Toast, Pancakes and any kind of eggs. The flavor of the food is acceptable but nothing to write home about. The waitstaff on the contrary are very friendly and helpful.

Excellent service, wide menu, and fun vibe.  Particularly great option for a group as there is something for everyone.  We have been for brunch (you can actually reserve a table a few days rather than weeks ahead) and dinner and they are equally good.
Delicious food and pleasant atmosphere. Tried the calamari, burger, and the avocado toast and all of it was very tasty. The outside seating is very nice and staff is great.

google.name: Lincoln Ristorante
google.address: 142 West 65th Street, Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Hidden Gem

My Friend and I found ourselves in the area after walking through Central Park. After looking up places to eat near us, we found Lincoln Ristorante. We were not expecting to find such a beautiful building designed in glass with a grass roof in the middle of Lincoln Center!
From start to finish, the experience was incredible. We were sat immediately and greeted by our kind server. We asked for recommendations and nothing disappointed. We had cocktails, shared entrees and shared desserts. I've been to New York a number of times and I look forward to making this a staple for each visit following.

Not quite as good as it should be given the prices but the perfect pre-opera location.  Himachi was incredibly skimpy but tasty. Salad was very good but not super fresh. Excellent service and atmosphere. It’s tough to find a good place near Lincoln Center….

Recent visit the food was incredibly oversalted so bad got salt shock and had to leave theater at intermission. The waiter did not know what al dente meant (and guessed wrong). But worst was overhearing some angry waiter (or bartender!) say “damn customers” loud enough we could hear.  Won’t be back.

Came back a year later - the pastas were excellent and so was the dessert. The restaurant did a shockingly bad no-no though - gave us a bill, and then we give them the card and when they give it back to us to sign they add a glass of wine -?! Cost them a star….

Excellent service and delicious food. The wine list is extensive and can get very pricey. The Gelato al cioccolato was delicious! We all enjoyed our meals and it was very convenient being next to the Metropolitan Opera.

Our meal was satisfactory but not special. It was the atmosphere and service that were notably poor. Upon entry we asked the receptionist if a particular table were available. No, she said, reserved. It remained empty during our stay. No effort to be gracious or polite upon our departure. One senses a lack of interest in dealing with customers. No smiles or greetings. Just plain cold and rude.
Biggest bang for the buck, for Michelin worthy food, but not yet a star. Every single dish we ordered was just absolutely delectable.

google.name: Cafe Luxembourg
google.address: 200 W 70th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
The server never stopped by to take our order after waiting 30 minutes.  The manager finally took our order.  I was shocked that a salad with salmon cost $35 and only had 8 pieces of lettuce and a square of salmon that was the size of a deck of cards.

My Manhattan and my friend’s Vesper was good.Her fries were crispy.  Thankfully she shared them with me because I was given no bread or anything in addition to my tiny salad with salmon.   Nobody stopped by to see if we were happy or if we needed anything.   We had to flag someone down to pay.  It was a huge disappointment

See photo to understand what I got for $35.

The food and ambiance was great. I had the French onion soup and ravioli. The ravioli was amazing. The soup had a little less salt than I’m used to in a French onion. However, I will definitely be back very soon for the amazing food and wine!
We ate outside on a lovely warm Sunday afternoon. The french toast is to die for and we loved the french onion soup too! Excellent service, super relaxing vibe overall. Highly recommend!

Lovely late night dinner. I was amazed at how cheerful the staff is—especially late at night.
The bolognese has such a warm traditional taste. We added a Chianti. Pure delight.
I went for the special roasted chicory salad. Unusual and satisfying enough for me.
My husband loved the profiteroles. Luscious and tasty.

This restaurant is a staple on the uws. Prices are okay.  My favorite dish is the Sticky purple rice with veggies.  Healthy with a wonderful mix of flavors including grains and greens. The quiche came out burnt but they fixed it.  It’s a very old restaurant with a slightly grungy feel but a classic.

google.name: Peacefood - Upper West Side
google.address: 460 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting this place, and I must say, it was an experience to remember!

From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm welcome and a delightful array of colorful, mouth-watering desserts. The menu was extensive, offering a variety of options from classic pastries to innovative creations, all vegan and Jain friendly.

I decided to try the vegan banana bread and macron and it was divine. The banana bread was moist and rich,  perfectly balanced by the sweetness. It was clear that high-quality ingredients were used, and the skill and care put into baking it was evident in every bite.

Mini brownie was average but I plan to visit this place again.
The sandwiches and pastries were so good! I would love to come back and try more of the menu. I enjoyed the patio seating.

Love this vegan cafe! The sautéed beech mushroom bowl and vanilla cake were super delicious! The fava bean + plant-based cutlet wasn’t the best, the cutlet was dry but the presentation was fun! I think it’s a little over priced in general but has some good items for sure

I really enjoyed this place, both the food and atmosphere were great. I would highly recommend the chickpea fries, dumplings, and key lime pie. The mocha breakfast smoothie was delicious, like a milkshake almost. The lasagna and strawberry cheesecake were also good.  I would pass on the potato pizza. I found out that if something is not on the paper menu but is located on the menu online, it’s available to order. Staff was very kind and attentive. It was a great date spot and had so many pastries and desserts available. I will definitely be coming back.

I have eaten at this cafe twice and have not been disappointed. The staff is very attentive and can make suggestions when not sure what to order. They have a good selection of gluten free,  raw dishes, and many healthy options.  My husband loved the raw pizza, grilled broccoli (best I've ever had), and potato salad. I had red lentil and pumpkin soup, and a quinoa salad. They were both incredibly delicious. The prices are also very reasonable. The only thing is the place is a little noisy.

google.name: Amsterdam Ale House
google.address: 340 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: Very busy, fairly unremarkable bar/restaurant that’s been around for many years. Decent drinks, beer and food. Bartenders not so communicative. Food was okay but not terrific. Three bathrooms, which was nice; no waiting. Asked to pay cash, but by the time I got back from the bathroom a different bartender had already swooped up and charged by credit card. Extra 3%. No big deal, but still…

My husband and I went off the tourist track and visited this bar today! Lovely chilled atmosphere! Server more than helpful and we can watch Liverpool game there on Sunday! Good selection of beers (husband expert level beer taster having had his own bar) had chicken wings and a lovely conversation with a library expert local who I assume is a regular … nice speaking to a New Yorker about all things American and British!

We had been looking for a nice local bar and this was definitely one we were pleased to go in!
insane packed crowd after the marathon pretty fun my girlfriend bought 7 (regular) beers for 70 dollars (plus a tip) so pretty dang expensive but maybe i just don’t belong in manhattan
Nothing like a nice beer on the sidewalk. The service is excellent and they treat my dog super well.

4/13/24 first time here. Cool bar vibe. Interesting beers on tap.
We had the pretzel 'filled with jalapeno cheese' but there was No hint of jalapeno.
So it's just cheese filled, good but smaller than we expected. Not like your traditional large hot pretzel.
We had the turkey Ruben, which was good.
Friendly service.
Trendy crowd-

yelp.name: Amsterdam Ale House
yelp.address: 340 Amsterdam Ave, Ste 1, New York, NY 10024

google.name: Bar Boulud
google.address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: I love Bar Boulud. I go there whenever I attend Lincoln Center concerts by the NY Philharmonic and also the NYC Ballet. There is outdoor seating and indoor seating with a great bar and food. I had the French Onion Soup with Balsamic Brussel Sprouts. The Gateau Aux Mures – Devils Food Cake, Blackberry Mousse, and Red Wine Chantilly. One of their Signature Cocktails – La Poire Rouge – Trimbach Poire Williams, Lemon, Pomegranate, Ginger. A beautiful interior tastefully decorated, great atmosphere and excellent staff. One of my favorite eateries in NYC.

I ate here on a Sunday evening.  Dined outside on the terrace. I utilized their 3 course prix-fixe menu. The food quality was very good, the presentation was very nice, and the food was good to me. I loved the melon-burrata salad. Very tasty! Service was excellent, attentive, but not obtrusive. The female sommelier was very on point.

We made an unexpected visit to Bar Bolud who were immediately able to accommodate our party of three; lucky us!  I thought that the location, space and service were great and I found the food tasty.  I particularly enjoyed my Parisian Love cocktail.  All the wait staff were excellent.  I would recommend it.

The charcuterie tray was one of a kind. My items made by the chef. Octopus was made to perfection. Coq au vin was also very good and a modernized version very nice flavors. Desert was different cheesecake diplomat was very good
Nice brunch food. Staff were friendly and polite. The prices are a bit high but it’s worth it.

google.name: P.J. Clarke's Lincoln Square
google.address: 44 W 63rd St., New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: Had a nice lunch here during our visit to NYC.  Food was great.  Service was great.  Near Central Park.  Nice atmosphere and open to outside with nice weather. I had the chicken pot pie. Tasted good.  I dumped it out on the plate though because it wouldve taken ages to cool. Hubby had fish and chips and said it was great.

We actually walked in with out a reservation, the place was quiet full and we were offered to sit outdoors which I wasn't pleased with since it was my Birthday weekend, then the host went and ask the Manager Tanya and we were able 😀 to sit indoors. As time went on and chatting to Tanya, we found out that she's from the same town in Puerto Rico 🇵🇷 as my wife is... the Waiter Anthony (Tony) was on point, very knowledgeable and friendly, I ask for recommendations and they were all Great...
I was surprised with a wonderful ch-cake and a candle 🕯 for my Birthday 🥳...
Once again Thank you very much to Tanya and Tony for making my Birthday a wonderful one, will definitely come back on my next visit to NYC...
Much Appreciated ❤️. I almost forgot, you guys make The Best Old fashion...

Good spot for some old school burgers. We tried the Bearnaise and the Cadillac burgers. Personally, I really liked the Cadillac. That said, the highlight for me was definitely the fries. So deliciously crispy. Good service too overall.
The best lobster roll I've ever had. Excellent burger and truffle fries as well.
Very clean and nice, historic restaurant near Fordham University. The Steak Frites was terrific!

yelp.name: P.J. Clarke's
yelp.address: 44 W 63rd St, Lincoln Square, New York, NY 10023

google.name: Boulud Sud
google.address: 20 W 64th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
We dined here during restaurant week. The restaurant features an open dining room with a bar and an open kitchen. Great airy atmosphere.

The service was outstanding!

We had the restaurant week 3-course menu
and it was one of the most delicious three course meals that we had in a long time. Our party had one person with special dietary needs and they accommodated this so well.

We can’t wait to come back and taste options from the regular menu!

Excellent presentation and execution in all the food. The baked goods were probably my favorite items and the cured salmon, which tasted heavenly. Surprisingly at the other end the barbecue meat tasted bland despite being cooked to perfect tenderness. It was hard to resist ordering the delicious looking orders for the table, but the prix fixe was plenty of food, even slightly too much. The service was good, friendly, though it seemed too busy at times.

The front of the house staff were very accommodating with my reservation time request. The young lady waiting for my table was excellent. The staff were very welcoming.

Flavors for the food could use some improvement, the Moroccan Chicken was very good but the citrus flavors were too strong for my liking.

For dessert I selected the Grapefruit Givré, I enjoyed part of the dessert but not all of them. I  regret picking this option, but your experience will vary.

Dined at Boulud Sud prior to a show at Lincoln Center. The bread, lemon saffron pasta and sorbets are excellent. I am familiar with the flavor profile of Tagine chicken and other than the skin not being crisp there was nothing truly wrong about it. I just would not order it again. The highlight was the Hawaiian prawn special which was so delicious. The service is outstanding.

My first visit to Boulud Sud will not be my last. The food and drinks were exceptionally delicious. We chose the restaurant week menu to try it out, and each course was exciting. The Mediterranean flavors are evident in everything including cumin, citrus and sesame. The staff may have been slightly overattentive, but we were happy with the care. The interior is a welcoming open space with comfortable seating and a bar in front. I'm excited to return for the tasting menu. With delivery prices on mediocre food so expensive now, dining in on outstanding food is the antidote.

google.name: Prohibition
google.address: 503 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: It's a very cute and intimate spot, it's also great for small groups. We really enjoyed the live band! The service was great considering how busy they were. The food and drinks were  good. We had the gnocchi and the cheese steak egg roll. I would definitely go back again!

As the name suggests, this bar-restaurant is modeled after a 1920’s prohibition era speakeasy, with an actual speakeasy. So nice for a refreshing Sunday evening drink. Also got so see great love performance by musician Arthur Latin and Tommy.

Nestled in the back is also a cozy speakeasy- didn’t get to go inside but seems really nice.

We came here specifically for jazz music but were disappointed.. It was super noisy and acoustic was not good. I'd say the singer was not great either.

Food and drinks were good.   Good place if you want to hangout as it's near the central park
Great steak and truffle fries. The drink selection was also very nice. We loved the live music and cozy vibes, overall I definitely feel like reccomending this place!
Great place for live music, food and drinks! A nice selection of crafted cocktails. Tonight the music was fantastic!

google.name: Barney Greengrass
google.address: 541 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: A true New York City institution, this establishment has been in business for over a century, offering a taste of history and culinary legacy. The smoked fish here is unparalleled—the finest I’ve ever encountered. The perfect balance of smokiness and saltiness, paired with high-quality salmon and sturgeon, creates a flavor profile that is nothing short of exceptional. When combined with their toasted bagels, the experience becomes an embodiment of tradition and craftsmanship. In my opinion, this is the most iconic food destination in New York City.

I only had three bagels in New York, but this was easily the best one. The pastrami smoked salmon was also delicious, but it's the pickle that came with my sandwich that I'm still thinking about two weeks later. Will I ever have a pickle as good? Should I have emptied my suitcase of belongings and filled it with pickles, instead? I'll be back someday. Wait for me, pickles.

A must, one of the few iconic old school delis/breakfast/bagel  left in NYC!
Located in the UWS, the grandson of the original owner will greet you at the cash register (remember is cash only) with a smile and a nice word!!
Totally worth it, for some of us is the best comfort food and time travel we can have!

OMG - why is there not a queue a mile looooong to get onto this place. Once TikTok dIscovers it, it will become the next viral place. Established for over a century, the food is outstanding and the team is amazing. NYC at its best. Go - like NOW !!!
My favorite place to grab a Bagel to go. The pastrami salmon and gravlox are my favorite. Can't cone to town without stopping in.

google.name: Saravanaa Bhavan
google.address: 413 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great food. Vegetarian options. Good flavor. Loved the masala dosa. The paper one is so big !
But little burnt. There’s a bathroom. The space inside is nice. Close enough walk to metro and Central Park.
Wasn’t busy for lunch. The service is good. I liked everything. Would come back to this chain. Maybe just a bit pricey compared to other places.

The food is flavorful and has great heat (recommended only for those with a good tolerance for spice). The South Indian thali ($23.49 plus tax) made for a satisfying meal. Unfortunately the air conditioning is inadequate for peak summer conditions. And with ongoing construction indoors, you may be better off dining outside actually.

This was a 5-star vegetarian dining experience with excellent service. We dined at the Amsterdam Avenue location. The food was fresh and flavorful, and the serving sizes were just right. The dishes that were advertised as spicy were in fact spicy. Five-star reviews are rare but Saravanaa Bhavan is deserving. This place was recommended to us a by a food critic yet the google ratings average 4.2. We had more faith in the food critic and that faith paid off! For a party of 4, we ordered Vegetable Butter Masala, Palak Paneer, plantain bajji, paper masala dosa, bullet naan, garlic naan, bisibelabath, and two orders of mango lassi for a total of $108 without tip. Everything was delicious. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

We thoroughly enjoyed the diverse selection of dosas and the delicious tea at this eatery! The food truly stole the show, with each dosa variant offering a unique and flavorful experience.

However, the atmosphere fell short of expectations. The compact space had a slight lapse in cleanliness, with the bathroom and floors requiring more attention. Despite this, we remain hopeful that the establishment will prioritize tidiness and maintain a cleaner environment for future patrons.

Rating: 5 stars for food and service and 2 stars for atmosphere. We look forward to returning and enjoying another tasty meal in a cleaner setting!

I ordered an Uttapam, the taste wasn't that great compared to their outlets in other countries.

Their service was slow, I had to ask for every little thing from the water to the check.

The ambiance was underwhelming. The AC wasn't working and the washroom was also untidy.

google.name: Rosa Mexicano
google.address: 61 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: We love this place!! The food is always so delicious and fresh! The service is great and the staff is always very friendly. We love getting the table side hand made guacamole! The chips are tasty as well. We like the enchilada dish. We always find ourselves coming back here! It’s so good!

Great two storied Mexican café and restaurant with outdoor dining options that are available almost year round. Fantastic food selections and cocktails that are surprisingly good but size-wise they may have some wondering [what’s this?]. Overall wonderful combos nevertheless. The outdoor tables are especially nice during the better part of the dryer seasons even in autumn, here in Manhattan. Very sensational location situated directly from the Lincoln Square’s main plaza and the fountain. And within walking distance of the No. 1-subway line entrances a couple of blocks away. A definite stopover before or after the opera begins, or when the concert or film ends to grab a bite and schmoozing with friends or colleagues at a table. Reasonable prices and moderately expensive. Plus some great late after-hours Happy Hours too through the weeknights and weekend vibes. With several locations located across the cityscape for convenient accommodations.

We had a wonderful experience at Rosa Mexicano. They were very accommodating to our large group, and the guacamole table service was delicious. The duck and fish tacos were a highlight, and their drinks were great too. Clean bathrooms and super friendly staff made it even better. Highly recommend!

This place is amazing! The drinks are top-notch and the service is exceptional. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, making it the perfect spot to unwind after a long day. The staff is knowledgeable and attentive, always ready to recommend a new cocktail or dish to try. Overall, this establishment truly sets the bar high for quality and customer satisfaction.

Belen was an exceptional waitress; great recommendations, very attentive and a lovely warm manner. The food was very good - I had been recommended this restaurant by a Mexican born foodie I met in the city, and it didn't disappoint! I had ceviche, guacamole (mixed at the table, a great touch) and the shrimp tacos. Absolutely delicious! Try to come here if you're anywhere near the area for a welcoming atmosphere and an authentic taste! ☺️🙏

google.name: Smoke Jazz & Supper Club
google.address: 2751 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

review_snippets.text:
Great vibes and music - we got lucky with the band that was playing that evening; different acts on different nights.

It was my first time having ratatouille and I was not disappointed at all - very tasty! The crab cake was perfect! The chocolate mousse dessert was delicious!

Drinks weren't too bad - I had the spicy margarita; not enough tajin around the rim for my liking.

Good for families, friends and significant others!

If you're looking for an unforgettable night out, Smoke jazz club is the place to be. The performance was top-notch, showcasing some of the finest talent in an intimate setting that brings the music to life. The service was exceptional—attentive without being intrusive.
What truly surprised us was the dinner. The dishes were not only beautifully presented but also bursting with flavor, elevating the entire experience. It’s the perfect spot for a romantic date, where you can enjoy great music, delicious food, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommended!

Very cool, small jazz club that had a very nice vibe. I was surprised at how amazing the filet minion tasted. It was soft, juicy, and tasted just wonderful. Typically, at jazz places, you don't expect a good steak, but here they made it like a real professional who knew how to cook a good steak. I have also tried wagu burger, which is also amazing. I Typically don't eat burgers, and I was shocked how good it was, too. The music band was great, I really loved the atmosphere and how they performed. Service was fast and pleasant as well.

I definitely recommend this place for jazz lovers!

Great date night location. Outstanding service and ambiance. The band was amazing. I didn't want the set to end. Eric Scott Reed is a true entertainer with meaningful stories to tell and original compositions that take listeners on a journey. What a night! ❤️

I arrived at Smoke for the first time this past Saturday (8/17) with a meet-up group, there were 7 of us.  We arrived at 6pm and were quickly seated for dinner.  I must say, I never have high expectations for the food in most jazz clubs but, the food at Smoke was exceptionally great!  From the hostess who arranged for all of us to sit together to our server who accommodated us with separate checks, the service was fantastic!  The jazz show was stellar and the atmosphere of the club just added to the overall great experience.  Everyone in my party was happy with the food, club, service, and the entertainment.  I have already booked another show for next month.  I highly recommend Smoke Jazz & Supper Club!

google.name: Deli Kasbah Kosher Grill
google.address: Kosher Steak House Restaurant, 251 W 85th St #3221, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: The food was phenomenal! Especially the appetizer! We got babaghanoush with 2 cigars and 2 pitas, and it was mind blowing. The seasoning of the babaghanoush was just perfect. The beef cigars and pitas were also extremely delicious. The outside of the cigars were almost like pastry, a little flaky and mildly crispy. The pita bread was simply excellent. It was freshly baked and steaming hot. The burger was also very delicious, but a bit salty to my taste. The classic rib-eye steak was also well cooked. The meat was very tender and juicy. The grilled vegetables were okay. Good thing the fries were great, too! The service was also very nice. Very laid back and relaxing. Overall, it was a great experience. Can’t wait to come back again!!
Excellent choice for lunch or dinner. Steak was made to perfection. Chicken soup was heavenly. Will definitely be back and recommend!!

I ordered a burger tonight and they asked me what I wanted as a side dish, including mashed potatoes, now when I got home and I looked at the bill, I saw I was charged $5.00 for the side dish that was supposed to be included. I feel I got totally ripped off and won't be coming back any time soon..

I had a great dinner experience here. The ambience and lighting were great. My rib-eye steak was delicious! The pricing was very reasonable and my friend got a free desert for giving a dvar Torah! I highly recommend.

Great, fresh food with huge portions. Good service, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Everyone is always happy with their meal at Kasbah Grill. This has become one of our go to places for family dinners in NYC. 🩶🤍

google.name: Flor de Mayo Restaurant
google.address: 2651 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA

review_snippets.text:
I’ve now been to both locations over the last 5 years. Several times. It’s been 50/50 with the good/bad experiences.

I’ve given up on this hype, though. Most of the dishes are average to good, on their best days. On their off days, they can be average to poor. But, when you’re spending close to or over $50 on two dishes, it’s a dealbreaker.

Eating here is part of the experience. I have yet to do so there’s a chance it could be better than takeout? Not for me though.

TLDR: If you've never had Chino Latino - you're depriving yourself of some crazy good stuff. Large portions, even larger flavors. Broiled pork chop, lomo saltado, squid ink fried rice, seco de res. You're welcome.

I've been eating at the Amsterdam location for years but recently I've been coming to this one. It's a family run spot with a full Chino Latino menu. Think a collision of Chinese and Peruvian/Spanish. They've got some straight up Spanish things, totally Chinese and in between.

For starters, definitely try the papa arequipena. It's a Peruvian potato either cold or fried with this red pepper sauce and hard boiled eggs and olives. It's a very unique flavor. If you're there on the weekends, grab the shrimp stew. It's an ultra tasty shrimp soup with rice, corn, a bit of spice.

The broiled pork chops are probably my favorite pork chops anywhere. They're brined incredibly well are dotted with chopped garlic that caramelizes under the flame. It's so insanely juicy.

Squid ink fried rice is a must. It's a squid ink coated fried rice with ham, shrimp, pease and a unique ginger flavor. The lomo saltado you definitely need to get. Sliced steak in a stir-fried sauce with onions, tomato and french fries on top of rice.

The other items I'd recommend are the seco de res, a cilantro-centric tender beef stew. The tallarin verde is a Peruvianish pesto pasta, it's great with the garlic shrimp.

No matter how much good stuff I've eaten, Flor de Mayo is in my list of restaurants I love going to and bringing visitors to. It's something that's tough to find but it's a testament to the melting pot that NYC is.

I recently dined at Flor de Mayo, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we walked in, the warm and inviting atmosphere set the tone for a fantastic evening. The service was top-notch—attentive, friendly, and truly accommodating. The staff made us feel welcomed and ensured that our dining experience was smooth and enjoyable from start to finish.

The food was absolutely incredible, showcasing the rich and flavorful fusion of Peruvian and Chinese cuisine that Flor de Mayo is known for. We ordered the Lomo Salteado, which was a standout dish. The beef was cooked to perfection—tender, juicy, and bursting with flavor. The mix of spices, fresh vegetables, and savory sauce created a perfect balance that made each bite better than the last. The dish was beautifully presented, and the portion size was generous, leaving us completely satisfied.

The drinks were another highlight of the evening. Whether you’re in the mood for a classic cocktail or something more adventurous, the bar at Flor de Mayo does not disappoint. The cocktails were expertly crafted, with just the right blend of flavors to complement the meal. They added a nice touch to the overall dining experience.

Overall, Flor de Mayo exceeded all expectations. The combination of amazing food, outstanding service, and delicious drinks made for an unforgettable night. Whether you’re looking to enjoy a casual dinner or celebrate a special occasion, Flor de Mayo is the place to be. We can’t wait to return and explore more of the menu!

Not what it used to be. Food was extremely mid. Fried chicken? Mid. White rice? Somehow mid. Beans? Tasted just like beans like no seasoning. Steak with onions + fried rice was the best thing I ate. But I’ve had just as good at the Chinese spot. The eggroll? A true fusion that idk what it was. Why does all the food have cinnamon? The Chinese spot where you pay $10 has better food. Don’t come here and pay $28 for it. Just go to your local Chinese spot. I’m now on the toilet sick just 15 minutes after finishing eating. The bathroom is gross and had graffiti all over it. Zero stars.

Honestly beyond disappointed the place has a long wait you would imagine the food would be amazing but no, the A la brasa chicken taste weird has a aromatic flavor which isnt for everyone, the menu is pricey and not really worth it, atleast the drinks are strong , but the place is very fast
Paced, you will have no peace people constantly passing by you, and staff trying to get you in and out to seat more people its A MESS ! I will not be coming back

google.name: Noi Due Cafe
google.address: 491 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text:
The food was delicious—loved the Bronzino, salmon teriyaki, iced coffee, and green salad.

Service was impressively fast, even though the place was packed. I did have a minor stomach ache afterward, though I’m not sure it was related to the meal. Regardless, the food was excellent and the atmosphere was great.

We had a great experience!!! The ambiance to the food to the service is just beyond. I can not come to this place enough it is just amazing and is consistent with the great food… you will not be disappointed. Marco who was our server was kind and nice and really took care of us!!! Highly recommend
Highly recommended! A very nice calm place, with a perfectly good atmosphere. It is kosher Chalav Yisrael and Pas Yisrael. The service is richly provided and the main thing: Delicious, tasty food.

Popped in after a show and was pleasantly surprised! The staff was very welcoming even though they were closing soon.
Place was pretty full, and they seated us quickly. Our server was outstanding and delightful throughout our entire meal! His delivery was quick but not rushed, and the food came out just as fast and hot off the grill.
Shout out to Ahmed!
We will definitely be back for another amazing dining experience!🤩🤩👍👍

The food was decent but the price really threw me off… $50 for a bread bowl with gnocchi? The menu was on an iPad, a representation of the overall experience. Service was great, but the price was outrageous for what we received.

google.name: The Gin Mill
google.address: 442 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: Stopped by for F1 racing, NFL, and a couple beverages... the place was busy but not packed. The staff were kind and helpful. We didn't eat but the food looked and smelled good. Good atmosphere.

Had greasy deep-fried bar food: Bartender woman busy chatting it up with apparent locals, We are so feeling ignored, really the service was poor.  She served the worst G&T and discarded it too casually .  The inside atmosphere is dark, dingy & skuzzy.   We  opted instead for outdoor seating to experience a noise & grit of  NYC...it was a lousy date overall, and I wouldn't go there alone or ever with him

We didn’t eat here but it was our local while we were staying in the UWS. Drinks were awesome. They played the US Open on the tv. Barman Louie was the best, took care of us both with beverages and moving on unwelcome attention. I hope he enjoyed the TimTams we left him. :)

It is one of my favorite bars in the upper west side. The happy hour and daily specials are unbeatable. The bartenders are very nice and great to talk to. The soundtrack however… is criminal. This community is mostly jews and senior citizens. None of which want to listen to doja cat sing profanities while sipping their $14 pitcher of kona big wave. A classic rock vibe would appeal to more folks and create a more relaxing atmosphere. Mazel tov!

Additionally, something most people don't think of but as a big sports enthusiast, I love watching games here. They always play the sound and have great timing to switch it back to music when the games are on commercial breaks. Although I don’t like the music, if they listen to this review and change the music, it would be a 10/10 bar.

One of the female bartenders there is not only extremely rude but confronts customers on how much they tip (I tipped over 20% on a large tab btw) and tries to coerce them to tip more. Avoid this place.

google.name: Atlantic Grill
google.address: 50 W 65th St At, Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Nice seafood restaurant near Central Park. My group and I were wearing attire that might be considered less than appropriate, but thankfully were seated anyway. I do feel like we were treated weirdly because of it, but maybe it was just how the staff is. It was later in the evening so it was pretty much empty; we weren't wasting space or anything.

For my entree, I got the beef cheeks, which was fantastic. I loved every bit of it. I finished off with the churros and they were also good, although the sauce was a little too sweet for my taste. Still, we had a great meal here and I'd recommend coming dressed up even just a little.

Last night, I had the pleasure of dining at Atlantic Grill on the Upper West Side, just steps away from Central Park. This low-key yet elegant spot has an ambiance that's both cozy and inviting, making it the perfect escape from the city's buzz. The restaurant's quiet, intimate atmosphere, frequented by locals, adds to its charm--it's a place where you can truly enjoy a relaxed evening out.

The culinary experience was just as impressive as the setting. I started with the octopus carpaccio, which was fresh, tender, and perfectly seasoned, followed by the salmon tartar--light and refreshing, with a beautiful balance of flavors. For mains, I opted for the seafood paella and the shrimp curry. The paella was generously packed with a medley of fresh seafood, and the shrimp curry had just the right amount of spice to leave a memorable kick.

If you're looking for a refined yet unpretentious spot for seafood on the Upper West Side, Atlantic Grill is a gem worth visiting. Perfect for an evening with friends or a quiet dinner for two!

I have yet to have anything I did not love in this establishment. The staff is beyond amazing, especially Kayla who makes every visit into a holiday for me. She is amazing. I have to say she is more amazing than the salmon but only fairly as the salmon is pretty outstanding. I recommend everything here, but the sushi is to die for. I’m currently enjoying the preheater dinner which included tuna, Tartar and the salmon that I’m going to show picture, it’s all fantastic
I stopped by for some drinks while I waited for my dinner reservation. Marjorie was our bartender and was great. I decided to order some oysters, which were pretty good.

A very chill yet formal atmosphere. Staff was super professional and on top of everything. I tried the crab ravioli and really liked it I also tried the walnut noir dessert which was also great!. It is high end so expect to spend a lot.

google.name: Pomodoro Rosso
google.address: 229 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: Delicious neighborhood Italian restaurant with an excellent wine selection. We had the eggplant, fish stew and fresh pasta... Everything was outstanding. The cannoli and cappuccino were best we've had! The servers were so personable and attentive...We will be back!

This restaurant has established itself as a great spot for homemade Italian cuisine in the Upper West Side, and I prefer it even more because it’s open for lunch. The 12-3 menu is a fantastic daily lunch option. You can select from four different pastas, with a choice of Caesar or house salad, and for dessert, tiramisu or cannoli, all for a reasonable price of $26.

The salad is fresh, and the pasta is truly authentic.

Absolutely amazing gem right by Central Park. I had a group of 7 and we all had a craving for Italian food. We stopped by for a late lunch and were quickly seated. The wait staff was super friendly, always had our water glasses filled and answered all our questions about the menu. Even offered us a few off menu items that were great. Pictured are the antipasto salad, burrata, calamari, tri color salad, chicken parm, chicken francese, seafood pasta, & the spaghetti and meatballs. Fun fact, chicken francese was not on the menu but the chef made it and it was absolutely delicious and came paired with spaghetti made in the francese sauce. After about an hour, we cleared our plates and we were on our way enjoying the great weather in the park. Stop by Pomodoro Rosso for a great meal.

If there's one must-stop inspired by movies and TV shows, it's eating at an Italian cantina in NY.
And Pomodoro ticks all the boxes, and more. It's located in a prime spot, just a few blocks from Lincoln Center and Central Park, on Columbus Avenue. Inside, the ambiance is typical, but more importantly, the staff offers excellent service, and the value for money is outstanding.
Everything was plentiful and delicious, with a flavor profile friendly to tourists.
Highlight: the pesto. Just for that is all worth it. And the chicken parmigiana — "la milanesa" was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside, served with tasty al dente pasta.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to recharge after a walk or for those wanting to enjoy a great Italian dinner.

As a NYC native, this is one of the best Italian spots I've been to in the city. Everything we had was delicious. I highly recommend the bruschetta, the spaghetti polpette, and the espresso martini - it's perfection. Although the waiter was a bit inattentive, it's worth mentioning that when we arrived we alerted the wait staff we were in a rush to catch a movie in the area, and they ensured we were served quickly despite the dinner rush. Can't wait to return again and again.

google.name: Jake's Dilemma
google.address: 430 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: Jake’s Dilemma is a classic NYC bar in the upper west side. Great place for happy hour, sports games, and almost always a good time. A local hang with a vibrant crowd.

On a beautiful Tuesday night, I was looking for something to do in the city that never sleeps. After visiting 2 other bars that had rude or tired employees, we happened to find Jake's dilema. Immediately, we felt at ease, and Wade welcomed us and treated us like the happy celebratory humans we were. This was a beautiful way to discover a new place to hang out while in the city. I am hoping we can start an open mic night or something, so I will be coming back to speak to Wade and the manager about that.
