My only complaint is having to go down a flight of steps to get to the restroom. It's not fun when you're tipsy to have to go up two steps, down about 12 steps, and then down 2 more steps. Yes, I counted it was actually a running joke all night with us (though my count may be off, I was really tipsy at this point.) Overall, I really enjoyed this place, and it's all because of the bartender and how amazing he is. Thank you, Wade!!!

There were so many drunk patrons blocking the sidewalk, the security guard didn’t make them move, so I couldn’t walk by with my stroller.  I had to walk at the edge of the bike lane, and almost got ran over by three bicyclist.  It is Jake’s
dilemma.

Jake’s is undoubtedly my favorite bar in NYC. the entire staff, especially the manager Bekim, are so incredible and friendly are the reason why I come back time and time again. Not to mention the deals they offer like every night?? Will come here as long as I live in NYC.

I’ve never met a waitress so fun and engaging as Katie. My friends and I literally came back the next day just to see her. She’s hilarious and super sweet, in addition to just being a wonderful server. She honestly has the personality of a great bartender. Will continue to return for Katie!

google.name: Cafe Fiorello
google.address: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
I have visited Cafe Fiorello a couple of times, and both have been fantastic! My first visit was for dinner, and it was a great experience. A lovely couple who frequented the restaurant chatted with me telling me their favorites. I had the fried artichokes (after falling in love with them in Rome) and pepperoni pizza with hot honey. Both wonderful! So good in fact that I ordered the same when I returned.
A lovely spot for lunch or dinner!

Love Cafe Fiorello! New York institution. Located right across Lincoln center, so it’s a nice place to eat before show or have antipasto bar and drinks after show.Thin crust pizza is my favorite. Nice atmosphere and good food. Indoor and  outdoor seating.

I had a blast at this restaurant! The ambiance was lovely, the lights in the restaurant romantic and the music 🎶 ! Our waiter was so nice and personally made sure we had a good time, besides the delicious food he brought us. He gave us detailed explanation on the questions we asked about food and threw couple jokes, which was very, very nice! The food was absolutely delicious and fresh! I had Caprese salad with chicken, loved the olive oil. Beautifully decorated plate. Vanilla gelato was perfect end to a lovely dinner. Will be back again!

Very fast paced restaurant, excellent  before a show at lincoln center.

I would say the vegetable sides that are on display at the antipasto bar was my favorite part. The veggie sides were so yummy....Great flavor, good portion sizes, and quick service.

I ate the eggplant parmigian as entree which was superb. Good portion size and flavor on point. Service was alright. Price was a little high but i felt very satisfied with what i ate and what i paid at the end of everything. It was worth it

I will be back, the food, quality of food and selection of options made this place a true 5 star experience.

Lovely Italian spot near Lincoln Center. Outdoor seating there is really nicely done. They have brunch and all day Italian menu on the weekend. I enjoyed my avocado toast with smoked salmon. Drinks were very tasty too.

google.name: El Mitote
google.address: 208 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: Very friendly staff you get the food within seconds I was done with dinner in under 15 min and the food is decent. The only things are the tables are problematic to fit your legs under there. See pictures attached.

Cloth napkin prices with plastic plate quality food isn’t a good combo. I ordered the carnitas platter and as you’ll see in the pic, it’s definitely NOT carnitas. The waiter told me that the owner told the staff this is how she wants it served, which made no sense at all. If this place was located anywhere else in the five boroughs, it would be out of business in 6 months.  Only decent thing: guac.

Overall there is nothing too special at El Mitote. From other reviews, I was expecting to be blown away when in reality, this place is just good.

The atmosphere: is a small place with limited seating inside and a more extensive outdoor area. The aesthetic is nice but nothing special.

The staff: were nice. Besides taking my order and giving the check, there wasn’t much interaction or service. The food came reasonably quickly.

The food: was good. The guacamole was a bit wet. In my opinion, the pork tacos seem a little dry. The platter I had was tasty but needed a sauce.

Cleanliness: Good

Excellent shrimp tacos, Guacamole, chicken enchiladas and cheese quesadillas!!! The red and green salsas were amazing!! We sat out in the heated outdoor seating, and even with it being cold and rainy outside, we stayed cozy! The staff was great as well!

No reservations. Walk in only. We waited less than 15 minutes on a Sunday evening. The guava frozen margarita is to die for! So delicious but also a bit strong. Fish tacos were so good. We will definitely be coming back and try more!

google.name: Land Thai Kitchen
google.address: 450 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: I had a wonderful experience at Land Thai Kitchen! Their vegetarian options are not only plentiful but also incredibly delicious. Everything tasted so fresh and full of authentic Thai flavors. From the vibrant stir-fried veggies to the perfectly crafted dumplings, each dish was a delight. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a fresh and flavorful Thai meal with great vegetarian choices.

Best green curry I’ve ever had- even better than when I went to Thailand. All the food was so flavorful and the ambiance is amazing. Highly recommend getting the lunch special (comes with an app and an entree). Definitely recommend to anyone in the Upper West Side.

Very very delicious food. I’ve been eating here for over 5 years and still my favorite usual food in the neighborhood. Drunken noodles always spice me up , not only spicy but there’s also something about it I don’t know :) so good.  My husband got Pad thai this time and we shared the fish. This place has such nice atmospher , not too hectic. Price is reasonable compared to most.  👍
Best Thai spot I’ve been coming for years. Love the salmon fried rice, Pad Thai, Satay chicken. Good Value, friendly stuffs and prompt service

The crispy calamari was an excellent appetizer ($15 plus tax).  Land is one of a few places that offer a lunch special ($13.50) on weekends. I had the Land salad and the fried rice with tofu. Both were decent, though I did find the general flavor profile (the dressing for the salad, the actual fried rice itself, and the dipping sauce for the calamari) to be on the sweet side.

google.name: Osteria Cotta
google.address: 513 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant by chance, and what a pleasant surprise! The food is absolutely delicious, with well-prepared and flavorful dishes, all at very reasonable prices. The service is quick and efficient, perfect for a lunch break or a casual dinner. The large terrace is also very nice and the perfect spot to enjoy a great meal outdoors, whether you're dining solo or with friends. I’ll definitely be coming back!

Had brunch on Sunday and it was such a nice experience. This is a warm and chic spot with a nice menu. Two floors with plenty of seating but weekend fill up so I highly suggest reservations.  Brunch menu is nice with egg dishes, French toast, paninis and the well known wood fired pizzas.   Reasonably priced, nice wine list and excellent service.

Had an early dinner for a group of 7 at the upstairs area. Went mostly for the happy hour, but it does not apply to the seating area upstairs, only applicable if sitting downstairs or outside. We decided to forego the happy hour and sit upstairs. The bar and downstairs area only has high chairs. The outside area is not very attractive. Groups of 8 or more have to order from a prefix menu ($40 pp)   We ordered from the regular menu. The pizza is ok. The lasagna was good. The calamari was good. The spaghetti was tasteless and very salty. The penne was ok, a bit salty. The salmon was ok. The branzino was ok. The chicken milanese was not good. Ordered a bottle of red wine (screw top for $38 ) was ok. The glass of Lambrusco was good  The service was average. The upstairs feels dingy.   The food overall is a 3. Most of it lacks flavor, and is very heavy on salt. It’s basically Americanized Italian food. Only worth a visit if you do the happy hour. Would not return.

This is such a cozy cute restaurant. Service is quick and efficient and I absolutely love their desserts they are huge and fair priced (try their tiramisu). I always go for the pizza, its not the best pizza in NYC but its light and crispy and worth it for the whole experience!

The food here is FANTASTIC!

I would say it’s the best Italian on the upper west side.

My dish completely melted in my mouth. The wings are the best you will ever have.

The prices are also super reasonable, a bit cheaper than most of the restaurants in the area.

The atmosphere is almost medieval mixed with some upscale features.

I recommend sitting upstairs.

google.name: The Leopard at des Artistes
google.address: 1 W 67th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: Oh, des Artistes I love you. A New York gem of a building and ambiance to dine in. The jazz brunch is my favorite time to dine, with delicious options of more breakfast oriented and also pasta or steak options if you’re feeling like diving in. The menu is excellently curated with a diversity of flavors and colors, from salads to seafood and meats between dishes like the tuna tartare, steak and eggs, ragu pasta and some fun desserts like the Zabaione prepared in front of the table. Banana pancakes with ricotta is a classic for brunch. The food is good quality and menu is great but I feel some of the dishes are unbalanced, too salty or sweet, and I’ve had a couple underwhelming dinners so four. (Overcooked steak, pasta with very little sauce, a complaint). The sparking and white wines are great, but you’d be missing out if you didn’t also indulge in some of the exquisite reds from their extensive Italian wine list (by region/ wine character). Overall, dining at The Leopard can be an excellent experience, thank you.

Our reviews had over 52 million in the last 12 months.  We do not get paid we just love to eat and have fun.  We really love The Leopard at Des Artistes.  Love it This is a great place to eat.  The building used to be a hotel for artists but now is a high end condo bldg.  The Restaurant was run by the artists for years, but now is run by a very high end group.  First class room, first class service and the food is out of this world.  Started with the marinated anchovies that were bright but not too strong.  Just right. Love the meatballs app and the black truffle custard with asparagus.  Both are must haves.  I had the spaghetti carbonara which had just the right amount of sauce and huge chunks of homemade bacon.  Really good.  She had the old family Lasagna recipe which was full of flavor and great texture.  We had many desserts.  One of the best was prepared tableside.  It is a custard poured over fruit.  I do not know the name but it was really good.  It was a beautiful evening and we will be back again for sure.  LOVED IT.   Check out all of our reviews. If we do not like it we do no review it so all of the ones you see are places that are fantastic. Follow us if you like. We had over 36 million views so far this year and we thank you for that. We don't get paid, we just love to eat. Be sure to click on "RobH" at the top of this review to see all of them and to follow us if you like good food and FUN.  If we do a review it is because we love it.

We had a fabulous experience at The Leopard for my husband’s birthday. One of our group of four was delayed about 20 minutes due to a flight issue, yet we were promptly seated without him so that he could join us when the flight issue was resolved. We appreciated being seated despite our party not being complete!
The night we went, there was some kind of private event going on so we had to sit outside. However, the outdoor seating was lovely - the best outdoor dining experience I’ve had yet in the city! It was a warm evening and yet the mosquitoes didn’t bite me to death, and the turf grass was a really nice touch.
Our server was incredible. She was a true professional. She had excellent recommendations and she also sent over an excellent sommelier when we were deciding on wine. The wine was fantastic - a smoky, earthy French wine that I don’t recall the name of (forgot to snap a pic of the bottle 🤦‍♀️) and the sommelier steered us in a perfect direction.
While the pre-dinner cocktails and dishes themselves came out slowly due to the private event, the staff was very accommodating and expressed their apologies. The food really made everything perfect.
For dessert, everyone got something sweet except for me — I had their cheese plate. Highly recommend.
Definitely recommend going here for a special event! And you need a reservation! All in all, it was lovely.

Enjoyed a prix fixe menu during restaurant week. It's a cozy, relatively small, culinary joint with a rustic theme. Only half way into the dinner, did I notice their murals along the wall, which I believe they are also known for. The food was very good and I was satisfied with the portion size. Service was impeccable. I'm not cultured enough to understand the concept of a coat check. Therefore, I was glad to find out their coat check was optional. Overall a fine dining experience.

My friend and I decided to celebrate our birthday here and it was absolutely the right place. The ambience is perfect. We followed the advice of the staff and ordered most of the food and the service impeccably.

Will definitely want to come back for other meals.

google.name: Salumeria Rosi
google.address: 283 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom’s to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the restaurant Salumeria Rosi in Upper West Side, NYC. Focusing on classic Italian dishes and various Italian cured meats. We had a blast enjoying all these specialties. This is also located not far from some Central Park highlights.
A wonderful discovery for me, and a return after the pandemic for my lunch partner. Terrific Italian food, great service, and lots of attention to detail.
Overall a wonderful dinner. Pasta was good, but the salumeria is just out of this world. Fabulous! Nice service too. Definitely recommend.
The meat was delicious, and I’d definitely want to have it again. The potatoes were a bit oily, but balanced and enjoyable with the house red. I expected the bread to be warm, though.

Salumeria Rosi is the place to go for wonderful, tasty Italian food served in a warm, cozy, friendly atmosphere. The ricotta with pears is delicious and the cheese plate is terrific.
Must try prosciutto!!! Homemade green pappardelle with sundried tomatoes and mascarpone is unbelievably good also. The wine selection is short but very good. Macchiatos and biscotti were just right and the ricotta cheese cake was excellent. In many places tiramisu is almost always cloying and sweet and mushy but this was ideal. This is a terrific little restaurant on the Upper West Side.

google.name: Pappardella
google.address: 316 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Host was nice.  Waiter could be better, maybe was tired.  Very little attention given to us and had to call(beg) for her attention.

I have been to this restaurant since circa 2003/2024.

The food was delicious!  I ordered the short rib special..it was otherworldly & a generous portion..food went home!  I ordered their House cocktail and it was yummy!  Service was great, the prices reasonable, & the atmosphere was lovely.

Not bad, but for the price you would expect better service. If you’re coming here make sure you have a readily available water bottle and a salt shaker. The food was a bit bland. Overall, they were nice people but should you have to beg for water??
Had an omelet off of their brunch menu and Italian sausage on the side and it was amazing!!! Chicken parm was awesome- and they have a gluten free menu!!

We had two pasta dishes. Their mushroom pasta Pappardella funghi e tartufo was excellent. It was a pleasant surprise! There are lots of Italian restaurants in UWS, but this is one of the few that I would recommend. Another one is La Pecora Bianca.

yelp.name: Pappardella
yelp.address: 316 Columbus Ave, Ste 1, New York, NY 10023

google.name: The Dead Poet
google.address: 450 Amsterdam Ave #2, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text:
The Dead Poet Bar on the Upper West Side is a cozy, literary-themed spot with a great atmosphere. The dark wood, bookish quotes on the walls, and dim lighting create an inviting space perfect for casual drinks. Their cocktail menu, especially the namesake "Dead Poet" with Jameson and ginger ale, is creative and affordable for Manhattan.

Though small and often crowded, especially on weekends, the laid-back vibe and friendly bartenders make it worth a visit. Whether you're a literary fan or just looking for a great neighborhood bar, The Dead Poet is a gem you'll want to return to.

Bar looks like it’s been here for many years, and it’s obviously because it is a relaxing, pleasant place to stop by for a beer, drink or food. Bar seating, tables in back and out front. Bartenders were very friendly and welcoming. TVs throughout, bathrooms in the rear. Lots of interesting things to look at on the walls. Nice place.

Probably my favorite pub in New York! Has some of the best Guinness in the City and a creative cocktail selection! My only complaint would be that the music can be a bit deafening when the pub is full. But other than that, great place with very friendly staff!
Cheers!
Really cool spot. My husband is Irish and was looking for a good pint of Guinness. Unfortunately the bartenders didn’t know how to properly pour it, but good vibes overall.

Guinness was smooth and had a great pour. You CAN bring your own food!

Can be packed with standing-room only at the bar. Very lively with many screens to watch the different sporting games going on.

Shout out to the servers who were great at checking in on how we were doing.

google.name: Le Pain Quotidien
google.address: 1131 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

review_snippets.text: First off, I will say that the mint lemonade is an absolute must. I will get it once a week. It is not too sweet, perfectly tart, and so fresh. The brownies and tarts are delicious. On the downside, my dining in experience was sub-par. Service was pretty slow, and the food was just ok. I much prefer the bakery items. The French cream donut was also sort of a miss for me, it tasted old. Not sure if that’s how it was supposed to taste or not. Nonetheless, high stars for the lemonade and other baked good items. Also, the man working at the bakery register is always very pleasant every time I stop by!

We are tourists from the Bay Area, and we met a friend for coffee and a bite to eat here on a beautiful Fall Saturday afternoon, and this place was packed! Feels like mostly locals for the most part. Not too much to say about the food, and it felt short-staffed at the time, but it happens.

Disappointing Visit to Le Pain Quotidien
My recent visit to Le Pain Quotidien fell short of expectations. While we were promptly seated, it took a significant amount of time for our server to acknowledge us. Once we ordered, the portions were surprisingly small, especially considering the price. My tomato sandwich, for example, left me feeling unsatisfied. To make matters worse, the iced matcha latte had clumps of undissolved matcha powder, and getting the bill took another long wait. Overall, the slow service and underwhelming food quality detracted from the experience.

The communal table experience.

Had the mashed avo on sourdough toast, a fresh fruit salad and an Iced cappuccino. The food is very good.

At first I had to summon a waiter to take my order, however, after year service was good.

Good quality food that tastes fresh is something that just can’t be beat! I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken and mozzarella melt and the iced matcha latte. Also, sitting at the community table was so much fun! They have outlets so you can charge your phone and a lot of people had their laptops and were doing their own thing. It was a really nice experience!

google.name: Ashford & Simpson's Sugar Bar
google.address: 254 W 72nd St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: This spot is IT!! I think my boyfriend and I could have stayed there all night if we wanted with how homely this experience was. We were greeted by an amazing older woman who may have been the owner. The cool thing is, it’s truly a brownstone! The food was phenomenal and not over seasoned! 10/10 would recommend and go again!

First timer... the space was great, staff awesome, but the food was not the best. Cooked well but not seasoned.

I asked our server is it normally like this, she replied,  "our regular cook is off tonight."

Drinks were good, overall slightly pricey but not ridiculous.

It is a good place for Happy Hour 😁😉🥂🍾

Fantastic food, music and service! Smiling faces everytime I come! And I don't love in NY, I FLY IN to come here because it feels like home every time.. i looove the food and live band! And again,  really nice service. They know how to treat a guest there!

Was on a Girls Trip the weekend of April 12th 2024 with a group of 8 ladies and we really enjoyed ourselves. It was the first for all of us and we all agreed the food was delicious and the atmosphere was simply amazing and the service was EXCELLENT.
The Group of Ladies from SAVANNAH will be back SOON!!!!

Oh Yeah!!! I can’t forget the Live Performance was AWESOME….,,,,

Went this Sunday for dinner. Absolutely spectacular. Walking in and immediately greeted with a warm welcome. We started out with the delicious jumbo shrimp and crabmeat. They were soo yummy! For dinner we ordered lamb shanks with mac and cheese and collard greens. When you order lamb there’s not much meat on them but not here. It did not disappoint! We also ordered fried chicken and he got his own mac and cheese because I wasn’t sharing 🤭Domenic our server was fantastic and suggested both sauces for the lamb. I suggest the jerk sauce with the fried chicken actually. I’d absolutely come back in a heartbeat!

google.name: Tavern On the Green
google.address: W 67th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text: I had not been to Tavern on the Green in many years. I was very glad to return to celebrate my cousin's birthday. The decor has been updated and improved. There are many more good seats to look out and view the courtyard. The service was so friendly and helpful. The really made you feel as though they were happy to see you. The most improvement that I noticed was the food. The old Taverns food was uneven. On this occasion we throughly enjoyed our meal. From the appetizers (octopus and crab cake) to the desserts (slice of birthday cake and strawberry shortcake) there we no complaints. Let me not leave out the delicious main dishes, roast chicken and swordfish. They were excellently prepared.

Great outdoor seating area, but why no infrared heaters? Super friendly server. Great tuna tartare appetizer. Sea bass was lukewarm and not very flavorful. Peanut butter chocolate molten lava cake sounds way more delicious than it actually tastes. At these prices, I expect a bit more.

We were visiting the city and were looking for a place to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. I asked for suggestions and was given Tavern On The Green. Not knowing too much about the city we just went with it hoping to have a great experience. Upon walking in met with the ambience of a 50 style vocalist that set the tune for beautiful evening .  A reservation was for 815 and we were seated shortly before not waiting hardly at all. Upon entering the dining area, it was quite busy and we were unsure of how much attention we would get. We were greeted with a Happy Anniversary card and our lovely waiter Plato. Throughout the evening he was so attentive to us, always making sure my water glass was full and we had everything that we needed. We went with the special a tomahawk steak for 2. The presentation was out of this world, but the flavor was even better. It was cooked perfection and the sides were delectable. We throughout enjoyed the atmosphere, our food and the service just was the icing on the cake! Thank you Plato for your service. We will definitely return.

We stayed at midtown for 3 nights and walked into Tavern On The Green as we explored Central Park.
It was Thursday evening, and there were not many people in the Tavern.  We had just eaten dinner so we just went in to see the place.

The floor manager, Jaime Rios, greeted us and offered a tour of the beautiful site. He told us about live music the next day, so we returned on Friday after dinner with friends to enjoy the jazz music, dessert, and wines.

The warm hospitality of Jaime made our experience so much better. He came to greet us, help with photos, and gave us some complimentary chocolate truffles and Prosecco unexpectedly.

Overall, we totally enjoyed the jazz music, food, wines, and atmosphere in this iconic tavern of NYC.  It's worthy to visit here!

Tavern on the Green in Central Park is a charming oasis with exceptional service and a magical atmosphere. After arriving soaked from a rainstorm, the staff’s warm hospitality set the stage for a pleasant lunch. I opted for the chicken sandwich, a basic menu option that likely caters to a broad range of tastes and provides a familiar choice for diners. However, while generous in size, it was difficult to eat and lacked flavor. On the other hand, the lava peanut butter cake dessert was outstanding—one of the best desserts I had in NYC. Overall, it’s a beautiful spot worth visiting, but I recommend exploring their specialty dishes for a more memorable experience.

yelp.name: Tavern on the Green
yelp.address: 67 Central Park W, New York, NY 10023

google.name: Sushi of Gari UWS (Gari Columbus)
google.address: 370 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

review_snippets.text: We have dined at Sushi of Gari on the Upper West Side twice, once in the restaurant a long time ago, and then again for takeout tonight. The sushi has been great on both occasions. It's not my favorite Japanese in Manhattan, but along with Sushi Yasaka, it is definitely the best Japanese cuisine on the Upper West Side. Gari is the more formal experience while Sushi Yasaka is more laid back. Both places are great.
After nearly 20 years, Gari remains one of our family’s favorite omakase places! The fresh fishes, their rice and unique sauces make Gari’s sushi among the best. Service is impeccable.

The pictures on Google does it no justice. It is SO nice inside, everyone is professional, warm and welcoming. The sushi was probably one of the top 5 sushi places I have ever been.

I will definitely go back and encourage others to do the same

*Okay granted this is partially our fault buttttt - we asked the waiter for a recommendation for sake. The waiter provided us 3 small samples to try but he did not offer to share the price of the bottle nor did we ask. When the bill came, we found out it cost us $220!!! I felt like this was dishonest and put a damper on our otherwise wonderful meal.
Ambiance (5/5): The establishment is pretty small but very organized and neat, clean, and welcoming! We were seated next to the chef's table and loved watching the preparation right in front of our eyes. The chefs worked together seamlessly to prepare the various dishes with special garnishes, sauces, and presentation.
Service (4/5): We were warmly greeted at the door. Warm towels for wiping at the beginning of the meal and during the middle course.
He went out of his way to ask us in advance if we wanted a birthday dessert since there was only 2 left in the back so he could reserve it. They came out with a sparkler candle for us! Free green tea with the dessert.
Food (5/5): We chose the combo omakase for $180 (4 sashimi & 8 sushi). Every single dish was fresh and delicious! Presentation was exceptional and the tastes were infused with art.

Mediocre Japanese restaurant. The sushi was nothing special and certainly not worth $60 for the sushi deluxe. The teriyaki chicken was dry and overcooked. I asked for extra teriyaki sauce to make it moister and was informed that extra sauce costs $5. Really? The gyoza had little flavor. Anyway, I won’t be returning. Too many great Japanese restaurants in this city

google.name: Shun Lee West
google.address: 43 W 65th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Shun Lee West on the Upper West Side effortlessly evokes the charm of 1970s-80s fine Chinese dining. As you step inside, the refined ambiance, with its classic Chinese motifs, sets a serene and welcoming tone.

The menu offers a delightful journey through American Chinese culinary traditions. Dishes like Chicken with Three Nuts, Chicken with Vegetables (Moo Goo Gai Pan), Hot and Sour Soup, and Wonton Soup are prepared with meticulous attention to detail, reminiscent of the first Chinese food my mother took me out to enjoy. The quality of ingredients and the chefs' skill shine through, making each meal memorable. These are not new fusion dishes but traditional American Chinese dishes.

The old-fashioned service at Shun Lee West is impeccable. The attentive and courteous waitstaff provide a smooth and enjoyable dining experience. The restaurant maintains a peaceful atmosphere, allowing for relaxed conversation and a leisurely meal.

Overall, Shun Lee West is a charming throwback to the golden age of fine Chinese dining in America. Its combination of classic dishes, impeccable service, and quiet elegance make it a true gem on the Upper West Side.

The main disadvantage dinning room is terrific and the food is better than most NYC chinese options.

Definitely a favorite is the chicken with three nut, it’s a must add. Also you need to get soup dumplings and Singapore curry rice noodle dish with 3 ingredients.

Actually most everything is great. I’d go so far as to say you can order anything and take chances. You likely won’t be dissatisfied.

Went here for dinner recently. It’s an upscale Chinese food restaurant on the Upper West Side. It is very spacious and nicely decorated. There are many servers and they are all very attentive. The clientele is a lot of older people and families. We started off with soup dumplings and fried shrimp balls which were both delicious. We also got Chinese broccoli, crispy beef, General Tso’s chicken, walnut shrimp, fried rice and they brought another vegetable dish out to us. Everything was really good. Portions were a good size. Good for sharing. Definitely the type of place to go to on a special occasion with a group. Check it out.

Yum. Happy, smiling customers. Great food. Nice big both that quiets the noise. Great tea. Only two of us and we over ordered which is terrific for tomorrow. Kind staff. A really fun happy pleasant evening.

It's been a long time since I last review anything. Thankfully, I have returned and what better way to start off before I headed to Shen Yun yesterday is this upscale Chinese Restaurant. First off, this place has very impressive decor. The atmosphere felt very positive and the servers were very attentive to all the tables. It was my very first time eating there and their recommendations were spot on and true to their word. Their Mai Tai was pretty good and their Pork Fried Rice with General Tso's Chicken made my stomach performed the "happy dance" the whole time. Yes, it was really that tasty.

Additionally, I love how they were quick to notice that my water supply was low and immediately refilled it without me saying anything. Bonus points for that. Anyway, they checked on me often to make sure I was okay and it really made me feel valued and welcomed. In the end, although my bill was a little more than expected, I was not surprised because the quality of the whole restaurant was worth every penny. For those who appreciates Chinese culture like I do, you will not be disappointed because I will highly recommend this place to you.

google.name: Dive 75
google.address: 101 W 75th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

review_snippets.text:
Quirky is the best description. Free candy on the bar, fish tank, Jell-O shots, and plenty of board games.

Great for a drink after visiting the museum of  Museum of Natural History. Short walk.

I won’t really call this place a dive. The atmosphere is cozy, and they have a pretty large selection of beer and liquor.

Very cute dive spot which has a fun cocktail menu full of incentive drinks. The Adult Capri Sun was my favorite and "That Pink Drink" was absolutely delicious. They did get a bit crowded with a birthday celebration, so note that this is a bit of a smaller space and may not be the best if you have a super large group. The bartender was chill, kind, and attentive. Overall a nice place.

This place is a great neighborhood bar! 🍻 Dice 75 serves a wonderful selection of draft beers! 🍺 They also have lots of board games 🎲 available to play! Staff 👨‍🍳 is friendly and service is quick. They have plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. 🪑 I wish I came here earlier!

Great little bar by Central Park with very decent prices. The bar tender was great, would chat with us occasionally and answer our touristy questions. My husband was very impressed/pleased with their selection of Irish/Scottish whiskeys; he was able to try many different things. I was really happy that the house wine wasn't just a crappy boxed wine. They have a fun big tub of little rubber duckies that you'll some times find in your drinks. Highly recommend if looking to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city-we're midwestern so we love a more divey bar!

Cool, casual, non-fussy joint.
It went from 0->60 on a Tuesday though when they host trivia at 8pm.
Don’t go then if you don’t wanna play trivia 🫣

Otherwise - very enjoyable.
Not really a food place either. Mainly just drinks.

google.name: Awash Ethiopian Restaurant
google.address: 947 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

review_snippets.text:
Awash was recommended by my Ethiopian friend as the best place to try their food. The welcome was warm and the service was friendly. We were five and initially wanted to order samplers with other items from the menu but the food sharing fee is a very unusual and alogical rule and we had to change our mind. Finally, we ordered individually different food from the menu. I tried beef and lentil Sambusa and beef Siga Tibs. The food was delicious, I really enjoyed Sambusa.
Overall, we enjoyed the evening but considering numerous factors we decided that it was worth trying but doubt to return shortly.

My first time trying Ethiopian. Food was amazing especially the red lentils. Meat was so so . I had beg tibs

Would surely come back again here. Service needs to be more attentive

Our go-to Ethiopian restaurant and comfort food spot! We’ve ordered takeout multiple times and it’s always very flavorful and spicy! The portions are large, so we always have leftovers. Love this place so much!!!
Came here on a Sunday afternoon, and ordered a Doro Wat (Ethiopian Chicken Stew), with a side of salad and Shiro. The food was great! Also loved the ambience!

Loved loved this place. It was my first time getting Ethiopian food and I thought it was amazing. Got the veggie platter and the spices/seasoning was soo good. The combo together was delicious- really loved the beets complementing the chickpea mix. Everything was wrapped in a type of bread/wrap which has a kind of grainy texture but is very complementary. Got this for take out and 100% would get again. Large portion as we had it for 2 meals.
